finding: The rs2476601 SNP in the PTPN22 locus was significantly associated with type 1 diabetes risk in individuals of European ancestry, as established in prior case-control studies. It was shown to contribute to the risk and earlier age at onset of type 1 diabetes in this population.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs951740 was found to be significantly associated with traits linked to impulsivity, including its ties to opioid use disorder.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: The SNP rs6025, located at the F5 locus, was documented as having the most significant association with DVT, displaying an odds ratio (OR) of 0.20 (95% CI: 0.17-0.22) indicating a strong protective effect. This SNP corresponds to the well-known Factor V Leiden (FVL) mutation.
title: Using genotyping and whole-exome sequencing data to improve genetic risk prediction in deep venous thrombosis

finding: The SNP rs2076343, located in the gene HMGCL, was identified as causally associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) susceptibility. This association was established through summary-data-based Mendelian randomization (SMR), which demonstrated that this SNP modifies mRNA expression and, consequently, protein translation. The evidence indicated a consistent direction of effects observed at both mRNA and protein levels, thereby confirming its role in MS pathology.
title: Multi-omics integration prioritizes potential drug targets for multiple sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs3003378 was identified as a causal SNP in the GWAS analysis involving simulated phenotypic values, where it had an assigned effect size of 0.02.
title: A High-resolution Haplotype-resolved Reference Panel Constructed from the China Kadoorie Biobank Study

finding: The SNP rs10915307 was classified as a causal SNP with an effect size of 0.01 in the course of the GWAS analysis.
title: A High-resolution Haplotype-resolved Reference Panel Constructed from the China Kadoorie Biobank Study

finding: The SNP rs17367504-G was characterized as a potential protective locus for preeclampsia. This finding has relevance because this polymorphism is associated with the MTHFR gene, which plays a role in folate metabolism and may influence vascular conditions during pregnancy. The study suggested that this polymorphism could be protective against developing preeclampsia, which aligns with the broader genetic architecture of the disorder being investigated in the context of severe preeclampsia.
title: Integrated Protein Network Analysis of Whole Exome Sequencing of Severe Preeclampsia

finding: This SNP in CFH was associated with lower FVC but demonstrated strong associations with reduced risk of macular degeneration, signifying a dual impact on lung function and eye health.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The common missense variant in CACNA1S was associated with lower FVC and FEV1, demonstrating its significance in skeletal muscle function and its implications for respiratory capacity.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: rs548640610 was associated with episodic memory decline and resided within neuron and astrocyte-specific regulatory elements. It was located in an intron of CHRM3, which has been implicated in Alzheimer's Disease due to its role in G protein-coupled receptor signaling.
title: Rare genetic coding variants associated with age-related episodic memory decline implicate distinct memory pathologies in the hippocampus

finding: The lead variant rs12031894, located at locus 1q25.2, was identified as the only novel locus in the study, reaching genome-wide significance in both depression and SCZ meta-analysis. It was also recognized as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) influencing the expression of various genes across tissues, particularly in the brain.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs151193009 was identified as a loss-of-function variant that significantly impacted LDL-C levels, showing a per-allele effect of 0.65 SD on LDL-C. In the prospective China Kadoorie Biobank study, it was included in the PCSK9 genetic score that was associated with lower risks of cardiovascular disease outcomes, but also linked to higher risks of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) hospitalization and respiratory infections.
title: PCSK9 genetic variants and risk of vascular and non-vascular diseases in Chinese and UK populations

finding: The missense variant rs11591147 was previously associated in UK Biobank analyses with various respiratory disease outcomes, including asthma and upper respiratory tract infections. In the subsequent CKB study, it helped corroborate the association with URTI, showing a significant increase in risk among carriers, suggesting respiratory effects linked to therapeutic PCSK9 inhibition.
title: PCSK9 genetic variants and risk of vascular and non-vascular diseases in Chinese and UK populations

finding: As part of the genetic score for PCSK9, rs2495477 was associated with LDL-C levels but no further specific disease associations were reported in the CKB study beyond its inclusion in the analysis, reaffirming the role of genetic variants in the context of LDL-C influence.
title: PCSK9 genetic variants and risk of vascular and non-vascular diseases in Chinese and UK populations

finding: This SNP was also included in the PCSK9 genetic score associated with LDL-C. Although no direct associations with specific respiratory outcomes were highlighted in the study, it was part of the trio of SNPs that correlated with cardiovascular risks and was significant for LDL-C reduction.
title: PCSK9 genetic variants and risk of vascular and non-vascular diseases in Chinese and UK populations

finding: The SNP rs192471919 was found intronic to FNBP1L and exhibited a meta-analysis P-value of 0.017, supporting its association with AD risk in the study.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals new Alzheimer’s disease-associated rare variants in loci related to synaptic function and neuronal development

finding: The strong association between rs6025 (chr1:169549811) and primary hypercoagulable state (phecode: 286.81) was documented, with this missense variant in the F5 gene being among the top associations for multiple related coagulation phecodes.
title: The Michigan Genomics Initiative: a biobank linking genotypes and electronic clinical records in Michigan Medicine patients

finding: The variant rs7528419, located in the SORT1 gene and coding for the sortilin protein, was strongly associated with coronary heart disease (CHD) in previous GWAS studies. PRISM identified that this variant had a direct effect on apolipoprotein B (apoB), suggesting it influenced CHD through its effects on apoB. This conclusion was supported by recent studies that indicated sortilin restricts apoB secretion and that apoB serves as a critical marker of lipid-induced cardiovascular risk.
title: Inferring genetic variant causal networks by leveraging pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs12724121 was recognized as an intronic variant situated within a conserved CHD-enhancer element. This SNP was associated with regulatory potential in cardiac-related processes and was identified among 63 CHD-SNPs with known expression quantitative trait loci (eQTLs). Its presence in an evolutionarily conserved context indicated a functional role, especially regarding cardiac tissue expression.
title: Computational analysis of congenital heart disease associated SNPs: Unveiling their impact on the gene regulatory system

finding: This SNP was identified in the gene MTR, associated with methionine biosynthesis, and was linked to diastolic blood pressure. The significant association was evidenced by its linkage disequilibrium with the suggestive SNP rs10925261, demonstrating a potential role in homocysteine metabolism and cardiovascular risk in essential hypertension patients, with a p-value of 2.5×10-3.
title: Genomic Exploration of Essential Hypertension in African-Brazilian Quilombo Populations: A Comprehensive Approach with Pedigree Analysis and Family-Based Association Studies

finding: This SNP was characterized as a suggestive genetic variant in relation to hypertension, as revealed through fine-mapping studies. It showed a strong linkage with rs1805087 in MTR, indicating its relevance in blood pressure regulation.
title: Genomic Exploration of Essential Hypertension in African-Brazilian Quilombo Populations: A Comprehensive Approach with Pedigree Analysis and Family-Based Association Studies

finding: The rs12083537 AA genotype was associated with a decreased response to tocilizumab, as compared to the AG genotype. This genotype was notably higher in Sub-Saharan African populations (0.337) indicating a decreased metabolism and clearance of tocilizumab when compared to East Asians (0.110).
title: Interleukin-6 receptor genetic variation and tocilizumab treatment response to COVID-19

finding: The rs11265618 CC genotype was linked to an increased response to tocilizumab versus the CT and TT genotypes. Higher allele frequencies were observed in Sub-Saharan African populations (0.347), suggesting that these populations might demonstrate a better clinical response to tocilizumab than East Asians (0.104).
title: Interleukin-6 receptor genetic variation and tocilizumab treatment response to COVID-19

finding: The FCGR3A rs396991 AA genotype was associated with an increased response to tocilizumab in comparison to the AC or CC genotypes, suggesting a potentially beneficial genotype for treatment outcomes.
title: Interleukin-6 receptor genetic variation and tocilizumab treatment response to COVID-19

finding: The index SNP rs114101204 was found to have a strong association with severe COVID-19 in patients with VTE, indicating a genetic link at the locus 1q24.2.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs146887912 variant was fine-mapped by MultiSuSiE at the RUNX3 locus for height, where it serves as a single-nucleotide insertion. This variant was confirmed fine-mapped using Afr47k but not in the European cohorts due to lower MAF. While the surrounding RUNX3 locus had previous GWAS associations with height, rs146887912 had not been documented in GWAS data prior to this analysis.
title: MultiSuSiE improves multi-ancestry fine-mapping in All of Us whole-genome sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs12040925 was associated with the prognostic impact of sarcopenia and skeletal muscle loss during neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy in patients with esophageal cancer, as reported in a study involving 343 liver transplantation patients. This finding highlighted the importance of assessing body composition and its implications on patient outcomes.
title: MuViSS : Muscle, Visceral and Subcutaneous Segmentation by an automatic evaluation method using Deep Learning

finding: The SNP rs12071766 was associated with endometrial cancer susceptibility, as indicated by the work of Ignatov and Ortmann in 2020 which examined various endocrine risk factors for endometrial cancer.
title: Multi-tissue transcriptome-wide association study identifies genetic mechanisms underlying endometrial cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs658956 emerged as a dynamic caQTL affecting a specific enhancer linked to the HSD52 gene. It was reported that the alteration from the reference (G) to the alternative (T) allele disrupted a BACH1/2 transcription factor binding motif, subsequently leading to decreased HSD52 expression as supported by significant eQTL findings.
title: Single cell variant to enhancer to gene map for coronary artery disease

finding: Similarly, rs4480415 was highlighted as a novel locus in the GWAS for accelerometer-measured MVPA with a significant p-value of 8.7×10²⁻⁹.
title: Association of Sedentary and Physical Activity Behaviors with Body Composition: a Genome-Wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The rs791273 SNP was near genome-wide significant in the accelerometer-measured MVPA GWAS, with a p-value of 5.0×10²⁻⁸.
title: Association of Sedentary and Physical Activity Behaviors with Body Composition: a Genome-Wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: SNP rs368433, located in the Toll-like receptor 10 (TLR10) gene on chromosome 4p14, was also found to be strongly associated with H. pylori infection. Similar to rs10004195, it acted as an instrumental variable in the Mendelian randomization study, confirming the absence of an association between genetically predicted H. pylori infection and CHD. The odds ratio for the association with CHD was calculated as 1.049 (95% CI, 0.980–1.118; p-value = 0.178), indicating no significant relationship. This SNP was part of the analysis that ultimately concluded that the causal effect of H. pylori on CHD was not direct but might be mediated by body mass index (BMI).
title: Causal Effect of Helicobacter Pylori Infection on Coronary Heart Disease is mediated by Body Mass Index: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The rs2076591 variant situated in INKA2 at 1p13.2 showcased a significant association with PSA levels, presenting new insights into the relationship between genetic markers and PSA.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The association of rs12569177 with FAF1 at 1p32.3 indicated its relevance among PSA-associated variants, advancing the knowledge surrounding the genetic basis of PSA variation.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The BFP lowering allele of rs13303359 was associated with lower abdominal subcutaneous adipose tissue (ASAT), lower HDL, and higher TG, indicating adverse metabolic implications.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs4478781 was discovered to be associated with smoking trajectories unique to African Americans in a large-scale study, underscoring its relevance in smoking behaviour over time.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: The SNP rs2814778 in the Duffy region at 1q23.2 was specifically included as a covariate in the analysis of traits such as white blood cell count and C-reactive protein due to its known strong association with admixture peaks. The SNP was not directly typed or imputed in the study data but was inferred through local ancestries of nearby SNPs, which highly correlated with rs2814778 due to significant differences in allele frequencies across ancestries.
title: Causal effects on complex traits are similar across segments of different continental ancestries within admixed individuals

finding: Rs17024393 was located at 1p13.3 and was detected in 4 SNP-transcript-BMI associations, confirming its status as a previously reported BMI signal associated with the GSTM3 gene.
title: Integrating Genetic and Transcriptomic Data to Identify Genes Underlying Obesity Risk Loci

finding: The rs10911021 variant in GLUL was identified to be associated with cardiovascular disease (CVD) in several studies, including a genome-wide association study (GWAS) among type 2 diabetes (T2D) patients, demonstrating significant associations with CVD outcomes and confirmed in two independent studies.
title: Precision Prognostics for Cardiovascular Disease in Type 2 Diabetes: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis

finding: This SNP was highlighted as a significant causal variant linked to PDE4B with strong association findings related to the general addiction risk factor (addiction-rf), suggesting its role in addiction susceptibility.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: Identified near PDE4B, this SNP was part of significant findings with implications for substance addiction.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: Identified in the intron of CDC42, this SNP was associated with cervical cancer with a p-value of 3.1 × 10−8, suggesting its involvement in cancer invasion and migration.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: This SNP in the intron of CDC42-AS1 significantly colocalized with cancer-associated expression events, supporting its involvement in cervical cancer biology.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: This SNP was identified in the transcription start site flanking regions of LINC00339 and CDC42, showcasing its regulatory implications in cervical cancer.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: Identified as a credible set variant overlapping with TSS in HeLa cells, it indicates a potential regulatory role in cervical cancer mechanisms.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: This SNP was noted to overlap with enhancer marks, suggesting an influential role in gene expression related to cervical pathology.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: Associated with enhancer marks within relevant tissue contexts, indicating its regulatory potential in cervical disease processes.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: The analysis identified rs114831731, linked to AHCYL1, which displayed interaction with STST for PP in Hispanic populations, with a noteworthy P-value of 1.6×10^-9, indicating its relevance in hypertension.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: rs143863772, linked with MROH7, indicated interaction with STST for SBP among Hispanic individuals, with a significant P-value of 5.8×10^-5, affirming its role in blood pressure regulation.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs4915019 in the NTNG1 gene showed a significant association with ASD in 26% of cases, thus reinforcing its role in the axon guidance pathways critical for neurodevelopment.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: SNP rs1497828, located in the ESRRG-GPATCH2 intergenic region, was significantly associated with insulin resistance, where the G/C-C/C genotype indicated a higher risk compared to G/G genotype carriers (P=0.0011; OR=2.90; 95% CI: 1.51-5.57). This finding underscored the relevance of genetic variations in predisposing individuals to type 2 diabetes risk.
title: Insulin Resistance Risk in Normal BMI Individuals: Investigating the Role of Genetic Polymorphisms in RNF138, ABCA1, and ESRRG-GPATCH2 Genes - A Case-Control Study in the Indian Population

finding: The SNP rs13303010 was associated with PDAC risk, showing a significant odds ratio (OR) of 1.26 (95% CI 1.19-1.35; P=8.36×10⁻¹⁴) in a meta-analysis that supported its role as a risk locus at 1p36.33, confirming its contribution to the development of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
title: Allelic effects on KLHL17 expression likely mediated by JunB/D underlie a PDAC GWAS signal at chr1p36.33

finding: rs13303160 exhibited strong allele-preferential binding of JunB and JunD, with functional studies revealing it as a significant risk variant for PDAC. This SNP demonstrated enhancer activity associated with KLHL17, indicating its crucial role in the regulatory mechanisms underlying PDAC risk.
title: Allelic effects on KLHL17 expression likely mediated by JunB/D underlie a PDAC GWAS signal at chr1p36.33

finding: The SNP rs13303327 showed allele-preferential binding, particularly to transcription factors like ELF2. Furthermore, it demonstrated allele-preferential gene regulatory activity, solidifying its role in pancreatic cancer risk mechanisms.
title: Allelic effects on KLHL17 expression likely mediated by JunB/D underlie a PDAC GWAS signal at chr1p36.33

finding: The SNP rs2230288, which has associations with GBA, was indicated to be linked with slower PD progression, despite excluding GBA mutation carriers from the study.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: rs12752133 was also mapped to GBA and contributed to an increased risk for PD, associated with slow progression.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: This SNP, rs76763715, was linked to GBA and identified as increasing the risk of PD, including associations with slower progression.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The risk allele (C) of SNP rs6681093 was found to be associated with lower secretion of the Hornerin (HRNR) protein from SMCs, linking this SNP to coronary artery disease (CAD) and aortic aneurysm risk.
title: Secreted protein profiling of human aortic smooth muscle cells identifies vascular disease associations

finding: The diastolic blood pressure risk allele (T) of SNP rs10797858 was associated with lower LAMC2 protein secretion from SMCs, establishing a connection between this SNP and diastolic blood pressure.
title: Secreted protein profiling of human aortic smooth muscle cells identifies vascular disease associations

finding: The missense variant rs2228145 (p.Asp358Ala) was found to significantly influence the cleavage of the IL6R by ADAM17, which potentially increased the release of soluble IL6R and was associated with a higher risk of asthma and urticaria in IgAV patients. Additionally, it demonstrated an association with lower risk of atrial fibrillation/flutter and coronary syndrome.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: The risk allele rs6694258 (OR=1.21, P=1.49×10−6) was associated with higher plasma protein levels of IL6R but lower IL6R transcript levels in blood. This SNP co-localized with expression and protein QTL, supporting its role in soluble IL6R modulation.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: The SNP rs4129267 was identified as the top variant explaining 25.9% of variance in plasma IL6R levels and linked to increased sIL6R levels, implicating it in the pathophysiology of IgAV.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: The SNP rs2758600 was linked to the gene PMF1 and showed a significant association with stroke in SMR analyses, indicating its role as a positive original finding related to stroke risk.
title: Integration of Mendelian randomisation and systems biology models to identify novel blood-based biomarkers for stroke

finding: The SNP rs887953 also tagged the gene PMF1 and demonstrated a significant association with stroke in both SMR analyses using eQTLGen and CAGE eQTLs, confirming its status as a positive original finding associated with stroke.
title: Integration of Mendelian randomisation and systems biology models to identify novel blood-based biomarkers for stroke

finding: This SNP was associated with hyperthyroidism, hypothyroidism, and TSH levels, indicating its relevance across all three thyroid phenotypes.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: This SNP was identified within novel loci for hypothyroidism, harbored genes associated with thyroid traits in mice, underlining its potential biological significance.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The missense variant rs11591147 (R46L in PCSK9) was found to have a significant interaction with age regarding ApoB levels, with a P-interaction of 3.9e-09. Its effect sizes were noted to decline with age, indicating that while it had pronounced effects on ApoB in younger cohorts, these effects diminished in older individuals.
title: Large-scale genome-wide interaction analyses on multiple cardiometabolic risk factors to identify age-specific genetic risk factors

finding: The study confirmed previously published observations that the p.V253I variant in SLC2A9 (rs1689079) was associated with decreased mean serum uric acid levels; specifically, levels were 3.7 mg/dL in variant carriers compared to 4.6 mg/dL in non-carriers, with a significant p-value of 0.02.
title: Pharmacogenetics of SGLT2 Inhibitors: Validation of a sex-agnostic pharmacodynamic biomarker

finding: The SNP rs55794721 was strongly associated with blood donorship (beta = 0.16, p = 8.88 x 10^-89) and linked to the RhD negative haplotype Rh dce, which is enriched in the blood donor population.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: For the SNP rs1061170 in CFH, a modest effect was observed in African-ancestry individuals with an odds ratio of 1.13, which highlighted the differential risk across ancestry groups.
title: Distinctive cross-ancestry genetic architecture for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The index SNP rs2724360 was linked to the significant downregulation of CD55 and upregulation of CD46, demonstrating its involvement in AMD pathophysiology.
title: Distinctive cross-ancestry genetic architecture for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The heterozygotes for NOS1AP rs12143842 were less likely to develop CKD as compared to common homozygotes, although specific HR values were not discussed. This suggests a protective association could exist necessitating further exploration.
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: The NPPA rs5063 TT homozygotes were associated with a higher incidence of edema (HR 4.40, 95% CI 1.09 to 17.76, p=0.04). This highlights considerations of edema risk when prescribing dCCBs.
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: The rs588316 variant was included in the credible set associated with LIPC, which influences hydrolysis of triacylglycerol.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The SNP rs3851294 was noted among the sentinel loci with potential deleterious effects indicated by a CADD score greater than 12.37. This SNP was located on chromosome 1 and showed associations with various traits related to RAG.
title: Genomic Determinants of Biological Age Estimated By Deep Learning Applied to Retinal Images

finding: Originally reported in research on opioid misuse, rs640561 showed an association with OA (p=0.009), reinforcing its potential relevance.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study of opioid addiction: OPRM1 and Beyond

finding: The SNP rs2479413 in PCSK9 showed multiple independent associations with low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol adjusted by medication. The trans-ancestry beta was statistically significant, indicating robust associations across different ancestry groups.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs12061443 was associated with the diagnosis of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma based on research published by Kim et al. in 2020, which indicated a biomarker panel for the disease.
title: Nano Sensing for Early Diagnosis of Pancreatic Cancer

finding: The SNP rs12041002 was linked to pancreatic cancer biomarkers through an untargeted metabolomics study conducted by Martín-Blázquez et al. in 2020, identifying significant metabolites associated with pancreatic adenocarcinoma.
title: Nano Sensing for Early Diagnosis of Pancreatic Cancer

finding: The SNP rs12124523, an intronic variant in the gene NEGR1, showed significant SNP heterogeneity between depression phenotyping definitions in a genome-wide association study of major depression (MD). The association with the common factor model was statistically significant (P = 8.4 × 10^-14) and demonstrated notable heterogeneity (Q heterogeneity P = 2.9 × 10^-10, I^2 = 0.71). A stronger association was observed in self-reported depression studies compared to other phenotype definitions, with a self-report odds ratio of 1.081 (95% CI = 1.065–1.098) versus an odds ratio of 1.008 (95% CI = 0.999–1.018) in other cohorts. This indicated variability in linkage to MD based on the phenotyping method employed, emphasizing the relevance of phenotype definitions in genetic association studies.
title: Genome-wide study of half a million individuals with major depression identifies 697 independent associations, infers causal neuronal subtypes and biological targets for novel pharmacotherapies

finding: The study confirmed expression of both alleles of the RYR2 SNP rs684923 in human induced pluripotent stem cell-derived cardiomyocytes (RYR2-hiPSC-CMs), suggesting that the transcript escaped nonsense-mediated decay. Additionally, total RYR2 expression was significantly reduced in the RYR2-hiPSC-CMs compared to control cell lines, with no significant expression differences between the control lines. The study established that shRNA targeting the mutant allele could significantly reduce its expression and increase the ratio of wild-type to mutant allele expression, indicating that the abnormal calcium handling phenotype in RYR2-hiPSC-CMs could be due to the presence of the p.(Arg4790Ter) allele, which exhibits gain of function properties.
title: Characterisation of the mechanism by which a nonsense variant in RYR2 results in ventricular arrhythmia

finding: The SNP rs1411478 was associated with PSP, yielding an odds ratio of 0.84 (95%CI=0.71–0.98; p=0.03), aligning with prior reports.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: The SNP rs6687758 showed an odds ratio of 0.80 (95%CI=0.66–0.97; p=0.02), supporting its association with PSP as previously documented.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: The novel SNP rs12744678 was associated with the NFASC locus showing a genome-wide significant association (OR[95%CI]=0.83[0.78–0.89]; p=4.15·10^-08), highlighting the involvement of neuron-oligodendrocyte interactions in PSP.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: The SNP rs4951151 was noted as the top variant in the NFASC/CNTN2 locus, associated with eQTL and pQTL for CNTN2 expression in cerebellar tissue and CSF/plasma respectively.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: The SNP rs1763610 associated with HSPB7 was test-wise significant in the MVP African American cohort after correction, indicating its potential importance as a genetic variant related to HFrEF.
title: Genetic Architecture of Heart Failure with Preserved versus Reduced Ejection Fraction

finding: The index SNP rs72730526 on chromosome 1 achieved genome-wide significance with a p-value of 3.69×10−8. This SNP was identified in the context of suicide attempt (SA) and contributed to the overall understanding of shared genetic architecture among psychiatric phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis of suicide attempt in 43,871 cases identifies twelve genome-wide significant loci

finding: SNP rs1044595, associated with hypothalamus volume (β = 0.04, MAF = 0.40), had prior connections to menopause status, enhancing its relevance in reproductive phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs35306826, correlated with hypothalamic grey matter volume (β = 0.05, MAF = 0.41), had prior associations with brain anatomy and reproductive timing.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The variant rs7550273, associated with CD46, was enriched in oesophagus mucosa, indicating its relevance to various reproductive processes.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs10800397 was linked to SPATA46, expressed in brain cerebellum, suggesting connections to reproductive functions.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs3820282 was identified as the lead endometrial cancer risk variant at the novel 1p36.12 locus. This finding was significant in the context of endometrial cancer and replicated in an independent dataset. Additionally, rs3820282 was associated with the expression of candidate genes like CDC42 and LINC00339, highlighting its potential role in the biological mechanisms underlying endometrial cancer.
title: Genetic analyses of gynecological disease identify genetic relationships between uterine fibroids and endometrial cancer, and a novel endometrial cancer genetic risk region at the WNT4 1p36.12 locus

finding: The SNP rs61768001 was classified as a candidate causal risk variant linked to endometrial cancer, along with rs3820282. It was previously associated with the expression of the gene CDC42 in blood, providing insight into its role in endometrial cancer risk.
title: Genetic analyses of gynecological disease identify genetic relationships between uterine fibroids and endometrial cancer, and a novel endometrial cancer genetic risk region at the WNT4 1p36.12 locus

finding: Similar to rs3820282 and rs61768001, SNP rs12037376 was identified as a candidate causal risk variant for endometrial cancer. Its association with LINC00339 gene expression in blood and endometrial tissues suggested a critical involvement in the disease pathway.
title: Genetic analyses of gynecological disease identify genetic relationships between uterine fibroids and endometrial cancer, and a novel endometrial cancer genetic risk region at the WNT4 1p36.12 locus

finding: As part of a newly identified locus (ADAMTSL4-AS1), this SNP indicates novel findings related to genetic predispositions for coffee consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The variant rs140425746 was part of a cluster that exhibited an average effect size of -2.05 in association with hypertension (HTN). This finding contributed to the identification of potentially risk variants.
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: The variant rs61757359 was identified in a cluster with an average effect size of -2.05, which indicated a potential risk association with hypertension (HTN). This was part of a larger study analyzing rare variants.
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: Similar to the other variants in its cluster, rs61758562 had an average effect size of -2.05 in relation to hypertension (HTN) and was classified as a risk variant.
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: rs116245325 demonstrated the smallest p-value of 1.46E-5 for hypertension (HTN) in single variant analysis, forming a separate cluster with a significant effect size of 4.33, indicating a protective variant.
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: The SNP rs6697359 was associated with RBS-R compulsive (p = 4.8 × 10−7) and was within 50 kb of SEC16B, which has been implicated in autism through somatic mosaic mutations.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The minor G-allele of SNP rs1051047 exerted a protective role on Sjögren's syndrome (SS) susceptibility by increasing DNA methylation levels at the upstream region of the gene IFI44 (cg1488022). This finding indicated that the G-allele might reduce the risk of developing SS.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The minor G-allele of SNP rs76397273 showed a protective effect on SS by decreasing GBP5 gene expression. This finding suggested that this genetic variant may play a role in reducing autoimmunity associated with SS.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The SNP rs232877 associated with MYSM1 expression was found to be in linkage disequilibrium with the lead SNP of the TACSTD2 locus. This association was significant within the context of both endometriosis and IBS, indicating a shared genetic predisposition.
title: Evidence of shared genetic factors in the aetiology of gastrointestinal disorders and endometriosis and clinical implications for disease management

finding: The lead SNP rs6661808 at the TACSTD2 locus was reported as an eQTL in blood and digestive tissues. This association was significant for both endometriosis and IBS, suggesting that TACSTD2 could play a crucial role in the overlap of these diseases.
title: Evidence of shared genetic factors in the aetiology of gastrointestinal disorders and endometriosis and clinical implications for disease management

finding: The SNP rs61746559, located in SGLT4 (also known as SLC5A9), demonstrated a protective recessive association with hypertension, indicated by an OR of 0.2 and a p-value of 3×10^-8. The significant dominance deviation p-value was recorded at 7×10^-6. This suggests that the variant's recessive effect may contribute to lower blood pressure, potentially through its involvement in the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system.
title: Widespread recessive effects on common diseases in a cohort of 44,000 British Pakistanis and Bangladeshis with high autozygosity

finding: The rs1801133 variant in the MTHFR gene was linked to folate deficiency, with a reported OR of 2.1 and a p-value of 5×10^-9, which was retained in a replication cohort. This recessive effect highlighted a notable distinction from prior additive associations with elevated homocysteine levels and demonstrated the significance of folate in essential metabolic processes.
title: Widespread recessive effects on common diseases in a cohort of 44,000 British Pakistanis and Bangladeshis with high autozygosity

finding: The missense variant rs6330 in <italic>NGF</italic> was identified as a significant risk variant for migraine with a posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.59. It was reported to be only in weak linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the lead variant rs12134493 in its locus, contributing to the association observed in migraine risk.
title: Fine-mapping a genome-wide meta-analysis of 98,374 migraine cases identifies 181 sets of candidate causal variants

finding: The rs6695940 variant at the SERPINC1 locus was identified as a common variant encoding antithrombin, which has been previously associated with venous thromboembolism (VTE).
title: Cross-Ancestry Investigation of Venous Thromboembolism Genomic Predictors

finding: The SNP rs11122007 was identified in a study that utilized a machine learning approach for predicting colon cancer stages and survival periods. It was involved in assessing genetic factors that contribute to cancer prognosis, highlighting its significance in understanding patient outcomes and responses to treatment.
title: A Review of AI and Data Science Support for Cancer Management

finding: The variant rs11591147 in PCSK9 was noted for its contribution to DALYs predominantly through its association with ischemic heart disease.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: Variant rs6701619 was associated with bicuspid aortic valve and calcific aortic valve stenosis, affecting PALMD, which regulates endocardial-to-mesenchymal transition and VIC remodeling, providing a molecular basis for congenital valve defects.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The rs6702619 variant, near PALMD, was associated with a subtype of CHD and overlapped an enhancer regulating PALMD, influencing chromatin accessibility and validating its link to valve structure.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The rs10888690 variant was part of a credible set covering the FAF1 and DMRTA2 genes, with FAF1 involved in programmed cell death. The association with sporadic miscarriage was significant, indicating a potential link between these genes and miscarriage outcomes.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The rs66499095 variant, identified as an indel in TARS2, was associated with sporadic miscarriage. This gene is linked to oxidative phosphorylation deficiencies and was prominent due to its expression quantitative trait loci (eQTLs) related to miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The variant rs1061170 (CFH Y402H) was adjusted for in the analyses, serving as an established independent genetic risk factor for age-related macular degeneration (AMD). The variants associated with increased risk of AMD, including rs1061170, were observed to influence the protective effects of other rare variants.
title: Rare predicted loss-of-function and damaging missense variants in CFHR5 associate with protection from age-related macular degeneration

finding: The variant rs570618 was identified in strong LD with CFH Y402H and thus was accounted for during analysis. It was part of the eight independent AMD-associated variants identified in the CFH region by Fritsche et al. (2016), indicating its relevance in understanding genetic contributions to AMD risk.
title: Rare predicted loss-of-function and damaging missense variants in CFHR5 associate with protection from age-related macular degeneration

finding: The missense variant rs41299613-C, which was predicted to be damaging, was predominantly found in individuals carrying the protective variant rs565457964-CA. Its presence correlatively associated with decreased AMD risk, underlining the potential role of CFHR5 in protecting against AMD.
title: Rare predicted loss-of-function and damaging missense variants in CFHR5 associate with protection from age-related macular degeneration

finding: The TSH-increasing allele C of the intronic variant rs10926981 was found to be associated with reduced risk of thyrotoxicosis and thyroid cancer, as well as improvements in renal function indicated by decreased creatinine levels and increased eGFR.
title: Genome-wide association study of thyroid-stimulating hormone highlights new genes, pathways and associations with thyroid disease susceptibility and age-of-onset

finding: The study analyzed the c.1-67T>C point mutation (rs2814778) in the GATA-1 transcription factor binding site of the DARC gene. It was found that among the samples collected for molecular screening, <italic>P. vivax</italic> positive samples included instances of the mutation, supporting the association of the Duffy blood group status with susceptibility to <italic>P. vivax</italic> infection in Duffy-negative individuals. This mutant allele's presence was linked to the ability of <italic>P. vivax</italic> to infect Duffy-negative individuals.
title: Prevalence and characteristics of Plasmodium vivax Gametocytes in Duffy-positive and Duffy-negative populations across Ethiopia

finding: The study reported that the common DPYD variant c.85T > C (rs1801265) was associated with altered dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase activity, which directly impacted 5-fluorouracil toxicity. This indicated that patients with this SNP could have varying responses to 5FU treatment in the context of advanced gastric cancer, linking genetic variation to drug resistance and toxicity.
title: Dynamic phospho-proteogenomic analysis of gastric cancer cells suggests host immunity provides survival benefit

finding: The SNP c.496A > G (rs2297595) was similarly highlighted in the literature as having significant effects on dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase activity. This genetic variant was shown to be important in determining the toxicity of 5-fluorouracil, thereby providing insights into personalized treatment strategies for patients with advanced gastric cancer undergoing therapy.
title: Dynamic phospho-proteogenomic analysis of gastric cancer cells suggests host immunity provides survival benefit

finding: The lead variant in a locus associated with sex-specific mutation pathways, rs61804016 was correlated with increased breast cancer risk and influenced SRGAP2C expression, tying gender differences to genetic predisposition in clonal areas.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: The rediscovered SNP rs12740374 was identified on the gene CELSR2 and played a role in the shared genetic predisposition to AAA and cardiometabolic disorders.
title: Shared Genetic Susceptibility between Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm and Cardiometabolic Traits

finding: The SNP rs11591147 was recognized for its involvement in AAA through the PCSK9 gene, contributing to the shared causal variants among cardiometabolic traits.
title: Shared Genetic Susceptibility between Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm and Cardiometabolic Traits

finding: This SNP was identified in the intronic region of IL6R and shared genetic links with AAA, atrial fibrillation, and coronary artery disease, indicating its relevance in these traits.
title: Shared Genetic Susceptibility between Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm and Cardiometabolic Traits

finding: The SNP rs12126142, also located in the IL6R gene, was found to connect AAA with coronary artery disease, highlighting its role in the intersection of these cardiovascular conditions.
title: Shared Genetic Susceptibility between Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm and Cardiometabolic Traits

finding: In the analysis of gastric cancer, the SNP rs760077 was identified as genome-wide significant using the TAPE and TAPE-LTFH methods. This finding is notable as rs760077 had been previously reported to be associated with gastric cancer in Chinese and Japanese populations, but it had not been associated with the disease in Korean samples before this study.
title: Incorporating family disease history and controlling case-control imbalance for population based genetic association studies

finding: This SNP was a novel locus associated with PD among MAPT H2 carriers, located near VANGL1. It had an odds ratio (OR) of 1.69, with a 95% CI of 1.40-2.03 and a p-value of 2.72E-08, indicating an increased risk for PD. However, this finding was not replicated in UKBB data, with a subsequent analysis showing OR of 1.32 (95% CI: 0.94-1.86, p=0.17).
title: Genome-wide association study stratified by MAPT haplotypes identifies potential novel loci in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The eRNA-QTL rs72700813 was previously known and linked to the modulation of GOLPH3L eRNA (GOLPH3Le) expression, which is closely associated with neurological disorders.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: The A allele of rs6703982 downregulated the expression of NENF eRNA (NENFe) and its target gene NENF, suggesting its role in altering eRNA expression.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: The SNP rs1492258 was identified as the lead marker associated with the locus around LPHN2/ADGRL2, which encoded a synaptic adhesion molecule. Despite its prior lack of association with retinal phenotypes, this SNP was linked to seven autoencoder-derived embedded features with a minimum p-value of 1.4 x 10^-15, suggesting a significant role in retinal-related genetic associations.
title: Autoencoder-based phenotyping of ophthalmic images highlights genetic loci influencing retinal morphology and provides informative biomarkers

finding: The SNP rs7515828 was linked to individual major depression symptoms and was also associated with a common genetic factor of major depression symptoms. This finding was part of a larger analysis that noted several associations from genome-wide association studies (GWAS) related to unipolar depression (EFO ID EFO_0003761).
title: Genetic structure of major depression symptoms across clinical and community cohorts

finding: The SNP rs150046352 was also found to be associated with major depressive symptoms, contributing to the overall findings regarding individual symptoms and a common genetic factor. This finding was consistent with earlier meta-analyses of major depressive disorder.
title: Genetic structure of major depression symptoms across clinical and community cohorts

finding: The rs2230288 SNP, within the GBA gene, was associated with pathologically confirmed Dementia with Lewy Bodies (DLB) without Alzheimer's disease (AD) pathology, marking a significant risk variant identified in recent GWAS.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs2501374 showed robust association in the main effect model, particularly within an intergenic region. It was associated with transcription factor binding despite lacking direct eQTL evidence.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: The finding related to SNP rs12071933 was significant in the context of cancer. Specifically, the research indicated that heteroplasmy in mitochondrial DNA could be observed in both normal and tumoral cells in colorectal cancer patients. This SNP was associated with the variations in mitochondrial haplotypes, demonstrating that somatic mutations, while present, did not have a prominent role in tumorigenesis in the studied patients. The study highlighted the complexity of mitochondrial genetic variation in cancerous tissues.
title: Single-cell mtDNA heteroplasmy in colorectal cancer

finding: The non-coding GBA1 rs3115534 risk variant was found to be associated with increased REM sleep behavior disorder (RBD) symptomatology in individuals of Nigerian origin. The study provided a beta value of 0.3640, SE of 0.103, and a P-value of 4.093e-04, indicating a significant association with possible RBD. This association was maintained even after adjusting for Parkinson's disease (PD) status (Beta = 0.2542, SE = 0.108, P = 0.019), suggesting the variant may have consequences similar to those of GBA1 coding variants.
title: The non-coding GBA1 rs3115534 variant is associated with REM sleep behavior disorder in Nigerians

finding: This variant led an X-chromosomal locus in an intron of <GPM6B> and was highlighted as a GTEx eQTL of the same gene. Its involvement suggested regulation of serotonin uptake in the brain, linking it to neuropsychiatric health.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: The lead GWAS SNP rs10797576 showed high colocalization with multiple sQTLs in the SIPA1L2 gene. It was associated with increased skipping of exon 4, linked to alterations in the gene's 5’ UTR. This observation indicated that the SNP acted primarily through splicing events rather than expression changes, with its impact predicted to weaken the upstream splice site.
title: Long-read RNA-seq atlas of novel microglia isoforms elucidates disease-associated genetic regulation of splicing

finding: The SNP rs16857578 was identified as a lead junction usage QTL SNP associated with alterations in SIPA1L2 splicing at the 5’ splice site. Its T allele was suggested to weaken this splice site, correlating with increased skipping of exon 4. Both spliceAI and Pangolin models supported this observation, providing insights into the functional impact on this gene.
title: Long-read RNA-seq atlas of novel microglia isoforms elucidates disease-associated genetic regulation of splicing

finding: In a proband diagnosed with Usher syndrome, a homozygous deep intronic variant c.4885+740A>T in the USH2A gene was identified. This variant, which was predicted as splice-altering with a strong score of 0.7, was absent from GnomAD and was found to be extremely rare in the TOPMed Bravo dataset, occurring in only 6 alleles out of 264,690. Additionally, it was present in 15 out of 19,896 alleles from the Mexico City Prospective Study. Confirmation of this variant's presence was achieved through direct Sanger sequencing in DNA from an affected sibling, suggesting its association with the Usher syndrome phenotype.
title: Resolving the diagnostic odyssey in inherited retinal dystrophies through long-read genome sequencing

finding: The CC genotype of rs7512462 was associated with greater lung function in cystic fibrosis (CF) individuals, particularly among those with minimal function, gating variants, and homozygous Phe508del mutations, with p-values of 0.008, 0.033, and 0.006 respectively. It additionally showed a strong association with lung function improvement upon treatment with CFTR modulators. Evidence indicated that the C allele is linked to enhanced CFTR function in human nasal epithelial cells when exposed to modulator treatments, suggesting the genetic variant serves as a marker for lung function outcomes in CF populations.
title: Genetic evidence supports the development of SLC26A9 targeting therapies for the treatment of lung disease

finding: The GBA variant exhibited a strong positive association with cluster C1, suggesting a significant role in neurodegenerative processes and a strong negative association with C2, indicating varied influences on NDD symptomology.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The variant TNNT2; NM_001001430.3: c.571-1G>A (rs483352835) was identified in two unrelated probands with cardiac phenotypes of Oceanian ancestry. The study elaborated that this variant disrupts the canonical splice acceptor site, activating a cryptic acceptor which leads to an in-frame deletion of the amino acid p.Gln191del. The classification of the variant was determined to be benign based on the ACMG/AMP guidelines, particularly highlighted by its minor allele frequency greater than 0.05 in Oceanian populations. This investigation revealed complexities in interpreting variants due to the underrepresentation of non-European ancestries in genomic datasets.
title: A rare splice-site variant in cardiac troponin-T (TNNT2): The need for ancestral diversity in genomic reference datasets

finding: The analysis indicated that rs1432639 was associated with a genetic cluster where light-intensity physical activity (LIPA) led to a significant reduction in self-harm behavior risk. This variant linked to obesity/BMI suggested a possible interaction with neural plasticity mechanisms in depression.
title: Associations between physical activities and self-harm behavior in depression across the genotype: findings from the UK Biobank

finding: Lastly, rs11209948 also fell under the same cluster. Like the other two variants, it was correlated with decreased self-harm behavior in response to LIPA, and it was associated with body fat percentage, linking it to the broader context of depression and obesity.
title: Associations between physical activities and self-harm behavior in depression across the genotype: findings from the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was identified as an eQTL of several genes in multiple immune cell types, and it demonstrated strong allele-dependent enhancer activity, indicating its regulatory potential in lupus-related pathways.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: This SNP caused a mutation in adipolin (CTRP12), disrupting its protein folding and likely affecting its receptor interactions, which are critical in the immune context.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: Similar to rs199690076, the rs762710288 SNP was part of a biallelic SLC34A3 variant associated with urinary stone disease. This SNP was also classified as likely pathogenic in Clinvar, highlighting its relevance to the genetic predisposition for USD.
title: Rare variants in SLC34A3 explain missing heritability of urinary stone disease

finding: The single nucleotide variant (SNV) rs7535263 in the CFH gene was significantly associated with increased risk for <CRB1>-associated inherited retinal dystrophies (CRB1-IRDs) specifically in Dutch patients. The A allele of rs7535263 showed an odds ratio of 2.85 (95% CI 1.35-6.02, P = 6.19 × 10^-3) indicating a skewed allele distribution among patients compared to healthy controls. This allele was not found to be significantly associated in the broader global cohort (P = 0.12). Additionally, the relationship was reinforced by the findings of strong linkage disequilibrium with common CRB1 missense variants, suggesting that genetic linkage may play a role in influencing plasma complement factor levels.
title: Elevated Plasma Complement Factors in CRB1-associated Inherited Retinal Dystrophies

finding: In the analysis of genetic factors associated with generalised genetic epilepsy (GGE), the SNP rs876793 was identified in the intronic region of the RYR2 gene. The study found a significant association for protein-truncating ultra-rare variants (URVs) in RYR2 with a log odds ratio of 1.8 and a p-value of 8.6×10^-6. This SNP contributed to the understanding that RYR2 mutations are implicated not only in cardiac arrhythmogenic disorders but also in the etiology of GGE, suggesting a novel neuro-cardiac calcium channelopathy. The findings emphasized the genetic complexity of GGE and the unique roles of specific genes in its development.
title: Exome sequencing of 20,979 individuals with epilepsy reveals shared and distinct ultra-rare genetic risk across disorder subtypes

finding: The SNP rs263526 was identified as a local-eQTL for the gene DFFA within the AFR ancestry group. However, the TWAS association for DFFA in blood tissue showed an effect direction that was opposite to that observed in the EUR ancestry group using the SNP rs903916. Although the TWAS association for rs263526 did not reach transcriptome-wide significance, it provided critical insights into ancestry-specific genetic associations related to asthma risk.
title: Best practices for multi-ancestry, meta-analytic transcriptome-wide association studies: lessons from the Global Biobank Meta-analysis Initiative

finding: The SNP rs903916 was identified as a local-eQTL for the gene DFFA within the EUR ancestry group. Similar to rs263526, the TWAS association for rs903916 in blood tissue revealed an opposite effect direction compared to the association found in the AFR ancestry group. Like rs263526, the significance of this association was only nominal, highlighting the distinct genetic architectures present in different ancestry groups with regards to asthma risk.
title: Best practices for multi-ancestry, meta-analytic transcriptome-wide association studies: lessons from the Global Biobank Meta-analysis Initiative

finding: The analysis identified rs11118119 as a novel cis-pQTL for circulating TGF-β2 levels, with the G allele associated with higher levels. The finding was validated in a prostate cancer cohort (CALGB 90401), where the association was even stronger (p-value < 3.3e-25).
title: Common variation in a long non-coding RNA gene modulates variation of circulating TGF-β2 levels in metastatic colorectal cancer patients (Alliance)

finding: This SNP was associated with focal epilepsy (FE) and was exclusively identified in individuals of Asian ancestry. It was noted as one of the two SNPs that linked to epilepsy types in the specified population.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: The SNP rs4971091 on chromosome 1 was identified in a GWAS meta-analysis as significantly associated with ectopic pregnancy (p=5.32×10−9). It was located in the exon of a non-coding transcript, KRTCAP2, and was positionally related to the gene MUC1, which is known for its role in the barrier function related to embryo implantation.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis supports association between MUC1 and ectopic pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs4072037, a splice acceptor variant in the MUC1 gene, was identified as part of the meta-analysis associating with ectopic pregnancy. It was shown to cause a 27bp/9 amino acid deletion that potentially affects the functionality of MUC1, elucidating mechanisms behind its association with ectopic pregnancy.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis supports association between MUC1 and ectopic pregnancy

finding: The rs769009649 SNP in C1orf52 displayed a significant association with established decreased lifespan (p = 7.4 × 10^-7), further linking this SNP to health outcomes.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The minor allele of rs2228145 in the IL6R gene was found to be associated with a lower risk of developing type 1 diabetes, confirming its protective effects.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The locus rs2229238 near IL6R was linked to type 1 diabetes risk, with its association being corroborated through multiple genetic studies.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs10908839 showed an increased association with type 1 diabetes risk (OR 1.079) and was related to IL6R expression, highlighting its pathogenic relevance.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The variant rs115982800 met genome-wide significance in the discovery GWAS meta-analysis, associated with an annual decline of 140 ml/year in forced vital capacity (FVC) per copy of the risk allele A. It demonstrated consistent effect sizes across studies and was identified as related to the progression of lung capacity decline following IPF diagnosis.
title: Genome-wide analysis of longitudinal lung function and gas transfer in individuals with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs145213510, associated with the PER3 gene, was linked to increased chronic pain susceptibility specifically in females. This finding was novel as PER3 had not been previously associated with pain, but was known to influence circadian rhythms and sleep, suggesting a potential indirect pathway through which circadian processes affect pain susceptibility in women.
title: GWAS of Extended Prescription Analgesic Use Identifies Novel Genetic Loci in Chronic Pain

finding: This SNP within the CHRNB2 gene was identified as significant for tobacco use disorder, supporting its role in nicotine-related traits.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: Associated with tobacco use disorder, this SNP in KDM4A was implicated in problematic opioid use and dopaminergic interactions.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: This SNP in PDE4B was related to TUD as it influences dopaminergic pathways, supporting prior findings of its role in addiction.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The SNP rs61757683 in ALDH4A1 was positively associated with S-1-pyrroline-5-carboxylate, linking it to proline metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs6702754 associated with AQP10 was implied to transport arabonate/xylonate, underlining its metabolic significance.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs752521494 in DEGS1 was associated with palmitoyl dihydrosphingomyelin, indicating its role in lipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs3918290 in DPYD was linked to uracil levels, supporting its role in nucleic acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The study identified the MTHFR 677C allele as a low-penetrant risk factor for rectal cancer. Specifically, combined genotype analysis suggested that individuals carrying the 677CT/1298AC genotype exhibited a protective effect against rectal cancer, while carriers of the 677CC/1298AA genotype faced an increased risk. This finding points to the importance of the 677C allele in the development of rectal cancer in the studied Slavic population.
title: Methylenetetrahydrofolate reductase polymorphic variants in rectal cancer: significance for cancer risk and response to chemoradiotherapy

finding: Similar to the findings related to rs1801133, the study indicated that the MTHFR 1298A allele was a low-penetrant risk factor for rectal cancer. In conjunction with the 677C allele, it was linked to increased risk profiles, whereas the 677CT/1298AC provided a protective advantage. This highlights the significance of the 1298A allele in the context of rectal cancer risk in the population analyzed.
title: Methylenetetrahydrofolate reductase polymorphic variants in rectal cancer: significance for cancer risk and response to chemoradiotherapy

finding: rs35749011 exhibited linkage to the PD-associated gene GBA, with evidence showing eQTL effects on GBA, thereby supporting its role in PD risk.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: Also linked to GBA through strong linkage disequilibrium, rs12726330 was recognized as a potential contributor to PD pathogenesis, underscoring the genetic interplay in disease development.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: Being a missense coding variant within GBA, rs2230288 had established links to PD, contributing to the understanding of PD genetics and risk factors.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: The SNP rs2296172, located in the MACF1 gene, was associated with susceptibility to Type 2 Diabetes (T2D) specifically in the Mizo population from Northeast India. This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic risk factors linked to T2D, indicating that certain genetic variants may vary in their impact across different populations.
title: Polygenic Risk Score Comparative Analyses Reveals Risk Disparity of Genetic Predisposition to Chronic Kidney Disease- A Multi Ancestry Approach

finding: The SNP rs17367504 was confirmed to have a consistent effect across the studied population in relation to preeclampsia, highlighting its role in the genetic basis of this adverse pregnancy outcome.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: The rs56319427 SNP near the CDC42 gene demonstrated a strong association with endometriosis, showing a significant p-value of 4.91E-11. It was confirmed to be in high linkage disequilibrium (R2 = 0.91) with previously reported CDC42 loci, indicating its continued relevance in the genetic understanding of endometriosis.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The rs2814778 SNP located on chromosome 1q23.2 was identified as a significant genetic variant affecting neutrophil count in individuals of African ancestry. The CC genotype was associated with decreased neutrophil count, as it inhibited the binding of the GATA transcription factor, affecting the expression of the ACKR1/DARC gene, which plays a key role in chemokine signaling.
title: Investigating a causal role for neutrophil count on P. falciparum severe malaria: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The index SNP rs12747038 was associated with neutrophil count, with an effective Beta coefficient of -0.22 and P-value of 3.90e-09, indicating its role in alternative splicing related to phenotype.
title: Investigating a causal role for neutrophil count on P. falciparum severe malaria: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: This SNP showed association with decreased granulocyte count in people of African ancestry, similar to results found with neutrophil count, establishing its relevance in the genetic regulation of these immune cell types.
title: Investigating a causal role for neutrophil count on P. falciparum severe malaria: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The index variant rs3747957 located in the <italic>STX6</italic> locus was associated with genetic upregulation of both gene and protein expression linked to increased risk of sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (sCJD), particularly in oligodendrocytes. It exhibited strong evidence of eQTL-GWAS colocalization (PP4s = 94.3-98.0%), highlighting significant associations across multiple brain datasets.
title: Multiomic Analyses Direct Hypotheses for Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease Risk Genes

finding: The study revealed that the A-allele of rs324420, which encodes threonine and leads to reduced FAAH expression and activity, was significantly associated with lower subjective well-being scores across two time points over three years. Specifically, each additional A-allele corresponded to a decrease in well-being scores of 0.54 units in PART Wave I and 0.42 units in PART Wave II. This association was confirmed through linear regression analyses, adjusting for age and sex, across both waves. Additionally, a phenome-wide association study (PheWAS) further validated the reduced well-being connection in the UK Biobank cohort, linking the A allele also to alcohol dependence indirectly through lower well-being.
title: Functional Variation in the FAAH Gene is Directly Associated with Subjective Well-being and Indirectly Associated with Problematic Alcohol Use

finding: SNP rs598253 near ANGPTL3 was associated with a reduction in plasma LDL-C and triglycerides, illustrating its therapeutic potential for cardiovascular risk mitigation, particularly in familial hypercholesterolemia contexts.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: The SNP rs11591147 near PCSK9 was found to affect post-translational degradation of LDLR, indicating its role in LDL-C modulation and potential therapeutic avenues for reducing cardiovascular event risks.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: Associated with thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH), rs10799824 was previously reported to be significantly linked to TSH levels in both a new GWAS and prior studies, reinforcing its role in thyroid function.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The study demonstrated an association between the rs7549881 variant and Parkinson's disease (PD) specifically in females, suggesting a potential link between the SGIP1 gene and neurodegeneration. Among female participants homozygous for the GG allele of rs7549881, 26% had PD compared to 22.2% of those without PD, with a p-value of 0.004 indicating significance. Logistic regression further revealed that the GG genotype was associated with increased PD risk when compared to the AA genotype (OR 1.208, p = 0.015). Additionally, the Phenome-Wide Association Study (PheWAS) identified significant associations of rs7549881 with various digestive disorders, thereby supporting the emerging theory of a gut-brain axis in PD.
title: SNP rs7549881, near SGIP1 at 1p31.3, is significantly associated with digestive disorders and Parkinsonism in women

finding: The rs3115534 variant was identified as a novel non-coding risk allele for Parkinson's disease (PD) specifically in African ancestry populations. It was found to be prevalent in approximately 50% of West African PD cases with an odds ratio of 1.58 indicating a dose-dependent increase in PD risk. This variant is located in intron 8 of the GBA1 gene and has been associated with abnormal splicing and reduced levels of glucocerebrosidase (GCase), suggesting a mechanism of disease through altered RNA processing rather than traditional protein coding mutations.
title: African ancestry neurodegeneration risk variant disrupts an intronic branchpoint in GBA1

finding: An association was identified at rs560804, with a lead SNP p-value of 9.30×10−9. This SNP colocalized with NAV1 expression in the heart and has been previously implicated as a candidate gene for aortic valve stenosis, linking it to vascular calcification processes.
title: Calcification of abdominal aorta is a high risk underappreciated cardiovascular disease factor in a general population

finding: Identified as the first lead variant in the IL6R locus, rs12126142 was found to independently associate with RA and influenced total expression, which plays a role in RA genetic risk.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: This variant served as the second lead variant in the IL6R locus, showing independent associations with RA and contributing to splicing quantitative trait loci (sQTL) signals in monocytes.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: Assumed to be the second lead variant at the PADI2 locus, rs2076616 was associated with RA and indicated alternative splicing likely contributing to the risk.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: Described as a missense variant in the PTPN22 gene, it represented one of the specific EUR signals contributing to RA.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs12123730 was found to be significantly associated with ovarian cancer, particularly in relation to the biomarker CA-125. This connection was emphasized in the context of the study by Charkhchi et al. (2020), which provided a comprehensive review on CA-125 and its relevance in ovarian cancer diagnosis and monitoring. The study underscored the importance of genetic factors in the expression levels of CA-125, enhancing the understanding of ovarian cancer pathology.
title: A Wearable In-pad Diagnostic for the Detection of Disease Biomarkers in Menstruation Blood

finding: The SNP rs661849, located downstream of IRF6, was identified to have allele associated interactions linking it to the genes TRAF3IP3 and IRF6 in CD4+ T cells. This SNP was also validated as an eQTL for these genes, supporting its relevance in immune response.
title: Functional genomics in primary T cells and monocytes identifies mechanisms by which genetic susceptibility loci influence systemic sclerosis risk

finding: The SNP rs2056626 associated with CD247 demonstrated significant allele interactions with the CD247 promoter only in CD4+ T cells. Increased expression of CD247 was observed in CD4+ T cells compared to CD14+ monocytes (log2FC = 7.49, FDR = 3.99 × 10^-210), and it was identified as a strong eQTL for CD247.
title: Functional genomics in primary T cells and monocytes identifies mechanisms by which genetic susceptibility loci influence systemic sclerosis risk

finding: The rs2228145 SNP in the IL6R gene was identified as a common partial loss of function allele with a 39% allele frequency in Europeans. This allele was associated with a nominal reduction in odds of hospitalization for Covid-19, with a pan-ancestry meta-analysis per-allele odds ratio of 0.96 (95% CI, 0.93 to 0.99; P=0.007).
