Furthermore, it was related to a 7% lower level of C-reactive protein (CRP), reduced surface IL-6R levels, a 50% increase in IL-6R shedding, and a 34% increase in serum soluble IL-6R levels. Additionally, this SNP conferred a 7% reduced risk of rheumatoid arthritis and a 5% reduced risk of coronary artery disease, while increasing the risk of asthma by 9% and atopic dermatitis by 15%.
title: A Randomized Placebo-Controlled Trial of Sarilumab in Hospitalized Patients with Covid-19

finding: The SNP rs12071817 was identified as a key feature in distinguishing molecular diagnostic and prognostic characteristics in adult diffuse gliomas, particularly in relation to IDH mutation status. The study indicated that variations in this SNP could serve as complementary biomarkers to MRI-perfusion metrics for enhanced classification of high-grade astrocytomas.
title: Vascular differences between glioblastoma IDH-wildtype and astrocytoma IDH-mutant grade 4 at imaging and transcriptomic level

finding: The SNP rs684559 located in the CHI3L2 gene was shown to correlate with increased risk for tumor-related death, confirming its status as a predictive biomarker in the context of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
title: Prospective validation of a predictive non-invasive SNP-based biomarker signature in resectable pancreatic cancer: a study protocol

finding: The variant rs2228145, a missense mutation in the IL6R gene (p.Asp358Ala), was found to confer protection against chronic liver disease in individuals with clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential (CHIP). Specifically, the odds ratio indicated a significant protective effect for those with CHIP (OR 0.32 CI 0.11, 0.95, p=0.04), whereas no protective association was observed in individuals without CHIP (OR 1.17 CI 0.91, 1.50, p=0.21). This finding suggested a role for proinflammatory IL6 signaling in mediating the relationship between CHIP and chronic liver disease.
title: Clonal hematopoiesis and risk of chronic liver disease

finding: The SNP rs6679677 was found to be associated with juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA). It was linked to the gene HIPK1, which showed decreased expression in CD4+ T cells from active JIA patients compared to healthy controls. The study indicated that the presence of rs6679677 may suppress HIPK1 expression, which subsequently diminished its regulatory role on two transcription factors, GATA4 and TP53, thereby prolonging pro-inflammatory gene expression programs. This suggested a pathogenic role for HIPK1 in JIA and identified it as a potential candidate for therapeutic modulation.
title: Using Genetics, Genomics, and Transcriptomics to Identify Therapeutic Targets in Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis

finding: The interleukin-6 receptor (IL6R) variant rs2228145 (Asp358Ala) was associated with a reduced risk for cardiovascular disease (CVD) and peripheral arterial disease, while at the same time being linked to an increased risk of rheumatoid arthritis (RA). The missense variant was known to decrease the expression of IL6R, which subsequently resulted in reduced IL-6 signaling and lowered downstream inflammation. Subjects carrying the Asp(358)Ala variant exhibited a phenotypic profile that mirrored individuals receiving IL-6R blocking therapies, demonstrating higher hemoglobin levels and lower high sensitivity C-reactive protein (hsCRP) compared to those without the variant.
title: Differential Associations of Interleukin 6 Receptor Variant Across Genetic Ancestries and Implications for Targeted Therapies

finding: The SNP rs6696218 was associated with atopic dermatitis, as it had the highest odds ratio (OR) of 21.45 with a p-value of 8.61e-05. This mutation was located in the LYST gene, which previously showed an association with markedly elevated IgE levels and severe atopic dermatitis in a case study involving a 6-year-old male patient. This indicates that rs6696218 contributes significantly to the genetic susceptibility in atopic dermatitis.
title: An Integrated Genomic and Transcriptomic Analysis Reveals Distinct Molecular Features Associated with Mild-to-moderate Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The missense variant rs4074536 (p.Thr66Ala) in the CASQ2 gene was identified as a lead SNP for LAEF, where the T allele was associated with reduced LAEF in the GWAS. Additionally, expression studies in GTEx showed that this allele correlated with reduced CASQ2 expression in the right atrial appendage and left ventricle. The T allele was also linked with a longer QRS complex duration.
title: Deep Learning of Left Atrial Structure and Function Provides Link to Atrial Fibrillation Risk

finding: The lead AF SNP, rs4484922, was associated with increased risk for AF as noted in previous studies. It was shown to be in linkage disequilibrium with the LAEF-reducing T allele of rs4074536, establishing a connection where an allele increasing AF risk corresponded with reduced LAEF.
title: Deep Learning of Left Atrial Structure and Function Provides Link to Atrial Fibrillation Risk

finding: In the context of gestational length, the SNP rs12037376 in WNT4 replicated at a nominal level in GnuMoM2b, exhibiting a P-value of 6.8×10^-4. This SNP was previously associated with gestational length and implicated in decidualization and embryo implantation processes.
title: Searching and visualizing genetic associations of pregnancy traits by using GnuMoM2b

finding: The SNP rs12404660 in WNT4 was found to be significantly associated with cervical length (Trait ID: U3BB02) at 22-29 weeks, producing a genome-wide significant P-value of 1.0×10^-15. It was also the most significant SNP in the analysis of cervical length in the meta-analysis of GWAS, with a reported P-value of 2.3×10^-12. However, the associations of both rs12037376 and rs12404660 with gestational length did not reach significance at the genome-wide level, likely due to not excluding certain groups of subjects from the analysis.
title: Searching and visualizing genetic associations of pregnancy traits by using GnuMoM2b

finding: The SNP rs4655584 in the LEPR locus was associated with hs-CRP levels, with a significant P-value of 5.57e-27. This finding indicated a relationship between genetic variation in LEPR and inflammation levels defined by hs-CRP.
title: The combined impact of persistent infections and human genetic variation on C-reactive protein levels

finding: The SNP rs4129267 in the IL6R locus demonstrated a strong association with hs-CRP levels, evidenced by a P-value of 4.23e-19. This suggested that genetic variation in IL6R affects inflammatory responses reflected in hs-CRP measurements.
title: The combined impact of persistent infections and human genetic variation on C-reactive protein levels

finding: The SNP rs2794520 located in the CRP gene was significantly linked to hs-CRP levels, with a P-value of 2.51e-32. This highlighted a direct genetic influence of CRP on the inflammatory biomarker levels.
title: The combined impact of persistent infections and human genetic variation on C-reactive protein levels

finding: The SNP rs2794520, located approximately 3kb downstream of the CRP gene, was associated with maternal CRP levels and utilized as a genetic instrument in a Mendelian Randomization study. It explained 1.4% of CRP variance by itself and was used in the analysis to estimate the causal effect of maternal CRP on gestational duration and birth weight. The analysis revealed that a unit increase in log-transformed maternal CRP levels was associated with a reduction of approximately 2.75 days in gestational duration, indicating a negative causal relationship between elevated maternal CRP and gestational length.
title: Interrogating the causal effects of maternal circulating CRP on gestational duration and birth weight

finding: The rs1558498928 SNP, associated with the pathogenic p.Arg299Ter variant in the KDM5B gene, was linked to cognitive impairments in carriers. Specifically, KDM5B PTV carriers had a lower average cognitive function measured by EDU and VNR compared to non-carriers, indicating the impact of this variant on intellectual developmental disorder.
title: The impact of rare protein coding genetic variation on adult cognitive function

finding: The rs10798888 SNP located on chromosome 1 was found to be significantly associated with educational attainment (P=5.15×10^-14) and was in proximity to the ADGRB2 gene, which revealed a significant association with cognitive function as well. Its presence suggested a contribution to cognitive function variance in the adult population.
title: The impact of rare protein coding genetic variation on adult cognitive function

finding: The study found that the rs7542235 genotype GG, which tagged a homozygous deletion at the complement factor H-related (CFHR) proteins locus, predisposed kidney transplant recipients to acute rejection. The unadjusted hazard ratio was reported as 3.10 (95% CI, 1.53–6.29; P=0.002) and the adjusted hazard ratio was 2.97 (95% CI, 1.46–6.05; P=0.003), indicating a significant association between the mismatch in rs7542235 and the risk of acute rejection compared to no mismatch status. Furthermore, sequencing confirmed that the GG genotype was associated with varying sizes of homozygous deletions in the CFHR region, notably affecting rejection-free graft survival.
title: Mismatches in gene deletions and kidney-related proteins are novel histocompatibility factors in kidney transplantation

finding: The rs750046020 variant in the MPL gene was previously associated with thrombocytosis and observed in the Qatari population at a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.009, indicating its potential relevance to blood disorders in this demographic due to founder effects.
title: Qatar Genome: Insights on Genomics from the Middle East

finding: The variant rs72886119, located in NCMAP, was significantly associated with the change of VEGF levels between visit 2 and visit 1, with a P-value of 4.18×10^-8. This suggests that this SNP may play a role in the dynamic regulation of VEGF during pregnancy.
title: Genetic Associations with Dynamic Placental Proteins Identify Causal Biomarkers for Hypertension in Pregnancy

finding: Higher genetically-predicted expression of PLA2G5 was associated with a higher risk of CHD (P=3.18×10^-6), determined using the instrumental variant rs12408798 in aortic artery tissue.
title: Transcriptome- and proteome-wide Mendelian randomization to prioritize therapeutic targets for coronary heart disease

finding: The SNP rs578139575 was associated with a novel locus near HS1BP3 which was found exclusively in Latin American and African cohorts. It was rare in European populations but more common in African and Latin American populations, suggesting a potential protective effect against Parkinson's disease (PD) with a beta of -1.3.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs4844390 was identified as having an effect on the binding of transcription factors, particularly related to CD46 expression. This SNP was significant in the context of Alzheimer’s disease, as it suggested a mediatory role of CD46 in the amyloid and BACE1 activity levels, linking genetic variation to microglial and amyloid pathway activity.
title: A multi-omics approach identifies a blood-based miRNA signature of cognitive decline in two large observational trials

finding: SNP rs606714 was influential in altering the binding of transcription factors associated with microglial activation in neuronal cells. This finding pointed towards a genetic basis for neuroinflammatory responses potentially involved in Alzheimer's disease pathology. However, no eQTL signals for sTREM2 were reported for this variant.
title: A multi-omics approach identifies a blood-based miRNA signature of cognitive decline in two large observational trials

finding: This SNP demonstrated significant associations with physical activity and smoking in the analysis of risk factors for HF.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The variant rs2776741, nearest to RCAN3AS, was also associated with time to irreversible EDSS milestones in females, demonstrating adjusted hazard ratios of 0.77 (p=0.010) for irEDSS3 and 0.74 (p=0.005) for irEDSS6.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: The SNP rs12144136, located near 'CDK18', was associated with early ischemic stroke at genome-wide significance with a P-value of 2.38 × 10−9 and was found to be a cis-eQTL in skeletal muscle, indicating its role in upregulating CDK18 expression.
title: Genome-wide association study of ischemic stroke risk in Sickle Cell confirms ADAMTS2, CDK18, uncovers 12 novel loci

finding: The finding indicated that rs975025 in the 1q25.2 region was associated with the sleep index and tagged multiple diffusion tensor imaging (DTI) parameters, particularly the mean axial diffusivity (AD) of the splenium of the corpus callosum. Strong evidence of shared causal genetic variants between chronotype and DTI parameters was observed (PPH4 > 0.976).
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs10782582 indicated its significance in the connection between daytime nap traits and the cerebellar vermal lobules.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The missense variant rs12737449 in C1orf87 was noted for its potential causal relationship to dyslexia due to its predicted deleterious effects.
title: Discovery of 42 Genome-Wide Significant Loci Associated with Dyslexia

finding: The rs373211062 SNP corresponds to the MFN2 variant Q367H, which was associated with a late-onset myopathy phenotype without typical peripheral neuropathy. This change from glutamine to histidine at codon 367 indicated a hypermorphic change due to the conservation of the glutamine residue across vertebrate MFN2 sequences. The variant had a low allele frequency, present in population databases, and was noted in Clinvar with conflicting interpretations of pathogenicity related to neurological phenotypes. Functional characterization showed significant impairment of mitochondrial function and elevated inflammation pathways, implicating this variant in the pathogenicity of the patient’s myopathy.
title: The MFN2 Q367H variant from a patient with late-onset distal myopathy reveals a novel pathomechanism connected to mtDNA-mediated inflammation

finding: The SNP rs12082297 was originally associated with lymphatic valve function, particularly in the context of cancer-related lymphedema. In the setting of the study, which involved lymphatic flow and associated dysfunction such as that observed in rheumatoid arthritis (RA), this SNP may have implications for the reduction in lymphatic clearance observed in RA patients. This finding was supported by the overarching discussions about lymphatic vessel behavior and clearance in both the experimental TNF-Tg mouse model and clinical observations in RA patients.
title: Near-Infrared Imaging of Indocyanine Green Identifies Novel Routes of Lymphatic Drainage from Metacarpophalangeal Joints in Healthy Human Hands

finding: The SNP rs4245739 was identified in the 3' UTR of MDM4, a regulator of the p53 pathway. It was associated with prostate cancer and highlighted the potential regulatory roles of noncoding SNPs in cancer risk.
title: A distinct class of pan-cancer susceptibility genes revealed by alternative polyadenylation transcriptome-wide association study

finding: The analysis identified a heterozygous variation at rs55886062 (c.1679 T>G), which impacted drug metabolism and was associated with severe toxicity responses to chemotherapy. Crucially, this patient experienced an incomplete response to therapy, with residual cancer remaining. The sequence data informed the selection of an alternative to the initial chemotherapeutic capecitabine, thereby aiming to reduce potential toxicity during the patient's second-line therapy.
title: The Q-IMPROvE (Queensland-IMplementation of PRecision Oncology in brEast cancer) pilot study

finding: The variant rs7549256 at 1p36.22 was associated with Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) / FVC ratio, being in LD (r^2 = 0.55) with a reported index variant.
title: Leveraging global multi-ancestry meta-analysis in the study of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis genetics

finding: At locus 1p31.1, rs4130548 was implicated as the index variant for Body Mass Index (BMI). This finding highlighted a connection between BMI and IPF susceptibility.
title: Leveraging global multi-ancestry meta-analysis in the study of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis genetics

finding: The SNP rs12048727 was found to be significantly associated with AUD in the LA samples, marking it as a noteworthy finding in the cross-ancestry analyses.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The SNP rs7531138 was identified as a likely causal variant associated with multiple traits, including educational attainment and its association with schizophrenia, thus also linking it to behavioral traits in the context of PAU.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: This variant within the PDE4B gene was found to be GWS in the OUD-MTAG analysis, highlighting its potential contributions to opioid use disorder susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: The SNP rs35704242 in NIBAN1 was significantly associated with the combined response to non-chemotherapy drugs, particularly BI 2536, gefitinib, and belinostat.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukemia patients

finding: This SNP is a cis-eQTL for CD247, crucial for T cell receptor signaling; it is related to severe combined immunodeficiency.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: The lead SNP rs198379, located downstream of the NPPB locus, was associated with increased levels of NT-proBNP and BNP as observed in GWAS. The variant was linked to an increased risk of hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) and heart failure, while also showing a protective effect against dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM). Additionally, it increased NPPB expression in the atria.
title: Circulating cardiovascular proteomic associations with genetics and disease

finding: The <italic>PCSK9</italic> R46L variant (rs11591147-T) was associated with significantly lower LDL-C levels in both heterozygous and homozygous carriers among the study participants. Heterozygotes exhibited a decrease of 15.5 mg/dl (11.8%) in LDL-C, while homozygotes showed a decrease of 25.2 mg/dl (19.2%), with both associations being statistically significant (P<0.001). This variant, therefore, demonstrated a beneficial lipid-lowering effect crucial for understanding genetic influences on cholesterol levels.
title: Protective lipid-lowering genetic variants in healthy older individuals without coronary heart disease

finding: The SNP rs1410996 was strongly associated with AMD, tagged as 'FGAMD1'. It contributed significantly to the genetic signal at the CFH locus, showing a p-value of 9.6x10^-618 in univariate analysis, and its proxies exhibited similarly strong signals.
title: Loss of CFHR5 function reduces the risk for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs10922109 was found to explain a large proportion of the AMD genetic signal in the CFH region, previously reported as tagged by rs1410996. It was utilized in conditional analyses which confirmed its role in AMD susceptibility.
title: Loss of CFHR5 function reduces the risk for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs570618 was in complete linkage disequilibrium with p.Tyr402His of CFH and was shown to contribute to the strong association with AMD in the Finns.
title: Loss of CFHR5 function reduces the risk for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs537634973 represented a third independent signal at the CFH locus linked with AMD, having a conditional p-value of 6.2x10^-25, suggesting its role in modulating AMD risk.
title: Loss of CFHR5 function reduces the risk for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP chr1:196994128:C:CAA corresponds to the frameshift variant p.Glu163insAA in CFHR5, which was significantly associated with reduced risk of AMD as established through univariate analysis.
title: Loss of CFHR5 function reduces the risk for age-related macular degeneration

finding: This SNP was associated with TNFRSF1B, a gene involved in cytokine signaling, essential in understanding atopic dermatitis.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP, located in the locus associated with immune cell distributions, showed a significant association with an unspecified immune cell type. It was validated and indicated potential relevance in multiple immune-related conditions.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with CD8+ memory stem cells and other T cell types, indicating its role in the immune response and potentially linking it to diseases such as type 1 diabetes.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: Associated with immune cell distributions in a manner similar to other T cell phenotypes, this SNP contributed to understanding the genetic underpinnings of immune responses.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: This SNP was associated with the expression levels of multiple genes, indicating its possible role in regulating immune cell functions.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: The study identified the variant rs2625222 within the NFASC gene on chromosome 1 as a novel genome-wide significant signal associated with Alzheimer disease (AD) susceptibility. Functional analyses supported that NFASC is the primary gene tagged by this risk association.
title: A genome-wide association study in Peruvians suggests new risk loci for Alzheimer Disease

finding: The SNP rs77449572 was identified as the sentinel variant at an intergenic locus on chromosome 1p22.2 associated with trigeminal neuralgia (TN). It reached genome-wide significance with a p-value of 1.72 x 10^-9 and was shown to overlap an enhancer element in cortex-derived neurospheres, suggesting its potential role in regulating gene expression related to TN.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals genetic risk factors for trigeminal neuralgia

finding: The SNP rs543311093 was one of the five SNPs that reached genome-wide significance at the intergenic locus on chromosome 1p22.2 associated with TN. Its association contributes to the genetic understanding of TN, although specific functional implications were not detailed in the context.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals genetic risk factors for trigeminal neuralgia

finding: The SNP rs35117749 was also identified at the intergenic locus on chromosome 1p22.2, contributing to the genetic risk factors associated with TN. Like the others, it reached genome-wide significance, adding to the broader context of genetic involvement in TN.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals genetic risk factors for trigeminal neuralgia

finding: The SNP rs71666259 was one of the significant variants at the chromosome 1p22.2 locus for TN. It was located in an enhancer element in embryonic stem cells (HUES48), indicating a possible role in gene expression regulation relevant to TN.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals genetic risk factors for trigeminal neuralgia

finding: Similar to rs71666259, the SNP rs116010656 was found at the chromosome 1p22.2 locus linked to TN and also overlaps an enhancer element in embryonic stem cells (HUES48), suggesting it may affect gene regulatory mechanisms that influence susceptibility to TN.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals genetic risk factors for trigeminal neuralgia

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly distinct in the DUFFY blood group system between the Orang Asli and cosmopolitan Malaysians, with a reported P-value of 0.0270.
title: Genomic map of blood group alleles in Malaysian indigenous Orang Asli population from whole genome sequences

finding: This SNP was linked to the RH blood group system and showed a highly significant difference with a P-value of 0.0000 between the indigenous Orang Asli and Malaysian populations.
title: Genomic map of blood group alleles in Malaysian indigenous Orang Asli population from whole genome sequences

finding: The SNP rs41272536, found at locus 1q25.3 in the SMG7 gene, was identified as another significantly associated marker for SLE, exhibiting a P-value of 3.5×10^-52, confirmed across EU and Chi cohorts.
title: Genome-wide Association Clustering Meta-analysis in European and Chinese Datasets for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus identifies new genes

finding: The finding indicated that individuals who carried the Factor V Leiden variant (rs6025) exhibited an increased risk of inherited thrombophilia, which was associated with a 2.05 hazard ratio for developing venous thromboembolism (VTE) following Covid-19 infection. This risk was comparable to the effect of aging by 10 years.
title: Venous Thromboembolism in Ambulatory Covid-19 patients: Clinical and Genetic Determinants

finding: The c.1905+1G>A variant was identified as a splice-site variant causing exon 14 skipping, which resulted in the production of an inactive DPD protein. This variant was noted to be present in South Asian, East Asian, and Middle Eastern patients with severe fluoropyrimidine-related toxicity.
title: DPYD genetic polymorphisms in non-European patients with severe fluoropyrimidine-related toxicity: A systematic review

finding: The c.1156G>T variant leads to protein truncation and was detected in three Japanese patients with severe fluoropyrimidine-related toxicity, evidencing significant reductions in DPD activity.
title: DPYD genetic polymorphisms in non-European patients with severe fluoropyrimidine-related toxicity: A systematic review

finding: The c.557A>G variant was connected to severe 5-FU-related toxicity in multiple case studies among African Americans, indicating its potential predictive value for toxicity.
title: DPYD genetic polymorphisms in non-European patients with severe fluoropyrimidine-related toxicity: A systematic review

finding: SNP rs10919543 was detected as a possibly invalid instrumental variable in the relationship of TREM2 on Alzheimer's disease (AD), as it was associated with red blood cell count, a known risk factor for AD. Following the exclusion of this SNP, MR-SPI suggested a negative association between TREM2 and the risk of AD.
title: Robust Mendelian Randomization Analysis by Automatically Selecting Valid Genetic Instruments for Inferring Causal Relationships and Identifying Omics Biomarkers

finding: This SNP was associated with primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG), showing an odds ratio (OR) of 1.35. It colocalized with an eQTL and sQTL for the gene TMCO1, where decreased expression of TMCO1 and increased expression of its antisense gene RP11-466F5.8 were proposed to lead to increased intraocular pressure (IOP) levels and increased POAG risk.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs116089225 was noted for being the top IOP association and was linked to decreased expression of TMCO1, which was also associated with increased POAG risk. The beta value reported for IOP was -0.744.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: This SNP colocalized with TMCO1 sQTL and was associated with skipping of exons linked to TMCO1, which correlated with protection from POAG. It indicated that changes in splicing could have significant implications for the risk of POAG.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: This SNP was highlighted as a European-specific locus with a considerable odds ratio of 5.47 for POAG risk, linked to a nonsense mutation in MYOC, which is known for juvenile-onset and adult-onset open-angle glaucoma.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs7528419 also exhibited a bidirectional causal relationship with coronary artery disease (CAD). Similar to rs2519093, it was associated with the alteration of a metabolite's levels, showcasing its role in the genetic landscape influencing both the metabolite concentration and CAD risk.
title: Integrative metabolomics differentiate coronary artery disease, peripheral artery disease, and venous thromboembolism risks

finding: SNP rs6656401 was within the CR1 gene and served as a significant eSNP in both blood and brain, influencing expression differently across tissues while being associated with AD risk.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: The study found that the PADI4 haplotype, including SNP rs11203366, affected neutrophil behavior and clinical outcomes related to wound healing in patients with diabetes mellitus (DM). Patients homozygous for the minor variant experienced significantly higher rates of infections (60.7%) and delayed wound healing (78.6%). This SNP was linked to higher levels of PADI4 expression in neutrophils.
title: PADI4 minor haplotype as risk factor for excessive NET formation and associated wound healing disorders in diabetes mellitus

finding: Similar to SNP rs11203366, this variant was part of the PADI4 haplotype influencing neutrophil behavior in patients with DM. Higher rates of complications, specifically infections and delayed wound healing, were linked to the minor allele presence. This SNP contributed to increased neutrophilic PADI4 expression levels.
title: PADI4 minor haplotype as risk factor for excessive NET formation and associated wound healing disorders in diabetes mellitus

finding: This SNP was noted for its significant association with PADI4 expression levels, with homozygous minor carriers showing drastically higher expression than other genotypes. In the context of wounds in patients with DM, this SNP was linked to higher frequencies of infections and delayed healing, reaffirming its role within the PADI4 haplotype.
title: PADI4 minor haplotype as risk factor for excessive NET formation and associated wound healing disorders in diabetes mellitus

finding: The rs72688573 variant was associated with LV mass to end-diastolic volume ratio and two heart failure risk factors, indicating its role in heart failure.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The rs646776 SNP was identified as one of the five SNPs in the PRP-5 associated with complex coronary artery disease in T2DM patients, with an odds ratio (OR) of 5.2, highlighting its genetic significance.
title: Complexity of Coronary Disease and a Genetic Risk Profile in Patients with Type 2 Diabetes in Colombia

finding: The SNP rs1022464, identified as a lead variant at the TDRD9 locus, displayed significant association with lower FEV1 and was involved in promoter-enhancer interactions with PPP1R13B expression, although it did not correlate directly with TDRD9 expression.
title: Multi-omic association study identifies DNA methylation-mediated genotype and smoking exposure effects on lung function in children living in urban settings

finding: The rs112437613 SNP in the DAB1 gene was identified as a novel genome-wide significant locus associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD), showing an odds ratio of 2.28, with 95% confidence interval (CI) of 1.73-3.01 and a p-value of 5.4×10^-9. The minor allele T was associated with increased disease risk, exhibiting a higher frequency in AD individuals compared to non-AD participants in those who were APOE-ε4 homozygous.
title: Whole genome analysis in APOE4 homozygotes identifies the DAB1-RELN pathway in Alzheimer’s disease pathogenesis

finding: The duffy null allele (rs2814778) in the ACKR1 gene was linked to significant variability in white blood cell and neutrophil counts in both African Americans and Hispanic Latinos. Its high frequency in malaria-endemic regions provided resistance to Plasmodium vivax malaria.
title: Systematic comparison of phenome-wide admixture mapping and genome-wide association in a diverse biobank

finding: The SNP rs2070901 was associated with chronic periodontitis and had significant associations with other inflammatory processes, thus contributing positively to the findings related to colorectal cancer risk.
title: Two-sample Mendelian randomization analysis of associations between periodontal disease and risk of colorectal, lung, and pancreatic cancers

finding: SNP rs1052067 located at 1q22 was a novel shared locus with a P-value of 2.76×10−08, identified as part of the pleiotropic SNPs associated with breast cancer and COVID-19.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The SNP rs9659023, identified as an intronic variant of the FMN2 gene, was associated with both total hip and femoral neck BMD traits. The significance of this variant had been previously reported in associations with heel and total body BMD, confirming its relevance in bone density traits.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: In the ANGPTL3 locus, the intronic variant rs6657050 was significantly associated with phosphatidylcholine PC(38:7)+AcO- and phosphoinositol PI(36:2)-H-. This association highlighted the role of ANGPTL3 in lipid and glucose metabolism and its potential impact on cardiovascular disease.
title: Genome-wide analysis of blood lipid metabolites in over 5,000 South Asians reveals biological insights at cardiometabolic disease loci

finding: The rs12411216 SNP was strongly associated with anti-WUPyV IgG levels (P=2.70e-30), indicating genetic modulation in response to WUPyV, linked to the MUC1 gene.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: The association of rs4072037 with IgG levels against WUPyV was confirmed, showing that the T allele was associated with increased IgG, but also highlighting its known link to gastric cancer susceptibility due to splicing alterations in MUC1.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: Research indicated that the rs932335 variant in the HSD11B1 gene was linked to colorectal cancer in a Chinese population.
title: Identification of potential core genes in hepatoblastoma via bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs192146294 on chromosome 1 was significantly associated with Staphylococcus infection, with a p-value of 1.23 × 10^-9, highlighting its relevance in the genetic determinants of infectious diseases.
title: The genetic architecture of human infectious diseases and pathogen-induced cellular phenotypes

finding: The study found that the C allele of SNP rs479200 in the EGLN1 gene was significantly associated with severe COVID-19 outcomes. Specifically, the odds ratio for the CC genotype in severe COVID-19 patients was 11.414 (adjusted) and 6.214 (unadjusted), indicating a strong risk factor for severity in COVID-19 based on the genotype. The frequency of the C allele was two-fold higher in severe cases compared to asymptomatic and moderate cases.
title: C allele of rs479200 of the host EGLN1 gene - a risk factor for severe COVID-19 (pilot study)

finding: This SNP was associated with a trans-colocalization signal linking fibulin-5 (FBNL5) and age-related macular degeneration (AMD). The study identified this novel colocalizing trans-association, suggesting potential therapeutic implications for AMD.
title: Systematic disease-agnostic identification of therapeutically actionable targets using the genetics of human plasma proteins

finding: The rs5361 SNP in SELE was identified as a rare variant conferring substantial risk for NPC, with odds ratios indicating a major contribution to the disease (OR ≈ 2.20). This variant was linked to altered endothelial cell function, thus promoting NPC progression, underscoring the impact of rare genetic variants on NPC heritability.
title: Whole-Exome Sequencing Association Study Implicates Genetic Effects on Viral Oncogenesis and Tumor Microenvironment in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs16837903 was associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) at locus 1q21.2 with allele G showing decreased odds of the disease (OR[95%CI]=0.88[0.85, 0.92], P=9.54×10^-9). This finding related to the effector gene MCL1, which exhibited increased expression in IPF patients compared to controls.
title: Common and rare variant analyses reveal novel genetic factors underlying Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis and shared aetiology with COVID-19

finding: The rare variant rs143435072 was linked to increased risk for IPF, showing an OR of 28.79 [8.51-97.43] and a P-value of 6.73×10^-8. This variant was identified as a loss of function variant in ANGPTL7, suggesting its role in the pathogenesis of IPF.
title: Common and rare variant analyses reveal novel genetic factors underlying Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis and shared aetiology with COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs12142240 was significantly associated with later menopause at the RAD54L locus, consistent with findings from the ReproGen consortium's GWAS on absolute menopausal age.
title: Rare coding variants in five DNA damage repair genes associate with timing of natural menopause

finding: At the RAD54L locus, rs12073998 also exhibited a strong association with later menopause that was reported to be in high linkage disequilibrium with rs12142240.
title: Rare coding variants in five DNA damage repair genes associate with timing of natural menopause

finding: The missense variant rs28363218 at the RAD54L locus was nominally significant with later menopause, with a p-value of 7.1 x 10^-5, contributing additional evidence to the association.
title: Rare coding variants in five DNA damage repair genes associate with timing of natural menopause

finding: The SNP rs4606 in the RGS2 gene was associated with later-life hypertension and a history of early-onset PE in a Norwegian cohort. It was identified that the CG or GG genotypes were linked to increased hypertension risk, post-adjustment for age and BMI.
title: Genomic variation associated with cardiovascular disease progression following preeclampsia: A systematic review

finding: The SNP rs575265, associated with the gene CHADL, showed a high association with Gilles de la Tourette syndrome (GTS) and obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). This finding was part of a meta-analysis of GWAS results indicating its significant role in the genetic basis of these psychiatric disorders.
title: An oligogenic risk-model for Gilles de la Tourette syndrome based on whole-genome sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs76472767 was significantly associated with subsequent arterial ischemic stroke (AIS) in the African ancestry genome-wide association study (GWAS) with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.75 and a p-value of 3.69x10^-08. This association indicated that the presence of the variant was linked to a reduced risk of subsequent AIS after an incident stroke.
title: Protein identification for stroke progression via Mendelian Randomization in Million Veteran Program and UK Biobank

finding: The study found that the rs1137101 polymorphism of the LEPR gene had a high frequency of the G allele in patients with metabolic syndrome (87%) compared to those without (91%), suggesting a relationship with obesity risk in the Yakut population.
title: Polymorphism Q223R of the leptin receptor (LEPR) - a possible relationship with adaptation to non-tropical climate in Yakuts

finding: Research indicated that the rs1137100 polymorphism, responsible for the K109R substitution, had a G allele frequency of 66.6% in the Yakut population; however, it was not significantly associated with metabolic syndrome or its components.
title: Polymorphism Q223R of the leptin receptor (LEPR) - a possible relationship with adaptation to non-tropical climate in Yakuts

finding: The SNP rs12071965 was associated with early detection of pancreatic cancer as indicated by the study conducted by Kato and Honda in 2020. This finding related to biomarkers and imaging was significant in enhancing awareness of genetic factors influencing pancreatic cancer prognosis.
title: PanCanAID – Pancreas Cancer Artificial Intelligence Driven Diagnosis in CT Scan Imaging: A Protocol for a Multicentric Ambispective Diagnostic Study

finding: The rs1205 variant was linked with CRP levels, showing allele frequency patterns that suggest implications for COVID-19 outcomes.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: Rs78062588 was identified as a sentinel variant in a novel locus related to lung cancer and is regarded as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor subunit CHRNB2, particularly in brain tissue.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The rs301806 SNP was associated with major depression and was identified as a daSNV. It had the highest BRAIN-MAGNET cb score among 4 candidate SNPs in LD at this locus, demonstrating its potential as a disease-associated variant.
title: A novel functional genomics atlas coupled with convolutional neural networks facilitates clinical interpretation of disease relevant variants in non-coding regulatory elements

finding: In FCGR2A, the rs1801274 (H131R) allele showed weak evidence of a better outcome associated with the R allele, and homozygosity for the H allele was associated with inferior response measures in RA and SLE.
title: Comprehensive genetic and functional analysis of FcγRs in rituximab therapy for autoimmunity reveals a key role for FcγRIIIa on NK cells

finding: The rs396991 (F158V) variant in FCGR3A was also confirmed as having an impact on clinical response, particularly in SLE where homozygosity for the V allele showed improved response odds for BILAG MCR.
title: Comprehensive genetic and functional analysis of FcγRs in rituximab therapy for autoimmunity reveals a key role for FcγRIIIa on NK cells

finding: The SNP rs2092504 was recognized as an intronic variant in the TMEM51 gene and was found to be genome-wide significant in relation to Raynaud's syndrome, potentially implicating its role in the condition's molecular underpinnings.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The rs142000963 (g.156138719 C>T; LMNA p.R644C) variant was found to significantly associate with hepatic steatosis in a cohort from the Michigan Genomics Initiative (MGI) comprising over 57,000 individuals, demonstrating an odds ratio of 1.7 (P=0.02). This association remained consistent across diverse ancestry groups. Moreover, this variant was linked to more advanced liver disease conditions, such as hepatic decompensation with an odds ratio of 5.0 (P=0.002), and had weaker associations with liver transplant and hepatic necrosis, with odds ratios of 10.0 and 16.4, respectively. Additional analyses showed strong associations with metabolic traits such as waist-to-hip ratio, type 2 diabetes, hemoglobin A1c levels, and decreased HDL cholesterol in publicly available datasets, affirming its pathogenic role in metabolic disorders.
title: LMNA R644C associates with hepatic steatosis in a large cohort and increases cellular lipid droplet accumulation in vitro

finding: The non-coding variant rs1527365-T in the PARP1 gene acted as a protective allele for overall CHIP, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.88 (95% CI 0.85-0.91) and a significant p-value of 7.0 x 10^-13, indicating its association with decreased PARP1 expression and increased DNA methylation, further supporting its regulatory role.
title: Germline genomic and phenomic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis in 323,112 individuals

finding: SNP rs76934732 also exhibited pronounced positive mean Z-scores, representing a consistent effect direction across various cerebellar features, confirming its role in cerebellar morphology.
title: The genetic architecture of human cerebellar morphology supports a key role for the cerebellum in recent human evolution and psychopathology

finding: The missense variant rs1061170, which altered histidine to tyrosine at position 402 of the Complement Factor H (CFH) protein, introduced an artificial difference in protein levels across genotypes. This finding was identified as a biased attributable pQTL but did not result in false identifications.
title: Plasma Proteome Variation and its Genetic Determinants in Children and Adolescents

finding: The SNP rs723177, located at the fetal RPL31P11 locus, acted as an eQTL and pQTL for immunoglobulin receptors, suggesting implications in maternal antibody transfer across the placenta, thereby implicating it in placental growth.
title: Genome-wide association study of placental weight in 179,025 children and parents reveals distinct and shared genetic influences between placental and fetal growth

finding: The SNP rs543874 was listed among the seven common SNPs identified in the significant causal associations with PCOS, emphasizing its relevance in the context of obesity.
title: Both general- and central- obesity are causally associated with polycystic ovarian syndrome: Findings of a Mendelian randomization study

finding: Variant rs35479618 in NPR1 was reported to be associated with increased blood pressure. The analysis confirmed that nonsynonymous variants affecting NPR1 generally elevate the risk for hypertension.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects implicates genes involved in increased and decreased risk of hypertension

finding: Similar to rs35479618, variant rs116245325 in NPR1 was found to increase blood pressure. This SNP, in conjunction with others in NPR1, provided support for the role of this gene in hypertension.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects implicates genes involved in increased and decreased risk of hypertension

finding: The variant rs61757359 in NPR1 was associated with decreased blood pressure. While it primarily shows a protective association, it highlights the complex role of NPR1 variants in influencing hypertension risk.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects implicates genes involved in increased and decreased risk of hypertension

finding: The rs12752585:G>A variant was identified as protective against SARS-CoV-2 infection, showing a decreased risk with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.98 and significant statistical relevance (P = 1.5 × 10^-11). It also increased MUC1 expression in the esophagus mucosa.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The rs35154152:T>C missense variant (p.Ser279Gly) in THBS3 was found to reduce the risk of hospitalization (OR = 0.88, P = 5.6 × 10^-22), indicating its protective effect.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The rs11208552:G>T intronic variant in JAK1 was protective against critical illness (OR = 0.92, P = 5.5 × 10^-10) and hospitalization (OR = 0.95, P = 2.2 × 10^-9), thereby influencing disease outcome.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs74707424, a leading SNP in the significant locus at 19p12, is located in the 3’ untranslated region of the gene ZBTB40, which has been reported to regulate osteoblast activity and bone mass, thus linking it to OPLL pathogenesis.
title: Genetic insights into ossification of the posterior longitudinal ligament of the spine

finding: The variant rs2814778 was specifically highlighted in the context of Benign Ethnic Neutropenia (BEN), predominantly observed in African Americans. Studies suggested that screening for this genotype could improve the interpretation of neutropenia in affected individuals, avoiding unnecessary invasive procedures while enhancing treatment inclusivity.
title: Leveraging genomic diversity for discovery in an EHR-linked biobank: the UCLA ATLAS Community Health Initiative

finding: The rs890293 polymorphism in the CYP2J2 gene was associated with an increased susceptibility to Alzheimer’s disease specifically within the Chinese Han population. This finding provided insight into the genetic factors that may underpin the inflammatory processes involved in Alzheimer’s disease, as the cytochrome P450 pathways are implicated in lipid mediator regulation.
title: Association of plasma and CSF cytochrome P450, soluble epoxide hydrolase and ethanolamides metabolism with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: In the analysis of the rs1541255 A>G polymorphism in the ATP2B4 gene, it was associated with higher plasma concentrations of PfHRP2 and a significant increase in the sequestration index. Although this finding appeared contrary to expectations, suggesting a higher prevalence of PfHRP2 despite lower peripheral parasite densities, the observed results indicated a distinct protective effect linked to this allele.
title: The impact of malaria-protective red blood cell polymorphisms on parasite biomass in children with severe Plasmodium falciparum malaria

finding: The SNP rs1801274 was identified in locus 1q23.3, and was confirmed to be associated with ulcerative colitis in several European-ancestry studies. This finding was exclusively identified by the ReAD method.
title: A powerful replicability analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The splice donor variant rs56043070 (c.89+1G>A) in the GCSAML gene was associated with urticaria with an Odds Ratio (OR) of 1.24 and a p-value of 6.9×10^-12, indicating a loss of function resulting in this condition.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The rare East Asian missense variant rs151193009 (p.Arg93Cys) in the PCSK9 gene was found to have a protective effect against thromboembolic diseases, with an Odds Ratio (OR) of 0.75 and a p-value of 7.1×10^-11.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The rs10737681 SNP, located on chr1q31.3, was associated with CFHR5 levels, showing a significant increase of β= +81.33 ± 8.67 (p = 6.49E-21) in plasma from the analyzed cohorts. This SNP mapped between the CFHR1 and CFHR4 gene loci, highlighting its relevance in plasma CFHR5 concentration.
title: Elevated plasma Complement Factor H Regulating Protein 5 is associated with venous thromboembolism and COVID-19 severity

finding: The rs10494747 SNP exhibited a borderline significant association (p = 9.83E-08) with CFHR5 levels, where the A-allele was correlated with an increase of β= +47.60 ± 8.92. This variant is located ≈343 kb away from the lead SNP rs10737681, mapping to the ZBTB41 gene.
title: Elevated plasma Complement Factor H Regulating Protein 5 is associated with venous thromboembolism and COVID-19 severity

finding: The SNP rs148010464 was described as an intergenic variant related to the genes PLA2G4A and LINC01036 and was also unique to South Asia. This variant was associated with an increased risk of stroke, particularly through its implications in metabolic processes. The gene PLA2G4A plays a role in phospholipid metabolism and cardiovascular processes, including the production of thromboxane A2, which is involved in platelet aggregation.
title: Ethnic and region-specific genetic risk variants of stroke and its comorbid conditions can define the variations in the burden of stroke and its phenotypic traits

finding: The SNP rs35288741 was identified as a repressive SNP-DRE that modulated the transcriptional activity of the gene NUAK2. Deletion of the rs35288741 region resulted in a significant reduction of the NUAK2 gene expression (p-value = 0.038), indicating that this SNP plays a critical role in the regulation of neural pathways potentially related to stress response and psychiatric disorders.
title: Assessment of glucocorticoid-induced enhancer activity of eSNP regions using STARR-seq reveals novel molecular mechanisms in psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs72673189 was found to be significantly associated with the development of levodopa-induced dyskinesia (LiD) in Parkinson's disease patients, reporting a hazard ratio (HR) of 2.77 and a p-value of 1.53 x 10^-8. This variant was located within the LRP8 gene on chromosome 1.
title: Genetic meta-analysis of levodopa induced dyskinesia in Parkinson’s disease

finding: pgBoost linked rs35249183 to TNFRSF8 (CD30), fine-mapped for eosinophil count with a PIP of 1.00. This SNP lies within an ENCODE cCRE with a distal enhancer signature, considered gold-standard based on an independent GWAS coding variant. This link scored outside the top 5% of other methods, which implicated different genes.
title: Linking regulatory variants to target genes by integrating single-cell multiome methods and genomic distance

finding: The rs2661319 variant in RGS4 gene was found to predict relative responsiveness to atypical antipsychotic treatment (perphenazine) in African ancestry patients.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The rs2842030 variant in RGS4 gene was also associated with predicting the responsiveness to atypical antipsychotic treatment in patients of African descent.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: Homozygous individuals for the 'C' allele of rs951439 in the RGS4 gene demonstrated a more favorable response to perphenazine compared to other antipsychotics like quetiapine or ziprasidone.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The SNP rs41309643 located on chromosome 1 at 1q42.13 was identified as significantly associated with melanoma-specific survival (MSS) during the GWAS meta-analysis of the MIA and UKB cohorts, with a reported P-value of 2.08x10^-8 and a hazard ratio (HR) of 2.09. However, it was not replicated in the Leeds Melanoma Cohort (LMC), where P was 0.679, and later analyses showed it was no longer significant at the level of P < 5x10^-8 with HR 1.83 and P 3.21x10^-7, indicating high heterogeneity.
title: Higher polygenic risk for melanoma is associated with improved survival

finding: The rs1026417 variant was found to be associated with decreased levels of NfL in circulation (P = 1.36x10-8) in African-American participants, pointing to its role in modulating neuro-axonal injury and indicating a potential protective factor.
title: Genome-wide Association Study Meta-analysis of Neurofilament light (NfL) levels in blood reveals novel loci related to neurodegeneration

finding: The SNP rs6025 was noted for its significant association with VTE, presenting a transancestry odds ratio (OR) of 2.39. This SNP was previously demonstrated to have a large effect size on the F5 gene, indicating its importance in VTE risk assessment.
title: Multi-ancestry polygenic risk scores for venous thromboembolism

finding: SNP rs260512 was shown to have regulatory implications at the SKI locus, another factor contributing to the biological mechanisms behind gout.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: This missense variant in AQP10 showed linkage to gout through expression regulation in immune responses.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: rs6685323 was associated with AQP10, which plays a role in cell volume regulation affecting NLRP3 inflammasome activation.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of 2,622,830 individuals reveals new pathogenic pathways in gout

finding: The SNP rs6686750 was associated with IL6R plasma protein levels in STEMI patients across all time points. It demonstrated a genotype effect of β=0.42 with a p-value of 1.6×10^-5. This finding underscored the relevance of genetic variation in modulating immune responses during myocardial infarction.
title: Single-cell dissection of the immune response after acute myocardial infarction

finding: SNP rs6689206 regulated soluble IL6R levels, impacting trans-signaling pathways in both STEMI patients and controls. This variant was highlighted for its role in inflammation modulation during the critical early phase of myocardial infarction, establishing a genetic basis for potential targeted anti-IL-6 therapies.
title: Single-cell dissection of the immune response after acute myocardial infarction

finding: The rs36053993 variant was significantly associated with PrCa risk (p=0.031) in the North American dataset and was identified in the MUTYH gene, which is involved in oxidative damage repair.
title: Germline sequencing of DNA-damage-repair genes in two hereditary prostate cancer cohorts reveals new disease risk-associated gene variants

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with the rapid symptom progression subtype (Subtype III) of Parkinson's disease (PD).
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: Association with the rapid symptom progression subtype (Subtype III) of PD was noted for this SNP.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with the rapid symptom progression subtype (Subtype III) of PD.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: This SNP was associated with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I) of PD.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs2166172 located at locus 1p22.2 was found to be significantly associated with hospitalized COVID-19, with a p-value of 2.74×10⁻⁸, indicating its role in the genetic predisposition to severe outcomes in COVID-19 patients.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: SNP rs6679677 was found to map to the gene PTPN22 on chromosome 1, identified as a locus that matched significant GWAS results, indicating its relevance in the context of genetic associations with autoimmune diseases.
title: New Genetic Insights in Rheumatoid Arthritis using Taxonomy3®, a Novel method for Analysing Human Genetic Data

finding: The genetic variant rs7554873 was found to be located near the FCGR2B gene on chromosome 1, which is involved in immune responses and neuroinflammation. It was noted for its relationship to chronic inflammation, suggesting a role in conditions like ALS.
title: Polygenic associations and causal inferences between serum immunoglobulins and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs1004819 was found to be the main disease-associated variant for IL23R in German Crohn's Disease patients. This finding contributed to the understanding of the genetic factors influencing Crohn's Disease, showing that this specific variant had a significant impact on the disease's susceptibility.
title: The missing link between genetic association and regulatory function

finding: The G allele of rs3903239 was linked to atrial fibrillation and had lower frequency in LLIs, suggesting a reduced risk of cardiovascular disorders, with survival chances decreasing by 0.498 times for the G allele.
title: Genetic variants associated with longevity in long-living Indians

finding: The rs138295139 variant was one of three significant loci identified that related to clusterin biology in Alzheimer's disease, showing consistent replication across multiple studies. Its proximity (4.4kb) to the rs4428865 variant associated with plasma clusterin suggests a potential role in Alzheimer's pathophysiology.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: As a rare variant in HSPG2, rs143543800 was identified as associated with Alzheimer’s disease, signaling the potential importance of heparin sulfate pathways in the disease process.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: The rs3918290 variant associated with DPYD deficiency-linked fluorouracil toxicity was found to be significantly enriched in the Reddy group.
title: Endogamy and high prevalence of deleterious mutations in India: evidence from strong founder events

finding: The rs2297595 variant related to severe toxicities in cancer patients treated with fluorouracil was identified as significantly enriched in the Yadav group.
title: Endogamy and high prevalence of deleterious mutations in India: evidence from strong founder events

finding: The C allele of rs10803164 was found to have pleiotropic effects on blood cell trait variance. This SNP was associated with increased variance in blood cell traits and displayed a strong correlation with mean blood cell trait levels.
title: Genome-wide analyses of variance in blood cell phenotypes provide new insights into complex trait biology and prediction

finding: This SNP was identified as showing damaging potential with a high CADD score, potentially affecting reading ability and indicating its relevance in complex traits.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: The SNP rs2061155 was nominated as a putative causal variant at one of the adiponectin loci, aligning with the lead variants determined in the broader meta-analysis.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The missense variant rs11591147 in PCSK9 showed a protective effect against cardiovascular death or heart transplant in individuals diagnosed with ischemic heart disease, with a hazard ratio (HR) of 0.78 and a significant P value of 0.04 after controlling for comorbidities.
title: Combining Genetic Proxies of Drug Targets and Time-to-event analyses From Longitudinal Observational Data To Identify Target Patient Populations

finding: The SNP rs11205303 was observed to be frequently present in Europeans compared to Africans, with prior studies linking it to pulmonary function parameters.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pulmonary Function in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank Identifies Distinct Variants

finding: Associated with higher AD risk, the rs6656401 variant (R2 = 0.88 with lead SNP) was corroborated through its correlation with CSF pTau, aligning with established AD risk associations.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis for Alzheimer’s disease cerebrospinal fluid biomarkers

finding: The SNP rs6668622, located approximately 150Kb from the gene IVNS1ABP, was associated with COVID-19 susceptibility specifically in males, with a significant P-value of 3.28×10^-9 and an odds ratio (OR) of 0.69. This finding suggested that variants near this gene may influence mRNA abundance, potentially impacting disease severity.
title: AncestryDNA COVID-19 Host Genetic Study Identifies Three Novel Loci

finding: The SNP rs111972040 reached genome-wide significance for hospitalization due to COVID-19, with a P-value of 8.38×10^-9 and a notably high OR of 8.29. It was a non-coding transcript variant in the SRRM1 gene, potentially implicating this gene in splicing processes related to viral replication.
title: AncestryDNA COVID-19 Host Genetic Study Identifies Three Novel Loci

finding: The SNP rs2131902 was found to tag causal variants for lung and liver metastasis and was characterized as a protective allele with an odds ratio less than 1 compared to the major allele. It showed increased significance in the pooled analysis for lung and liver metastasis subtype compared to the overall stage I-IV analysis, suggesting that it may play a role in mitigating the risk of these particular types of metastasis.
title: Functional annotation with expression validation identifies novel metastasis-relevant genes from post-GWAS risk loci in sporadic colorectal carcinomas

finding: The intergenic SNP rs6658111 on chromosome 1 was highlighted as one of the most frequently shared independent SNPs, significant in 10 to 15 brain structures, indicating its overarching influence on brain shape traits.
title: Beyond Volume: Unraveling the Genetics of Human Brain Geometry

finding: The rare frameshift variant rs1176723126 in the FOXE3 gene was found significantly associated with the phenotype 'other cataract' (phenotype code H26), showing a p-value of 6.2e-9. The relationship between FOXE3 and cataract had been noted in prior studies but was not identified within previous UK Biobank imputed arrays.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of half-a-million UK Biobank participants

finding: The LoF variant rs28362286 (p.C679X) located in the PCSK9 gene revealed associations with significantly lower LDL levels, especially noted among homozygous carriers of African ancestry, reiterating its connection to lipid metabolism and cardiovascular health.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of half-a-million UK Biobank participants

finding: This SNP was identified as rs1176723126 and showed a significant association with the 'other cataract' phenotype, solidifying previous findings that linked mutations in the FOXE3 gene with cataracts.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of half-a-million UK Biobank participants

finding: This SNP had a replicated cis-eQTL for IL-6R and was part of a network supporting the genetic regulation of IL-6 protein levels, further associating it with immune system dynamics.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: The SNP rs12082227 was identified as a positive and original finding associated with the response to chemoradiotherapy (CRT) in locally advanced rectal cancer. The study revealed that patients with certain genotypes of this SNP exhibited a pre-existing tumoral B cell infiltration, which correlated with a favorable response to CRT, thereby suggesting its potential utility as a biomarker for predicting treatment outcomes.
title: Human Gene and Microbial Analyses Suggest Immunotherapy-like Mechanisms in Complete Response to Radiotherapy in Rectal Cancer

finding: The SNP rs3001038 was associated with febrile seizures at the 1p31.1 locus. It yielded a combined odds ratio of 1.14 and a very low P value of 1.84 x 10^-12. This variant was located within an LD block of the fever response gene PTGER3, and many associated SNPs at the locus were identified as eQTLs for PTGER3 in various brain tissues, where risk-increasing alleles corresponded to increased expression of the gene.
title: Genome-wide association study of febrile seizures identifies seven new loci implicating fever response and neuronal excitability genes

finding: The SNP rs1518111 was confirmed at the 1q32.1 locus to be associated with febrile seizures, yielding a combined odds ratio of 1.16 (P = 1.02 x 10^-10). This SNP is intronic or upstream of IL10, which encodes the cytokine interleukin 10. The risk allele was associated with decreased IL10 expression, and some variants at this locus were also linked to Behçet's disease.
title: Genome-wide association study of febrile seizures identifies seven new loci implicating fever response and neuronal excitability genes

finding: SNP rs561931 in PHGDH suggested a positive association with offspring birthweight through its role in serine biosynthesis.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The rs2814778-CC genotype was identified as common among individuals of African ancestry and was associated with lower white blood cell (WBC) counts in the absence of disease. This genotype was linked to an increased likelihood of undergoing diagnostic investigations, such as bone marrow biopsies, and discontinuation of medications due to toxicity concerns. Notably, carrier individuals experienced drug-induced leukopenia and discontinuation of treatment protocols related to chemotherapeutic and immunosuppressant drugs. These findings highlighted the clinical implications of the rs2814778-CC genotype in the context of benign neutropenia, particularly its role in leading to misinterpretations of WBC counts due to uncalibrated reference ranges for this genotype.
title: Clinical consequences of a polygenic predisposition to benign lower white blood cell counts

finding: Associated protectively against hospitalization for COVID-19, indicating how genetic makeup can influence disease severity.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: Recognized for its involvement in lung function, this SNP contributed to understanding genetic susceptibility to severe COVID-19.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs12030738 was identified in the context of FDA-approved immune checkpoint inhibitors according to NCCN guidelines, reflecting its significance in treatment response. This finding highlighted the potential of this SNP as a marker for selecting patients likely to benefit from ICI therapy, underscoring its relevance in precision cancer treatment.
title: Tumor genomic subtypes orthogonal to mutation burden predict the efficacy of immune checkpoint therapy

finding: The variant rs11557080, located in the 3' UTR of RAB29, emerged as noteworthy with a p-value of 0.0034. This SNP was highlighted due to previous studies suggesting an interaction between RAB29 and LRRK2 activity, indicating its potential association with CSF alpha-synuclein aggregate status.
title: LRRK2-Associated Parkinsonism With and Without In Vivo Evidence of Alpha-Synuclein Aggregates

finding: The SNP rs11591147 was identified as a direct causal variant associated with the PCSK9 gene related to LDL-C levels. TGVIS showed a CS-Pratt of 0.492, indicating its relevance as a causal variant in the context of lowering LDL-C.
title: Uncovering causal gene-tissue pairs and variants: A multivariable TWAS method controlling for infinitesimal effects

finding: The SNP rs11206517 was also noted as a direct causal variant linked to the PCSK9 gene for LDL-C. Along with rs11591147, it contributed to improved causal gene prioritization by TGVIS.
title: Uncovering causal gene-tissue pairs and variants: A multivariable TWAS method controlling for infinitesimal effects

finding: The genome-wide significant signal rs74048016 indicated that the C allele had a detrimental effect on lung function, particularly in contexts of increased PM10 exposure, leading to decreased expression of the HES4 gene and altered expression of two other genes associated with lung function.
title: Genome-wide gene-air pollution interaction analysis of lung function in 300,000 individuals

finding: There was significant evidence of a sex difference in the effect of rs145330152 on DLB risk, where the male effect size was approximately 1.8 times larger than that in females, highlighted by a p-value of 0.016 and a 95% confidence interval from 1.15 to 2.5.
title: Identification of a sex-specific genetic signature in dementia with Lewy bodies: a meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs2636014 was identified to be under positive selection, showing a weak linkage disequilibrium with rs2476601, a missense variant discordantly affecting autoimmune diseases and basal cell carcinoma.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: The intronic variant rs10788884 in SLC5A9 was associated with urinary xylose concentrations, representing a newly identified metabolite association and was a strong eQTL for SLC5A9.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: This variant was highly associated with low-density lipoprotein cholesterol, linking it to cholesterol metabolism and potential risk factors for CVD.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: The MUTYH c.1103G>A (p.Gly368Asp, rs36053993) variant was classified as pathogenic and linked to autosomal recessive colorectal adenomatous polyposis. It was one of the few variants exceeding a 1% prevalence rate in the Spanish population and recorded in population databases.
title: Unveiling the Landscape of Reportable Genetic Secondary Findings in the Spanish Population: A Comprehensive Analysis Using the Collaborative Spanish Variant Server Database

finding: For rs141749679, the hub gene SORT1 was prioritized in astrocytes, highlighting its significance in relation to Alzheimer’s pathology.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The GSTM1 polymorphism rs412543 was associated with increased risk of treatment-related adverse events, including hepatotoxicity, in the context of individuals receiving anti-tuberculosis treatment.
title: Pharmacogenetics of tuberculosis treatment toxicity and effectiveness in a large Brazilian cohort

finding: The missense SNP rs2642438 in MARC1 was previously protective against cirrhosis and associated with improved hepatic lipid composition, emphasizing its role in liver health.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs12061513 SNP was investigated in the context of oncologic patient management during the COVID-19 pandemic, particularly focusing on uro-oncologic patients. This study, published by Mistretta et al. in 'Cancers (Basel)' in 2020, highlighted the importance of understanding genetic variants such as rs12061513 in the management and outcomes of cancer patients amidst the healthcare challenges imposed by the pandemic.
title: The impact of the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic on healthcare provision in Italy to non-COVID patients: a systematic review

finding: The SNP rs77868538 was found to be significantly associated with Chinese Vocabulary – Knowledge (CVK) and character reading (CCR). It was located within the gene TNR (Tenascin R) that plays a crucial role in human brain development and has been previously reported to be associated with cognitive performance.
title: A genome-wide association study of Chinese and English language abilities in Hong Kong Chinese children

finding: The SNP rs16848469 was associated with CVD_Total and CVK_Total, and is located within the TNR gene. It emphasizes the gene's importance due to its involvement in brain development and previous associations with cognitive performance.
title: A genome-wide association study of Chinese and English language abilities in Hong Kong Chinese children

finding: The rs11591147 SNP was associated with a partial loss-of-function (LOF) variant in the PCSK9 gene among 440,371 UK Biobank participants. This variant led to a median time-averaged difference in plasma LDL-C levels, where partial LOF carriers had LDL-C levels that were 12.0 mg/dL (8.8%) lower than non-carriers, indicating a significant impact on lipid levels related to atherosclerotic cardiovascular risk reduction.
title: A NATUrally Randomized trial Evaluating a vaccine-like strategy to lower LDL by inhibiting PCSK9 on the lifetime risk of major cardiovascular events (NATURE-PCSK9)

finding: The NLRP3 rs10157379 T > C genetic variant was associated with fatigue, myalgia, hyperalgesia, and malaise during the acute infectious phase of COVID-19. This variant contributed to the exaggerated immune response, leading to pathology like the cytokine storm commonly seen in acute COVID-19 infections.
title: Chronic fatigue, depression and anxiety symptoms in Long COVID are strongly predicted by neuroimmune and neuro-oxidative pathways which are caused by the inflammation during acute infection

finding: The NLRP3 rs10754558 C > G variant also exhibited a significant association with fatigue, myalgia, hyperalgesia, and malaise during the acute phase of infection. Similar to rs10157379, this variant was implicated in the dysregulation of immune responses that may result in severe symptoms in acute COVID-19.
title: Chronic fatigue, depression and anxiety symptoms in Long COVID are strongly predicted by neuroimmune and neuro-oxidative pathways which are caused by the inflammation during acute infection

finding: The SNP rs3766916 was found to colocalize with several eGenes, including TRIM46 and GON4L. TRIM46 was noted for its role in controlling neuronal polarity and was implicated in high-glucose-induced ferroptosis in retinal capillary endothelial cells, suggesting a causal relation to retina-associated ocular traits.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The variant rs4845712 was highlighted for its strong LD with rs3766916 and showed potential as a causal SNP in a pleiotropic locus. It was located in the intron of the EFNA4 gene, known for inhibiting axonal regeneration and regulating optic nerve axon guidance, emphasizing its relevance in ocular disorders.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The SNP rs36053993 in the MUTYH gene was identified in ESCC patients, specifically found only in Caucasian patients, which may suggest geographical-specific mutation prevalence.
title: Comprehensive Study of Germline Mutations and Double-Hit Events in Esophageal Squamous Cell Cancer

finding: The SNP rs762307622, also in the MUTYH gene, was observed in Asian patients with ESCC, indicating its potential relevance in this demographic.
title: Comprehensive Study of Germline Mutations and Double-Hit Events in Esophageal Squamous Cell Cancer
