title: Common, low-frequency, rare, and ultra-rare coding variants contribute to COVID-19 severity

finding: The SNP chr1:207629207:A:C linked to the gene CR1 was identified as a damaging variant that completely co-segregated with the common variants in EFIGA families, highlighting its relevance in the genetic framework of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Identification of Rare Damaging Missense and Loss of Function Variants in GWAS Loci Using Genome Sequencing Data from Two Cohorts of Familial Late-Onset Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs11121880 was associated with a study conducted by Chroni et al. (2019) that investigated tumor migration paths using a Bayesian biogeographic approach. The findings highlighted the role of specific genetic variants, including rs11121880, in understanding the mechanisms of cancer cell metastasis, providing insights into how genetic factors may influence the migration of cancer cells and their subsequent spread to secondary tissues.
title: PathFinder: Bayesian inference of clone migration histories in cancer

finding: The rs746736545 mutation (p.Ala4210Val) in VPS13D was identified as causing spastic ataxia. It was noted that this mutation occurs at helical membrane-bound regions of the gondola domain of the protein, specifically at highly conserved residues, which suggests a potential disruption of protein docking at the lipid membrane.
title: In silico modelling human VPS13 proteins associated with donor and target membranes suggests lipid transfer mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs4077468, located at the SLC26A9 locus, was examined in a quantitative trait association analysis of the FEV1/FVC ratio using data from 1,927 non-CF individuals from the UK10K cohort. The analysis demonstrated evidence of association with p-values of 0.0392 using genotype likelihoods and 0.0375 using genotype calls. These results were consistent with prior studies in non-CF populations, including a large analysis from the UK Biobank (n=307,638), which yielded a highly significant association (p=4.35 \\times 10^-25). Although the p-values from the UK10K data were not as small as previously reported due to sample size differences and the limited range of FEV1/FVC in 8-year-olds, the findings supported the contribution of variants at this locus to lung function in individuals without cystic fibrosis.
title: VikNGS: A C++ Variant Integration Kit for Next Generation Sequencing association analysis

finding: The SNP rs11208009 on chromosome 1 showed a genome-wide significant association with word reading (p=1.10 × 10^-8). This rs11208009 has been indicated as independent of known loci related to intelligence or educational attainment. It has been linked to three nearby genes: DOCK7, ANGPTL3, and USP1, which were suggested as potential candidate genes for further investigation.
title: Genome-wide association analyses of individual differences in quantitatively assessed reading- and language-related skills in up to 34,000 people

finding: The A allele frequency in rs14103 (C1orf212) in Amami-Oshima island (0.791) was significantly lower than in the Hondo cluster (0.855, P = 0.022) but not significantly different from that in the Ryukyu cluster (0.753, P = 0.187). The frequencies in Kikai island did not show significant differences from any of the other populations (P = 0.287 with Amami-Oshima, P = 0.126 with Ryukyu, P = 0.562 with Hondo). This SNP could contribute to understanding the genetic differentiation within the region.
title: Genetic lineage of the Amami islanders inferred from classical genetic markers

finding: The SNP rs11420276 was implicated in that its GWAS lead SNP was 1.1E-12, but when conditioned on the expression of <italic>ELOVL1, CCDC24,</italic> and <italic>ARTN</italic>, the GWAS lead SNP P-value increased to 7.1E-04. This finding showed that these genes were driving the signals in previously implicated ADHD loci, explaining 0.774 of the variance.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder identifies associated genes and phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12082114 was associated with the oncogenic serine 45-deleted beta-catenin in human colonocytes. This finding was pertinent to the study on colorectal cancer (CRC) and the variable sensitivities observed in patient-derived xenografts (PDXs) when treated with the anti-EGFR antibody cetuximab. It indicated that EGFR genetic deletion had implications in the response to treatments within these models.
title: XENTURION, a multidimensional resource of xenografts and tumoroids from metastatic colorectal cancer patients for population-level translational oncology

finding: The finding established that rs11589479 regulated the skipping of the 19th exon in ADAM15 in all tested tissues. ADAM15 is implicated in inflammation mechanisms and associated with Crohn’s Disease.
title: Junction-skipping regulation in complex disease

finding: The research highlighted that rs267738, associated with glycated hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c), regulated junction-skipping in CERS2, further linking it to metabolic traits.
title: Junction-skipping regulation in complex disease

finding: The study found that the heterozygous LMNA coding SNV (C>T, rs4641) in Patient cells exhibited primarily monoallelic expression from only the normal allele, indicating an alteration in expression patterns associated with the LMNA mutation that leads to DCM.
title: LMNA-Related Dilated Cardiomyopathy: Single-Cell Transcriptomics during Patient-derived iPSC Differentiation Support Cell type and Lineage-specific Dysregulation of Gene Expression and Development for Cardiomyocytes and Epicardium-Derived Cells with Lamin A/C Haploinsufficiency

finding: The SNP rs12071811 was associated with the metastatic behavior of HER2-positive breast cancer cell lines, specifically in the study of the UACC-893 cell line which was identified as a useful model for examining metastasis in this context. This finding contributed to the broader understanding of subtype-dependent metastatic abilities in HER2-positive breast cancer.
title: Metastatic profiling of HER2-positive breast cancer cell lines in xenograft models

finding: The analysis identified SNP rs72705895 within a TGIF boundary associated with venous thromboembolism. This SNP also overlapped a CTCF binding site, suggesting its involvement in regulatory functions and potential disruption of the 3D genome organization that may influence cardiovascular disease phenotypes.
title: Examining dynamics of three-dimensional genome organization with multi-task matrix factorization

finding: Like rs3760638, rs2774290 was among the ASCA-SNPs showing opposite correlation trends in formative versus primed RNMs, highlighting its potential influence on the ratio of pluripotency states.
title: Unsupervised Machine Learning Identifies Chromatin Accessibility Regulatory Networks that Define Cell State Transitions in Pluripotency

finding: This SNP was noted as one of the ASCA-SNPs that had opposite correlations across the pluripotency states, contributing to the understanding of how genetic variants influence stem cell state transitions.
title: Unsupervised Machine Learning Identifies Chromatin Accessibility Regulatory Networks that Define Cell State Transitions in Pluripotency

finding: The SNP rs4645978 in the CASP9 gene was associated with an increased risk of breast cancer. The presence of mutations in CASP9 contributed to breast cancer development, highlighting its role as an initiator of apoptosis in this context.
title: Using Published Pathway Figures in Enrichment Analysis and Machine Learning

finding: Similar to rs4645978, the SNP rs4645981 in the CASP9 gene was linked to high breast cancer risk. This finding suggested a significant role of CASP9 mutations in the pathogenesis of breast cancer.
title: Using Published Pathway Figures in Enrichment Analysis and Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs11249433 in the NOTCH2 gene was studied in breast cancer patients and indicated that increased expression of NOTCH2 associated with this polymorphism could contribute to the development of estrogen receptor-positive luminal tumors.
title: Using Published Pathway Figures in Enrichment Analysis and Machine Learning

finding: The study identified rs646776 as a well-known trans-pQTL for the SORT1 locus, which was implicated in modifying coronary artery disease (CAD) risk by altering plasma low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol levels through the regulation of hepatic SORT1 expression. This finding suggested that while rs646776 influenced plasma protein levels associated with CAD, it supported the notion that GRN was not on the causal pathway to CAD but rather downstream of this regulatory process.
title: Integrative analysis of the plasma proteome and polygenic risk of cardiometabolic diseases

finding: The c.493A>G (rs2642438) variant, resulting in the p.A165T mutation in the mARC1 gene, was found to be associated with protection from all-cause cirrhosis and improved prognosis in nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH). In experimental settings, the A165T variant exhibited reduced protein stability and significant mislocalization from the mitochondrial outer membrane, leading to decreased N-reductive activity. Despite predictions of impaired function based on in silico models, it was noted that, in certain kinetic assays with specific substrates, the A165T variant did not behave differently from wild-type mARC1, indicating a complex relationship between the genetic variant and its functional consequences.
title: Biochemical and functional characterization of the p.A165T missense variant of mitochondrial amidoxime-reducing component 1 in HepG2 cells

finding: This SNP was associated with AAA, although it did not achieve genome-wide significance, presenting a suggestive p-value of 2.04x10^-7 and an OR of 0.7668.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: The rs6025 variant, known as F5 c.1601G>A (p.Arg534Gln, historically reported as p.Arg506Gln), had been associated with increased risk for venous thromboembolism (VTE). The allele was found across multiple ethnic groups, with the highest frequency among individuals of European ancestry (2.96% according to the Genome Aggregation Database). Evidence from various meta-analyses and case-control studies indicated that heterozygous carriers had odds ratios for developing VTE ranging from 2.2 to 4.93. Homozygous carriers exhibited even higher odds ratios between 7 and 11.5. In vitro and in vivo studies confirmed that this variant significantly impacted the functionality of the protein. As a result, the p.Arg534Gln variant met established criteria for classification as an official risk allele for VTE.
title: Considerations for clinical curation, classification and reporting of low-penetrance and low effect size variants associated with disease risk

finding: The SNP rs12030591 was positively associated with the karyotypic flexibility of cancer genomes, based on the work of Raftopoulou et al. in 2020. This finding provided insights into how polyploidization plays a critical role in maintaining the structural integrity of cancer chromosomes, particularly in contexts related to telomere dysfunction.
title: Pathway choice in the alternative telomere lengthening in neoplasia is dictated by replication fork processing mediated by EXD2’s nuclease activity

finding: The SNP rs11121985 was associated with the regulation of Hedgehog (HH) signaling pathways, particularly in the context of basal cell carcinoma (BCC). It was found that this SNP may contribute to the accumulation of mutations in genes related to Alström and Usher syndrome, which are known to suppress ciliogenesis and influence HH signaling in advanced cancer stages. This relationship indicated that rs11121985 could be a significant factor in the crosstalk between HH and other signaling pathways, affecting the behavior of tumors resistant to SMO inhibitors.
title: aPKC drives cilia-independent Hedgehog signaling to maintain basal cell carcinoma growth

finding: The SNP rs28411352 was linked to MTF1 expression in the context of RA. It overlapped with an enhancer region that was active under stimulatory conditions, indicating its involvement in the regulatory mechanisms contributing to RA.
title: Parsing multiomics landscape of activated synovial fibroblasts highlights drug targets linked to genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs12731181 was identified as a rare variant located in the miR-590-3p target site of the Prostaglandin F2α receptor gene. It was associated with an increased risk of essential hypertension within the Han Chinese population. This finding underscored the relevance of miRNA interactions in the regulation of gene expression impacting hypertension.
title: Modeling microRNA-driven post-transcriptional regulation by using exon-intron split analysis (EISA) in pigs

finding: The SNP rs12061694 was identified as a significant factor in the regulation of apoptosis through Bcl-xL, which is evolutionarily conserved. This finding related to its implications in various cancers, highlighting the potential of developing targeted therapies using broad-spectrum antivirals that modulate this pathway.
title: Broad-spectrum mono- and combinational drug therapies for global viral pandemic preparedness

finding: The SNP rs12082154 was associated with melanoma phenotypes as described in the work of Tang et al. (2020). This finding was derived from the application of the RESA framework which identified expressed somatic mutations in scRNA-seq data, including the retrieval of the BRAF driver mutation in a melanoma patient. This highlighted the significance of rs12082154 in relation to the study of melanoma and its mutation-related expression signatures.
title: Detecting expressed cancer somatic mutations from single-cell RNA sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs12123664 was positively associated with macrophage polarization processes, specifically in terms of M1 and M2 characteristics. This finding was directly relevant to the study of tumor-associated macrophages (TAM), which were modeled to understand their role in cancer dynamics. The connection indicated a potential impact on immune response modulation in cancer contexts.
title: Agent-based vs. equation-based multi-scale modeling for macrophage polarization

finding: The SNP rs1057519914 caused a C1483R mutation in mTOR, linked to hemimegalencephaly and several cancers.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: This SNP was associated with neutralizing antibody responses and was found relevant in the context of B cell-mediated immunity.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Linked to vaccine response, this SNP highlighted its significance in characterizing immune responses and potential autoimmunity development.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: The SNP rs4526602 was identified as the top ranked and most significantly associated variant for the monocyte percentage blood trait. Positioned in an intergenic region between the gene bodies of AIM1L and CD52, it was found that CD52 expression significantly decreased (log2 fold-change = -1.92) in an analysis of gene expression, indicating potential regulatory effects on this trait.
title: Discovery of target genes and pathways of blood trait loci using pooled CRISPR screens and single cell RNA sequencing

finding: Evidence pointed to this SNP affecting gene regulation critical for Treg activity influencing T1D progression.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: CDA rs602950 was associated with increased expression of CDA, which is relevant for capecitabine metabolism in colorectal cancer patients, indicating its importance in pharmacogenomics.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: CDA rs532545 was also associated with increased CDA expression in vitro in patients treated with capecitabine, marking its relevance in pharmacogenomics.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs2298804 was identified as having sex-specific effects on immune phenotype in the context of health and disease. Specifically, while males with this polymorphism upregulated their pro-inflammatory response, which negatively impacted their reproductive success, females exhibited an increased anti-inflammatory response that elevated their risk of infection without apparent reproductive costs. This highlighted the differential consequences of this genetic variant on male and female fitness in a wild population of field voles.
title: IgE receptor polymorphism predicts divergent, sex-specific inflammatory modes and fitness costs in a wild rodent

finding: The variant rs11591147 was established as a well-known causal variant for LDL cholesterol (LDLC) at the PCSK9 locus by the research group.
title: Improving fine-mapping by modeling infinitesimal effects

finding: The variant rs499883 was identified with high confidence at the PCSK9 locus for LDLC alongside rs11591147, replicating previous findings when using functionally informed priors. SuSiE did not capture this variant.
title: Improving fine-mapping by modeling infinitesimal effects

finding: The intronic variant rs7552841 was identified consistently with high confidence at the PCSK9 locus for LDLC, supporting its role as a significant variant in this region.
title: Improving fine-mapping by modeling infinitesimal effects

finding: The rs3795263 variant in the ACTRT2 gene was identified as harmful and associated with a severe form of tick-borne encephalitis virus infection. The ACTRT2 gene is involved in cytoskeletal organization.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing-based Characterization of Human Genome Variation and Mutation Burden in Botswana

finding: The analysis revealed that the SNP rs1805407 in the PARP1 gene was associated with increased sensitivity to PARP1 inhibitors in cancer cells. This finding suggested that individuals with this SNP could potentially benefit from an improved therapeutic strategy when treated with PARP1 inhibitors, highlighting its relevance in cancer treatment.
title: CausER - a framework for inferring causal latent factors using multi-omic human datasets

finding: rs147048677 was identified as a novel synonymous variant in the MUC1 gene and showed a significant association with PUD, suggesting its relation to genetic risk for Helicobacter pylori infection.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: The rs3737787 genetic variant of USF1 showed significant associations with familial hyperlipidaemia, a condition that is a known risk factor for premature cardiovascular disease. This variant was linked to alterations in pro-inflammatory cytokine secretion and serum lipid levels, thereby impacting cardiometabolic health and age-related disease risks.
title: Ageing-related defects in macrophage function are driven by MYC and USF1 transcriptional programmes

finding: Similar to rs3737787, the rs2073658 genetic variant of USF1 was found to have significant associations with familial hyperlipidaemia. Its involvement contributes to changing serum lipid levels and inflammatory responses, emphasizing its role in age-related cardiovascular health issues.
title: Ageing-related defects in macrophage function are driven by MYC and USF1 transcriptional programmes

finding: The rs10908821 SNP in USF1 was associated with age-related brain lesion development in Alzheimer's Disease. This genetic variant highlighted a connection between USF1 and neurological aging processes, adding another layer to understanding the implications of age-related decline in immune functions.
title: Ageing-related defects in macrophage function are driven by MYC and USF1 transcriptional programmes

finding: The SNP rs340874 at the PROX1 locus was initially nominally significant for associating with T2D (p-value=1×10^-7) but reached genome-wide significance (p-value=2×10^-22) in studies with larger sample sizes. LOGO identified this SNP as functional significant, demonstrating its role in after-meal metabolism and glucose levels, particularly within metabolic pathways validated in both Japanese and Chinese populations.
title: Integrating convolution and self-attention improves language model of human genome for interpreting non-coding regions at base-resolution

finding: The SNP rs12040990 was identified as a significant marker associated with the regulated cell death signaling network. This association was crucial for understanding diseases via comprehensive analytical tools in the study by Ravel et al. in 2020, suggesting its relevance in the context of cancer signaling.
title: Reusability and composability in process description maps: RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK signalling

finding: The SNP rs12082290 was linked to a study where a 3D heterotypic breast cancer model demonstrated a role for mesenchymal stem cells in fueling a proliferative and invasive phenotype. This finding suggested that genetic variations at this locus contributed to the aggressive characteristics of breast cancer.
title: Investigating the impact of fibroblast proximity to a tumor on fibroblast extracellular vesicle production utilizing 3D bioprinted stromal models

finding: The SNP rs11102694 was reported to be associated with type 1 diabetes (T1D) in both the EstFin and 1000 Genomes reference panels, indicating replicability of this association across different imputation datasets.
title: Advantages of genotype imputation with ethnically matched reference panel for rare variant association analyses

finding: This SNP was linked to the Duffy blood group system and was associated with multiple cytokine ratios. The findings indicated the complex relationships between the Fy alleles and cytokine production, which are clinically relevant in malaria resistance.
title: Genetic associations with ratios between protein levels detect new pQTLs and reveal protein-protein interactions

finding: The SNP rs2814778, located within the Duffy Antigen Receptor for Chemokines gene (DARC), was identified as part of a selective sweep. This gene has significant functional implications, as the null (nonexpression) allele of DARC confers resistance to the malaria parasite Plasmodium vivax. The analysis showed that a 430 kbp region surrounding the DARC locus, including rs2814778, was affected by a selective sweep at a confidence threshold of 0.5, and this region narrowed to 370 kbp at a more stringent threshold of 0.99. Evidence indicated that sweeps occurred within high recombination regions near DARC, reaffirming the region's association with strong adaptive evolution linked to malaria resistance.
title: Versatile detection of diverse selective sweeps with Flex-sweep

finding: The SNP rs12061524 was associated with GNA alterations in cancer, particularly affecting the treatments for uveal melanoma. This indicated that understanding the specific genetic makeup could help tailor chemotherapy strategies, demonstrating a significant advancement in precision oncology.
title: An interpretable deep learning framework for genome-informed precision oncology

finding: The SNP rs12071765 was associated with the ccl5/ccr5 axis in cancer progression, as detailed in a study by Aldinucci et al. (2020). This finding indicated that variations in this locus could influence immune processes related to cancer, potentially interacting with the mechanisms of humoral immunity and the role of B cells in response to specific environments influenced by sex hormones.
title: Oestrogen influences B cell class-switching in individuals with an XX sex chromosome complement

finding: The SNP rs539515, found 6kb downstream of the SEC16B gene, demonstrated significant GxE interactions also relating to logBMI, with a highly significant p-value of 6.5 × 10⁻¹². Previous research noted interplay between SEC16B and various environmental factors.
title: Gene-environment interactions using a Bayesian whole genome regression model

finding: The minor allele (A) of rs3024493 at the IL10 locus associated with an increased risk of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). It was identified as the top cis pQTL for IL10 and correlated with lower plasma levels of IL10.
title: Large-scale comparison of immunoassay- and aptamer-based plasma proteomics through genetics and disease

finding: The correlating variant rs3024505 (r^2=1) similarly associated with the risk of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and was identified alongside rs3024493 in a cis pQTL context for IL10.
title: Large-scale comparison of immunoassay- and aptamer-based plasma proteomics through genetics and disease

finding: The sentinel cis pQTL for CD58 (rs10801908) was linked to reduced risk of multiple sclerosis (MS) and associated with lower levels of CD58, reinforcing its significance in autoimmune processes.
title: Large-scale comparison of immunoassay- and aptamer-based plasma proteomics through genetics and disease

finding: The SNP rs2251636 showed interaction with the SEMA4A gene, which has implications for vascular signaling and development, enhancing the understanding of genetic influences on BP and vascular health.
title: Chromatin interaction maps of human arterioles reveal new mechanisms for the genetic regulation of blood pressure

finding: The rs11591147 variant in PCSK9 was confirmed to be associated with LDL-C levels. This finding was previously known, reinforcing the connection between this SNP and lipid regulation.
title: Role of Rare and Low Frequency Variants in Gene-Alcohol Interactions on Plasma Lipid Levels

finding: The rare missense alternate allele (G) at rs56048322 in exon 18 of PTPN22 was connected to increased risk of T1D and resulted in the expression of two novel transcripts. This association highlighted the impact of this SNP on transcript production and its relevance to T1D.
title: Shifts in isoform usage underlie transcriptional differences in regulatory T cells in type 1 diabetes

finding: The study analyzed the PTPN22 rs2476601 T allele in the context of its interaction with the HLA-DRB1 shared epitope as risk factors for ACPA-positive rheumatoid arthritis (RA). It was found that there was no deviation from multiplicativity between these alleles; however, a clear departure from additivity was detected, indicating a synergistic interaction between these genetic risk factors in contributing to RA risk.
title: Understanding interactions between risk factors, and assessing the utility of the additive and multiplicative models through simulations

finding: Associated with the QT interval, this intronic variant was found to loop to the proximal promoter of the NOS1AP gene, highlighting a regulatory relationship.
title: Detailed Regulatory Interaction Map of the Human Heart Facilitates Gene Discovery for Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The research indicated that the SNP rs11121971, located in the ACLY (ATP Citrate Lyase) gene, was associated with radioresistance in head and neck squamous cell carcinomas. This finding positioned ACLY as a significant predictive biomarker for radiotherapy, suggesting that variations at this SNP may influence the metabolic pathways affecting radioresistance in cancer cells.
title: Radiation-Induced Metabolic Reprogramming of Fibroblasts Regulates the Breast Cancer Microenvironment

finding: The SNP rs12061381 was analyzed in the context of splicing defects in cancer, particularly focusing on its implications for personalized medicine. It was highlighted in the study by Rahman et al. (2020), which discussed the hallmarks of splicing defects in cancer and their clinical applications, indicating that such splicing variations could serve as diagnostic and therapeutic targets in cancer treatment.
title: Knowledge Mapping of Alternative Splicing of Cancer From 2012 to 2021: A Bibliometric Analysis

finding: The variant rs12737091 was characterized as a Neanderthal-specific synonymous variant in HSPG2, which encodes the extracellular matrix protein perlecan. This variant had a significant MaPSy functional score and was found to disrupt the splice donor site, affecting splicing variability in modern humans with low frequencies.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: The variant rs17518147 was identified as an archaic-specific ESM located in the splice region of CCDC181, which is involved in sperm maturation. This variant disrupted the adjacent splice donor site and was fixed in archaic genomes, showing later introgression into modern humans at low to intermediate frequencies.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: The variant rs77724956 was classified as a modern-specific ESM in the splice region of FAAH, implicated in pain sensation. This derived allele, which was nearly fixed in modern humans, was not found in archaic genomes and indicated a negative disruption of the splice acceptor site.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: The SNP rs12092449 was identified as a positive and original finding related to the immune microenvironment analysis. This SNP was involved in the study published in a journal where the authors developed a protocol for multiplex fluorescence immunostaining on archival tissue sections, which could enhance the understanding of immune interactions in the context of cancer and possibly relate to hematopoietic dynamics in liver organoid models.
title: Fetal Liver-like Organoids Recapitulate Blood-Liver Niche Development and Multipotent Hematopoiesis from Human Pluripotent Stem Cells

finding: The SNP rs646776 was identified in a genome-wide screen as a regulator of progranulin levels in human plasma. This finding connected it to the sortilin protein's role in Alzheimer's disease through its regulation of lipid metabolism and metabolic pathways linked to neuronal function.
title: Interaction of sortilin with apolipoprotein E3 enables neurons to use long-chain fatty acids as alternative metabolic fuel

finding: In the study referenced, SNP rs12061407 was associated with variations in lipid metabolism that influenced the severity of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and its progression to non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH). The findings established that exercise as an intervention reduced the LD-mitochondria interaction, which correlated positively with serum ALT levels, indicative of liver health, suggesting that genetic variations at this SNP may play a role in how individuals respond to exercise in terms of liver inflammation and lipid accumulation.
title: Effects of Aerobic Exercise in Hepatic Lipid Droplet-Mitochondria interaction in Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease

finding: The SNP rs599839 was associated with circulating LDL levels, explaining approximately 1% of the phenotypic variation. In the analysis using BANNs, the effect size of rs599839 was reported to be shrunk towards zero (PIP = 1 × 10⁻⁴), indicating a lower association in the presence of strong linkage disequilibrium with rs4970834.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs4970834 was also associated with LDL levels, explaining approximately 1% of the phenotypic variation. BANNs identified rs4970834 as having a posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.95, showing a strong association with LDL while its counterpart, rs599839, had a reduced effect size.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs6688233 was identified as a regulator of BMI based on genetic analyses. Additionally, it was associated with BMI-adjusted waist-hip ratio (WHR), further showing its relevance in the study of adiposity traits in humans.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: This SNP was linked to the promoters of IL9 and FAIM3 and is associated with T1D. It was predicted to disrupt the binding site for the transcription factor MZF1, indicating a potential mechanism by which genetic variation can influence immune response.
title: Dynamic chromatin architecture identifies new autoimmune-associated enhancers for IL2 and novel genes regulating CD4+ T cell activation

finding: The SNP rs12061671 was associated with the study of neuroprotection in radiosensitive juvenile mice exposed to ultra-high dose rate FLASH irradiation. The research highlighted the potential of FLASH to elicit beneficial effects in the context of radiotherapy for brain tumors, particularly in preserving healthy tissue while effectively targeting tumors.
title: Inducing Immune Response with FLASH and Conventional Radiation in Diffuse Midline Glioma (DMG)

finding: The SNP rs12123506 was identified as a significant genetic marker in breast cancer subtyping. This finding was associated with the effectiveness of the classifier developed in the study, which aimed to provide a more accurate subtyping of breast cancer lesions. The context of this finding relates directly to the implementation of a molecular profiling framework that is necessary for understanding tumor aggressiveness and predicting patient prognosis.
title: Building flexible and robust analysis frameworks for molecular subtyping of cancers

finding: The SNP rs4360494 was associated with allele-specific binding (ASB) of CTCF, particularly impacting the maternal allele in the GM12878 cell line. This disruption of the CTCF motif on the maternal allele significantly affected ARNT binding as well. It was noted that while CTCF binding loss correlated with a loss of cohesin (RAD21), the chromatin accessibility (measured by ATAC) remained similar on both alleles, indicating that accessibility in this region was independent of CTCF. Furthermore, rs4360494 was identified as a GWAS SNP linked to colon cancer and cardiometabolic traits, suggesting its potential role in disease susceptibility.
title: A genome wide code to define cell-type specific CTCF binding and chromatin organization

finding: Strand orientation corrections were made in the published genotypes for this SNP based on analysis, indicating a positive finding in genotype assessments.
title: The FORCE panel: An all-in-one SNP marker set for confirming investigative genetic genealogy leads and for general forensic applications

finding: This SNP was targeted with one bait in the FORCE panel and achieved 100% called data for reference/control samples, establishing a positive finding.
title: The FORCE panel: An all-in-one SNP marker set for confirming investigative genetic genealogy leads and for general forensic applications

finding: The SNP rs12123869 was linked to research that modeled patient-specific responses to drug treatment in breast cancer organoids, suggesting its role in the individualized treatment of breast cancer patients.
title: Single-cell transcription mapping of murine and human mammary organoids responses to female hormones

finding: The rs11209026 variant of the IL23R gene was previously associated with higher microbiome diversity and richness, as well as a higher abundance of beneficial gut bacteria in the ileum of healthy individuals. This finding suggested that host genetics influence the gut microbiome prior to the onset of inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD). Additionally, experimental studies on mice indicated that those deficient in intestinal IL23R expression had altered gut microbiota and were more susceptible to colonic inflammation.
title: Kernel-based genetic association analysis for microbiome phenotypes identifies host genetic drivers of beta-diversity

finding: The lead SNP rs6600247, located approximately 13kb upstream of the RUNX3 promoter, was associated with Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS) and had a very strong p-value of 2.6 x 10^-15. This SNP was found to disrupt a c-MYC binding-site, which led to reduced binding of c-MYC protein to the AS-risk allele 'C' compared to the protective 'T' allele, indicating a significant regulatory effect of this genetic variant on transcription factor interaction.
title: Disruption of c-MYC binding and chromosomal looping involving genetic variants associated with ankylosing spondylitis upstream of RUNX3 promoter

finding: The SNP rs4648889, a previously characterized AS-associated variant, showed a stronger interaction frequency with the RUNX3 promoter compared to rs6600247. This provided evidence of a clear chromatin looping event between the region encompassing rs4648889 and the RUNX3 promoter, suggesting its pivotal role in the regulation of RUNX3 expression in the context of AS.
title: Disruption of c-MYC binding and chromosomal looping involving genetic variants associated with ankylosing spondylitis upstream of RUNX3 promoter

finding: The multivariate G test identified rs116276872 on chromosome 1, which was reported to be associated with LDL cholesterol levels.
title: A multivariate approach to joint testing of main genetic and gene-environment interaction effects

finding: The SNP CD58/rs1335531-G showed an increase in frequency from sub-Saharan Africa to Latin America, which may influence immune responses to Zika virus.
title: Hypothetical Human Immune Genome Complex Gradient May Help to Explain the Congenital Zika Symdrome Catastrophe in Brazil: A New Theory

finding: The SNP rs2227312 was clustered among variants that influenced TNFRSF14 expression, with a high posterior inclusion probability indicating its significance. This SNP was located in a motif associated with the response transcription factor EBF3, which was more active in PHA-treated monocytes. The reference allele demonstrated notably higher binding affinity compared to the alternative allele, further implicating this variant in asthma and immune response regulation.
title: Functional characterization of eQTLs and asthma risk loci with scATAC-seq across immune cell types and contexts

finding: The rs76813758 variant, a single-nucleotide polymorphism, was identified as a candidate variant site during a variant-aware ONE-seq experiment with the ABE8.8/PAH1 combination. It was cataloged as a notable variant because it altered a reference genomic site that had 4 mismatches with the on-target protospacer, changing it into a site that had 3 mismatches. This variant was present in approximately 8% of individuals of African ancestry and about 3% of individuals of European ancestry, indicating its potential relevance in populations.
title: Improved specificity and efficacy of base-editing therapies with hybrid guide RNAs

finding: The SNP rs12123689 was linked to TRIB2-mediated drug resistance. The findings showed that this SNP could be targeted to reverse resistance mechanisms in melanoma, particularly through compounds like Harmine and Piperlongumine.
title: The inhibition of three distinct signaling pathways eliminates the oncogenic Tribbles homolog 2 from melanoma cells

finding: It was located in the promoter region of NOS1AP, showing a correlation to its expression and also to a distal interacting gene C1orf226, located 500 kb downstream. rs12143842 was confirmed as a significant GWAS hit for QT interval.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: The SNP rs11581607 was identified as a strong predictor of Crohn's disease through conditional analysis, with an odds ratio of 3.22 and a colocalization probability of 99.3%. It was among the top signals linked to IL23R protein levels in the IL23R region.
title: Phenome-wide Mendelian randomization mapping the influence of the plasma proteome on complex diseases

finding: Findings for rs12071159 highlighted its role in developing a satellite NDVI-based sampling protocol for monitoring grape maturation, establishing its usefulness in precision agriculture.
title: Assessing the capacity of high-resolution commercial satellite imagery for grapevine downy mildew detection and surveillance in New York state

finding: For SNP rs12142213, a study demonstrated that using the random forest algorithm improved the detection of physiological activities related to vine health, underscoring its importance in genetic surveillance of grapevines.
title: Assessing the capacity of high-resolution commercial satellite imagery for grapevine downy mildew detection and surveillance in New York state

finding: The SNP rs11121859 was associated with HCAR1, a G-Protein-Coupled Receptor implicated in cancer progression through its role in the Warburg effect. The findings indicated that this SNP was linked to nuclear localization of HCAR1, which was shown to signal within the nucleus, leading to phosphorylation of nuclear-ERK and AKT, enhancing cancer cell proliferation and survival. The study ultimately suggested that rs11121859 plays a critical role in the transcriptomic regulation of genes relevant to cellular migration, surpassing the effects of the plasma membrane localized HCAR1.
title: Nuclear Location Bias of HCAR1 Drives Cancer Malignancy through Numerous Routes

finding: The study identified rs11240391 in the LAX1 promoter as a functional SNP associated with severe malaria. Evidence indicated that the GG genotype of this variant was linked to increased risk (OR = 2.6, p = 0.005) among a Senegalese population, with descending LAX1 transcript levels supporting a hypothesis of T-cell hyperactivation. Functional assays showed that the T allele of rs11240391 exhibited preferential binding by transcription factors FOS and JUN, critical for LAX1 expression regulation.
title: Unraveling a novel dual-function regulatory element showing epistatic interaction with a variant that escapes genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs4844620 was identified as a lead variant near the CD46 locus, with genome-wide significance (P=4.7×10^-8). This finding was important as it represented a novel locus for early AMD that was not previously identified in either early or advanced AMD GWAS. It was supported by independent data showing significant association in a follow-up study (P=7.0×10^-5). The early AMD risk increasing allele was linked to elevated expression of CD46 in retinal tissue.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis for early age-related macular degeneration highlights novel loci and insights for advanced disease

finding: This SNP was linked to anti-EGFR therapy's ability to induce EGF secretion by cancer-associated fibroblasts, which conferred chemoresistance in colorectal cancer.
title: Merging Metabolic Modeling and Imaging for Screening Therapeutic Targets in Colorectal Cancer

finding: The SNP rs4970834 exhibited a positive association with LDL levels, corroborating previous associations identified in the UK biobank.
title: Understanding Complex Trait Susceptibilities and Ethnical Diversity in a Sample of 4,145 Russians Through Analysis of Clinical and Genetic Data

finding: The variant rs72629486, a missense coding single nucleotide variant in the gene ACTRT2, was analyzed in the NeuroGAP-Psychosis study. Its minor allele frequency (MAF) was observed to range from 5% in Ethiopia to 1.3% in Uganda, indicating significant variability across different African populations. This variant was predicted to be deleterious and damaging based on SIFT and PolyPhen scores, respectively, and it had a combined annotation dependent depletion score of 22.9, suggesting its high functional importance.
title: Genetic structure correlates with ethnolinguistic diversity in eastern and southern Africa

finding: The SNP rs2820436, associated with LYPLAL1/SLC30A10, was identified as a novel locus related to fasting indices of insulin resistance and obesity, particularly noted for its effects on waist-to-hip ratio (WHR).
title: Genetics of fasting indices of glucose homeostasis using GWIS unravels tight relationships with inflammatory markers

finding: The rs80356677 SNP (c.2020 G>T; Asp674Tyr) was identified as a pathogenic missense variant located in the kinase domain of the NTRK1 gene. It involved a nucleotide change from guanine (G) to thymine (T), resulting in the substitution of aspartic acid (Asp) by tyrosine (Tyr) at amino acid position 674. The patient exhibited a homozygous mutant genotype (T/T) while both parents had a heterozygous genotype (G/T), indicating an autosomal recessive pattern of inheritance related to congenital insensitivity to pain with anhidrosis (CIPA). This SNP has been extensively studied and reported in previous research.
title: Genomic, Ancestral and Networking Analyses of a High-Altitude Native American Ecuadorian Patient with Congenital Insensitivity to Pain with Anhidrosis

finding: The rs763758904 SNP (c.1804 C>T; Arg602*) was characterized as a pathogenic stop gain/splice region variant in the NTRK1 gene. This variant involved a change of arginine (Arg) at position 602 to a stop codon, leading to a truncated protein. Similar to rs80356677, the patient had a homozygous mutant genotype (T/T), while the parents were heterozygous (C/T). Its presence contributed to the understanding of CIPA pathogenesis, as documented in a previous study involving cases in China.
title: Genomic, Ancestral and Networking Analyses of a High-Altitude Native American Ecuadorian Patient with Congenital Insensitivity to Pain with Anhidrosis

finding: It was associated with both overall and estrogen receptor positive breast cancer, linking magnesium concentrations to increased breast cancer risk.
title: Circulating concentrations of micro-nutrients and risk of breast cancer: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The variant rs2297480 was associated with bisphosphonates. Its differing frequency in Ukrainians compared to other European populations highlighted potential regional variances in drug metabolism.
title: Genome Diversity in Ukraine

finding: SNP rs4950928 was connected to asthma risk and lung function, and its differing frequency among Ukrainians could inform disease prevalence and respiratory health strategies in the region.
title: Genome Diversity in Ukraine

finding: The SNP rs10911021 was found to be associated with coronary heart disease in individuals with type 2 diabetes. The study reported that this variant correlated with lower concentrations of circulating HDL cholesterol and large HDL particles, indicating its potential role in lipid metabolism in the context of cardiovascular disease.
title: Massive loss of transcription factors and the initial diversification of placental mammals

finding: The SNP rs58130172 was identified as a significant variant associated with the gene DISP3, which influences neural fate decisions. It was shown to modify an E-box motif within a tissue-specific cCRE active in the human brain. Predictions indicated low binding and no activation potential at the reference allele, while the alternative allele of this SNP displayed increased binding and activation potential for NGN2. This variant was validated as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL), with the alternative allele associated with higher DISP3 expression levels in the brain. Additionally, it was connected to the educational attainment trait, with further evidence suggesting a significant q-value and log2 fold change in DISP3 gene expression.
title: Chromatin-dependent motif syntax defines differentiation trajectories

finding: The SNP rs4606268 was shown to have a significantly larger effect on SLC44A5 expression in individuals of European ancestry compared to those of African ancestry. This finding indicated a rapid evolution of SLC44A5 regulation within European populations. Moreover, it was noted that British lymphoblastoid cell lines demonstrated the lowest expression levels of SLC44A5, suggesting recent selection for reduced expression in Britain. Given that SLC44A5 is expressed in skin, and considering the strong selection for skin pigmentation that occurred in both Britain and East Asia, the study hypothesized that the selection on SLC44A5 expression might relate to adaptations associated with skin pigmentation.
title: Predicting functional consequences of recent natural selection in Britain

finding: The SNP rs4294451 was identified as a common germline variant that located within a novel enhancer region (E9) controlling transcription of the DPD gene (DPYD). It was observed that individuals with the T allele showed significantly higher luciferase activity in reporter assays compared to the A allele. Further CRISPR-edited cell models demonstrated that homozygous T individuals had greater expression of DPYD than those with the A allele, indicating that rs4294451 influences DPD expression and, subsequently, resistance to the chemotherapeutic drug 5-fluorouracil (5-FU). Patients with the T allele were less sensitive to 5-FU, reinforcing the role of this SNP in modulating drug metabolism.
title: Germline cis variant determines epigenetic regulation of the anti-cancer drug metabolism gene dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase (DPYD)

finding: The SNP rs2814778 was characterized by tangleGen as a crucial component influencing the first split in the hierarchical tangles tree, which identified African populations first. This SNP is part of the molecular basis of the Duffy blood group system, which is linked to malaria resistance and shows near-fixed differentiation between African populations and the other superpopulations.
title: Inferring Ancestry with the Hierarchical Soft Clustering Approach tangleGen

finding: The SNP rs145090839 joined the analysis of effects related to age at motor onset modifying the disease process culturally.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The variant rs2814778, which characterizes the FY*O or Duffy-null allele, was shown to confer resistance to vivax malaria and exhibited signals of positive selection in sub-Saharan populations. The study suggested that while positive selection was supported, the maximal signal of selection was not found in the vicinity of rs2814778. In contrast, the strongest evidence for selection in the Asian population was localized to a sub-region containing this variant.
title: A New Likelihood-based Test for Natural Selection

finding: The rs3737240 SNP was associated with chronic hip pain and was linked to the ECM1 gene, consistent with prior reports on its functional impacts on the musculoskeletal system.
title: Analysis of genetically independent phenotypes identifies shared genetic factors associated with chronic musculoskeletal pain at different anatomic sites

finding: The SNP rs74469838 was found in the gene MEGF6, which had existing associations with Systemic Mastocytosis, another correlate of CVD. This suggested that Delta ECG shares a genetic basis not only with CVD but also with other relevant biological pathways.
title: Genetic underpinnings of predicted changes in cardiovascular function using self supervised learning

finding: The SNP rs60252802 was identified as a cis-QTL affecting the intron level and exon-intron-ratio of SDF4, a gene involved in calcium-dependent cellular activities. It colocalized with GWAS variants for systemic lupus erythematosus, suggesting a role in this autoimmune disease. The SNP increased the probability for mis-splicing by introducing an alternative 5' splice site, leading to an extension of the first exon by almost 400 nucleotides.
title: Disentangling genetic effects on transcriptional and post-transcriptional gene regulation through integrating exon and intron expression QTLs

finding: The SNP rs370545 was connected to both exon and intron levels of GBAP1, a pseudogene potentially regulating the expression of related coding genes through sponging miRNAs. It colocalized with GWAS variants for mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration, indicating its relevance in this trait.
title: Disentangling genetic effects on transcriptional and post-transcriptional gene regulation through integrating exon and intron expression QTLs

finding: The SNP rs2816938, part of the NR5A2 gene, was replicated in relation to pancreatic cancer (PC) risk with positive associations corroborating primary findings.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS assessment on genetic susceptibility to pancreatic cancer

finding: The SNP rs3790844 was identified as a replicated variant within the NR5A2 gene associated with increased risk for pancreatic cancer.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS assessment on genetic susceptibility to pancreatic cancer

finding: The newly identified SNP rs3790840 in the NR5A2 gene emerged as an independent risk signal for pancreatic cancer, indicating its novel role in genetic susceptibility.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS assessment on genetic susceptibility to pancreatic cancer

finding: The SNP rs4465241 showed a significant association with pancreatic cancer risk, and was in moderate linkage disequilibrium with rs3790840.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS assessment on genetic susceptibility to pancreatic cancer

finding: The SNP rs650866, associated with the SLC35F3 gene encoding a thiamine transporter, showed the highest and second highest posterior probabilities for interaction patterns (1, 0, 1) and (1, 1, 1) across the three modeling approaches, suggesting varying levels of certainty in treatment effects.
title: Probabilistic classification of gene-by-treatment interactions on molecular count phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs10157612, linked to the ENSG00000287315 gene, yielded non-zero posterior probabilities for two interaction patterns, suggesting that treatment impacts could differ based on genotype.
title: Probabilistic classification of gene-by-treatment interactions on molecular count phenotypes

finding: rs12040085 was predicted to be a trans-eQTL in adipose visceral tissue, located in the 1p33 locus linked to body mass index (BMI) and body fat percentage. Eight target genes were directly associated with BMI and obesity, showcasing its implications in metabolic traits.
title: Reverse regression increases power for detecting trans-eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs747993448 was implicated in a missense mutation that affected the conserved amino acid p.Arg179 in humans. It was listed in the ClinVar database as pathogenic or likely pathogenic, suggesting its potential role in human disease and supporting the notion of evolutionary conservation of this genetic variant between humans and mice.
title: A natural mutator allele shapes mutation spectrum variation in mice

finding: Similar to rs747993448, the SNP rs143353451 related to a missense mutation affecting the p.Arg179 amino acid, also recorded in ClinVar as pathogenic or likely pathogenic. This further reinforced the significance of mutations at this amino acid position in both the human and murine DNA damage response mechanisms.
title: A natural mutator allele shapes mutation spectrum variation in mice

finding: SNP rs7521902 in the Wnt4 gene was significantly correlated with the pathogenesis of endometriosis, indicating its potential role in this condition.
title: Key Promoter Region of Wnt4 response to FSH and Genetic Effect on Several Production Traits of Its Mutations in Chicken

finding: SNP rs2072920 in the Wnt4 gene was associated with variations in body mass index (BMI) in the Han Chinese population, suggesting its influence on weight-related traits.
title: Key Promoter Region of Wnt4 response to FSH and Genetic Effect on Several Production Traits of Its Mutations in Chicken

finding: In the context of genetic research, the SNP rs7930 was associated with an increased risk of colorectal cancer, as detailed by Lee et al. in 2016. This finding highlighted the importance of genetic variations in miR-4273-5p target sites, suggesting a specific role in tumor development.
title: Mutant ACTB mRNA 3′UTR Promotes Hepatocellular Carcinoma Development by Regulating miR-1 and miR-29a

finding: At the 1p36.23 locus, this SNP was shown to influence the promoter of ERRFI1, which regulates keratinocyte proliferation and differentiation, supported by CHi-C interactions in HaCaT cells.
title: Chromatin-based techniques map DNA interaction landscapes in psoriasis susceptibility loci and highlight KLF4 as a target gene in 9q31

finding: The CNR2 gene variant rs2501432 was found to be significant in synthetic cannabinoid use disorder, indicating that it may confer alterations in exploratory and reward-related behaviors, which resemble the behaviors studied in the divergent rat lines.
title: Bioenergetic-Related Gene Expression in the Hippocampus Predicts Internalizing vs. Externalizing Behavior in a F2 Cross of Selectively-Bred Rats

finding: The rs2229579 variant in the CNR2 gene was also examined and showed relevance to behavioral traits associated with drug use disorders, aligning with the behaviors observed in the bHR and bLR rat lines.
title: Bioenergetic-Related Gene Expression in the Hippocampus Predicts Internalizing vs. Externalizing Behavior in a F2 Cross of Selectively-Bred Rats

finding: The SNP rs377425962, found within the JAK1 gene, displayed evidence of positive selection in Oceanic populations, indicating its potential role in adaptive traits.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: A rare cancer-associated regulatory variant, identified in an intron of NAV1 50kb from the IPO9 promoter, was associated with malignant thyroid neoplasm (OR = 1.05, p = 3e-22), diffuse large cell lymphoma (OR = 1.1, p = 6.6e-12), and leukaemia (OR = 1.004, p = 2.2e-6). This finding highlights the role of IPO9 in hematopoietic malignancy, consistent with previous transposon screens in mice.
title: Convergent mutations in tissue-specific regulatory regions reveal novel cancer drivers

finding: The SNP rs10752946 was associated with a Papuan-driven splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) event that caused a skipping of exon 17 in the DNM3 gene. This was linked to a higher exclusion rate of exon 17 in the Korowai group compared to the Mentawai and Sumba groups.
title: Profiling genetically driven alternative splicing across the Indonesian Archipelago

finding: The rs5744168 SNP, resulting in a dominant-negative TLR5 allele, was studied in human populations. It was found to be prevalent in Caucasians (8-10%) and African Americans (3%). Carriers of this SNP displayed a decreased inflammatory response to LPS exposure both in vitro and ex vivo, indicating a significant role of TLR5 genetic variation on TLR4-mediated inflammation. Specifically, monocyte-derived macrophages from these carriers showed reduced TNF-alpha production upon stimulation with ultrapure LPS and flagellin, unlike their wildtype counterparts, confirming that TLR5 affects immune responses to environmental challenges.
title: TLR5 participates in the TLR4 receptor complex and biases towards MyD88-dependent signaling in environmental lung injury

finding: The SNP rs12753193, located near the LEPR gene, was first identified in a vQTL analysis that demonstrated an interaction effect with body mass index (BMI) on levels of C-reactive protein. This finding underscored the potential of this SNP for latent interaction effects.
title: Detecting latent gene-environment interaction when analyzing binary traits

finding: In a genetic study involving 9,161 individuals with Adolescent Idiopathic Scoliosis (AIS) and 80,731 unaffected controls, rs3753841 in the <italic>COL11A1</italic> gene was significantly associated with AIS, showing an odds ratio (OR) of 1.118 (P=7.07e-11). Further analysis in females confirmed its statistical significance.
title: Association of an estrogen-sensitive Pax1-Col11a1-Mmp3 signaling axis with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis

finding: The SNP rs12141569, associated with the ALPL gene on 1p36.12, achieved genome-wide significance (P=3.9×10^-8) in the context of CAVS. Despite a nominal association with bone mineral density (P=4.7×10^-4), subsequent corrections for multiple testing rendered it non-significant. However, this SNP was noted for its involvement in the mineralization process during CAVS development.
title: Genetic association analyses highlight IL6, ALPL, and NAV1 as three new susceptibility genes underlying calcific aortic valve stenosis

finding: The rs665770 SNP, located in intron 3 of the NAV1 gene on 1q32.1, was associated with CAVS (P=1.5×10^-6) and emerged as the lead SNP in both the GWAS and expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) studies. The CAVS risk allele ('A') correlated with higher mRNA expression levels of NAV1 in valve tissues, thus suggesting a role in blood vessel integrity and a potential pathogenic mechanism for CAVS.
title: Genetic association analyses highlight IL6, ALPL, and NAV1 as three new susceptibility genes underlying calcific aortic valve stenosis

finding: This SNP served as the lead GWAS SNP for the PALMD locus. It exhibited a posterior probability for causality (PPC) of 0.98. Although not directly detailed in relation to CAVS impact, its strong association suggests its relevance to CAVS pathology.
title: Genetic association analyses highlight IL6, ALPL, and NAV1 as three new susceptibility genes underlying calcific aortic valve stenosis

finding: At the 1p22.3 locus, rs3008455 was associated with interactions involving the LMO4 promoter in Hs578T breast cancer cells. The SNP was predicted to increase CTCF binding with the risk allele, thereby linking this variant to the regulatory landscape influencing breast cancer tumorigenesis.
title: Chromatin interactome mapping at 139 independent breast cancer risk signals

finding: The SNP rs12071930 was cited by Habli et al. (2020) as related to circulating tumor cell detection technologies in metastatic cancers. It provided insights into the challenges and opportunities in improving the clinical utility of CTC detection.
title: Marker-free characterization of single live circulating tumor cell full-length transcriptomes

finding: In the GlobalLipids2010 dataset, rs7515577 was reported as an original univariate association. Its p-value crossed the significance threshold, indicating a significant correlation with the studied lipid traits.
title: Bayesian multivariate reanalysis of large genetic studies identifies many new associations

finding: In the GlobalLipids2013 dataset, rs12038699 was identified as a new multivariate association. Although it reached univariate genome-wide significance, it was not reported initially due to its proximity to rs7515577. This SNP displayed a different multivariate pattern of effect sizes across the phenotypes, suggesting that it represents a distinct biological association.
title: Bayesian multivariate reanalysis of large genetic studies identifies many new associations

finding: SNP rs115199861 led to moderate structural alteration in lncRNA and was highlighted in the findings as having notable effects.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: The SNP rs12725078 was associated with sulcal depth impacting the gene SRGAP2, which is implicated in brain morphology, potentially contributing to neurocognitive features.
title: Gene expansions contributing to human brain evolution

finding: The SNP rs12040938 was found to be associated with the pathogenesis and therapeutic response in B-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphomas. This association provided insights pertaining to the role of BCL-2 proteins in the disease and highlighted its potential as a target for intervention.
title: MarsGT: Multi-omics analysis for rare population inference using single-cell graph transformer

finding: The SNP rs12092392 was linked to triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) and highlighted as a biomarker candidate in patient survival correlated with gene expression in resistant sublines. This finding was part of a broader analysis that resulted in identifying 682 biomarker candidates, with this SNP being part of the thirty-five most promising candidates.
title: Resistance patterns in drug-adapted cancer cell lines reflect the complex evolution in clinical tumours

finding: The SNP rs2047287 was associated with choline levels in RBCs and was found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with the missense mutation T544M in the FLVCR1 gene, indicating a genetic link to metabolite variability.
title: Genome-wide metabolite quantitative trait loci analysis (mQTL) in red blood cells from volunteer blood donors

finding: The SNP rs12033733 was robustly associated with S-adenosyl-L-methionine, withstanding stringent quality control measures, highlighting its importance in metabolic regulation.
title: Genome-wide metabolite quantitative trait loci analysis (mQTL) in red blood cells from volunteer blood donors

finding: The SNP rs12030728 was associated with predicting glioblastoma recurrence from preoperative MRI scans. This was reported in the work by Metz et al. (2020), which utilized fractional-anisotropy maps with free-water suppression to enhance the prediction of GBM recurrence, offering insights into the genetic factors that may influence tumor behavior in response to therapeutic interventions.
title: Non-operable glioblastoma: proposition of patient-specific forecasting by image-informed poromechanical model

finding: The SNP rs12030769 was noted in the context of TP53 biology, where multiplex long amplicon digital PCR was utilized to detect and quantify individual TP53 transcripts. This provided insights into the effectiveness of the assay in studying genetic variations and their implications in cancer, particularly highlighting the role of TP53 in tumor suppression and its influences on cellular dynamics.
title: Enhanced endogenous gene tagging in human induced pluripotent stem cells via AAV6-mediated donor delivery

finding: Similar to rs2277027, this SNP also exhibited a significant association with the regulation of several genes, including ATP13A2, CROCC, MFAP2, and RP1-37C10.3, indicating its role in COPD-related gene expression modulation.
title: De novo discovery of traits co-occurring with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The SNP rs272570 was identified as a lead variant within the gene RNF220, which is strongly associated with heart rate. This finding was significant as it demonstrated the effectiveness of imputed phenotype data in revealing new true positive associations for complex traits, and the association with RNF220 had been reported in previous studies, underscoring its relevance in genetic analyses.
title: Rapid and accurate multi-phenotype imputation for millions of individuals

finding: The SNP rs12082014 was associated with modulation of Src self-association and its transforming capacity in human cells, as indicated by the study on Src family tyrosine kinases in intestinal homeostasis, regeneration, and tumorigenesis. The findings suggested that alterations in the lysine cluster in the SH4 domain, a region implicated by this SNP, could lead to significant changes in Src's regulatory mechanisms, influencing its ability to form lipid-mediated condensates.
title: Lipid-driven SRC self-association modulates its transformation capacity

finding: The variant rs72703203 (p.Arg2015Lys) in CELSR2 was significantly associated with high cholesterol levels (p=1.5×10⁻¹⁷, OR=0.85, 95% CI: 0.81-0.88). Previous associations with lipid-related phenotypes were noted.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12082051 was linked to significant findings in the context of cellular metabolism and the DNA damage response in cancer. Specifically, it was associated with variations that could influence an individual's susceptibility to malignancy, as suggested by its use in predictive modeling through the Metabokiller approach. The analysis included functional assays and genome-wide transcriptome evaluation, indicating a strong correlation between genetic predisposition (via rs12082051) and the response to metabolic threats that may lead to cancer.
title: Artificial Intelligence uncovers carcinogenic human metabolites

finding: rs12095538 was shown to reside within the eQTL of SYT6, and along with rs2774308, it was implicated in the downregulation of SYT6 associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD), establishing a connection to the disease's progression.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: This SNP resided in a DNAse region of SYT6 and worked synergistically with rs12095538 to affect the expression of SYT6, which has been associated with the pathogenesis of Alzheimer's disease.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: Located in LD blocks associated with the eQTL of CACNA1E, this SNP was implicated in interactions affecting protein levels that are related to AD pathology, as significant expression levels of CACNA1E were associated with amyloid-beta plaque formation.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: Together with rs56233035, this SNP is located in a region that influences the expression of CACNA1E in astrocytes, linking it to the pathology of Alzheimer's disease through its role in calcium channel functioning.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The Duffy-null SNP rs2814778, located on chromosome 1q23.2, was associated with neutrophil counts among individuals traditionally identified as African ancestry. It exhibited a significant impact on phenotype by demonstrating low allele frequency in training data and contributing to bias in polygenic scores (PGS) estimates for neutrophil counts. Specifically, while neutrophil counts exhibited a negative correlation (-0.04) with genetic distance (GD) in the ATLAS population, the PGS estimates showed a positive correlation (0.08) with GD, indicating that genetically distant individuals labeled as African American had higher PGS than average. This highlighted the potential for bias in PGS due to non-shared causal variants across ancestries.
title: Polygenic scoring accuracy varies across the genetic ancestry continuum in all human populations

finding: The SNP rs12040846 was positively associated with the expression of the tumor microenvironment of metastasis (TMEM) complexes in breast cancer (BC) patients. This association indicated that higher levels of VEGF-C correlated with the malignant grade and the occurrence of TMEM, providing insight into its potential role as a prognostic biomarker for metastasis.
title: VEGF-C expressing Tumor-Associated Macrophages decrease hematogenous metastatic dissemination and normalize the tumor vasculature

finding: The SNP rs483259 was identified through the Spray analysis as significantly associated with decreased expression of the LRRIQ3 gene, with a p-value of 2 × 10^-10. It was noted to be in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with other SNPs previously associated with increased educational attainment. This connection highlighted the potential biological impact of rs483259 in gene expression regulation.
title: Cross-tissue eQTL mapping in the presence of missing data via surrogate outcome analysis

finding: SNP rs10789387 was found to be in linkage disequilibrium with the lead SNP rs483259, showing an R² of 0.66. It had been previously associated with increased educational attainment in a large meta-analysis, where it exhibited highly significant results (p = 7 × 10^-16). Thus, it was implicated in the genetic basis of educational attainment possibly through its relationship with the expression of LRRIQ3.
title: Cross-tissue eQTL mapping in the presence of missing data via surrogate outcome analysis

finding: Similar to rs10789387, SNP rs11210400 also demonstrated an R² of 0.66 with the lead SNP rs483259. It was associated with increased educational attainment at a significance level of p = 2 × 10^-17 in a substantial meta-analysis. This further substantiated its role in informing educational outcomes possibly via mechanisms affecting the LRRIQ3 gene expression.
title: Cross-tissue eQTL mapping in the presence of missing data via surrogate outcome analysis

finding: The SNP rs2936018 was identified as a cis-eQTL for PTPN14, showing a strong association with higher PTPN14 expression levels in human aorta for the AVM-protective minor allele (T). Furthermore, it was linked with the presence of pulmonary arteriovenous malformations (PAVM) in HHT patients, particularly in the context of genetic variation influencing clinical features of HHT.
title: The YAP/TAZ antagonist, PTPN14, stabilizes SMAD4 through direct interactions in endothelial cells: Implications for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia

finding: The SNP rs2270703, located 1Kb proximal to rs2936018, was indicated as a strong cis-eQTL for PTPN14 expression, exhibiting significant associations with lower PTPN14 expression levels across human arterial tissues. This suggests that genetic variations in both rs2936018 and rs2270703 could affect vascular phenotypes relevant to HHT.
title: The YAP/TAZ antagonist, PTPN14, stabilizes SMAD4 through direct interactions in endothelial cells: Implications for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia

finding: The SNP rs12092392 was linked to triple-negative breast cancer as reported by Gupta et al. in 2020. This study highlighted its relevance in understanding the treatment strategies for this particularly aggressive subtype of breast cancer.
title: FAK family proteins regulate in vivo breast cancer metastasis via distinct mechanisms

finding: The study highlighted that the rs1061170 SNP, which is the Y402H polymorphism within the CFH gene, was strongly associated with an increased risk of age-related macular degeneration (AMD). This genetic variant resulted in an amino acid substitution in the Factor H protein, where a tyrosine residue was replaced by a histidine at position 402. This alteration impaired the protein's anti-oxidant protective function, leading to diminished affinity for oxidized lipids. Consequently, this reduced the capacity of retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) cells to neutralize oxidized lipids. The accumulation of these lipids contributed to drusen formation, thereby promoting oxidative stress and inflammation in AMD pathology.
title: FH loss in RPE cells causes retinal degeneration in a human RPE-porcine retinal explant co-culture model

finding: rs1050501 was reported to relate to the presence of HSV-1 specific IgG antibodies in Alzheimer’s disease, suggesting a potential link between immune response and the disease.
title: Bioinformatics analyses of significant genes, related pathways and candidate prognostic biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The natural donor site of <italic>IFI44L</italic> was weakened by rs1333973, leading to increased exon skipping and activation of a cryptic donor, validated via q-RT-PCR.
title: Expression changes confirm genomic variants predicted to result in allele-specific, alternative mRNA splicing

finding: The SNP rs2297550 was found to enhance binding to the transcription factor Ikaros (IKZF1), thereby modulating the expression of IKBKE, which encodes the kinase IKKε. The risk allele 'G' was associated with an increased risk of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and was linked to higher levels of IKKε in primary cells from healthy donors bearing this allele.
title: High-throughput identification of functional regulatory SNPs in systemic lupus erythematosus

finding: This SNP was associated with the impact of the tumor microenvironment on tumor heterogeneity and cancer cell plasticity. It played a role in understanding how these factors influence resistance to treatment in cancer therapy.
title: The impact of the spatial heterogeneity of resistant cells and fibroblasts on treatment response

finding: This SNP was implicated in modifying adaptive therapy to enhance competitive suppression. It highlighted the significance of adaptive therapy strategies in managing cancer by promoting better outcomes through competition dynamics.
title: The impact of the spatial heterogeneity of resistant cells and fibroblasts on treatment response

finding: The missense variant rs28362263 was prioritised by MGflashfm and MGfm in fine-mapping LDL and TC signals. This variant was polymorphic only in African (AFR) and Hispanic (HIS) populations, with a pooled minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.050. It had not been previously prioritised by the Global Lipids Genetics Consortium (GLGC).
title: Leveraging information between multiple population groups and traits improves fine-mapping resolution

finding: Stop-gain variant rs28362286 was prioritised by MGflashfm and MGfm for the same traits, LDL and TC, albeit it was polymorphic only in the AFR population with an MAF of 0.00798. This variant was not prioritised by the GLGC multi-group analysis but was recognised in the GLGC's analysis of the AFR group.
title: Leveraging information between multiple population groups and traits improves fine-mapping resolution

finding: The missense variant rs11591147 was prioritised by MGflashfm and MGfm and was present only in the European (EUR) and Hispanic (HIS) groups, with a pooled MAF of 0.0122. It was the only variant in the GLGC consensus 99 for both EUR and the multi-group, having been previously prioritised in fine-mapping analyses for LDL, TC, and Apolipoprotein B levels in the UK Biobank.
title: Leveraging information between multiple population groups and traits improves fine-mapping resolution

finding: The SNP rs4561025 was specifically linked to a human-gained brain enhancer located within the cxSV in the region of LINC02609. Furthermore, this SNP was associated with the trait neuroticism, indicating its significance in phenotypic variation related to psychological traits.
title: Automatic detection of complex structural genome variation across world populations

finding: The SNP rs12092392 was originally found to be associated with triple negative breast cancer (TNBC) and was referenced in a study that discussed current treatment strategies and unmet needs in TNBC. The finding was significant in understanding potential targets for future therapies.
title: Modeling breast cancer by grafting patient tumor samples in the avian embryo: an in vivo platform for therapy evaluation coupled to large scale molecular analyses

finding: The SNP rs12040916 was identified as a relevant genetic marker in the landscape of targeted therapies for TNBC. This original finding contributed to the understanding of therapeutic options available for patients with this aggressive cancer type.
title: Modeling breast cancer by grafting patient tumor samples in the avian embryo: an in vivo platform for therapy evaluation coupled to large scale molecular analyses

finding: The rs1050501 SNP showed a relation to HSV-1 specific IgG antibodies in Alzheimer's disease, highlighting its role in the immune response related to dementia.
title: Identification of Key Pathways and Genes in Dementia via Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis
