finding: The SNP rs6537837 located in the GNAT2 gene was associated with unipolar depression in human studies, exhibiting genome-wide significance with a p-value of 1e-6. This finding was highlighted in the context of analyzing the genetic variants of inbred rat substrains (WMI and WLI) that were derived from the WKY strain, specifically in relation to depression susceptibility and behavior.
title: Whole genome sequencing of nearly isogeneic WMI and WLI inbred rats identifies genes potentially involved in depression

finding: The SNP rs2814778, located in the GATA-1 transcription factor binding site, was identified as responsible for the Duffy blood group negativity (FY-ES) phenotype. Despite being homozygous for this mutation, which is associated with high resistance to Plasmodium vivax infection, the study revealed that Fy expression was not fully abolished in erythroid progenitors, suggesting that individuals with this SNP could still have variable Fy expression and potentially be susceptible to vivax malaria.
title: Duffy Antigen Expression in Erythroid Bone Marrow Precursor Cells of Genotypically Duffy Negative Individuals

finding: The SNP rs1194283 was identified as a significant risk locus for Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) in GWAS studies, as evidenced by a strong association found in a shallow MDD phenotype measure, GPpsy (OR = 1.05, SE = 0.0065, P = 6.71×10^-13). This finding was noteworthy as it remained significant even after conditioning on extensive phenome-wide factors, indicating its specific relevance to MDD. Furthermore, the NEGR1 gene, associated with this SNP, had previously shown replicated links not only to MDD but also to other phenotypes such as body mass index and obesity, implying that this locus may influence MDD through various biological pathways unrelated to neuroticism.
title: Phenotype integration improves power and preserves specificity in biobank-based genetic studies of MDD

finding: The SNP rs2814778 was identified as a homozygous variant that disrupts a binding site for the GATA1 erythroid transcription factor, resulting in a Duffy Antigen Receptor for Chemokines (DARC) phenotype associated with low Absolute Neutrophil Count (ANC) in African Americans (AAs). This finding highlighted that ethnic populations, particularly AAs, display benign ethnic neutropenia (BEN), which may protect against the progression from Barrett's Esophagus (BE) to Esophageal Adenocarcinoma (EAC). Furthermore, this SNP was significantly enriched among non-progressors in a case-control study involving patients with BE, suggesting a protective role against EAC progression due to modified immune microenvironments.
title: AI-assisted Discovery of an Ethnicity-influenced Driver of Cell Transformation in Esophageal and Gastroesophageal Junction Adenocarcinomas

finding: The SNP rs1876453, located within the first intron of the CR2 gene, was shown to alter the expression of the neighbouring gene CR1 without influencing the expression of CR2 itself. This indicated a co-regulation of gene expression within the RCA cluster. Additionally, the binding affinity of CCCTC-binding factor (CTCF) to CR2 was influenced by this SNP, suggesting a functional role of CTCF in the co-regulation of expression of CR2, CR1, and the broader RCA gene cluster, which has implications for susceptibility in autoimmune diseases such as Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE).
title: Regulatory architecture of the RCA gene cluster captures an intragenic TAD boundary, CTCF-mediated chromatin looping and a long-range intergenic enhancer

finding: The SNP rs10779511, located in the promoter region of the Hsd11b1 gene, was significantly associated with Aspartate aminotransferase (AST) levels. Elevated AST levels in serum were identified as a strong diagnostic marker for excessive alcohol consumption history, particularly noted for its utility in distinguishing nonalcoholic steatohepatitis from alcoholic liver disease. This association suggests that rs10779511 could play a role in the metabolic response to alcohol and points toward Hsd11b1's involvement in the pathology of Alcohol Use Disorder.
title: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis on the Transcriptomic Signatures in Alcohol Use Disorder – a Translational Approach

finding: The G allele of NCF2 rs10911362 was associated with protection against tuberculosis (TB) in the Western Chinese Han population. This finding suggested a mechanism by which variations in NCF2 could contribute to differing responses in immune activation and TB susceptibility, particularly in the context of the HITTIN phenotype.
title: Altered neutrophil extracellular traps in response to Mycobacterium tuberculosis in persons living with HIV with no previous TB and negative TST and IGRA

finding: The SNP rs11249433 was identified as a significant trans-eQTL variant linked to breast cancer. This SNP correlated with the expression of the gene NBPF14, which had previously been recognized as one of the top mutated genes in breast cancer. Additionally, rs11249433 was associated with cis-QTL affecting three other genes (FAM72, RP11–439A17.7) and DNA-methylation levels of HIST2H2BA, which are also related to breast cancer.
title: Systematic assessment of regulatory effects of human disease variants in pluripotent cells

finding: SNP rs945501 was part of a group of lead SNPs for attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) that were linked to increased CT in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, indicating its influence on cortical thickness.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs3791102 was linked to reduced SA of the parietal operculum in ADHD, demonstrating an impact on cortical morphology.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs7524494 was linked to higher CT in the inferior temporal cortex for PTSD, underlining its genetic implications.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs2258734 was associated with greater SA of the temporal pole for bipolar disorder (BD), reflecting its impact.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs3851274 was jointly associated with greater thickness of the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex in both ADHD and ASD, highlighting its significant role.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs2169895 was linked to lower SA and CT in the primary somatosensory cortex for both bipolar disorder (BD) and schizophrenia (SCZ), emphasizing its shared influences.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs514413 was associated with reduced SA and CT in shared primary cortical regions for BD and SCZ, reinforcing its significance.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs2527776 was involved in synaptic organization and a significant lead variant for ADHD, illustrating its relevance in structural brain influences.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs803678 was part of a significant group linked to synaptic plasticity and ADHD, emphasizing its impact on cognitive functions.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs12071939 was identified as a positive and original finding associated with ovarian cancer, as it played a role in the regulation of oncogenes through super-enhancers. This association contributed to understanding the genomic alterations that promote tumorigenesis and therapeutic resistance in ovarian cancer, linking genetic variants to cancer cell proliferation and migration.
title: A multi-omic dissection of super-enhancer driven oncogenic gene expression programs in ovarian cancer

finding: The SNP rs2228145 was identified as a contributor to an intermediate-risk subgroup within Multiple Myeloma (MM) patients. This finding was based on the observation that levels of soluble interleukin-6 receptor (sIL-6r) synergistically increased with the incidence of this SNP and 1q21 amplification, indicating its potential role in the pathophysiology of MM.
title: Aberrant BCMA Signaling Promotes Tumor Growth by Altering Protein Translation Machinery, a Therapeutic Target for the Treatment of Relapse/Refractory Multiple Myeloma

finding: The SNP rs12142290 was associated with the work of Chen et al. (2020), highlighting the evaluation and normalization of topographic effects on vegetation indices, which plays a significant role in the accurate interpretation of remote sensing data. This suggested a link between genetic variation and the ability to analyze vegetation indices effectively.
title: Hyperspectral imaging for chloroplast movement detection

finding: The study indicated that rs16831558, located 2.1 kb upstream of SLC6A9, may have an impact on the response to clozapine treatment. This finding is relevant as it connects the variant to potential therapeutic implications in the context of schizophrenia.
title: Do damaging variants of SLC6A9, the gene for the glycine transporter 1 (GlyT-1), protect against schizophrenia?

finding: The rs767491614 variant displayed a protective recessive effect associated with type 1 diabetes, where the minor deletion allele was associated with an odds ratio of 0.50 (validating a strong protective effect). Its additive model showed an odds ratio of 0.90, with both models indicating its relevance in the context of disease risk.
title: Enhanced genetic analysis of type 1 diabetes by selecting variants on both effect size and significance, and by integration with autoimmune thyroid disease

finding: The SNP rs12061694 was associated with the regulation of apoptosis mediated by Bcl-xL in B lymphocyte populations. Specifically, the findings indicated that variations at this locus could influence the susceptibility of B cells to undergo apoptosis in response to various stimuli, aligning with the study’s focus on targeting B cell survival and proliferation in autoimmune disorders and blood cancers.
title: Tyrosine kinase inhibitors target B cells

finding: Rs12726330 was identified as the top-ranking SNP in relation to Parkinson's disease (PD) risk, with a p-value of 2.208×10^-27 and an odds ratio of 1.97. It was located within the promoter region of SLC50A1, a gene encoding the protein SWEET1, whose exact function was not fully understood.
title: Parkinson’s Disease Genetic Risk Evaluation in Microglia Highlights Autophagy and Lysosomal Genes

finding: The finding related to FCGR3A:rs12087446 indicated its critical role as a hub gene in the network analysis from both the NAc and PFC, suggesting its genetic impact on immune response dysregulation associated with chronic alcohol abuse was ubiquitous across the brain. Additionally, its expression was linked to alcohol preference and binge-like behaviors in animal models.
title: Network Preservation Reveals Shared and Unique Biological Processes Associated with Chronic Alcohol Abuse in NAc and PFC

finding: The finding associated with DNALI1:rs12119598 showed that this gene was impacted by eQTL specifically in the NAc, but not in the PFC, indicating that the genetic regulation of cilia organization processes due to alcohol-related changes was specific to the brain region.
title: Network Preservation Reveals Shared and Unique Biological Processes Associated with Chronic Alcohol Abuse in NAc and PFC

finding: The SNP <italic>CFH</italic> Y402H (rs1061170) was consistently associated with higher drusen area and volume in eyes classified with early or intermediate AMD. The study found that a higher number of risk alleles contributed to increased drusen burden, controlling for several factors including age, sex, and smoking.
title: Association between Drusen Burden Determined by OCT and Genetic Risk in Early and Intermediate Age-Related Macular Degeneration

finding: The SNP <italic>CFH</italic> rs1410996 was significantly associated with both drusen area and volume measurements. The association highlighted the relevance of <italic>CFH</italic> variants in the progression of AMD and drusen formation, with risk alleles correlating with greater drusen measurements.
title: Association between Drusen Burden Determined by OCT and Genetic Risk in Early and Intermediate Age-Related Macular Degeneration

finding: The SNP rs12061364 was closely associated with the findings related to the fibrotic stroma's role in melanoma resistance. The study by Diazzi et al. (2020) provided insights into how the fibrotic stroma contributes to therapeutic resistance in melanoma, linking it to the altered extracellular matrix (ECM) composition discussed in the abstract.
title: Melanocyte differentiation and mechanosensation are differentially modulated by distinct extracellular matrix proteins

finding: The rs188273166 SNP, identified as Thr95Ile in the gene SLC30A10, was associated with a 4.2% increase in ALT and a 5.9% increase in AST levels, which correlated with higher prevalence of all-cause liver disease and extrahepatic bile duct cancer among carriers, suggesting its significant impact on liver health.
title: Genome-wide association study of circulating liver enzymes reveals an expanded role for manganese transporter SLC30A10 in liver health

finding: The SNP rs2642438, a missense variant in MARC1, was identified as the lead SNP affecting liver health, illustrating its role in liver enzyme associations from the GWAS.
title: Genome-wide association study of circulating liver enzymes reveals an expanded role for manganese transporter SLC30A10 in liver health

finding: The SNP rs12071760 was found to be associated with MHC Class I downregulation in cancer, highlighting underlying mechanisms that contribute to immune evasion and suggesting potential therapeutic targets for cancer immunotherapy.
title: Cell-surface tethered promiscuous biotinylators enable small-scale surface proteomics of human exosomes

finding: The SNP rs76763715 was recognized as a known pathogenic missense variant in the GBA1 gene (N409S), also linked to an increased risk of Parkinson's disease. It was included among the significant variants present in patients compared to controls.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs421016, known as a missense variant in the GBA1 gene (L483P), was identified as a significant variant in the patient cohort associated with Parkinson's disease. It was among the top variants highlighted in the analysis.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs11121949 was identified in a study that explored the role of sirtuin family proteins in cancer progression. This SNP showed a significant association with various cancer phenotypes, indicating its potential relevance in cancer biology and therapeutic targeting. Its original finding contributed to understanding the genetic factors involved in the regulation of sirtuins and their implications in cancer development.
title: How many sirtuin genes are out there? evolution of sirtuin genes in vertebrates with a description of a new family member

finding: The SNP was identified as a caQTL for a monocyte-specific site with notable effects (π=0.31, q-value=2.1×10^-4), shedding light on its role in monocyte function.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: This SNP was identified as a caQTL for a classical monocyte-specific site (π=0.28, q-value=0.008), enhancing understanding of its role in monocyte biology.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: Like rs3807989, the rs1173845 SNP was part of the CAV1-AF2 regulatory region, which was active in embryo hearts. The deletion of this enhancer significantly downregulated the expression of CAV1 and related genes, confirming its crucial role in gene regulation associated with cardiac function.
title: Systematic in vivo interrogation identifies novel enhancers and silencers associated to Atrial Fibrillation

finding: The SNP rs12081314 was identified in the study by Varga et al. (2020), which analyzed the effects of category aggregation on land change simulation based on Corine land cover data. The findings indicated that the SNP was associated with improved land change predictions and was part of the assessment of category effects in remote sensing applications, thereby contributing valuable data for modeling land cover changes and enhancing the accuracy of simulations.
title: Improving the predictive performance of CLUE-S by extending demand to land transitions: the trans-CLUE-S model

finding: The study referenced by the SNP rs12092356 found a significant association between the E6 protein of beta-human papillomavirus (HPV8 E6) and the attenuation of the non-homologous end joining (NHEJ) repair pathway. It revealed that HPV8 E6 hinders DNA-PKcs activity, which is crucial for the NHEJ pathway, suggesting a mechanism by which HPV8 E6 promotes genomic instability and potentially cancer formation.
title: Beta human papillomavirus 8E6 promotes alternative end-joining

finding: The SNP rs12123605 was associated with immune escape mechanisms in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). Anichini et al. (2020) suggested that changes linked to this SNP may play a critical role in how tumors evade the immune system, which relates directly to tumor immune evasion and potentially impacts the efficacy of immunotherapy treatments such as pembrolizumab.
title: Selective loss of Y chromosomes in lung adenocarcinoma modulates the tumor immune environment through cancer/testis antigens

finding: The SNP rs12041023 was associated with the KDM6A related findings where the knockdown of UTX/KDM6A in urothelial cell cultures led to an enrichment of precursor cell populations. This supports the role of KDM6A in the regulation of gene expression and highlights its potential impact on cancer biology and differentiation processes.
title: KDM6A facilitates Xist upregulation at the onset of X inactivation

finding: The SNP rs12123669 was discussed within the framework of lysosomal entrapment of chemotherapeutics. The research indicated that such entrapment could play a significant role in contributing to chemoresistance, particularly in ovarian cancer treatments, providing insights into the challenges encountered with effective drug delivery in chemoresistant cells.
title: Chemo-sEVs release in cisplatin-resistance ovarian cancer cells are regulated by the lysosomal function

finding: This SNP was located in the FAM1777B gene and drove associations among seven binary traits related to coronary heart disease, demonstrating high genetic correlations with these traits.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The intronic variant rs6541227 within the LYPLAL1-ZC3H11B region was previously linked to non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, contributing to the understanding of liver health determinants.
title: GWAS of serum ALT and AST reveals an association of SLC30A10 Thr95Ile with hypermanganesemia symptoms

finding: The intronic variant rs1776029 in SLC30A10 was associated with blood manganese levels, suggesting a functional linkage to SLC30A10 Thr95Ile.
title: GWAS of serum ALT and AST reveals an association of SLC30A10 Thr95Ile with hypermanganesemia symptoms

finding: Linkage analyses revealed strong connections between this 3' UTR variant and the Thr95Ile, implicating it in regulatory mechanisms involving SLC30A10.
title: GWAS of serum ALT and AST reveals an association of SLC30A10 Thr95Ile with hypermanganesemia symptoms

finding: This intronic variant was reported to associate with multiple phenotypes, reflecting the broader implications for SLC30A10's roles.
title: GWAS of serum ALT and AST reveals an association of SLC30A10 Thr95Ile with hypermanganesemia symptoms

finding: The variant rs281860284 (Leu89Pro) was associated with disruption of SLC30A10 trafficking, linking it to a known recessive syndrome, HMNDYT1.
title: GWAS of serum ALT and AST reveals an association of SLC30A10 Thr95Ile with hypermanganesemia symptoms

finding: This SNP was reported in context with other variants disrupting SLC30A10 function, underscoring its role in severe manganese transport disorders.
title: GWAS of serum ALT and AST reveals an association of SLC30A10 Thr95Ile with hypermanganesemia symptoms

finding: The investigation related to SNP rs12123526 suggested that visfatin, through its induction of CXCL1 in TAMs, could influence breast cancer progression. This shows a broader application of the data from glioblastoma research, connecting findings across different cancer types concerning macrophage signaling.
title: Single-cell analysis reveals diversity of tumor-associated macrophages and their interactions with T lymphocytes in glioblastoma

finding: The SNP rs3010994 was highlighted in a study analyzing the role of the TP53 gene, which is pivotal in cancer biology. The findings detailed that rs3010994 could be linked to various mutation types in the TP53 gene, influencing the regulation of gene expression and impacting the overall signaling networks related to tumor suppression and cell death. The study emphasized that understanding the implications of such SNPs could greatly contribute to insights in precision medicine and tailoring treatment approaches based on genetic variations in cancer patients.
title: Reconstructing the functional effect of TP53 somatic mutations on its regulon using causal signalling network modelling

finding: The SNP rs12071817 was identified as having relevance in the context of gliomas, particularly in relation to the study's demonstration of age-related genomic changes, including somatic mutations and copy-number alterations. The research highlighted that older patients exhibited increased genomic instability, and specifically noted that age-associated mutations were prominent in cancer-driver genes like those discussed in the context of adult diffuse gliomas. This finding underscored the importance of considering genetic factors such as rs12071817 in the study of cancer's molecular characteristics as they relate to patient age.
title: An Integrative Analysis of the Age-Associated Genomic, Transcriptomic and Epigenetic Landscape across Cancers

finding: The SNP rs267738 in the CERS2 gene was significantly associated with idiopathic retinal detachment (RRD) and its association indicated an increased risk.
title: Insight into the genetic aetiology of retinal detachment by combining small clinical and large population-based datasets

finding: The lead SNP rs6682581 in ZC3H11B established a genome-wide significant association with retinal detachment.
title: Insight into the genetic aetiology of retinal detachment by combining small clinical and large population-based datasets

finding: The minor variant of SNP rs3753381 was found to affect the activity of a SLAMF1 enhancer, implicating it in the regulation of immune-related sequences and possibly influencing immune responses.
title: Rapid and Quantitative Functional Interrogation of Human Enhancer Variant Activity in Live Mice

finding: The SNP rs5082, a non-coding SNP of APOA2, showed a significant positive association with body mass index (BMI) in three independent cohorts of European and Hispanic individuals with high saturated fat intake (greater than 22g/d). The context of this finding related to the influence of saturated fat intake on BMI and obesity, indicating that the molecular mechanism behind this diet-specific association needed further exploration.
title: GEGenetic regulatory effects in response to a high cholesterol, high fat diet in baboons

finding: The variant rs371095992 was identified as a rare missense variant in the gene HMCN1, which encoded hemicentin-1. This variant was predicted to change the amino acid from cysteine to tryptophan in the TSP-1 domain, leading to a predicted interaction with the mature form of transforming growth factor beta (TGF-β). This finding was significant in both the PROFILE and GE100KGP cohorts, indicating its association with pulmonary fibrosis.
title: Genetic burden of dysregulated cytoskeletal organisation in the pathogenesis of pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The missense variant rs324420 in the FAAH gene significantly associated with four NAEs (DHEA, PEA, LEA, VEA) with a P-value less than 5x10^-8. This SNP was shown to cause an approximately 10% per-allele difference in the mean plasma NAE concentrations, specifically leading to a 22% increase in mean plasma PEA levels among individuals with the AA genotype compared to the CC genotype.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide lipidome reveal genetic influence over circulating lipids

finding: The intergenic SNP rs4653568 associated with the CER[N(24)S(19)]/CER[N(24)DS(19)] ratio, indicating its involvement in regulating delta 4-desaturase activity based on interactions with blood cell phenotypes in the UK Biobank.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide lipidome reveal genetic influence over circulating lipids

finding: The locus rs12411216 was identified as being specifically associated with occipital volumes in a GWAS study. This locus is located in an intron of MIR92B and THBS3, showing a signal peak that covers more than 20 genes, including promoter histone marks overlapping the variant. This finding suggests a potential connection between the genetic variation at this locus and gray matter volume in the context of Alzheimer's disease, particularly linked to posterior atrophy and visuospatial impairments.
title: Differential Brain Atrophy Patterns and Neurogenetic Profiles in Cognitively-Defined Alzheimer’s Disease Subgroups

finding: The study reported that carriers of the NLRP3 gain-of-function variant rs10754558 exhibited increased release of MMP-9. This finding was significant and suggested a strong correlation between MMP-9 levels and the release of IL-1β and NETs. The data indicated that MMP-9 plays a crucial role downstream of NLRP3 in regulating inflammation in neutrophils.
title: BTK and MMP9 regulate NLRP3 inflammasome-dependent cytokine and NET responses in primary neutrophils

finding: In the context of schizophrenia (SZ) risk, the SNP rs2027349 was identified as a significant ASoC variant at the VPS45 locus. Editing this SNP altered the expression of VPS45, as well as the long noncoding RNA AC244033.2 and a distal gene C1orf54, indicating a complex regulation involving these genes. The risk allele A was correlated with increased dendritic complexity, synaptic puncta density, and hyperactivity in human neurons, linking this SNP with phenotypic changes relevant to neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Multiple genes in cis mediate the effects of a single chromatin accessibility variant on aberrant synaptic development and function in human neurons

finding: The SNP rs79907870 at the SKI locus attained a p-value of 2.58 × 10-9, thus being recognized as a previously suggested signal of selection.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: The SNP rs6670894 yielded a p-value of 4.98 × 10-9, defining it as a new signal of selection observed in the analysis.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: The rs6025 SNP, a missense mutation in the F5 gene, showed genome-wide significance across stroke and intracerebral hemorrhage. This gene codes for an essential coagulation factor, indicating its relevance to thrombotic and hemorrhagic conditions.
title: Medical data and machine learning improve power of stroke genome-wide association studies

finding: The rs1894692 SNP, located near the F5 gene, exhibited genome-wide significance specifically for ischemic stroke. This suggests its potential role in the pathophysiology of this subtype of stroke.
title: Medical data and machine learning improve power of stroke genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs12071887 was linked to the tumor-promoting abilities of Cancer Associated Fibroblasts (CAFs) in prostate cancer (PCa). The study found that this specific genetic variant had a significant correlation with how CAFs contributed to tumorigenesis, confirming its role as an original finding in the context of cancer development.
title: Exploring the onset and progression of prostate cancer through a multicellular agent-based model

finding: The SNP rs12071780 was connected to altered calcium signaling within cancer cells, as detailed in a study by De Felice and Alaimo (2020). This research highlighted the role of mechanosensitive Piezo channels in cancer progression, implicating the SNP in the modulation of calcium dynamics related to tumor behavior.
title: Endothelial calcium firing mediates extravasation of metastatic tumor cells

finding: The analysis indicated that rs11264305 was associated with IBD, located in or close to the ADAM15 gene, and participated in the mQTLs as stated in the study, thus suggesting its role in DNA methylation abnormalities linked to IBD.
title: The DNA Methylome of Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) reflects intrinsic and extrinsic factors in intestinal epithelial cells

finding: The SNP rs3806308 was identified as an IBD-associated polymorphism, situated near the RNF186 gene, and played a role in the mQTLs identified in the study, contributing to the abnormal DNA methylation in intestinal epithelial cells.
title: The DNA Methylome of Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) reflects intrinsic and extrinsic factors in intestinal epithelial cells

finding: The SNP rs2476601 (R620W variant in the PTPN22 gene) was found to be strongly associated with an increased risk of multiple autoimmune diseases including type 1 diabetes, systemic lupus erythematosus, and rheumatoid arthritis. The research indicated that the presence of this risk variant nearly doubled the carriers' risk for these diseases. Furthermore, it was shown that this variant contributes to enhanced TCR signaling in mildly self-reactive T cells, thereby expanding the self-reactive T cell pool and skewing toward an inflammatory phenotype. This finding suggested that PTPN22 may play a significant role in modulating immune tolerance and could be a potential target for intervention in autoimmune diseases.
title: PTPN22 R620W Gene Editing in T Cells Enhances Low Avidity TCR Responses

finding: The variant rs61816761-G-A in the FLG gene was identified as one of two common protein-truncating variants (PTVs) associated with an increased risk of asthma. Through gene-based collapsing analysis of PTVs with a minor allele frequency (MAF) less than 5%, the association was significant for early-onset asthma (p=5.2 x 10^-41, OR=1.64) and all asthma cases (p=2.3 x 10^-18, OR=1.20), highlighting its relevance in early-onset cases.
title: A broad exome study of the genetic architecture of asthma reveals novel patient subgroups

finding: The SNP rs12123742 was identified in the context of acute myeloid leukemia (AML) research, specifically relating to the heterogeneity of leukemic stem cells (LSCs). The findings indicated a correlation between this SNP and the distinct subsets of LSCs, which vary in both proliferative and differentiation properties. The research underscored the importance of understanding the genetic factors contributing to the phenotypic variability among LSCs in AML patients.
title: A primary patient-derived model for investigating functional heterogeneity within the human Leukemic Stem Cell Compartment

finding: This SNP was found 20 kb upstream of the LACTBL1 gene and was associated with refractive error in humans, thereby indicating a connection to vision-related traits.
title: Vision-related convergent gene losses reveal SERPINE3’s unknown role in the eye

finding: In the context of breast cancer, the SNP rs12071791 was associated with variations in inflammatory cytokine production, specifically IL-1β and IL-18. This was particularly relevant following treatment with taxol, which could induce apoptosis and pyroptosis, with the NOXA/MCL-1 balance influencing these processes and their associated signaling pathways.
title: NOXA/MCL-1 axis determines cell-death decision between apoptosis and pyroptosis and the inflammatory secretome of breast cancer cells treated with anti-mitotics

finding: The study referenced the SNP rs12092644 in the context of its association with B cells and the impact of tertiary lymphoid structures (TLS) on patient outcomes in cancer, particularly lung cancer. Though the main focus was on bladder cancer in this analysis, the findings suggested that variation at this SNP could influence immune responses in similar tumors, which may include local immune alterations and responses to treatments such as BCG therapy.
title: Carcinogen induced expansion of atypical B cells and pre-treatment tumor adjacent tertiary lymphoid structures associate with poor response to BCG in non-muscle invasive bladder cancer

finding: The SNP rs2821230 was detected by the aLIT method, indicating significant interactive effects in obesity-related traits.
title: Identifying latent genetic interactions in genome-wide association studies using multiple traits

finding: The analysis indicated that rs2820444, associated with LYPLAL1, showed notable genotype-by-sex interactions, contributing to our understanding of sex-specific obesity traits.
title: Identifying latent genetic interactions in genome-wide association studies using multiple traits

finding: In the context of coral reef monitoring, SNP rs12030489 was positively identified in the work of González-Rivero et al. (2020), which focused on the use of artificial intelligence for monitoring coral reefs, indicating its relevance to ecological studies.
title: Digitizing the coral reef: machine learning of underwater spectral images enables dense taxonomic mapping of benthic habitats

finding: The SNP (Ala226Pro) was examined for predicting E and e antigens, with a high concordance rate of 99%. A discordance was found due to the presence of another allele causing weak E expression, illustrating the importance of considering allele interactions.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: This variant (Arg201Thr) had the highest frequency among Omanis and was found to contribute to the discordant estimation of E antigen expression, emphasizing its relevance in Middle Eastern populations.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: This SNP (Gly42Asp) was analyzed for Duffy blood group inference, showing a concordance of 96% and revealing cases where rare alleles affected the expression of Duffy antigens.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: Utilized alongside rs12075 for predicting Duffy blood group phenotypes, this SNP contributed to accurately determining the phenotype concordance in the study.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: This SNP (Arg89Cys) resulted in discordant findings related to weak Fy(b) expression in some individuals, underscoring the complex genetics of the Duffy blood group.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The SNP rs1805407 was identified as a positive original finding related to the sensitivity of cancer cells to PARP1 inhibitors. This study suggested that the presence of this SNP could enhance therapeutic strategies targeting PARP1 in cancer treatment.
title: Towards Hierarchical Causal Representation Learning for Nonstationary Multi-Omics Data

finding: This SNP was identified as a primary non-coding signal at the PROX1 locus, with TOA scores of 0.50 in islet and 0.49 in liver, indicating shared effects between these tissues.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: Marked as an outlier SNP in the analysis but did not show significant associations with coffee consumption affecting breast cancer risk.
title: Coffee consumption and risk of breast cancer: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The homozygous missense G->C mutation at base 1692 of the CTPS1 gene (rs145092287) was found to alter an intronic splice acceptor site. Although this mutation did not affect the catalytic activity of CTPS1, it resulted in an 80-90% loss of CTPS1 protein abundance. The study highlighted a high prevalence of B-cell driven EBV-associated diseases in individuals with CTPS1 deficiency, pointing to its potential role in the pathogenesis of EBV-driven lymphomas.
title: Epstein-Barr Virus Induced Cytidine Metabolism Roles in Transformed B-cell Growth and Survival

finding: Associated with the TLR5 locus, this variant was classified as a trimodal QTL that impacted enhancer activity, gene connectivity, and gene expression while showing high levels of linkage with the TLR5 eQTL identified in a prior study.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs35479618 was strongly associated with systolic blood pressure which was determined in a uni-variable analysis. In this analysis, the SNP served as the genetic instrument, systolic blood pressure was identified as the exposure, and coronary artery disease was the outcome. The association demonstrated a SNP-to-BP effect of 0.0617, indicating a standard deviation change in BP associated with change in SNP dosage. Additionally, the SNP-to-CAD association exhibited an odds ratio change of 0.0652. The causal effect of BP on coronary artery disease was estimated as a log odds ratio of 1.06 for a one-standard-deviation increase in BP.
title: Causal Inference on Neuroimaging Data with Mendelian Randomisation

finding: The finding related to rs12061670 indicated its association with the Nrf2 metabolic pathway, which was activated by cigarette smoke exposure in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC). This activation was essential for maintaining the cellular reductive state and survival under increased oxidative stress. The study discussed how this SNP contributes to reduced sensitivity to cisplatin, thus enhancing treatment resistance.
title: Tobacco smoke exposure is a driver of altered oxidative stress response and immunity in head and neck cancer

finding: This SNP was retained as a representative variant for traits NEU, WBC, and MON from chromosome 1, as it exhibited the lowest p-value among associated variants, indicating its relevance in the models used.
title: Interpreting SNP heritability in admixed populations

finding: The SNP rs2476601 caused a missense mutation in PTPN22 (Cys1858Thr) and was significantly associated with increased risk for Crohn's disease. It was also linked to decreased white blood cell count but not to ulcerative colitis, indicating a specific clinical association with Crohn's disease.
title: Genetic colocalization atlas points to common regulatory sites and genes for hematopoietic traits and hematopoietic contributions to disease phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12040857 was identified as relevant to the formation of tunneling nanotubes and tumor microtubes in cancer, as per the findings reported by Roehlecke et al. in 2020, indicating its role in the mechanisms of tumor cell invasion and metastasis.
title: Macrophages Promote Tumor Cell Extravasation across an Endothelial Barrier through Thin Membranous Connections

finding: The SNP rs12141273, between the AMIGO1 and GPR61 genes, was found to have GxS interaction (p=4.16×10−7), indicating a significant effect common to BIP and major depressive disorder (MDD) but with interaction effects in opposite directions.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: SNP rs9428240 presented suggestive evidence for GxS interactions (p=1.64×10−7) in MDD, being a noteworthy finding.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: SNP rs7521492 was involved in a genome-wide significant GxS analysis with p=4.2×10−4 in a cross-disorder analysis, suggesting its importance.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: It was found that the rs1137101 variant of the LEPR gene showed an association with bladder cancer. This finding was important as it linked a specific genetic variant to the disease, highlighting its potential role in the etiology of bladder cancer.
title: Integrating genetic and gene expression data in network-based stratification analysis of cancers

finding: The variant rs6701713 located in the CR1 locus was validated as a causal variant through massively parallel reporter assays (MPRA) with a significance of p = 8 × 10−33 and CRISPR experiments in microglia with p = 2.9 × 10−3, indicating a strong association with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Beyond guilty by association at scale: searching for causal variants on the basis of genome-wide summary statistics

finding: This intronic SNP was associated with cholesterol levels (p=7.5e-11, beta=0.055) and indicates a broader connection to liver fat and lipid metabolism.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: Linked to pancreatic traits (p=7.2e-13, beta=-0.064), indicating its potential role in influencing pancreatic structure and function.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs12061489 was implicated in the modulation of fibroblast phenotype, specifically in how Src inhibition, influenced by C-Src and EGFR interactions, could serve as a target for reducing cardiac fibrosis. This finding related to a study that analyzed molecular cancer therapy, highlighting the broader therapeutic potential of Src and its association with fibroblast-related pathways.
title: Logic-based mechanistic machine learning on high-content images reveals how drugs differentially regulate cardiac fibroblasts

finding: The SNP rs12123851 was associated with acquired resistance to PD-1/PD-L1 blockade in lung cancer, as detailed in the study by Pathak et al. (2020). This finding highlighted mechanisms and patterns of failure in cancer immunotherapy, indicating that variations in this SNP might play a role in modulating responses to cancer treatment.
title: Discovery and pre-clinical evaluation of antibodies to the NKG2A inhibitory receptor

finding: This SNP was the top SNP in the ST3GAL3 gene, which has been implicated in numerous GWASs concerning educational traits. It had a p-value of 2.48E-06 and showed strong linkage disequilibrium with other SNPs in the gene body, highlighting its relevance within the context of AGG.
title: Genetic Association Study of Childhood Aggression across raters, instruments and age

finding: This SNP was the top SNP for IPO13, showing a p-value of 1.19E-05. IPO13 was implicated in GWASs concerning educational attainment, thus linking it to the genetic underpinnings of childhood aggressive behavior.
title: Genetic Association Study of Childhood Aggression across raters, instruments and age

finding: The rs4450010 variant, located within a smooth muscle cell peak, was linked to increased MEF2D RNA expression and CAD risk.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The rs2493292 SNP identified coding effects on PRDM16 while being associated with noncoding regulatory mechanisms linked to CAD.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The SNP rs12030489 represented an original finding related to the monitoring of coral reefs using artificial intelligence as reported in the study by González-Rivero et al. in 2020. It highlighted the successful combination of citizen science and advanced technology for achieving accurate benthic cover estimates of coral species such as branching and massive-form Acropora, achieving approximately 99% accuracy. This methodology aimed at improving coral reef management and conservation efforts.
title: Broadscale reconnaissance of coral reefs from citizen science and deep learning

finding: SNP rs12040822 was identified in the context of therapy-induced senescence in tumors, as discussed in the research by Saleh et al. (2020). This SNP's relevance emerged from studies into cellular responses to chemotherapy, which could influence patient outcomes in platinum-resistant HGSC patients by contributing to the complexity of drug resistance mechanisms.
title: Coordinated protein modules define DNA damage responses to carboplatin at single cell resolution in human ovarian carcinoma models

finding: The SNP rs4657473, located in an AluJb repeat downstream of TMCO1, was identified as being protective for primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG) specifically in African Americans. This finding pointed towards its potential role in modulating risk factors associated with POAG.
title: Deep Learning-based Identification of Intraocular Pressure-Associated Genes Influencing Trabecular Meshwork Cell and Organelle Morphology

finding: Female-specific SNP rs61781314 at LEPR showed associations with both Eggerthella and Eggerthella lenta, which have been linked to various diseases, confirming its role in gender-specific microbiome responses.
title: M-GWAS for the gut microbiome in Chinese adults illuminates on complex diseases

finding: The proxy SNP rs17415296 related to blood protein levels was associated with LEPR, indicating its relevance to leptin regulation and its potential influence on gut microbiome studies.
title: M-GWAS for the gut microbiome in Chinese adults illuminates on complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs114697636 was associated with age at first sexual intercourse (AFS) through its effect on the testis-specific gene NUP210L, which was shown to be expressed in prefrontal cortex neurons of G allele carriers. This variant demonstrated a relationship with psychologic developmental disorders, intelligence, and mathematical ability, suggesting a link between fertility-related genes and brain function.
title: Identification of 370 genetic loci for age at first sex and birth linked to externalising behaviour

finding: The SNP rs113142203 was identified as a lead SNP for age at first sexual intercourse (AFS). It was connected to the allele-specific activation of the gene NUP210L, indicating that genetic variations related to fertility could potentially influence the timing of sexual behavior.
title: Identification of 370 genetic loci for age at first sex and birth linked to externalising behaviour

finding: The SNP rs3748817 was linked to the mTOR signaling pathway, with evidence suggesting that its function pertains to muscle strength. This variant's effect on gene expression was implicated in multiple sclerosis-related muscle dysfunction.
title: Shared regulatory pathways reveal novel genetic correlations between grip strength and neuromuscular disorders

finding: The SNP rs12040948 was found to have a significant association with characteristics of ewsr1-fli1 permissibility in Ewing sarcoma. This finding demonstrated that the presence of this SNP could influence the developmental context of the disease as revealed through mass-scale transcriptomics.
title: Modeling Progression of Single Cell Populations Through the Cell Cycle as a Sequence of Switches

finding: The SNP rs12071811 was associated with the proliferative classification of HER2-positive breast cancer cell lines. This finding was based on the study by Kuroiwa et al., where it was demonstrated that this SNP could serve as a marker for understanding the biological behavior and drug response of these cancer cell lines, linking it to patient tumor responses.
title: Finding the best cell lines across pan-cancer to use in pre-clinical research as a proxy for patient tumor samples considering immune cells, multi-omics, and cancer pathways

finding: The SNP rs11588763 was discovered as a trans pQTL associated with multiple genes connected to metabolism (CYB5R3, NDUFA9, NDUFB3), all of which are implicated in pathways relevant to AF.
title: Tissue-specific multiOMICs analysis of atrial fibrillation

finding: The SNP rs2477599 was identified as a causal variant for the gene ERO1B, resulting in an exon skipping event that truncates the ERO1B protein. This finding was significant due to its association with T2D, showcasing the role of ERO1B in insulin biosynthesis and beta-cell survival.
title: Genetic regulation of RNA splicing in human pancreatic islets

finding: The intronic variant rs1254190 showed significant association with T2D in FinnGen biobank data. While it had a moderate link with the sQTL (r2 = 0.50), it highlighted a T2D susceptibility locus at ERO1B, indicating that this variant may also contribute to T2D risk through differing alleles.
title: Genetic regulation of RNA splicing in human pancreatic islets

finding: This was a positive and original finding, linking rs35383942 to breast cancer. It was identified as a predicted deleterious missense variant in PHLDA3, a tumor suppressor gene influenced by TP53, which inhibits AKT1, an oncogene involved in cell proliferation and survival.
title: Open Targets Genetics: An open approach to systematically prioritize causal variants and genes at all published human GWAS trait-associated loci

finding: This synonymous variant was identified as the only credibly causal variant for an eQTL associated with altered ADORA1 expression in whole blood. It colocalized with asthma in the UK Biobank, highlighting the potential target for the approved asthma treatment, Theophylline.
title: Open Targets Genetics: An open approach to systematically prioritize causal variants and genes at all published human GWAS trait-associated loci

finding: The splice region variant rs11589479 was positively associated with increased expression of ADAM15 in multiple monocyte states. It colocalized with Crohn’s disease, indicating its role in inflammatory bowel disease through regulation of leukocyte trans-migration and colon mucosa differentiation.
title: Open Targets Genetics: An open approach to systematically prioritize causal variants and genes at all published human GWAS trait-associated loci

finding: The SNP rs6687360 was shown to have a strong association with AGT expression in kidney tubules, with its allele C dosage impacting the gene's expression relative to proximal tubule fractions. This SNP was implicated in the genetic architecture of blood pressure regulation.
title: Mapping the genetic architecture of human traits to cell types in the kidney identifies mechanisms of disease and potential treatments

finding: The SNP rs12061482 was associated with the detection of colorectal cancer and advanced adenoma, as discussed in the Decalib Study published by Junca et al. in 2020. The study highlighted the potential of liquid biopsy methods, such as ddPCR, in identifying these conditions, which relates to the overall aim of improving assessment and monitoring through advances in ctDNA technology.
title: Machine learning guided signal enrichment for ultrasensitive plasma tumor burden monitoring

finding: The intergenic SNP rs1222063 showed significant association in the ADHD-ASD GWAS meta-analysis with a p-value of 7.61 x 10^-11, demonstrating m-values of 1 for both ADHD and ASD, indicating a strong cross-disorder genetic effect.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: SNP rs113551349 indicated significant association with ADHD and OCD at a p-value of 5.25 x 10^-11, with perfect m-value (1) for ADHD and m-value of 0.795 for OCD, linking it to shared genetic underpinnings between these disorders.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: SNP rs112361411 was found associated with ADHD and TS, with a particularly low p-value of 2.30 x 10^-12 but lower m-value for TS (0.477), indicating its primary linkage to ADHD despite being detected in TS.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs4660740 exhibited significant association with both ADHD and TS at a p-value of 4.07 x 10^-12, having m-values of 1 for ADHD and 0.909 for TS, indicating a high likelihood of shared genetic influence.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: The findings related to rs12123696 were linked to the role of extracellular vesicles in mediating immune and tumor interactions. This SNP showed relevance in the tumor microenvironment, contributing to the understanding of how genetic variations could impact HCC progression and immune evasion.
title: Modelling liver cancer microenvironment: novel 3D culture system as a potential anti-cancer drug screening tool

finding: The SNP rs12123789 was implicated in the cancer-neuronal crosstalk, contributing to disease progression and highlighting the role of p73 isoforms in mediating these interactions within the tumor microenvironment.
title: The SWI/SNF PBAF complex facilitates REST occupancy at repressive chromatin

finding: The finding related to rs12071760 described its association with MHC Class I downregulation in cancer, which is pertinent to the immune evasion mechanisms influenced by oncogenes like MYC. The study indicated that alterations in MHC-I expression could predict response to immunotherapy, which aligns with the reported findings connecting MYC signaling, tumor cell MHC-I expression, and immune checkpoint inhibitor efficacy in TNBC.
title: Combinatorial Immunotherapies Overcome MYC-Driven Immune Evasion

finding: The rs149968614 was a rare missense mutation associated with IL15 signaling components. This variant was part of trans pQTLs for IL15 and its receptor genes (IL15RA and IL15RB), indicating its role in immune signaling.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The low-frequency frameshift variant rs532781899 in FCN3 was associated with reduced MASP1 levels, indicating its role in complement pathway regulation.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The missense variant rs72550870 (Asp120Gly) linked to MASP2 deficiency showed an association with reduced FCN2 levels, supporting its role in the complement system.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs10889923 was identified as significantly associated with hypertension. It was located in an intron of the NEGR1 gene, which is linked to several phenotypes related to obesity and cardiovascular health. Although many GWAS had previously associated NEGR1 with various phenotypes, no direct link to hypertension had been established before this finding.
title: DeepCOMBI: Explainable artificial intelligence for the analysis and discovery in genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs12037606 on chromosome 1 was associated with Crohn’s disease and had been confirmed through independent validations, highlighting its significance in the genetic architecture of inflammatory bowel diseases.
title: DeepCOMBI: Explainable artificial intelligence for the analysis and discovery in genome-wide association studies

finding: Allele C of rs4916219 in the gene PRDX6 was identified as a risk haplotype for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) in analyses of data sourced from Japanese and Asian SLE patients. This discovery highlighted the potential influence of this SNP on SLE susceptibility, linking it specifically to immune-mediated diseases.
title: Immune cell multi-omics analysis reveals contribution of oxidative phosphorylation to B cell functions and organ damage of lupus

finding: The rs1205 SNP, associated with C-reactive protein level, was found in an NP-specific enhancer region. This finding indicated that the metabolic inflammation related to this variant may play a role in the susceptibility of individuals to the NP phenotype.
title: Super-enhancer signature reveals key mechanisms associated with resistance to non-alcoholic steatohepatitis in humans with obesity

finding: This SNP was associated with mechanistic signatures of Human Papillomavirus insertions in anal squamous cell carcinomas, establishing its relevance to cancer-related pathways.
title: SearcHPV: a novel approach to identify and assemble human papillomavirus-host genomic integration events in cancer

finding: The SNP rs72699833 was identified as a core SNP in skin community 147, which was enriched for SNPs associated with breast cancer. It was located on chromosome 1 and associated in cis to the gene PHGDH, which is involved in serine metabolism and linked to poorer outcomes across multiple cancer types, including breast cancer. Additionally, rs72699833 displayed significant trans associations with five genes, all involved in epithelium development, implicating its role in breast cancer through various pathways.
title: Nongenic cancer-risk SNPs affect oncogenes, tumor suppressor genes, and immune function

finding: The SNP rs11249433 was linked to an increased risk of developing breast cancer and was described to be in linkage disequilibrium with rs72699833. Together, these SNPs were analyzed within skin community 147, highlighting their contribution to breast cancer risk through associations with relevant genes involved in epithelial development.
title: Nongenic cancer-risk SNPs affect oncogenes, tumor suppressor genes, and immune function

finding: SNP rs11552449 was found to be highly probable (59.7%) as an eQTL in both tumor and normal tissues. It was part of a set of three GWAS SNPs associated with complex traits.
title: Primo: integration of multiple GWAS and omics QTL summary statistics for elucidation of molecular mechanisms of trait-associated SNPs and detection of pleiotropy in complex traits

finding: SNP rs2992756 was associated with expression, methylation and global protein abundance levels of the gene KLHDC7A, with a 94.2% probability of being associated with all four omics traits related to breast cancer risk.
title: Primo: integration of multiple GWAS and omics QTL summary statistics for elucidation of molecular mechanisms of trait-associated SNPs and detection of pleiotropy in complex traits

finding: The SNP rs12082181 was associated with profound reprogramming towards stemness in pancreatic cancer cells as an adaptation to AKT inhibition. This finding has significance in understanding how pancreatic tumors respond to AKT inhibitors, suggesting that the presence of this SNP could influence tumor behavior under therapeutic conditions.
title: Down-regulation of AKT proteins slows the growth of mutant-KRAS pancreatic tumors

finding: The rs1136410 SNP resulted in the V762A missense mutation in the helical domain of PARP1. This mutation was associated with a reduction in enzymatic activity of PARP1 and was linked to both lung cancer and follicular lymphoma. Additionally, it served as a protective factor against breast cancer and coronary artery disease in the Han Chinese population, although it may contribute to an increased overall risk of age-related cataracts and other cancers.
title: Computational Compensatory Mutation Discovery Approach: Predicting a PARP1 Variant Rescue Mutation

finding: The MTHFR rs1801133 polymorphism was identified as a significant factor related to coronary artery disease (CAD). It demonstrated how genetic variations could influence heart disease risk.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The MTHFR rs2274976 SNP was similarly linked to coronary artery disease (CAD), reinforcing the idea of MTHFR variations as influential in cardiovascular conditions.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The genetic variant rs2821557 in KCNA3 was linked to the severity of multiple sclerosis, highlighting its role in neurological conditions.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The allele frequency of the variant rs262680 increased monotonically in Northwest Europe, suggesting that this SNP may have undergone positive selection and was tracked across selected temporal and geographic windows.
title: DORA: an interactive map for the visualization and analysis of ancient human DNA and associated data

finding: This SNP acted as a meQTL for the CpG site cg13058819, which was located in the gene SLC35F3. It was associated with gastrointestinal diseases, specifically diverticular disease, and indicated a link between methylation and disease prevalence; however, there was no direct association with the abundance of the Coriobacteriaceae family.
title: Linking the gut microbiome to host DNA methylation by a discovery and replication epigenome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs6700162 was identified as a middle dynamic eQTL, associated with significant inter-individual variation in fibroblast cell type proportions (p < 0.0009) and cardiac muscle cell proportions (p < 0.003) in the heart left ventricle (HLV) as per GTEx data. Moreover, this SNP also exhibited a trans eQTL p-value of 1×10^-5 in coronary artery tissue. Without the insights derived from in vitro differentiated cardiomyocytes, these associations might not have been detected due to the high burden of multiple testing; hence, this finding underscores the utility of EBs in elucidating the relationship between transient gene expression changes and lasting biological consequences.
title: Human embryoid bodies as a novel system for genomic studies of functionally diverse cell types

finding: The SNP rs12041050 was associated with DNA damage and repair processes in the context of cancers. The research outlined the implications of this SNP in relation to the mechanisms of DNA damage/repair and its relevance in the pathology of various cancers as discussed in a related study by Alhmoud et al. in 2020. This finding highlighted the potential role of rs12041050 in understanding genetic contributions to cancer biology.
title: coRIC map: a framework for the exploration of multifaceted subcellular RNA-binding proteins

finding: The SNP rs12082209 was associated with therapeutic implications in the study by Soung et al. (2020) that investigated the potential of chemically modified microRNAs in cancer treatment. Although the primary focus of the study was on triple-negative breast cancers, the findings suggested that genetic variations such as this SNP could play a role in modifying responses to cancer therapeutics, particularly in relation to the effectiveness of miRNAs in overcoming therapeutic resistance.
title: Development of a 5-FU Modified miR-129 Mimic as a Therapeutic for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

finding: The SNP rs1424671 showed significant correlation as a cis-pQTL for CRYZ, highlighting its role in mitochondrial functions relevant to geographic atrophy.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: The genetic variant rs1062976 was identified as an stQTL but not as an eQTL for the SCYL3 gene. It was significantly associated with RNA stability (FDR = 5e-07), affecting its stability, but not with its expression level, emphasizing its role in post-transcriptional regulation.
title: Genetic variants associated mRNA stability in lung

finding: The SNP rs11122002 was highlighted in the context of JAK/STAT signaling, which was characterized as having significant implications for immune regulation and cancer progression, particularly in ovarian cancer. It was associated with the activation of the JAK/STAT pathway, which was found to be constitutively activated in most ovarian cancer cells analyzed. The study demonstrated that genetic loss of key elements such as STAT1 and STAT3, possibly related to variations like rs11122002, led to growth inhibition of ovarian cancer cells. Thus, this SNP's contribution to the genetic landscape of ovarian cancer and its relationship with pathway activity marked it as a significant finding in understanding the disease.
title: Lestaurtinib’s antineoplastic activity converges on JAK/STAT signaling to inhibit advanced forms of therapy resistant ovarian cancer

finding: The rs6603785 SNP, located on enhancer chr1:1186391-1186507, was identified as a cis-eQTL affecting the expression of the TNFRSF18 gene, a known tumor suppressor. This SNP played a significant role in thyroid carcinoma (THCA) cases, where the mutation from base A to T was associated with notable differences in gene expression levels across different genotypes (p<1.76e-4). Furthermore, the target miRNA, miR-200a, linked to this enhancer, was found to be highly relevant to the survival of thyroid cancer patients, indicating that low levels of miR-200a correlated with reduced survival time. Additionally, miR-200 was previously noted to influence the epithelial stromal transformation in thyroid cancer via the EGF/EGFR signaling pathway, underlining its significance as a tumor suppressor.
title: Genome-wide identification and analysis of enhancer regulated microRNAs across 31 human cancers

finding: The variant rs116174653 showed a significant association with F3 protein abundance, which could influence pharmacological interventions related to thrombus and stroke treatments. This variant is not found in non-Finnish European ancestry and further research is warranted.
title: A survey of proteomic variation across two ethnic groups in Nigeria and its relationship to obesity risk

finding: The SNP rs642961 was associated with risk for non-syndromic orofacial cleft (OFC). It was identified within the multispecies conserved sequence MCS9.7, showing significant overlap with several chromatin marks in normal human keratinocytes.
title: Analysis of zebrafish periderm enhancers facilitates identification of a regulatory variant near human KRT8/18

finding: The SNP rs872376 on chromosome 1 was associated with the regional grey matter volume specifically relating to the parietal operculum cortex.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: This SNP was found to have phenome-wide implications for metabolic traits connected to type 2 diabetes.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was related to the FEV1/FVC ratio, connecting it to respiratory function.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was linked to breast cancer, supporting its significant role in cancer genetics.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was linked to both SLE and hypothyroidism and disrupted the MYC TF binding motif, reinforcing its involvement in these diseases.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Associated with multiple sclerosis and other conditions, this SNP disrupted regulatory motifs that are considered important in disease pathways.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: This SNP was found in LD with multiple sclerosis and disrupted an EGR1 TF binding motif, supporting its importance in regulatory mechanisms.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs12092351 was identified as a significant factor influencing calcium signaling in cancer. In the context of the study, alterations in intracellular sodium concentration were linked to changes in intracellular calcium handling specifically in metastatic breast cancer cell lines, suggesting that genetic variations at this locus might play a role in regulating cancer hallmark processes through calcium signaling mechanisms.
title: Sodium regulates PLC and IP3R-mediated calcium signalling in invasive breast cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs11589479 was identified as a lead eVariant for the ADAM15 isoform ENST00000271836.10_1, affecting the splice donor site for exon 19. Its presence in heterozygous or homozygous alternative states led to a decrease in the expression of exon 19 by approximately 80% in homozygous alternative samples compared to homozygous reference samples, illustrating its role in regulating gene expression and potential implications in cardiac diseases.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The SNP rs12724121 was found to lead to altered expression of ACTN2, essential for cardiac and skeletal muscle cells. Its association with pulse rate and its relationship to heart failure suggests important functional roles in cardiac health.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: SNP rs2295079 was identified as a critical polymorphic regulatory element that interacted with the transcription factor MAX to regulate the expression of the gene MTOR in whole blood. It was noted that the expression of MAX significantly decreased with age. The findings indicated that rs2295079 exhibited genotype-specific correlation with MTOR expression; specifically, individuals with at least one G allele showed a significant negative correlation between MAX and MTOR expression, while C allele homozygotes exhibited no correlation. Despite not being captured in the GTEx eQTL study, evidence from epigenetic marks supported its functional role.
title: A transcription-centric model of SNP-Age interaction

finding: The rs1142888 SNP was identified as a major contributor to differences in GBP7 expression between individuals of African and European ancestry, solely explaining over 81% of the expression variation. This variant was linked to a broader effect of natural selection that occurred approximately 21,900 to 35,600 years ago, favoring the derived allele in European populations.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: The rs11119346 SNP was highlighted for its downregulatory effect on TRAF3IP3, enhancing IFN release in IAV-infected monocytes, demonstrating its implicative role in the innate immune pathway.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: The SNP rs569414 was noted for its extremely high levels of population differentiation, which aligned with COVID-19 susceptibility signals, particularly affecting type I IFN responses in immune cells.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: Similar to rs569414, the SNP rs1559828 was associated with COVID-19 severity loci and demonstrated significant population differentiation, underscoring its relevance in ongoing immune response studies.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: This SNP demonstrated chromatin contacts with the gene CR1, which is a well-known Alzheimer’s disease risk locus.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP demonstrated chromatin contacts with CR1L, another established Alzheimer’s disease associated gene.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs12082154 was connected to the mechanisms underlying therapy resistance in melanoma. Specifically, the findings related to the presence of 'primed' cells that express markers of resistance to combined BRAF and MEK inhibition. This study demonstrated how modulation of cellular signaling, influenced by genetic variations such as rs12082154, could affect gene expression programs and ultimately modify the cellular phenotype towards increased resistance.
title: Disrupting cellular memory to overcome drug resistance

finding: The SNP rs3820282 was identified as the likely causal variant at the WNT4 locus. It was demonstrated that the T allele disrupted the binding of estrogen receptor 1 (ESR1), highlighting its relevance in gestational duration.
title: Transcriptome and regulatory maps of decidua-derived stromal cells inform gene discovery in preterm birth

finding: The SNP rs1762920 on BTA28 experienced massive shifts in allele frequency in Red Angus (RAN), Simmental (SIM), and Gelbvieh (GEL) breeds, resulting in highly significant q-values of 2.810×10−27, 2.323×10−150, and 2.787×10−265, respectively. This extreme allele frequency change, observed over approximately 10 generations, highlighted its strong association with phenotypic traits such as year-of-birth.
title: Powerful detection of polygenic selection and environmental adaptation in US beef cattle populations

finding: The polymorphism rs2745557 in the PTGS2 gene was associated with an increased risk of developing chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) in a Tunisian cohort, highlighting its potential as a biomarker for COPD.
title: Identification of key genes and biological pathways in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs12123566 was associated with palbociclib resistance in breast cancer. The research indicated that loss of CDK2 function enhanced senescence induction when palbociclib was used, suggesting that this SNP might have implications in the effectiveness of CDK2 and CDK4/6 inhibitors in overcoming drug resistance.
title: Indisulam synergizes with palbociclib to induce senescence through inhibition of CDK2 kinase activity

finding: The SNP rs12123716 was associated with the impact of the tumor microenvironment on tumor heterogeneity and cancer cell plasticity and stemness. The findings underscored how cell-ECM interactions could influence the spatial organization of phenotypic heterogeneity in melanoma, ultimately relating to treatment response.
title: Phenotypic melanoma heterogeneity is regulated through cell-matrix interaction-dependent changes in tumor microarchitecture

finding: The rs539515 variant, associated with SEC16B, was found to interact with alcohol intake frequency, showing a significant effect (p = 1.1 × 10^-5) relevant to body weight regulation.
title: Leveraging phenotypic variability to identify genetic interactions in human phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12030757 was associated with the gene LRRC15, which was identified through genome-wide screening as a novel human host factor for the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein. This interaction was demonstrated to have emerged recently within the coronavirus family and is distinct from previous spike attachment factors like ACE2. The findings suggested that while LRRC15 does not independently facilitate viral entry into human cells, it has the capacity to modulate infection, particularly relevant in tissues with elevated ACE2 levels.
title: LRRC15 mediates an accessory interaction with the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein

finding: The SNP rs11121946 was associated with the exosomal thrombospondin-1, which disrupted the integrity of endothelial intercellular junctions and facilitated breast cancer cell metastasis. This finding had implications in cancer progression mechanisms and highlighted the potential value of targeting such pathways in therapeutic strategies.
title: Bimolecule detection for Extracellular Vesicle Screening

finding: The SNP rs12123765 was associated with breast cancer stem cell characteristics. In the context of the study by Zhang et al. (2020), it was linked to the mechanisms governing the identification and isolation of breast cancer stem cells, which play a vital role in tumor progression and therapeutic resistance.
title: Neutrophils exposed to a cholesterol metabolite secrete extracellular vesicles that promote epithelial-mesenchymal transition and stemness in breast cancer cells

finding: This SNP was found to overlap with a GATA1 transcription factor binding site in ATP2B4, influencing erythroid-specific expression. The derived allele at this SNP disrupts a GATA motif and was correlated with decreased expression, indicating its protective effect against malaria.
title: New insights into malaria susceptibility from the genomes of 17,000 individuals from Africa, Asia, and Oceania

finding: This SNP was implicated in malaria susceptibility through its association with ATP2B4 in the context of other subphenotypes and was analyzed alongside other variants in the study.
title: New insights into malaria susceptibility from the genomes of 17,000 individuals from Africa, Asia, and Oceania

finding: The SNP rs1137100 was found to be associated with EHR-derived OSA diagnosis in the Geisinger dataset, with a beta of -0.08 (p = 3.58 x 10^-3). It corresponded to shorter respiratory events.
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs1137101 was similarly associated with EHR-derived diagnosis of OSA, beta of -0.05 (p = 3.78 x 10^-2). It linked to less frequent awakenings and enhanced sleep efficiency.
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records
