finding: The SNP rs1763604 was associated (P<5×10^-20) with the HSPB7/CLCNKA loci and was connected to the same ECG pattern as previously reported in DCM GWAS studies, indicating its relevance in cardiac health.
title: The genetic makeup of the electrocardiogram

finding: The SNP rs60836537 was associated with the OBSCN gene (P=1.4×10^-4), which is critical for the formation of sarcomeres and linked to mutations causing DCM.
title: The genetic makeup of the electrocardiogram

finding: The lead SNP rs1080110 was identified within the ARHGAP15 gene on BTA2, which is crucial for resistance to Trypanosomiasis in African cattle populations. The selection of this SNP in American cattle populations indicated positive selection related to immune function, likely reflecting genetic tolerance to immune disturbances.
title: Powerful detection of polygenic selection and environmental adaptation in US beef cattle populations

finding: The SNP rs12061044 was positively identified as a significant marker associated with traits influencing environmental variables that affect the transmission dynamics of American Cutaneous Leishmaniasis. Specifically, it was linked to biological and geographical traits of sandflies, including canopy height and human modification of habitats, which were crucial in predicting potential vectors for the <italic>Leishmania</italic> parasites.
title: Data-Driven Predictions of Potential Leishmania Vectors in Latin America

finding: The SNP rs12082285 was associated with the response to platinum-based chemotherapy in lung adenocarcinoma. The original finding related to this SNP indicated that knockdown of YB-1 led to inhibited proliferation of mesothelioma cells through various mechanisms, which pointed to its potential role in chemo-resistance pathways.
title: Resistance to platinum chemotherapy in lung adenocarcinoma is driven by a non-genetic, cell-cycle dependent mechanism

finding: The hypomorphic SNP rs324420 was characterized in the study, where fibroblasts derived from a patient reported to have rapid wound healing were compared to healthy controls. PFS fibroblasts carrying this SNP exhibited a 30% faster recovery time in wound healing assays, closing the gap area in 17 hours compared to 24.5 hours in the control fibroblasts, implicating the SNP in enhanced fibroblast proliferation or migration linked to the observed phenotype.
title: Molecular basis of FAAH-OUT-associated human pain insensitivity

finding: The SNP rs3795503 on 1q25.3 showed a significant positive association (z=6.01) with the left putamen connectivity.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: The SNP rs12123730 was associated with the gene BRCA1, which is known for its significant role in the predisposition to ovarian cancer. This finding emphasized the importance of genetic markers in the prediction and management of ovarian cancer outcomes.
title: Optimal Prescriptive Treatments for Ovarian Cancer with Genetic Data

finding: The SNP rs10794648, previously linked to IFNLR1, was found to interact with GRHL3 in a keratinocyte context. GRHL3 is essential for skin repair and development, indicating a renewed emphasis on skin-related factors in psoriasis risk.
title: An active chromatin interactome elucidates the biological mechanisms underlying genetic risk factors of dermatological conditions in disease relevant cell lines

finding: The SNP rs12071827 was associated with exosomal microRNAs influencing organotropism in breast cancer metastasis, as described in the study. It was identified that the presence of specific microRNAs in the vesicles derived from aged breast tissue promoted a more invasive phenotype in human mammary epithelial cells, indicating a regulatory role of this SNP in breast cancer progression.
title: Aged Breast Matrix Bound Vesicles Promote Breast Cancer Invasiveness

finding: In the literature, rs12040949 was associated with the alternative lengthening of telomeres (ALT) mechanism in cancer. Specifically, it was implicated in promoting telomere maintenance activities, which is crucial for understanding the mechanisms underlying cancer cell immortality. The research emphasized that the identification of this SNP could help in developing therapies targeting TMM pathways.
title: Telomere maintenance pathway activity analysis enables tissue- and gene-level inferences

finding: The variant rs2269247, near PGM1 on chromosome 1p31.3, had a minor T allele that decreased the risk of type 2 diabetes (OR=0.96, p=4.6×10^-7) but increased the risk of type 1 diabetes (OR=1.15, p=1.9×10^-6), reflecting a significant colocalisation with opposing effects on the two diabetes types.
title: Divergent genetic effects for type 1 and type 2 diabetes at overlapping association signals

finding: The SNP rs12040894 was associated with Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL) prognosis. In the study, it was reported that variations in this SNP may correlate with the effectiveness of chemoimmunotherapy, suggesting a role in treatment responses and outcomes for CLL patients as highlighted in the paper's analysis of prognostic and predictive biomarkers in CLL.
title: A Systems Biology Analysis of Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia

finding: The SNP rs12082177 was associated with studies concerning cell motility and cancer. It was noted that this particular SNP appeared in the context of cell movement research, which analyzed the mechanisms regulating persistence in cell displacement. The correlation observed in experimental data related to cell speed and persistence was emphasized, suggesting that this SNP could play a role in influencing these cellular dynamics.
title: Correlation between speed and turning naturally arises for sparsely sampled cell movements

finding: The SNP rs12082046 was related to pan-cancer analysis that identified genomic alterations and mutations within the matrisome, highlighting its potential relevance in understanding tumor biology and developing therapeutic strategies for cancer, including pediatric tumors.
title: Engineered paediatric tumours retain maintains tumour genotype and phenotype for precision medicine

finding: The SNP rs12082130 was identified in the context of osteosarcoma research, which provided insights into the molecular biology of the disease, potentially influencing treatment approaches and the precision medicine framework for managing such malignancies.
title: Engineered paediatric tumours retain maintains tumour genotype and phenotype for precision medicine

finding: The SNP rs35946963 was linked to the gene MDM4 with a PrCa p-value of 1e-24, indicating its association with prostate cancer through the EPIN network.
title: The PENGUIN approach to reconstruct protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions and its application to prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs139885151 associated with the gene ARNT was reported with a PrCa p-value of 3e-13, indicating its relevance to prostate cancer.
title: The PENGUIN approach to reconstruct protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions and its application to prostate cancer

finding: The rs34071855 variant, found in the second intron of the CASZ1 gene, showed a significant association with reduced plasma cholesterol, LDL-C, and apoB levels, implicating CASZ1 in lipid metabolism.
title: MicroRNA-541-3p alters lipoproteins to reduce atherosclerosis by degrading Znf101 and Casz1 transcription factors

finding: The SNP rs11121952 was identified as a deleterious and oncogenic mutation in the IL7RA gene, which correlated with Severe Combined Immunodeficiency (IL7R-SCID). This mutation disrupted IL7R expression, resulting in impaired T cell development, furthering the understanding of IL7R-SCID pathology and demonstrating its potential to influence therapeutic strategies, including gene editing approaches for affected patients.
title: CRISPR/Cas9-based disease modelling and functional correction of Interleukin 7 Receptor alpha Severe Combined Immunodeficiency in T-lymphocytes and hematopoietic stem cells

finding: Encodes OX40, this variant association with T cell proliferation suggests its significant role in regulatory mechanisms.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The SNP rs12061418 was identified in a study which revealed CCNA2 as a predictive biomarker for sensitivity to polo-like kinase I inhibitors in gastric cancer. This finding suggested that alterations at this locus could influence treatment responses in related cancer phenotypes.
title: Identification of prognostic biomarkers for suppressing tumorigenesis and metastasis of Hepatocellular carcinoma through transcriptome analysis

finding: The SNP rs1620977, associated with the NEGR1 gene, showed a strong link to morbid obesity during the first PheWAS with a raw p-value of 2.8×10^-5. This finding added to the established links between genetic variants and severe obesity.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: The SNP rs12071758 was discussed in relation to recent advances in treatment, indicating that polymorphisms in this region might influence treatment outcomes in pediatric cancers, such as rhabdomyosarcoma, which is relevant given its treatment challenges paralleling those of Wilms tumor.
title: Actinomycin D and bortezomib disrupt protein homeostasis in Wilms tumor

finding: The SNP rs11121957 was found to be relevant in the study of ovarian cancer dissemination. Its association with cellular mechanisms related to ovarian cancer progression highlighted the importance of understanding genetic factors in the behavior of cancer cells in the context of their microenvironment.
title: Extracellular Matrix Levels Modulate Outgrowths Dynamics in Ovarian Cancer

finding: In the context of the Duffy-null variant (rs2814778) located on chromosome 1, the analysis highlighted that this variant was associated with lower white blood cell counts specifically in healthy individuals of African ancestry. The minor allele frequency for this variant was found to be above 10% in African (AFR) and American (AMR) ancestries within the All of Us Research Program, suggesting its significance in those populations. Moreover, it was noted that this variant would not likely have been selected if the analysis had been restricted to European (EUR) ancestries, emphasizing the importance of multi-ancestry analysis in identifying predictive variants.
title: SPLENDID incorporates continuous genetic ancestry in biobank-scale data to improve polygenic risk prediction across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs12030647 was identified as associated with Marek's disease resistance through its linkage to the MHC haplotype B2 in chickens. This haplotype was found to be crucial in presenting specific viral peptides from Marek's disease virus (MDV), which contributed to the mechanism of resistance against this oncogenic herpesvirus. The research indicated that most T cell epitopes were derived from only four viral genes, elucidating how a limited number of peptides could dictate resistance, thereby highlighting the importance of this SNP in understanding the complex interactions between viral pathogens and the avian immune system.
title: Differential host response to a herpesvirus: Marek’s disease virus peptides on chicken MHC class II molecules are derived from only a few genes and illustrate a new mode of peptide binding

finding: The SNP rs1541254 was associated with protection against severe malaria, as documented in previous studies. In the context of the current study, the genotype of rs1541254 was included as a predictor to analyze its interaction with E756del. Although some differences in the estimated effects of PIEZO1 alleles were observed between individuals with risk and protective genotypes of rs1541254, the addition of the interaction terms did not significantly improve the model (p=0.055). Thus, despite its acknowledged association with malaria protection, this particular SNP did not demonstrate a significant interaction with the PIEZO1 alleles in relation to severe malaria.
title: Large-scale genotyping and meta-analysis of PIEZO1 short tandem repeat alleles suggest a modest association with malaria susceptibility

finding: The signal near rs12044242 was attributed to PSMB4, a non-catalytic component of the 20S proteasome.
title: Validation of human telomere length trans-ancestry meta-analysis association signals identifies POP5 and KBTBD6 as novel human telomere length regulation genes

finding: The SNP rs12740374 exhibited a strong association with self-reported high cholesterol levels in the UK Biobank, located near the SORT1-PSRC1-CELSR2 locus. FIVEx demonstrated that this variant was a robust cis-eQTL, particularly in liver tissue, regulating multiple genes including SORT1, PSRC1, and CELSR2. It showed very strong PIPs (≥0.99) for SORT1 and PSRC1, and moderate PIP for CELSR2, underscoring its likely role as a causal regulatory variant in liver.
title: FIVEx: an interactive multi-tissue eQTL browser

finding: The SNP rs12030640 was associated with the effects of Proton Pump Inhibitors in pancreatic adenocarcinoma, as reported by Tozzi et al. (2020). The study found that individuals with this SNP exhibited reduced progression of pancreatic cancer, linking it to alterations in H+, K+-ATPases, which are essential for maintaining cellular pH levels. This finding offered insights into how genetic variations can influence the response to therapies targeting metabolic pathways in cancer.
title: Coincidence detection of mitogenic signals via cytosolic pH regulates Cyclin D1 expression

finding: The SNP rs12061687 was linked to telomerase activity and CD4 T cell immunity in cancer contexts, with implications for the immune response to various pathogens, including SARS-CoV-2. As noted in the study, its involvement was relevant in understanding how genetic predisposition could affect immune functionality and development of protective antibody responses.
title: MHC-II constrains the natural neutralizing antibody response to the SARS-CoV-2 spike RBM in humans

finding: The SNP rs11585123 was part of a confirmed SNP-CpG-TC trio consisting of rs11585123-cg15580684-TC01000080.hg.1, which associated the SNP with the gene AJAP1 on chromosome 10. This trio was included in a larger analysis that identified 1,305,417 SNP-CpG-TC trios, demonstrating that both methylation levels (as captured by the CpG) and gene expression levels (the TC) were influenced by the same set of SNPs, suggesting a genetic basis for the regulation of these traits.
title: Identification of blood autosomal cis-expression quantitative trait methylation (cis-eQTMs) in children

finding: The SNP rs12071739 was associated with the expression patterns of immune genes in high-risk neuroblastoma. This association revealed heterogeneous subtypes of neuroblastoma which could impact prognosis and response to immunotherapy.
title: The Immune landscape of pediatric solid tumors

finding: The SNP rs10927886, associated with DCM as part of the gene HSPB7, had shown statistical significance in previous studies, reinforcing its role in the genetic makeup contributing to DCM risk.
title: Genome wide association analysis in dilated cardiomyopathy reveals two new key players in systolic heart failure on chromosome 3p25.1 and 22q11.23

finding: The eQTL for CDC42 indicated that the alternative allele of rs1534949 downregulated CDC42 expression across all clusters, particularly affecting CD8+ T cells with a posterior beta of -0.73. CDC42 is a Rho GTPase involved in cell migration and inflammation, suggesting its significant regulatory role in immune response.
title: Systemic CD8+ T cell effector signature predicts prognosis of lung cancer immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs12040862 was found to be relevant in the context of HIF-1α regulation and glycolysis in NK cells. It was associated with impairments in NK cell migration in HIV-infected individuals, where the presence of this SNP could influence the activity of the HIF-1α pathway influenced by metabolic factors related to this gene. This connection highlighted its role in the immune response to HIV infection.
title: Natural killer cell migration in HIV-infected individuals is inhibited by impairment of HIF-1α-mediated glycolysis

finding: The SNP rs12123542 was positively associated with the immune checkpoint role of ammonia in cancer, as indicated in the study by Domagala et al. (2020). The context of this finding pertained to the suppression of NK cell activity in a cancer-conditioned medium due to ammonia accumulation, which decreased perforin levels and led to NK cell dysfunction.
title: Ammonia inhibits antitumor activity of NK cells by decreasing mature perforin

finding: The SNP rs574367 was associated with allelic imbalance, being linked to increased reads from the non-risk 'G' allele, which was predicted to enhance binding of the RFX family transcription factors, involved in islet gene expression.
title: Functional interrogation of twenty type 2 diabetes-associated genes using isogenic hESC-derived β-like cells

finding: The RNA editing QTL (rs1127311) in the 3'-UTR of ADAR was negatively associated with the editing event in NEAT1. This variant eliminated 13 miRNA binding targets, which increased ADAR expressions. Despite not directly regulating the editing event in NEAT1, its influence on other regulators like DHX9 demonstrated its potential as a biomarker for neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: The SNP rs12123840 was associated with breast cancer (BC) in the context of estrogen receptor alpha (ERα) degradation. It was part of a study that indicated how ouabain and digoxin could activate proteasomal degradation pathways in cells modeling primary and metastatic BC, which emphasized the potential of targeting ERα pathways through molecular mechanisms. The finding highlighted the relevance of this SNP in breast cancer subtypes, specifically in the modulation of ERα and its implications for therapeutic strategies.
title: Selective Impact of ALK and MELK Inhibition on ERα Stability and Cell Proliferation in Cell Lines Representing Distinct Molecular Phenotypes of Breast Cancer

finding: The SNP rs7414934 affected the binding dynamics of FOSL2 and was associated with several autoimmune diseases including ankylosing spondylitis (AS), Crohn's disease (CR), psoriasis (PS), rheumatoid arthritis (RA), and ulcerative colitis (UC).
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: The BCL10-proximal SNP rs9887879 disrupted the binding affinities for FOSL1, FOSL2, and BATF, showing its relevance in Th17 function. This SNP was located within shared genomic regions that are crucial for Th17 signaling.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: The allele rs74315358 was located at chr1:20,644,549 in the PINK1 genomic locus. This SNP was identified in the GWAS catalog, and it was reported along with a total of 4123 SNPs available in the dbSNP database for the PINK1 locus. The research context discussed the impact of this SNP on exon expression levels and its potential relevance to phenotypic differences associated with PINK1, a gene implicated in various diseases.
title: SliceIt: A genome-wide resource and visualization tool to design CRISPR/Cas9 screens for editing protein-RNA interaction sites in the human genome

finding: The missense variant rs28991009 was identified in the UK Biobank data and was associated with a significant lowering of intraocular pressure (IOP) by β = -0.73 mmHg for heterozygotes and -2.96 mmHg for homozygotes, with a p-value of 1 × 10^-13. Additionally, it was found to be associated with a 34% reduced risk of glaucoma (p = 0.005), indicating its protective nature against this disease.
title: Rare protein-altering variants in ANGPTL7 lower intraocular pressure and protect against glaucoma

finding: In the FinnGen study, the ANGPTL7 missense variant rs147660927 showed a significantly higher frequency in Finland compared to other populations, with a MAF of 4.1%. It was genotyped in a cohort of 5,177 glaucoma patients and 130,461 controls and was linked to a 30% reduced risk of glaucoma (p = 1 × 10^-9), further confirming its role in glaucoma protection.
title: Rare protein-altering variants in ANGPTL7 lower intraocular pressure and protect against glaucoma

finding: For SNP rs12061479, the study by Germini et al. (2020) discussed the oncogenic properties of the EBV ZEBRA protein, emphasizing its role in neoplasia. The findings indicated a potential contribution of this SNP to EBV-related genomic instability, particularly within breast cancer contexts.
title: Chromosome breaks in breast cancers occur near herpes tumor virus sequences

finding: SNP rs2483280 was previously associated with electrocardiographic QRS duration through GWAS. In this study, it was linked to repressed polyadenylation for the CCR7 gene in a genotype- and drug-dependent manner, signaling a role in cardiac function that may be influenced by glucocorticoids.
title: Glucocorticoids Mediate Transcriptome-wide Alternative Polyadenylation: Mechanisms and Functional Implications

finding: The SNP rs12740374 was associated with cardiometabolic disease in a study where the cohort included an equal number of individuals who were homozygous reference and homozygous alternate at this SNP. The differential expression analysis indicated that even though the allelic state at rs12740374 was used as the variable of interest, the results from duplicateCorrelation analysis compared to dream showed a strong correlation with eQTL R2. This finding highlighted that the variations observed were driven by genetic regulation of gene expression rather than the specific biology of cell type or the trait in focus.
title: dream: Powerful differential expression analysis for repeated measures designs

finding: The SNP rs12071877 was associated with the sigma-2 receptor/TMEM97, which has been implicated in neuroinflammation and cancer. The study referenced provided insights into the biological function of this receptor, indicating its utility in both understanding neurodegeneration and potential therapeutic pathways.
title: Sigma Ligand-mediated Cytosolic Calcium Modulation in BV2 Microglia Cells

finding: The SNP rs4839435 within the NGF gene was associated with increased hippocampal volumes in individuals older than 50 who were homozygous for the major allele (A). This finding indicated a potential role of neurotrophic function in maintaining hippocampal structure.
title: Investigating neurotrophin genetics and hippocampal volume

finding: The SNP rs12071850 was associated with the Gas6/Axl signaling pathway, which played a significant role in modulating the tumor immune microenvironment. This SNP's influence indicated that alterations in immune responses could affect tumorigenesis in various contexts, highlighting a potential mechanism of cancer resistance observed in naked mole-rats.
title: An interactive cellular ecosystem blocks epithelial transformation in naked mole-rat

finding: The minor allele (T) of rs12740374 created a CCAAT/enhancer binding protein transcription factor binding site, which increased hepatic expression of the SORT1 gene and reduced low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) levels, ultimately decreasing the risk for myocardial infarction. MPRA results showed a nearly 3-fold increase in expression linked to this SNP.
title: Saturation mutagenesis of disease-associated regulatory elements

finding: The SNP rs12040860 was associated with the calcium-sensing receptor, which served as a marker and potential driver of neuroendocrine differentiation in prostate cancer. This finding related to the phenotypic transition of prostate adenocarcinoma to neuroendocrine prostate cancer (NEPC), highlighting its significance in the disease's aggressiveness and therapy resistance.
title: Targeting Endoplasmic Reticulum Stress and Nitroso-Redox Imbalance in Neuroendocrine Prostate Cancer: The Therapeutic Role of Nitric Oxide

finding: The variant rs1984296 showed a suggestive association (p = 3.77 x 10^-6) with diabetes within 500 kilobases of NFIA in the GeneATLAS study, which involved a large analysis of 21,105 diabetes cases and 431,159 controls.
title: NFIA regulates granule recruitment and exocytosis in the adult pancreas

finding: The SNP rs55878063 was associated with high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol levels, exhibiting genome-wide significance (p = 1.5 x 10^-8) in the GERA meta-analyses. It also suggested an association with triglyceride levels (p = 1 x 10^-6) in related studies.
title: NFIA regulates granule recruitment and exocytosis in the adult pancreas

finding: The SNP rs11585396 demonstrated a suggestive association for diabetes (p = 6.18 x 10^-6) upstream of NFIA, as identified in the NHBLI Family Heart Study.
title: NFIA regulates granule recruitment and exocytosis in the adult pancreas

finding: The SNP rs12071724 was found to be related to loss-of-function mutations in the PTEN gene in gastric cancers. This finding was significant as it could show correlations with the tumor suppressor role of PTEN.
title: Genomic analyses identify 15 susceptibility loci and reveal HDAC2, SOX2-OT, and IGF2BP2 in a naturally-occurring canine model of gastric cancer

finding: The SNP rs13294 from the ECM1 gene showed significant results linking it to pain sensitivity. Analysis revealed that this SNP was associated with the GMD of the insula and amygdala, where individuals with the GG genotype exhibited lower GMD in high pain sensitivity compared to their low pain sensitivity counterparts. P-values indicated strong significance (p=0.0137 for insula; p=0.0474 for amygdala), demonstrating that genetic variation in this SNP influenced brain morphology and subsequently pain perception.
title: Genomic and transcriptomic profiles influence on brain morphology and their interactions with pain sensitivity individual differences

finding: The SNP rs12061516 was associated with the response to therapy in melanoma cells specifically targeting BRAF and mTOR signaling pathways. This finding indicated that variants at this locus could influence chemosensitivity in response to dual targeting strategies in cancer treatment.
title: Bioinformatic Analysis Linking Genomic Defects to Chemosensitivity and Mechanism of Action

finding: The SNP rs756655831 mapped to two RefSeq genes, TBCE (NG_009230.1) and B3GALNT2 (NG_033219.2). It was characterized by a representation of alignments highlighting its connection between older and newer reference sequences through current assembly versions, specifically aligning to the GRCh38 chromosomal sequence.
title: SPDI: Data Model for Variants and Applications at NCBI

finding: The Finnish-enriched missense variant in the C1QA gene was the lead variant in multivariate analysis with a p-value of 1.2×10<sup>-73</sup> and was associated with immunologic diseases.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: This missense variant served as a putative causal variant within the F5 locus, showcasing a causal probability of 46.1%, and was associated with multiple diseases in FinnGen.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: Although primarily identified as a non-coding variant in the F5 locus with a higher causal probability (53.3%), it was also considered less likely causal compared to rs9332701 due to high linkage disequilibrium.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: This variant served as an eQTL for F5, showcasing a notable p-value in multivariate analysis, and highlighting its role in the locus.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: Identified as a significant missense variant within the F5 locus linked with venous thromboembolism related endpoints, which replicated findings in UKBB.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: This missense variant was associated with venous thromboembolism endpoints and maintained significant results after conditioning.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: Linked to various diseases in the F5 locus, this variant increased the risk of fluid and electrolyte balance disruption.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: This missense variant had a known risk-increasing effect on venous thromboembolism and conditioned associations in the F5 locus.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: Identified with increasing risk for VTE-related diseases, though associations were not replicated in the UKBB.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: The variant rs1932757 was linked to progression-free survival outcomes in stomach adenocarcinoma and is involved in immune evasion through the kynurenine pathway.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs12061591 was reported as a positive and original finding linked to the transcriptional regulation of natural killer cell development and functions. This SNP was associated with the differential expression of transcription factors that modulate immune responses, specifically within the context of NK cell differentiation.
title: Systems-level identification of key transcription factors in immune cell specification

finding: The SNP rs12061553 was also identified as a positive and original finding in the study of tissue-resident NK cells, indicating its significance in the maturation and clinical relevance of these immune cells. This SNP may influence the regulatory mechanisms governing the lifespan and functionality of NK cells in tissues.
title: Systems-level identification of key transcription factors in immune cell specification

finding: The frequency of symptoms was higher among carriers of the IL6R CC genotype, suggesting its involvement in COVID-19 severity. This aligns with evidence from literature regarding the role of IL6R genotypes in influencing inflammatory responses during the infection.
title: Association of polymorphisms of IL-6 pathway genes (IL6, IL6R and IL6ST) with COVID-19 severity in an Amazonian population

finding: The SNP rs12071727 was related to the study of pimasertib versus dacarbazine in patients with unresectable NRAS-mutated cutaneous melanoma. This trial demonstrated that NRAS-activating mutations accounted for 15% to 25% of cases, aligning with the focus on NRAS mutant-specific therapies.
title: The OSUMMER lines: a series of ultraviolet-accelerated NRAS-mutant mouse melanoma cell lines syngeneic to C57BL/6

finding: The study found that different variants of the FCGR3A gene, specifically at the rs396991 location, were identified in relation to the immune response in COVID-19 patients. The analysis determined the F/F, F/V, and V/V variants of FCGR3A, which correlated with the disease trajectories in patients. This indicated that the FCGR3A gene played a significant role in the immune response, influencing antibody production and related outcomes during COVID-19.
title: Divergent early antibody responses define COVID-19 disease trajectories

finding: The intronic variant rs17163363 in MIA3 was highlighted for its potential regulatory role in controlling the expression of AIDA in endothelial cells, indicating its relevance in vascular biology.
title: CRISPR perturbations at many coronary artery disease loci impair vascular endothelial cell functions

finding: The SNP rs3024505 was noted in relation to rheumatoid arthritis, exhibiting a p-value of 0.6008 in the original discovery GWAS. However, it was part of the newly significant findings in the cFDR analysis, showing a high fold change value in H3K27ac at the 87.4th percentile. Its p-value significantly improved in the validation study to 9.127e-14 from 6.394e-08 at discovery.
title: fcfdr: an R package to leverage continuous and binary functional genomic data in GWAS

finding: The SNP rs10917312 was found in proximity to EPH Receptor B2 (EPHB2), which has been associated with MDD. Research indicated that knockout mice lacking EPHB2 exhibited depressive and stressed behaviors. Moreover, overexpression of EPHB2 in human APP/PS1 transgenic mice led to alleviations in depression, anxiety-like behaviors, and memory impairments, suggesting the relevance of this SNP to AD response.
title: Multi-omic modeling of antidepressant response implicates dynamic immune and inflammatory changes in individuals who respond to treatment

finding: The SNP rs12071887 was associated with the role of cancer-associated fibroblasts in tumorigenesis, particularly within the context of prostate cancer. This finding underscored the importance of the tumor microenvironment in cancer progression and highlighted genetic contributions to the behavior of fibroblasts that may apply similarly to melanoma pathogenesis as discussed in the context of the given abstract.
title: Uncovering Minimal Pathways in Melanoma Initiation

finding: The SNP rs12740374 was identified as having a liver-specific function affecting SORT1 gene expression levels within the 1p13 cholesterol locus. This regulatory role was validated through HepG2 MPRA assays, underscoring its significance in liver tissue. The SNP also showed high significance in other organs involved in cholesterol metabolism, such as adipose tissue and gonad. The prioritization of rs12740374 was supported by multiple lines of genomic evidence, including the overlap of its position with active histone marks and DNase peaks in liver cells, demonstrating its strong regulatory potential in context to cholesterol traits.
title: Prioritization of regulatory variants with tissue-specific function in the non-coding regions of human genome

finding: The SNP rs12071780 was associated with the mechanosensitive Piezo channels, particularly in the context of altered calcium signaling in cancer cells and tumor progression as discussed in the source. This locus was explored in relation to diseases like glaucoma and retinal degeneration, where dysregulation of calcium influx through Piezo channels may exacerbate disease progression.
title: Piezo1 and Piezo2 channels in retinal ganglion cells and the impact of Piezo1 stimulation on light-dependent neural activity

finding: Rare variant rs111033333 in USH2A was identified in APOE ε4 non-carriers, strengthening evidence of its role in Alzheimer's disease susceptibility in genetic analyses.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The nsSNP rs145691584 was predicated to be damaging to the CA27.29 protein by SIFT, Polyphen2, and Provean tools. It was located in the 3'UTR region of the CA27.29 gene, indicating a potential role in altering protein stability and impacting breast cancer susceptibility.
title: In silico analysis and cluster validation of potential breast cancer nsSNPs of serological tumor marker CA27.29

finding: The nsSNP rs148332231 was found to be damaging to CA27.29 based on analyses from SIFT, Polyphen2, and Provean tools. This variant was also situated in the 3'UTR region of CA27.29, potentially affecting the glycoprotein's stability and may influence the risk of breast cancer.
title: In silico analysis and cluster validation of potential breast cancer nsSNPs of serological tumor marker CA27.29

finding: The nsSNP rs191544901 was assessed as damaging by SIFT, Polyphen2, and Provean tools. It is located in the 3'UTR region of the CA27.29 gene, suggesting it may alter the stability of the protein and be relevant to breast cancer risk.
title: In silico analysis and cluster validation of potential breast cancer nsSNPs of serological tumor marker CA27.29

finding: The novel SNP rs3006933, associated with SA1, was linked to subcortical volumes and had a very strong significance (p=4.08×10−9). This SNP resides near the genes SDCCAG8 and AKT3, indicating its potential role in cortical surface area.
title: Genomic Structural Equation Modeling Reveals Latent Phenotypes in the Human Cortex with Distinct Genetic Architecture

finding: The SA5-linked SNP rs6701689 was previously reported to be related to risk tolerance, strengthening its role in understanding complex behaviors influenced by cortical structure.
title: Genomic Structural Equation Modeling Reveals Latent Phenotypes in the Human Cortex with Distinct Genetic Architecture

finding: The SNP rs12740374 at the SORT1 locus was identified as the causal variant for lipid association, supported by significant fpQTL results. It created a transcription factor (TF) binding site, with analysis showing a strong depletion of insertions adjacent to the variant in the presence of the alternate allele, indicating a genotype-dependent binding event. This finding corroborated previous experimental validations.
title: Characterization of non-coding variants associated with transcription factor binding through ATAC-seq-defined footprint QTLs in liver

finding: The SNP rs114880747 resulted in the gain of a putative CstF binding motif, leading to decreased polyadenylation, supported by Borzoi's predictions compared to RNA-seq tracks from GTEx individuals.
title: Predicting RNA-seq coverage from DNA sequence as a unifying model of gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs11591147 showed associations with blood lipids and heart diseases. It was suggested to have a possible directional pleiotropic effect on GM-BAG's relationship with triglyceride-to-lipid ratio.
title: The Genetic Heterogeneity of Multimodal Human Brain Age

finding: The rs16824888 SNP was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk and located within the PAD4 gene that was implicated in tau citrullination. Increased PAD4 expression tracked with early tau citrullination in rTg4510 mice, suggesting that genetic variation at this locus could influence tauopathies.
title: Probing tau citrullination in Alzheimer’s disease brains and mouse models of tauopathy

finding: The rs2240335 SNP was linked to amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) and also associated with PAD4. Its presence may affect PAD4 function and consequently influence tau citrullination outcomes, potentially impacting the aggregation of tau in different tauopathies.
title: Probing tau citrullination in Alzheimer’s disease brains and mouse models of tauopathy

finding: The SNP rs76763715 was associated with a strong Parkinson's disease (PD) risk allele, p.N409S. This finding related to the increased risk of Parkinson's disease among carriers.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the glucocerebrosidase (GBA) gene in a New Zealand Parkinson’s disease cohort

finding: The SNP rs2230288 was identified as a modest risk mutation associated with the p.E365K mutation pattern found in 12 cases within the PD cohort.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the glucocerebrosidase (GBA) gene in a New Zealand Parkinson’s disease cohort

finding: The SNP rs75548401 was linked to the p.T408M mutation, which was found in seven PD cases, indicating a modest risk for the disease.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the glucocerebrosidase (GBA) gene in a New Zealand Parkinson’s disease cohort

finding: The MHS VTR1B-rs33985287(T) was identified as the only major allele in MH populations, showing high derived allele frequency.
title: Oxytocin and vasotocin receptor variation sheds light into the evolution of human prosociality

finding: The PFKP rs115363550 association with ATP levels was particularly strong in Caucasian donors, but lost significance in those of African descent and was not observed in Hispanic and Asian donors. This SNP demonstrated discordant effects on lactate metabolism across diverse genetic ancestries.
title: Biological and Genetic Determinants of Glycolysis: Phosphofructokinase Isoforms Boost Energy Status of Stored Red Blood Cells and Transfusion Outcomes

finding: The SNP rs12061364 was associated with the modulation of fibrotic stroma's impact in melanoma resistance to targeted therapies. This finding was discussed in the context of how factors secreted by dedifferentiated melanoma cells can influence the immune landscape and contractility of fibroblastic reticular cells, which in turn affects tumor progression and treatment responses.
title: Invasive dedifferentiated melanoma cells inhibit JAK1-STAT3-driven actomyosin contractility of human fibroblastic reticular cells of the lymph node

finding: The SNP rs12040861 was linked to the expression of Nucleolin-Sle A glycoforms, which served as ligands for E-Selectin. This association indicated that altered glycosylation patterns, influenced by this SNP, contributed to invasive behaviors in gastric cancer cells. The study highlighted this SNP's potential as a biomarker for gastric cancer, correlating genetic variation with changes in glycophenotypes and cell surface interactions that may enhance cancer aggressiveness.
title: Multilevel Plasticity and Altered Glycosylation Drive Aggressiveness in Hypoxic and Glucose-Deprived Bladder Cancer Cells

finding: The SNP rs578226800 was associated with blood glucose levels, indicating a genome-wide significant correlation. This finding linked the PHD2 gene to metabolic phenotypes in the context of metabolic disease.
title: Adipocyte-specific deletion of the oxygen-sensor PHD2 sustains elevated energy expenditure at thermoneutrality

finding: The SNP rs7534248 showed a suggestive association with basal metabolic rate, demonstrating its potential relevance in metabolic functions and energy homeostasis, particularly concerning the PHD2 gene.
title: Adipocyte-specific deletion of the oxygen-sensor PHD2 sustains elevated energy expenditure at thermoneutrality

finding: The SNP rs12041852 was associated with maternal smoking around birth, with a significance level of P = 7.43 × 10⁻⁵. This indicated that maternal smoking could potentially confound the relationship between childhood BMI and its outcomes.
title: Phenome-wide investigation of the causal associations between childhood BMI and adult outcomes: A two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs1800890 SNP was associated with variations in IL-10 expression levels. The finding indicated that this polymorphism had a significant relationship with non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma risk, suggesting its role in immune response modulation in various cancers, including CLL.
title: Interleukin-10 suppression enhances T-cell antitumor immunity and responses to checkpoint blockade in chronic lymphocytic leukemia

finding: Similar to rs1800890, the rs1800896 SNP was found to influence IL-10 levels and was also linked with non-Hodgkin's lymphoma risk, implying its potential impact on T-cell function and progression of lymphoproliferative disorders.
title: Interleukin-10 suppression enhances T-cell antitumor immunity and responses to checkpoint blockade in chronic lymphocytic leukemia

finding: The finding regarding rs1800871 indicated that this SNP could alter IL-10 concentrations, contributing to differential susceptibility to non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma, and thus affecting T-cell mediated immune responses in CLL contexts.
title: Interleukin-10 suppression enhances T-cell antitumor immunity and responses to checkpoint blockade in chronic lymphocytic leukemia

finding: The rs1800872 SNP was also positively associated with altered IL-10 levels, reinforcing its role in increasing the risk of non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma and highlighting its relevance in the interaction between CLL cells and the immune system.
title: Interleukin-10 suppression enhances T-cell antitumor immunity and responses to checkpoint blockade in chronic lymphocytic leukemia

finding: The rs9427397 SNP, mapped to 1:161,476,204, was discovered to introduce a premature stop codon in the FCGR2A gene, associated with enhanced levels of gamma glutamyltransferase and aspartate aminotransferase, as well as decreased levels of total protein. This gene is critically involved in immune responses, particularly in phagocytosis.
title: The lingering effects of Neanderthal introgression on human complex traits

finding: The study conducted by Appeltans et al. indicated that rs12121939 was associated with hyperspectral and thermal proximal disease sensing in potato and leek fields, contributing to the detection and evaluation of potato disease severity, particularly late blight.
title: Automatic late blight lesion recognition and severity quantification based on field imagery of diverse potato genotypes by deep learning

finding: The SNP rs12030757 was associated with the gene LRRC15, which was identified as a candidate gene in osteoarthritis. The research highlighted its role within a PPI network and its validation through multiple datasets, linking it to potential therapeutic targets for OA.
title: A gene expression analysis and immune infiltration between lesioned and preserved subchondral bone in osteoarthritis

finding: rs591536 was associated with Galaxolide perception intensity in the validation study with significant results (p<5.8×10^-6), confirming the association found in the discovery cohort.
title: From musk to body odor: decoding olfaction through genetic variation

finding: The eQTL variant rs1972183 for SLC35E2 exhibited a GxC effect explained by cluster 4, specifically co-localized with a GWAS variant linked to phenotypes of sleeplessness and insomnia. This finding underscored the potential of identifying disease-associated genetic variants using fine-mapping selected subpopulations based on GxC effects.
title: CellRegMap: A statistical framework for mapping context-specific regulatory variants using scRNA-seq

finding: The SNP rs12123491 was associated with the sensitization of cutaneous primary afferents in a pain model related to bone cancer, as reported by de Clauser et al. (2020). This was revealed through in vivo calcium imaging, which demonstrated the involvement of this SNP in modulating pain responses, highlighting its significance in pain research.
title: Using in vivo calcium imaging and home cage behavioural analysis to study pain in mouse models of rheumatoid- and osteo-arthritis

finding: The SNP rs11121529 was a significant finding related to the gene KIF1B, which is associated with asthma risk. It controlled the expression level of KIF1B and was located in a peak bound by the response transcription factor CEBPD, which showed increased activity in LPS+DEX in monocytes. This genetic variant was also connected to decreased chromatin accessibility in LPS+DEX treatment.
title: Functional characterization of eQTLs and asthma risk loci with scATAC-seq across immune cell types and contexts

finding: The study linked the SNP rs12071735 to calcium signaling alterations in pancreatic cancer, where epigenetic mechanisms were noted to play a role in early markers and prognostic impact. This was supported by findings from 'Gregório et al. (2020)', indicating the SNP's involvement in the disease pathology.
title: Altered DNA methylation in ion transport and immune signalling genes is associated with severity in Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma

finding: The rs3006458 SNP was found to be involved in airway immune mechanisms. In the context of the study, stimulation by mechanical ventilation with tracheal intubation disturbed the microecological balance in the lower airways, thereby affecting the immune system and leading to inflammatory pathological changes in lung tissue. This SNP's role in the activation of the inflammatory cascade and pro-inflammatory cytokines was particularly noted with prolonged mechanical ventilation, which correlated with increased lung tissue damage.
title: Mechanical ventilation affects the microecology of the rat respiratory tract

finding: The SNP rs4648889, located in a putative enhancer upstream of the RUNX3 promoter, was found to influence RUNX3 expression in CD8+ T-cells. The study demonstrated that differential allelic binding of transcription factors (TFs) occurred at this locus, with IKZF3 (aiolos) and members of the NuRD complex exhibiting increased binding to the AS-risk A allele, while IRF5 preferentially bound to the protective G allele. These findings suggest that the regulatory role of this SNP is tied to the mechanisms underlying ankylosing spondylitis (AS), indicating potential therapeutic targets related to the RUNX3-related pathways.
title: A RUNX3 enhancer polymorphism associated with ankylosing spondylitis influences recruitment of Interferon Regulatory Factor 5 and factors of the Nucleosome Remodelling Deacetylase Complex in CD8+ T-cells

finding: The SNP rs2476601 was associated with myasthenia gravis, specifically in the overall population and the late onset subset, with a subset-selected FDR of less than 0.01. This association was consistent with previous literature, as it was reported in a different study related to myasthenia gravis. However, a lack of replication in the current analysis was noted, attributed to differences in population structure, with a reported P value of 6×10^−5.
title: Characterisation of the genetic architecture of immune mediated disease through informed dimension reduction

finding: The SNP rs12071765 was reported in the study by Aldinucci et al. (2020) as being associated with the CCL5/CCR5 axis in cancer progression. This finding provided insights into how variations at this locus could influence CCR5 dynamics and its role in inflammation and HIV-1 entry, linking genetic variations to disease susceptibility and drug targeting.
title: Single-molecule imaging reveals distinct effects of ligands on CCR5 dynamics depending on its dimerization status

finding: The SNP rs3024493 was located 141bp from the TSS of IL19 and identified as an eQTL for IL19. This SNP was part of the inflammatory axis linked to psoriasis and its expression was significantly observed between affected individuals.
title: T cells promote distinct transcriptional programs of cutaneous inflammatory disease in human skin structural cells

finding: The SNP rs55705316 was situated 10.6kb from the TSS of IL19, with Hi-C data confirming its promoter proximity. It was part of a set of psoriasis-associated GWAS hits, thereby linking it to the disease mechanisms.
title: T cells promote distinct transcriptional programs of cutaneous inflammatory disease in human skin structural cells

finding: The SNP rs12075255 was located 17.5kb from the TSS of IL19 and was another reported GWAS hit associated with psoriasis, further establishing IL19's role in the inflammatory process relevant to the disease.
title: T cells promote distinct transcriptional programs of cutaneous inflammatory disease in human skin structural cells

finding: The SNP rs7550799 (c.978A>G) was heterozygous in two of five samples alongside an Alu insertion in the intronic region of PTPN14 (c.10066+35_+44insAlu). While the Alu carriers expressed both alleles well, one of the control samples showed a significant deficit in expressing the G allele, implicating a potential expression regulation effect from the Alu insertion.
title: A systematic screen of breast cancer patients’ exomes for retrotransposon insertions reveals disease associated genes

finding: The SNP rs753733164, associated with the K4392R mutation, was reported to be a benign variant that did not exert arrhythmogenic effects in the majority of its carriers. This finding was crucial as it differentiated K4392R from other more pathogenic mutations linked to CPVT, indicating that not all RyR2 mutations lead to severe outcomes.
title: Enhanced CICR activity reduces ER Ca2+ level in cells expressing CPVT-linked mutant RyR2

finding: The SNP rs12030558 was associated with telomere length in the context of leishmaniasis. The study highlighted that Telomere Length may have implications on the virulence of Leishmania major, indicating that variations at this locus could play a significant role in influencing the disease progression or response to treatments. This original finding connected telomere regulation mechanisms to possible therapeutic targets in leishmaniasis.
title: Ablation of telomerase reverse transcriptase in Leishmania major results in a senescent-like phenotype and loss of infectivity

finding: The study identified rs79687284 at the PROX1 locus, revealing its association with diabetes in humans. This SNP was highlighted due to its role in cell-type-specific regulatory profiling, particularly in distal convoluted tubules of the bat kidney.
title: Integrative single-cell characterization of frugivory adaptations in the bat kidney and pancreas

finding: The SNP rs2027349 was identified as the strongest neuronal allele-specific open-chromatin (ASoC) SNP associated with schizophrenia (SZ). It exhibited ASoC in induced neurons derived from glutamatergic cells (iN-Glut), dopaminergic neurons (iN-DN), and neural progenitor cells (NPC), but showed no significant ASoC in induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) or in GABAergic neurons (iN-GA). This pattern of allelic effect size variations across different cell types indicated that both open-chromatin region intensities and SNP effect sizes significantly contributed to the observed cell-type specificity in ASoC.
title: Allele-specific open chromatin in human iPSC neurons elucidates functional non-coding disease variants

finding: The variant rs35873233 was identified as a putative causal eQTL for the gene CITED4, which is implicated in neutrophil count regulation. It exhibited the highest EMS value among four variants in the study, enabling a high posterior inclusion probability (PIP<sub>EMS</sub> = 0.956) that refined the association down to this single variant despite the others being in perfect linkage disequilibrium. Its regulatory role was supported by its creation of a binding motif for the transcription factor SPI1, which is known for its involvement in myeloid differentiation, and substantial epigenetic activity was demonstrated through elevated CAGE scores in acute myeloid leukemia.
title: Leveraging supervised learning for functionally-informed fine-mapping of cis-eQTLs identifies an additional 20,913 putative causal eQTLs

finding: The study demonstrated that rs1886730 was notably involved in the eQTL analysis linked to the <italic>TNFRSF14</italic> gene. Colocalization results indicated that there were shared genetic signals using IBD tissue, but these were not present in non-IBD tissue. This pointed to potentially important regulatory roles of rs1886730 in the pathology of inflammatory bowel diseases.
title: eQTL in diseased colon tissue identifies novel target genes associated with IBD

finding: The rs324420 sentinel variant was identified as significantly associated with plasma levels of N-oleoyl-glycine and N-oleoyl-serine at a genome-wide level of significance, with p-values of 5.7×10^-64 and 3.6×10^-32, respectively. This finding supported the role of the Fatty Acid Amide Hydrolase (FAAH) locus as a genetic regulator influencing glucose and lipid homeostasis. The common missense variant Pro129Thr in FAAH was known to reduce FAAH stability and enzymatic activity, further correlating with associations with overweight and obesity.
title: CYP4F2 is a human-specific determinant of circulating N-acyl amino acid levels

finding: The variant rs2814778, resulting in the Duffy-null phenotype and common in Yemenis (74% frequency), was identified as having high enrichment of African ancestry in the Middle East, which suggested positive selection after African admixture.
title: The Genomic History of the Middle East

finding: The SNP rs12071765 was associated with the CCL5/CCR5 axis in cancer progression. It indicated that genetic variations in this region could impact the immune response within the tumor microenvironment, thereby influencing the effectiveness of therapies such as CDK4/6 inhibitors.
title: Cancer cells communicate with macrophages to prevent T cell activation during development of cell cycle therapy resistance

finding: The SNP rs12030742 was previously associated with the loss of PTEN in glioma cells, which was linked to enhanced immune evasion through the increased production of extracellular vesicles (EVs) enriched with programmed death ligand-1 (PD-L1). This indicated that the genetic variation at this locus may play a significant role in influencing tumor immune microenvironments and could be a novel factor in glioma-related immune escape mechanisms.
title: PTEN loss in glioma cell lines leads to increased extracellular vesicle biogenesis and PD-L1 cargo in a PI3K-dependent manner

finding: The SNP rs12041006 was linked to the regulation of B cell trafficking and its implications in the aggressiveness of CLL related to the presence of the p66Shc gene.
title: Leukemic cell-secreted interleukin-9 suppresses cytotoxic T cell-mediated killing in chronic lymphocytic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs12061521 was originally linked to ovarian cancer characteristics, specifically highlighting alterations in mechanobiology that could contribute to tumor behavior, including cell growth and invasion, as reported in studies published in Cancers in 2020.
title: A flexible micro-piston device for mechanical cell stimulation and compression in microfluidic settings

finding: The study referenced a finding related to the SNP rs11122017, where research demonstrated that aberrant protein phosphorylation could be linked to cancerous changes in cells. This SNP was associated with the biochemical characterization of colon cells, particularly in the context of Raman spectroscopy which helped distinguish between normal and cancerous cells based on their vibrational properties.
title: Vitamin C – protective role in oxidative stress conditions induced in human normal colon cells by label free Raman spectroscopy and imaging

finding: The SNP rs12082046 was associated with the gene CTHRC1, which was identified as a pan-cancer matrisome gene that upregulated its expression prominently in multiple cancers, correlating with disease progression and poor survival. CTHRC1's interaction with genes such as POSTN, MMP13, and SFRP4 indicates its role in driving matrisome regulation and collagen organization across cancers.
title: A pan-cancer analysis of matrisome proteins reveals CTHRC1and LOXL2 as major ECM regulators across cancers

finding: The SNP rs6661921, near the gene NEGR1, was associated with major depression (MD) and attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). It was part of a set of eight lead SNPs identified as eQTLs in 13 brain tissue types, and represented a significant finding correlating genetic factors with aspects of psychiatric disorders.
title: Genetic architecture of creativity and extensive genetic overlap with psychiatric disorders revealed from genome-wide association analyses of 241,736 individuals

finding: The SNP rs12030638 was found to correlate with c-MYC expression in colorectal cancer, playing a potential role in resistance to EGFR inhibitors. This study highlighted the importance of c-MYC in maintaining tumor growth, further emphasizing the SNP's significance in CRC treatment resistance.
title: In colon cancer cells, fascin1 functions as a mechanosensor that transforms adherens junction mechanotransduction

finding: Found in a new GWAS published in 2019 with a sample size of 635,000, rs4575098 and its associated gene ADAMTS4 highlighted additional genetic risk factors for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: The SNP rs12061479 was associated with findings related to the oncogenic properties of the EBV ZEBRA protein. In the context of breast cancer breakpoints, it was noted that the presence of EBV-like sequence patterns around these breakpoints related to gene fusion breakpoints in model EBV cancers. This interplay suggested a significant role for EBV in the mechanisms leading to breast cancer, particularly in BRCA mutation carriers who exhibited compromised immune responses.
title: In BRCA1 and BRCA2 breast cancers, chromosome breaks occur near herpes tumor virus sequences

finding: The SNP rs35338958 resided in an intronic region of the KIF26B gene and showed an association with the severity of HO. It had an odds ratio of 3.04 and a p-value of 1.65×10^-6, suggesting a significant role in the clinical manifestations of HO, although it did not achieve genome-wide significance in further analyses.
title: Genome-wide association and functional analyses identify CASC20 and KIF26B as target loci in heterotopic ossification

finding: The genetic variant rs2228145 in the IL6R gene was previously reported to dampen inflammation and was protective against severe depression. This SNP provided significant context linking inflammatory pathways to depressive symptoms.
title: Shared mechanisms between coronary heart disease and depression: findings from a large UK general population-based cohort

finding: The SNP rs12092392 was associated with the sensitivity of triple-negative breast cancer cells to drugs when treatment was aligned with their circadian rhythms. This finding indicated that genetic factors, particularly at this locus, influenced the timing of drug responses, demonstrating a significant impact on treatment strategy effectiveness.
title: Time-of-day effects of cancer drugs revealed by high-throughput deep phenotyping

finding: The SNP rs78025940 was identified with a strong association signal to the reproductive subtype of PCOS. It was located in an intergenic region of 1p36.21 and displayed a genome-wide significance level of P=2.2×10^-10, with an odds ratio of 4.75.
title: Phenotypic clustering reveals distinct subtypes of polycystic ovary syndrome with novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs16850259 was strongly associated with the reproductive subtype of PCOS with a meta-analysis P-value of 2.14×10^-9 and an odds ratio of 5.57. It was genotyped in the first stage of the study.
title: Phenotypic clustering reveals distinct subtypes of polycystic ovary syndrome with novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs12040949 was linked to the role of alternative lengthening of telomeres mechanisms in cancer, as discussed in the context of telomere maintenance and genomic integrity. The study indicated that this SNP could have potential translational and therapeutic implications in cancer related to telomere regulation.
title: CRISPR Cas13-based tools to track and manipulate endogenous telomeric repeat-containing RNAs in living cells

finding: The reQTL rs3108680 corresponding to PRMT6 in the PA experiment was significant and connected to levels of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL).
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs12061558 was identified in the context of glioblastoma (GBM) studies as related to the sensitivity of glioblastoma cancer stem cells (CSCs) to temozolomide (TMZ). The research highlighted that differentiation of these CSCs increased their sensitivity to TMZ, indicating that genetic variants like rs12061558 could influence treatment responses in GBM, potentially through alterations in oncogenic signaling and p53 activity.
title: Impact of genomic background and developmental state on signaling pathways and response to therapy in glioblastoma patient-derived cells

finding: SNP rs60023867 disrupted the regulation of the gene ACTN2 in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex by transcription factors NKX6-1 and NOBOX, which may be relevant to cognitive resilience in AD phenotypes.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs2062 impacted regulation of ACTN2 in the hippocampus, disrupting its regulation by TFs LEF1, SMAD3, and TEAD3, indicating its role in disease progression.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs144105756 affected the regulation of ACTN2 by transcription factors IRF2 and IRF9, linking to its associations with AD outcomes.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs79542980 disrupted FOXF2 regulation of ACTN2 in the lateral temporal lobe, further highlighting the complexity of gene regulation in AD.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs6425995 interrupted NFKB1 regulation of CSF3R in the lateral temporal lobe, indicating its potential involvement in the neuroinflammatory aspects of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: The SNP rs3738476, a synonymous mutation involving a C-to-A change in the CDS region of the PRUNE1 gene, was identified as generating a GGACU sequence de novo. This alteration enabled the site to become m6A modified, which was highlighted as an instance of a gain of m6A modification. Furthermore, the study articulated that m6A-related SNPs, including rs3738476, were correlated with diseases such as colorectal cancer, colorectal carcinoma, and coronary artery diseases.
title: Landscape and regulation of m6A and m6Am methylome across human and mouse tissues

finding: The SNP rs12071882 was identified in a study concerning tumor microenvironmental cells and their modulation of glioma biology. The study demonstrated that variations at this locus influenced the expression of CCR2, which is pivotal in modulating immune responses and consequent glioma progression. The finding underscored the regulatory role of tumor microenvironmental factors, linking this SNP directly to significant biological outcomes relevant to glioma.
title: Gene Function Revealed at the Moment of Stochastic Gene Silencing

finding: The variant rs200607541 in the AGRN gene was found to be predicted deleterious by VEP’s Condel, SIFT, and PolyPhen. This variant was significant as it was related to the severity of Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes (CMS), specifically showing implications on extracellular matrix components.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: Variant rs146309392 in HSPG2 was noted as possibly causative for Dyssegmental dysplasia. Its connection to a severe patient within the CMS cohort highlighted its role in neuromuscular dysfunction.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: The SNP rs6594028, found in the mitochondrial pseudogene MTND1P23, was prevalent in African populations (approximately 50%). This SNP allowed for perfect alignment of MT-ND1 reads and was shown to influence misalignment issues in individuals with the G allele, particularly among Black individuals, highlighting significant population-specific impacts on gene expression in the GTEx dataset.
title: Patterns of unwanted biological and technical expression variation across 49 human tissues

finding: The SNP rs3010126 was associated with melanoma metastasis as discussed in the context of its relevance in the inflammatory responses observed in the sentinel lymph node. The research highlighted the role of IL-1alpha and its signaling pathways, particularly STAT3, which were influenced by genetic variations represented by this SNP. It was part of findings relating to understanding how certain genetic traits could modulate the response to treatment and the progression of metastatic disease.
title: IL-1α secreted by subcapsular sinus macrophages promotes melanoma metastasis in the sentinel lymph node by upregulating STAT3 signaling in the tumor

finding: Evidence indicated that rs147176673 downregulated PTPN7 expression in whole blood and various immune cell isolates, suggesting a significant role in hematopoietic regulation.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The variant significantly upregulated GFI1 and EVI5, while also inducing a differential transcript usage impacting processed transcripts of EVI5.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The SNP rs12092626 was found to be linked to myeloid-derived suppressor cells (MDSCs) in cancer immunotherapy settings. It highlighted that variations at this locus were connected to the regulation of immunosuppressive mechanisms that could impact anti-tumor immunity, particularly in the context of targeting MDSCs.
title: Intratumoral CXCL12 Gradients Contextualize Tumor Cell Invasion, Migration and Immune Suppression in Breast Cancer

finding: The SNP rs7512462 in the SLC26A9 gene was identified as correlating with the extent of CFTR function rescue by VX-809 and VX-770 in human nasal epithelial cells from F508del/F508del cystic fibrosis patients. This correlation indicated that variants at this locus may influence the effectiveness of CFTR modulators.
title: Robust W1282X-CFTR rescue by a small molecule GSPT1 degrader

finding: The variant GBA N370S/N409S (rs76763715) was also analyzed in relation to urine BMP levels, with results supporting its influence alongside LRRK2 mutations in the context of lysosomal dysfunction in PD. It was part of sensitivity analyses conducted on a large sample set.
title: LRRK2 Kinase Activity Regulates Parkinson’s Disease-Relevant Lipids at the Lysosome

finding: The SNP rs1175550 was identified as predicted causative and intersected a cis-regulatory element in the SMIM1 locus. This regulatory element was associated with open chromatin only present in megakaryocytic-erythroid progenitors and early/intermediate erythroid precursors, indicating a significant role in red blood cell traits.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The rs35672330 SNP was associated with the L151P mutation in the EXO5 gene, which caused a significant loss of EXO5 nuclease activity and impaired nuclear localization. Analysis of TCGA data further revealed that cancer patients carrying the rs35672330 variant exhibited increased genomic instability and worse prognosis across multiple cancer types, supporting its role in cancer predisposition.
title: A common haplotype in the EXO5 gene can impact its protein structure and dynamics and modulate genome stability and cancer progression

finding: The rs2651899 variant was associated with an increased risk of migraine without aura in the North Indian population. This SNP was identified as a relevant risk factor, suggesting its role in the genetic predisposition to migraines.
title: The neurotrophin artemin and its receptor GFRα3 mediate migraine-like pain via the ion channel TRPM8

finding: The study highlighted that SNP rs7512462 in the SLC26A9 gene was linked to the extent of functional rescue of F508del-CFTR in cystic fibrosis patients. This correlation was significant in patients with F508del/F508del genotypes, indicating that this SNP could be a critical factor in managing chloride transport via SLC26A9, making it a relevant target for therapeutic strategies aimed at restoring ion transport in affected epithelial cells.
title: Elevator motion of chloride ion transporter SLC26A9 induced by STAS domain

finding: The SNP rs599839 was associated with cardiovascular diseases and was found to interact with the gene PSMA5 in immune cell lines. Predicted interactions showed high contact counts and were supported by one-dimensional signals like DNase I and H3k4me3, highlighting its regulatory role in immune responses.
title: Leveraging epigenomes and three-dimensional genome organization for interpreting regulatory variation

finding: The SNP rs1398148 at 1q32 was involved in cancer risk, mapping to the PIK3C2B locus and showing linkage disequilibrium with known risk variants associated with cancer. This finding emphasized the locus's role in modulating onogenic pathways.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: Temporal analysis of rs6603791 indicated a decrease in allele frequency from 0.71 to 0.47, supporting its classification as a Time Informative Marker for identifying ancient populations.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: The SNP rs800292, known as FH V62I, was reported as a protective polymorphism. Individuals carrying the variant I62 were found to be less prone to developing complement-dysregulation diseases such as age-related macular degeneration (AMD), atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS), C3 glomerulopathies (C3G), and dengue hemorrhagic fever. Moreover, it was demonstrated that the FH I62 variant exhibited increased binding affinity for C3b and enhanced cofactor activity, further indicating its protective role.
title: The synthetic protein MFHR13 as efficient multitarget regulator against complement over-activation

finding: The SNP rs1134586 in EXO5 marginally passed exome-wide significance (p=4.82e-07), linking it to the regulatory pathways of AD.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs12129705 SNP located in the PHGDH gene was significantly associated with increased appendicular lean mass at a genome-wide significance level (p=1.2e-14, beta=0.0221) in the UK Biobank cohort. This finding indicated its potential role in regulating muscle mass.
title: Skeletal muscle hypertrophy rewires glucose metabolism: an experimental investigation and systematic review

finding: The minor "C" variant of rs10913469 in the intron of SEC16B was found to be more prevalent in adults and children with obesity and higher BMI across various populations including Asia, Mexico, and several European countries. This suggests a strong association between this SNP and obesity phenotypes.
title: Intestinal SEC16B modulates obesity by controlling dietary lipid absorption

finding: The intergenic "G" variant of rs543874 was associated with an increased rate of obesity and body fat percentage in African American, East Asian, and European descent. This association highlights the potential impact of this SNP on body weight and fat mass.
title: Intestinal SEC16B modulates obesity by controlling dietary lipid absorption

finding: The SNP rs199722070 was associated with the creation of a target site in the miRNA seed for hsa-miR-488-5p, indicated by conservation scores of 9 and 7. This finding suggests its potential role in modifying the regulatory mechanisms of CCR5 expression through miRNA interaction.
title: In silico analysis of single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) in human C-C chemokine receptor type five (CCR5) gene

finding: The SNP rs942439 was involved in a study that examined its relationship with gene expression and hippocampal volume in Alzheimer's disease. The analysis revealed that the SEC14L2 gene expression was negatively associated with hippocampal volume specifically in the AA genotype subgroup at this SNP locus. Moreover, this correlation was observed to be opposite in the GA genotype subgroup. Overall, this SNP demonstrated significant findings, with a hypergeometric enrichment p-value of 0.024 linked with gene expressions related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Integrating Transcriptomics, Genomics, and Imaging in Alzheimer’s Disease: A Federated Model

finding: The variant rs823118 was associated with a larger effect size in the analysis, as it harbored the RAB7L1 gene, which is an interactor with LRRK2. This connection was highlighted as a potential influence on the penetrance of PD among carriers.
title: Penetrance of Parkinson’s disease in LRRK2 p.G2019S carriers is modified by a polygenic risk score

finding: The SNP rs4524 corresponded to a K>R substitution in the Factor V (F5) protein, which was identified as pQTLs when using the PAV-inclusive library. This indicated the necessity to consider isoform expression levels separately and reinforced the significance of including protein altering variants in protein quantification.
title: Nanoparticle Enrichment Mass-Spectrometry Proteomics Identifies Protein Altering Variants for Precise pQTL Mapping

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with the enhanced epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition in breast cancer tissues and cell lines. The study indicated that Pannexin 1 played a significant role in the biology of breast cancer, linking it to increased aggressive properties of the disease.
title: Novel Pannexin 1 isoform is increased in cancer

finding: The SNP rs66495454 was associated with decreased prudent eating and located at chr1:72748567 in the promoter of NEGR1, indicating its role in dietary habits and previously linked to cognitive ability.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: The SNP rs296547 demonstrated pleiotropic effects, influencing risk for both celiac disease and schizophrenia. It acted as an mQTL for C1orf106, but no further consistent associations were observed across other traits and molecular phenotypes.
title: Cross-disorder analysis of schizophrenia and 19 immune diseases reveals genetic correlation

finding: The SNP rs12071791 was discussed in relation to immune response in colon cancer patients. The study provided evidence that this SNP affects immune cell infiltration in tumors, suggesting implications for immunotherapy approaches tailored to specific genetic backgrounds.
title: Identification of cuproptosis and ferroptosis-related subtypes and development of a prognostic signature in colon cancer

finding: The study found that the 'A' allele of the omentin SNP rs2274907 was significantly associated with lower adiponectin concentrations, even after adjusting for confounders such as age, sex, body mass index, waist circumference, and cardiometabolic health status. This association was highly significant (p=1.90 x 10<sup>-47</sup>). Additionally, carriers of the 'A' allele exhibited a 1.35 times increased risk of being cardiometabolically unhealthy compared to TT homozygotes before adjusting for adiponectin concentrations, highlighting a potential genetic risk for cardiometabolic diseases in this population.
