title: Circulating adiponectin mediates the association between omentin gene polymorphism and cardiometabolic health in Asian Indians

finding: The study by Zhu et al. suggested that SNP rs12030603 was associated with cancer prognosis, linking it to the ability of glioblastoma patients to respond to therapies. This finding related specifically to the application of deep learning models in predicting cancer outcomes.
title: How to use transcriptomic data for game-theoretic modeling of treatment-induced resistance in cancer cells? A case study in patient-derived glioblastoma organoids

finding: The SNP rs12071765 was associated with the CCR5-CCL5 axis, which plays a significant role in cancer progression. The study highlighted the upregulation of CCR5 by cancer cells, suggesting that this locus could influence tumor microenvironment formation and contribute to pro-tumorigenic features such as drug-resistance and metastasis.
title: Super-resolved imaging deciphers ligand dependent membrane behaviour of the onco-immunogenic CCR5 receptor

finding: The SNP rs12071751 was associated with protective effects against UVB-mediated cutaneous damages and skin tumorigenesis. This finding was particularly relevant in studies involving topical formulations like GZ21T, which aimed to inhibit the growth of AKs and prevent their progression to cSCC, highlighting the importance of dietary factors on skin health.
title: Topical GZ21T inhibits the growth of actinic keratoses in a UVB induced model of skin carcinogenesis

finding: For EGLN1, the rs1435166/G allele resulted in a significant decrease in mRNA expression in Sherpa highlanders, measured at 38.1% of the corresponding levels in non-Sherpa lowlanders, reflecting adaptations associated with hypoxia tolerance.
title: Downregulations of mRNA expressions in the EPAS1 and EGLN1: Unraveling a genetic mechanism for high-altitude hypoxia adaptation in Sherpa highlanders

finding: The rs2153364/A allele resulted in mRNA expression levels of EGLN1 in Sherpa highlanders being only 14.2% of those seen in non-Sherpa lowlanders, suggesting its role in downregulating EGLN1 expression in response to high-altitude conditions.
title: Downregulations of mRNA expressions in the EPAS1 and EGLN1: Unraveling a genetic mechanism for high-altitude hypoxia adaptation in Sherpa highlanders

finding: The SNP rs147247472 located in the AGBL4 gene was found to be genome-wide significant (P=4.30×10^-8) and was linked to addiction related behaviors in the context of heroin and methamphetamine dependence, but it necessitated further exploration due to low minor allele frequency (MAF). It successfully replicated findings in the independent cohort.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies common genetic risk factors for alcohol, heroin and methamphetamine dependence

finding: rs6678914 showed weak associations with luminal A-like disease, with an OR of 0.93 and a p-value of 1.07×10^-4, and was indicated to have opposite associations between luminal A-like and TN disease.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: This SNP demonstrated associations with HER2 status and was affiliated with risk across all subtypes.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: This SNP was highlighted as strongly associated with TN status and was part of variants with high evidence for HR-negative associations.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Associated with luminal subtypes and offered details regarding grade consequences.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: This SNP demonstrated significant associations with high-grade tumors.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: This SNP was associated with lingual SA (P-value of 1.9 x 10^-11 and replicated as 3.0 x 10^-11) and suggested involvement in Wnt signaling pathways via its eQTL connections.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: This SNP was associated with inferior parietal SA (P-value of 1.6 x 10^-10 and replicated with 3.1 x 10^-14) and acted as an eQTL for LMO4, a gene critical in brain areal identity specification.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: The study highlighted that individuals with the GG genotype of SNP rs1800896 secreted smaller amounts of TNF-α compared to those carrying the AA or GA genotypes after infection with A. fumigatus. This finding was consistent with the notion that GG homozygotes generate fewer inflammatory responses, correlating to an anti-inflammatory microenvironment. The dichotomy between IL-10 and TNF-α production according to genotypes was confirmed in human macrophages, showcasing an extended impact on pro-inflammatory cytokines.
title: Paracoccin overexpression in Paracoccidioides brasiliensis reveals the influence of chitin hydrolysis on fungal virulence and host immune response

finding: The SNP rs10927806 was significantly associated with the salivary metabolite 4-guanidinobutanoate. This metabolite, along with beta-guanidinopropanoate, is generated through the polyamine synthesis pathway, underlining a novel saliva-specific locus-metabolite relationship linked to the AGMAT locus.
title: Genome-wide scan identifies novel genetic loci regulating salivary metabolite levels

finding: The SNP rs6690813 exhibited significant association with the salivary metabolite beta-guanidinopropanoate. It was found in high linkage disequilibrium (r²=0.99) with rs10927806, indicating shared genetic regulation over metabolites generated in the polyamine synthesis pathway from the AGMAT locus.
title: Genome-wide scan identifies novel genetic loci regulating salivary metabolite levels

finding: SNP rs12123563 was explored in the context of immune regulation and cancer progression related to extracellular vesicles, as supported by Mittal et al. (2020). This finding emphasized the regulatory role of these vesicles and their SNP-related mechanisms in glioma.
title: SMPD3 suppresses IDH mutant tumor growth via dual autocrine-paracrine roles

finding: The rs2814778 SNP in the ACKR1 promoter was identified as the cause of erythrocyte-specific ACKR1 deficiency in humans, which interfered with the binding of the erythroid-specific transcription factor GATA-1. This deficiency was found to be fixed in sub-Saharan African populations, likely under selective pressure from malaria infection, as the parasite Plasmodium vivax utilizes ACKR1 as an entry factor. The implications of this deficiency were linked to low COVID-19 mortality rates observed in these populations, suggesting that ACKR1 may influence the severity of the disease. The findings highlighted that while ACKR1 deficiency in erythrocytes was well established, ongoing investigations sought to clarify the role of endothelial cell ACKR1 deficiency in relation to viral load and mortality.
title: Atypical Chemokine Receptor 1 (Ackr1)-deficient Mice Resist Lethal SARS-CoV-2 Challenge

finding: The variant rs1175550, an intronic variant of SMIM1, was identified as a high-confidence variant related to red blood cell traits, validated by findings from the UK Biobank.
title: Improved genetic discovery and fine-mapping resolution through multivariate latent factor analysis of high-dimensional traits

finding: The variant rs841572 was identified as closely linked to fasting glucose (FG) and showed a strong association in the analyses, indicating its importance in glycaemic regulation.
title: The Trans-Ancestral Genomic Architecture of Glycaemic Traits

finding: The variant rs841576 was the lead eQTL variant associated with the expression of SLC2A1, thereby having implications for glucose entry into the brain and affecting plasma glucose levels, illustrating its relevance in glycaemic traits.
title: The Trans-Ancestral Genomic Architecture of Glycaemic Traits

finding: The minor allele of the TLR5 SNP rs5744168 was associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) in human patients. The discovery analysis indicated a significant dominant association with an Odds Ratio (OR) of 1.60 (p = 0.04), while the validation cohort showed a significant additive association with an OR of 1.31 (p = 0.01). Overall, the meta-analysis confirmed a significant additive association of OR = 1.28 (p = 0.009) and a dominant model OR = 1.29 (p = 0.01), suggesting that TLR5 deficiency conferred increased susceptibility to IPF.
title: Toll-Like-Receptor 5 protects against pulmonary fibrosis by reducing lung dysbiosis

finding: The SNP rs11122017 was originally associated with aberrant protein phosphorylation in cancer, providing insights into potential cancer biomarkers that could be used in oncological diagnostics. This connection was highlighted in a study by Abramczyk et al., published in Cancers (Basel) in 2019, emphasizing its relevance in cancer research.
title: Biochemistry and nanomechanical properties of human colon cells upon simvastatin, lovastatin and mevastatin supplementations – Raman imaging and AFM studies

finding: The rs3766325 variant associated with enlargement of epithelial cell nuclei in the esophagus mucosa was linked to post-injury regeneration. Gene expression analysis identified 30 genes related to this variant, with some upregulated genes enhancing cell proliferation and others inhibiting it.
title: HistoGWAS: An AI-enabled Framework for Automated Genetic Analysis of Tissue Phenotypes in Histology Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs12030731 was linked to the expression of proteoglycans (PGs) in lung adenocarcinoma tissues. Its presence correlated strongly with an invasive phenotype and poor prognosis in patients, suggesting that this SNP may have implications for the effectiveness of tyrosine kinase inhibitors as highlighted by Pottier et al. in their investigation of targeted therapies.
title: Extracellular matrix sulfation in the tumor microenvironment stimulates cancer stemness and invasiveness

finding: The stop-gain variant c.433C>T; p.Arg145Ter (rs766588568) in the ZMYND12 gene was identified as a homozygous variant in four unrelated male patients with asthenoteratozoospermia, leading to severe sperm flagellum malformations and primary male infertility. This variant, confirmed through Sanger sequencing, affects axonemal localization of critical proteins and is associated with a minor allele frequency of 3.391e-05 in the Genome Aggregation Database.
title: Novel axonemal protein ZMYND12 interacts with TTC29 and DNAH1, and is required for male fertility and flagellum function

finding: The SNP rs4951250 was identified as significantly discordant across different genotype discovery approaches. The findings indicated a very strong discordance with a P-value of less than 1x10^-16 when comparing genome versus exome data, and a P-value of 4x10^-5 when comparing genome versus array data. This suggests that the genotype calls for this variant differ sharply depending on the technology used, highlighting the importance of caution when interpreting results from datasets like gnomAD and All of Us.
title: Discordant calls across genotype discovery approaches elucidate variants with systematic errors

finding: The SNP showed high causality in configurations for height and was directed toward a validation in the study.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The SNP rs11209026, also referred to as R381Q in the IL-23R gene, was identified as having a protective role in immune-mediated diseases. This finding indicated that the polymorphism could influence the differentiation and function of Th17 cells, possibly impacting their regulatory roles in autoinflammatory conditions.
title: RORα enforces stability of the T-helper-17 cell effector program

finding: The rs1801133 polymorphism on the MTHFR gene was linked to maternal folic acid intake during gestation. This indicated that the environmental factor of maternal nutrition might influence the risk for ASD in individuals with specific genetic variants.
title: A role for gene-environment interactions in Autism Spectrum Disorder is suggested by variants in genes regulating exposure to environmental factors

finding: The study identified rs12568930 as an IBD susceptibility locus located at Chromosome 1:22,375,738. The findings indicated that this SNP was associated with the expression levels of C1Q transcripts, suggesting that C1q may play a significant role in IBD susceptibility.
title: The association between transcriptional regulation of macrophage differentiation and activation and genetic susceptibility to inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The SNP rs12061411 was implicated in the transcriptional regulation of profibrotic gene programs. The study indicated that increased activity of transcription factors such as AP-1, RUNX, and EGR in association with this SNP contributed to the activation of genes relevant to fibrotic processes in macrophages, notably those involved in systemic sclerosis-associated interstitial lung disease (SSc-ILD). This finding highlighted the role of specific transcriptional regulation mechanisms that could influence the development and severity of pulmonary fibrosis.
title: Altered AP-1, RUNX and EGR chromatin dynamics drive fibrotic lung disease

finding: The TNFSF4 polymorphism rs3861950 was linked to susceptibility to coronary artery disease, establishing a relationship between inflammation, metabolic disorders, and potential implications in GDM.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The rs1234313 A > G polymorphism of TNFSF4 was shown to influence susceptibility to coronary artery disease, highlighting potential inflammatory pathways relevant in the context of GDM.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The IL6R gene polymorphism rs2228145 was associated with increased levels of VCAM1 and ICAM1, suggesting a role in inflammation that could relate to the pathophysiology of GDM.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs1764391 was confirmed to have a significant association with the susceptibility to myocardial infarction (MI) in the Guangxi Han Chinese population, elucidating its role in genetic predisposition to this condition.
title: In-silico analysis of Myocardial Infarction-related missense SNPs to identify novel biomarkers to predict susceptibility

finding: The GG genotype of rs3480 was found to be associated with significantly elevated levels of Troponin I and triglycerides, which correlated with an increased risk of myocardial infarction (MI).
title: In-silico analysis of Myocardial Infarction-related missense SNPs to identify novel biomarkers to predict susceptibility

finding: Carriers of the GA genotype for rs726344 displayed significantly increased levels of CKMB, total cholesterol, LDLc, HDLc, Troponin I, and triglycerides, thereby heightening the associated risk of myocardial infarction (MI).
title: In-silico analysis of Myocardial Infarction-related missense SNPs to identify novel biomarkers to predict susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs12061044 was identified in the context of analyzing tree species distribution and climate change impacts. It related specifically to the bio-climatic study on global tree diversity, particularly how certain SNP variations could influence tree species' resilience to changing environmental conditions as indicated by the TreeGOER database.
title: TreeGOER: a database with globally observed environmental ranges for 48,129 tree species

finding: This stop gain variant in PCSK9 demonstrated a significant impact on lowering non-HDL cholesterol by 0.92 standard deviations and had a frequency of 0.93% in the XAF cohort.
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: This rare variant near the centromere of chromosome 1 was associated with lower uric acid levels and decreased risk of gout, with an impressive effect of -0.43 standard deviations.
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: The SNP rs12092400 also had a positive original finding that demonstrated its involvement in targeting mitochondrial complexes and Bcl-2 to show antileukemic activity against AML cells reliant on oxidative phosphorylation. This suggested potential therapeutic implications for manipulating this SNP in treatment regimens.
title: Acute myeloid leukemia mitochondria hydrolyze ATP to resist chemotherapy

finding: The SNP rs10900588, which was associated with malaria resistance, showed a notable high frequency of the G allele among Nilotic populations, specifically the Anuak and Gumuz of South Sudan. The G allele frequency was substantially higher in these populations compared to other ethnic groups in the Horn of Africa. Additionally, the G allele was found in relatively higher frequencies in the South Omotic populations, indicating a potential adaptive response to malaria. The presence of this allele in the Yoruba population suggested a significant association with malaria resistance, correlating with previous findings in East African Nilotics. This SNP was identified as indicative of natural selection related to malaria resistance.
title: The genetic and linguistic structures of Abyssinians and their neighbor reveal the historical demographic dynamics and environmental adaptation in the African Horn region

finding: The SNP rs2274910-C was associated with an increased risk of Crohn's disease in an early genome-wide association study (GWAS). Additional studies identified further variants in and around the ITLN1 gene linked to both Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis, suggesting a significant role for ITLN1 in the innate immune response in the gut.
title: Extensive variation in the mouse intelectin gene family: recent duplications, deletions and inactivating variants result in diversity in laboratory strains

finding: The SNP rs12061377 was associated with a clinical-grade peptide-based inhibition of CK2, which was reported to block viability and proliferation of T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (T-ALL) cells. This finding indicated the potential of targeting CK2 for therapeutic applications in both cancer and viral infections, contributing to the understanding of the molecular mechanisms underlying CK2's role in cellular processes.
title: Targeting of Protein Kinase CK2 Elicits Antiviral Activity on Bovine Coronavirus Infection

finding: The rs77272443 SNP was related to myopia and identified through both HiChIP and eQTL data, which refined its target gene predictions.
title: Single-cell multiome of the human retina and deep learning nominate causal variants in complex eye diseases

finding: The ZYG11A rs74227999 variant was negatively associated with age specifically in females, with a meta-analysis showing a p-value of 8.82×10^-10 and a beta of -14.62 years. This SNP represents the top replicable signal in the sex-stratified analysis.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: SNP rs143614333, a missense variant located in the CR2 gene, was found to have a CADD score of 23.6. It was included in ClinVar with three submitters noting its uncertain clinical significance.
title: An integrated personal and population-based Egyptian genome reference

finding: SNP rs2145402 mapped to gene LYST, which was noted for its abnormal distribution in the population studied, suggesting a connection to genetic diseases. The expected pattern 'AA' at this SNP was found absent, with a very low probability of occurring by chance.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: SNP rs4915931 was associated with gene ROR1, which was reported to be related to fatal genetic childhood diseases.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: SNP rs4660992 corresponded to gene BMP8B, known to play significant roles in embryonic development and associated with various diseases.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: At the 1q32/IRF6 locus, rs11119348 was found to be associated with lower levels of IRF6 expression when homozygous for the risk-associated alleles (AA genotype) compared to the non-risk genotype (CC). This allele favored the binding of the transcriptional repressor FOXE1, thus reducing IRF6 expression. The SNP was part of a conservation sequence located 10 kb upstream of the IRF6 gene, enhancing its significance in orofacial clefts (OFC).
title: Two non-coding variants associated with isolated orofacial cleft promote binding of transcriptional repressors FOXE1 or ETS2 and reduce expression of IRF6

finding: Similarly, rs661849 at the 1q32/IRF6 locus was shown to reduce IRF6 expression in cells engineered to have the risk (CC) versus non-risk (TT) genotype. This SNP was found to preferentially bind the transcriptional repressor ETS2, impacting IRF6 levels. It resided 22 kb upstream of the IRF6 promoter and was implicated in the majority of risk for OFCs associated with variation at the IRF6 locus.
title: Two non-coding variants associated with isolated orofacial cleft promote binding of transcriptional repressors FOXE1 or ETS2 and reduce expression of IRF6

finding: The SNP rs12123586 was associated with immunomodulatory effects related to IL-2 and IL-15, which were implicated in cancer immunotherapy. This finding emphasized the importance of this SNP in relation to immune system functionality, particularly in the context of inflammatory responses and their potential implications for age-associated diseases.
title: Small immunological clocks identified by Deep Learning and Gradient Boosting

finding: The SNP rs12082094 was associated with the regulation of TIF1 proteins involved in genome stability and cancer. This finding related to the implications of the Hippo pathway in developmental processes and cell fate decisions, particularly in the context of the Drosophila eye development.
title: Hippo pathway and Bonus control developmental cell fate decisions in the Drosophila eye

finding: The study identified a significant association with the phenotype "morning/evening person" (UK Biobank Field ID: 1180) using the nonsynonymous SNP rs139315125 (MAF: 0.47%, p value: 5.3E-21). This SNP is located in the gene PER3, which is a core component of the circadian clock, and the results suggested that subjects who tend to sleep and wake up early possess a higher frequency of the minor allele G.
title: Efficient mixed model approach for large-scale genome-wide association studies of ordinal categorical phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12040843 was associated with a distinct module of microRNA expression patterns in colorectal cancer (CRC), specifically linked to the aberrant upregulation of miR-24-3p. This SNP played a role in driving inter-tumor heterogeneity by influencing gene regulatory mechanisms, which were also shown to correlate with CRC cell survival in different contexts. Overall, this finding offered insight into the potential therapeutic targets within microRNAs for precision medicine in CRC.
title: Genome edited colorectal cancer organoid models reveal distinct microRNA activity patterns across different mutation profiles

finding: The SNP rs12071910 was identified as a significant genetic variant in the study of integrin signaling pathways, which are known to play critical roles in various cellular processes including migration and differentiation of leukocytes, particularly neutrophils. This finding was part of a broader investigation into how integrin crosstalk contributes to cell fate in cancer cells, highlighting the relevance of this SNP in immunological and cancer-related contexts.
title: Cell migration CRISPRi screens in human neutrophils reveal regulators of context-dependent migration and differentiation state

finding: The SNP rs12123788 emerged from the analysis of metabolic regulation involving epigenetic modifications that affect cell differentiation. The research underscored its importance in the context of cancer cell behavior and differentiation dynamics, particularly how metabolic signals orchestrate genetic and epigenetic factors influencing neutrophil development and function.
title: Cell migration CRISPRi screens in human neutrophils reveal regulators of context-dependent migration and differentiation state

finding: The SNP rs519989 was associated with allelic imbalance affecting promoter-enhancer connectivity. It was linked to PU.1 binding, histone modifications, and expression of the gene LRRC8C, which encodes a channel subunit and is important during neutrophil differentiation.
title: Variation in PU.1 binding and chromatin looping at neutrophil enhancers influences autoimmune disease susceptibility

finding: The study identified the SNP rs10873679 on chromosome 1 as significantly associated with intracellular replication of Salmonella Typhi, demonstrating a p-value of 6 x 10^-9. The C-allele of this SNP was linked to increased replication of S. Typhi in lymphoblastoid cell lines, which also correlated with reduced expression of the MCOLN2 gene, a member of the mucolipin family that regulates divalent cation transport. This association suggested that MCOLN2 acts as a restriction factor for S. Typhi, indicating its role in nutritional immunity.
title: Human variation impacting MCOLN2 restricts Salmonella Typhi replication by magnesium deprivation

finding: This SNP was part of a significant association with CSF YKL-40 levels and represented some of the strongest evidence observed in the study, implicating CHI3L1 as a candidate gene for YKL-40.
title: TMEM106B and CPOX are genetic determinants of cerebrospinal fluid Alzheimer’s disease biomarker levels

finding: Along with rs7551263, this SNP contributed to the genome-wide significant signal with CSF YKL-40 levels and supported the notion of a cis-pQTL for the CHI3L1 gene.
title: TMEM106B and CPOX are genetic determinants of cerebrospinal fluid Alzheimer’s disease biomarker levels

finding: This SNP demonstrated the single most significant GWAS signal for CSF YKL-40 levels and served as a cis pQTL for CHI3L1, showing significant eQTL interactions across multiple tissues.
title: TMEM106B and CPOX are genetic determinants of cerebrospinal fluid Alzheimer’s disease biomarker levels

finding: The SNP rs1050501, which results in the I232T substitution in the transmembrane domain of FcγRIIB, was positively associated with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) in individuals carrying the homozygous FcγRIIB-I232T variant. This association was established through extensive epidemiological studies that linked the presence of the I232T variant to clinical manifestations of SLE.
title: FcγRIIB I232T polymorphic change allosterically suppresses ligand binding

finding: The SNP rs12082287 was identified in the context of fascin inhibitors, which were reported to decrease the growth of specific subtypes of cancers. This finding related to fascin's role in pro-metastatic behaviors and cancer progression.
title: The Actin Bundling Protein Fascin Promotes Lung Cancer Growth and Metastasis by Enhancing Glycolysis and PFKFB3 Expression

finding: The DNM3 rs2421947 SNP was associated with age-at-onset (AAO) of Parkinson's disease (PD) in a meta-analysis involving LRRK2 p.G2019S carriers. Specifically, the analysis indicated a hazard ratio (HR) of 1.14 (95% CI, 1.02-1.27, p=0.025), suggesting that the G allele was correlated with an earlier onset of PD.
title: Analysis of DNM3 and VAMP4 as genetic modifiers of LRRK2 Parkinson’s disease

finding: This SNP was noted for having a high CADD score, indicating a probable deleterious variant effect, and was associated with several brain-related tissues through eQTL mapping.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: It was included among the SNPs that had significant associations with brain volumetric imaging phenotypes and marked with potential deleterious effects.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12082109 was identified in the context of its association with biomarkers and micro-RNAs relevant to bone metastases in cancer. This finding contributed to the understanding of the mechanisms involved in cancer metastasis, particularly in relation to breast cancer progression and organ-specific metastasis.
title: Transcriptome analysis of heterogeneity in mouse model of metastatic breast cancer

finding: The finding indicated that rs2013162 in the IRF6 gene had a significant interaction with methylation levels in gene regions. This interaction was significant in both case and control datasets, pointing to a potential link to orofacial clefts (OFC). However, the biological relevance of this interaction was uncertain given that methylation was assessed in cord blood, rather than the tissue of concern.
title: Gene-methylation interactions: Discovering region-wise DNA methylation levels that modify SNP-associated disease risk

finding: Significant interactions were found between rs560426 in the ABCA4 gene and the methylation levels of surrounding CpGs in both the CL/P and CLO datasets. The risk associated with the G-allele increased under high methylation levels, highlighting the importance of considering methylation in risk assessments for conditions like CLO.
title: Gene-methylation interactions: Discovering region-wise DNA methylation levels that modify SNP-associated disease risk

finding: The SNP rs12123787 was associated with the identification of potential serum protein biomarkers for pancreatic cancer cachexia. This finding highlighted its relevance in cancer research, particularly in understanding pathways linked to the disease.
title: PRSS2 promotes tumor growth and progression by repressing Tsp-1 in the tumor microenvironment via binding to LRP1

finding: The rs11591147 variant was specifically associated with lower VLDL-C levels. Additionally, the wGRS which included this SNP was significantly associated with reduced LDL-C and apoB levels (p<0.001). Per a 1 mmol/L reduction in LDL-C, carriers of this variant exhibited lower odds of coronary artery disease (CAD) with an odds ratio of 0.76 (95% CI 0.70-0.82, p<0.001) and lower odds of calcific aortic valve stenosis (CAVS) with an odds ratio of 0.55 (95% CI 0.39-0.77, p<0.001). This underscores the potential beneficial impact of the rs11591147 SNP on lipid levels and the associated cardiovascular risks.
title: Genetic inhibition of PCSK9, atherogenic lipoprotein concentrations, and calcific aortic valve stenosis

finding: In the context of the study investigating beta HPV8 E6, it was found that the SNP rs12092356 was associated with significant increases in genomic variations, including over 15-fold increases in mutations and over 20-fold increases in deletions related to double strand break (DSB) repair mechanisms. This finding supported the assertion that beta HPV8 E6 enhances genomic instability by altering the normal repair pathways of DSBs, allowing both NHEJ and HR to occur at the same lesion which is usually not the case.
title: Beta human papillomavirus 8 E6 allows colocalization of non-homologous end joining and homologous recombination repair factors

finding: The SNP rs12071811 was linked with the HER2-positive breast cancer cell lines studied by Kuroiwa et al. (2020). Their research indicated that this genetic variant contributed to the proliferation classification of these cells, thus implicating its relevance in HER2-positive breast cancer progression.
title: HOXB7 induces STAT3-mediated transformation and lung metastasis in an immortalized mammary gland NMuMG cells

finding: The SNP rs2476601 located in the PTPN22 gene was associated with juvenile idiopathic arthritis specifically in females, suggesting a gender-specific role of this allele in autoimmune diseases. This finding aligned with the understanding that variants of PTPN22 can potentiate autoimmunity, thereby contributing to the disease pathogenesis.
title: Autoimmunity associated allele of tyrosine phosphatase gene PTPN22 enhances anti-viral immunity

finding: In strong linkage disequilibrium with GWAS peak SNPs associated with celiac disease and rheumatoid arthritis, rs840015 disrupted TF binding motifs and was associated with lymphocyte variability, implicating it in the transcriptional regulation of immune responses.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: This SNP was identified as a significant hit affecting blood lipid levels, metabolic syndrome, and coronary heart disease risk in admixed populations. It had a p-value of 3.46×10^-8 and was found only on the African background, indicating its specificity in the context of local ancestry. Additionally, this locus was determined to be the causal variant affecting LDL-C in a multi-ethnic fine-mapping study.
title: Tractor: A framework allowing for improved inclusion of admixed individuals in large-scale association studies

finding: The SNP rs12082249 was associated with advanced thyroid cancer and potentially influenced the resistance of cancer stem cells to kinase inhibitors. This signifies its relevance in the context of thyroid cancer and the therapeutic challenges faced in treating such aggressive malignancies.
title: Inhibition of Glycogen Metabolism Induces Reactive Oxygen Species-Dependent Apoptosis in Anaplastic Thyroid Cancer

finding: The SNP rs11360 was classified with low pleiotropy despite being linked to stroke.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: The variant rs370370301, a non-coding and rare variant at the CRP locus, was found to be significant in the analysis with a p-value of 1.4×10^-11, contrasting with its previous p-value of 5.0×10^-6. This new finding was made in a study involving 38,465 participants.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The SNP rs77832441 at the CRP locus was part of a gene-centric set of missense rare variants associated with CRP levels, yielding a p-value of 3.6×10^-22. It was also associated with CRP at individual variant level with a p-value of 7.8×10^-16.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The variant rs3917677 was among the distinct signals recognized in the SELP locus, indicating its relevance to E-selectin variance.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Both conditionally significant rs3917825 and rs3917677 represented meaningful findings at the SELP locus with implications for E-selectin.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The synonymous variant rs6128 at the SELP locus associated with platelet physiology, suggesting its functional impact despite its lack of prior documentation in the GWAS catalog.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The variant rs61812598 was identified as significantly associated with IL-6, illustrating its probable role in inflammation.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: A new signal at rs568587329 was delineated, further characterizing the genetic landscape of the IL-6 response.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The variant rs3917422 was included among significant findings specific to E-selectin associated with African ancestry populations.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The SNP rs11265259 was previously documented in relation to CRP, affirming its genetic contribution to inflammation.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The final variant, rs181704186, was recognized as associated with CRP, adding to the understanding of inflammatory signaling mechanisms.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The trans-acting SNP rs3014874 located on chromosome 1 exhibited a suggestive association with EN-RAGE protein, with a much stronger P = 1.64 × 10^-29 in the SCALLOP consortium data, indicating its role in regulating multiple cis-genes.
title: Integration of Candida albicans-induced single-cell gene expression data and circulatory protein concentrations reveal genetic regulators of inflammation

finding: The SNP rs11161862, which was mentioned in the context of the study on predicting dengue incidence, demonstrated a positive association with dengue risk prediction in Brazil when using heterogeneous data sources. The research emphasized that this SNP contributed to the understanding of the epidemiological modeling necessary to forecast infectious diseases like dengue, highlighting its relevance in assessing predictive models.
title: Unlocking the Predictive Power of Heterogeneous Data to Build an Operational Dengue Forecasting System

finding: SNP rs646776 was found to be a strong trans-pQTL associated with progranulin (PGRN) levels. It was linked to the expression of CELSR2, PSRC1, and SORT1, and had previous associations with low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol and myocardial infarction risk, thus establishing a pathway that could connect blood lipid levels and CVD with platelet effects.
title: Integrative Genomic Analysis and Functional Studies Reveal GP5, GRN, MPO and MCAM as Causal Protein Biomarkers for Platelet Traits

finding: The haplotype pair rs7516817 and rs7538797 displayed an additive pattern, where all three non-reference haplotypes had significant individual effects, and the double-variant haplotype exhibited a larger effect size than either variant individually.
title: Multiple Causal Variants Underlie Genetic Associations in Humans

finding: Similar to rs7516817, the rs7538797 within the haplotype pair showed an additive pattern with the rs7516817 variant, contributing to significant individual effects and a larger effect size when combined.
title: Multiple Causal Variants Underlie Genetic Associations in Humans

finding: The study reported a relationship between the FVIII deficiency and the common variant of FV known as FV Leiden (rs6025). This variant was linked to a hypercoagulable state because the endogenous inhibitor, activated protein C (APC), could not bind to FVa, which caused individuals with this combination to exhibit a milder bleeding phenotype. This finding indicated a distinct interaction where low FV levels enhance FVIII binding to factor Xa in patients with FVIII deficiencies, contrasting with previous understandings of combined deficiencies.
title: A mathematical model of flow-mediated coagulation identifies factor V as a modifier of thrombin generation in hemophilia A

finding: The rs1452628:T variant was associated with reduced sulcal widths across superior brain regions and showed multiple pairwise colocalizations with cortex-specific KCNK2 eQTLs, suggesting a shared underlying variant affecting sulcal morphology and KCNK2 expression.
title: Genetic map of regional sulcal morphology in the human brain

finding: The SNP rs12040906 was found to be associated with hybrid Epithelial/Mesenchymal states, as investigated in a study by Godin et al. (2020). This study indicated that quantifying the presence of cancer cells showing hybrid E/M states in tissue samples could serve as a new prognostic marker, suggesting that variations in this SNP may influence the aggressiveness and metastatic potential of cancer cells by enhancing hybrid traits.
title: Network Topology Metrics Explaining Enrichment of Hybrid Epithelial Mesenchymal Phenotypes in Metastasis

finding: The variant rs2022003 was included in credible sets for mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration (MCHC) and was identified to overlap with regulatory elements associated with SPTA1 in erythroid cell types.
title: Mapping enhancer-gene regulatory interactions from single-cell data

finding: The variant rs200830867 was highlighted in credible sets for hemoglobin A1C (HbA1c) and mean corpuscular volume (MCV). It was found to co-localize with enhancers relevant to SPTA1, indicating its involvement in erythroid development.
title: Mapping enhancer-gene regulatory interactions from single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs12092413 was associated with the effects of vitamin D on cell differentiation and stemness in cancer, suggesting its potential involvement in mediating the antiproliferative action of 1,25(OH)2D3 (calcitriol) in colon carcinoma cells.
title: Vitamin D induces SIRT1 activation through K610 deacetylation in colon cancer

finding: The finding related to the SNP rs12071992 indicated that it was associated with clinico-biological features and clonal hematopoiesis in patients who experienced severe COVID-19. This study highlighted the relationship between genetic predispositions and immune responses during SARS-CoV-2 infection, noting that variations at this locus could contribute to the variation in disease severity among individuals.
title: COVID-19 virtual patient cohort reveals immune mechanisms driving disease outcomes

finding: The study found that the SNP rs12030569 was positively associated with increased expression of oxidative and genotoxic stress markers in FMRP-deficient cells. This association indicated a failure to actuate the Integrated Stress Response Pathway (ISR), which was linked to the activity of transcription factor ATF4. The findings suggested that individuals with this SNP might exhibit heightened susceptibility to stress responses in the airways, further substantiated by experiments using both murine and human bronchial cell models.
title: The Fragile X Mental Retardation Protein protects the lung from xenobiotic stress by facilitating the Integrated Stress Response

finding: The variant rs151193009 in PCSK9 was found to be protective against CAD development while decreasing serum TC levels significantly. The minor allele led to an amino acid substitution (Arg93Cys) that reduced the affinity of PCSK9 for LDLR, impacting CAD negatively and aligning with increased TC levels.
title: Population-specific and transethnic genome-wide analyses reveal distinct and shared genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: The rs564427867 variant in PCSK9 demonstrated an increased risk of CAD and elevated serum TC levels. Specifically, the minor allele of this variant was associated with a significant increase in TC, supporting its role as a risk factor for CAD.
title: Population-specific and transethnic genome-wide analyses reveal distinct and shared genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs12123692 was identified as being associated with cancer stem cells, specifically marking high-grade serous ovarian cancer. This finding was articulated in a 2020 study by Fan et al., which detailed the role of ZIP4 as a novel cancer stem cell marker.
title: Molecular insights into substrate translocation in an elevator-type metal transporter

finding: Identified as a lead SNP for smoking cessation in MTAG, the rs11210229 variant demonstrated increased significance compared to earlier GWAS.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs4606268 was characterized as a population-biased <italic>cis</italic>-eQTL for the gene <italic>SLC44A5</italic>, showing an allelic fold change of −4.82 in esophagus mucosa among European Americans and −2.85 in African Americans (permutation p-value = 1.2×10<sup>−3</sup>). This finding emphasized differences in gene expression regulation between populations.
title: The GTEx Consortium atlas of genetic regulatory effects across human tissues

finding: The minor (T) allele of rs138282551 was associated with higher triglycerides (TG) in both Africans (β 0.29, p=4.5×10⁻⁷) and African Americans (AA, β 0.14, p=0.0035). This variant was noted for its higher frequency among individuals of African ancestry.
title: GWAS in Africans identifies novel lipids loci and demonstrates heterogenous association within Africa

finding: The SNP rs12092497 was identified as a significant genetic variant associated with response to neoadjuvant immune-checkpoint blockade therapy in triple-negative breast cancer. This finding underscored its potential role in modulating the immune response and highlighted the importance of genetic factors in predicting patient outcomes in cancer treatment.
title: Antigen-derived peptides directly engage the unfolded-protein sensor IRE1α to curb cross-presentation by dendritic cells

finding: The SNP rs10913112 was associated with depression but not with neuroticism. It is located downstream of the RFWD2 gene, which has been implicated in promoting tumor growth.
title: Stratifying depression by neuroticism: revisiting a diagnostic tradition using GWAS data

finding: The SNP rs4660091 was found to be significantly associated with depression and is located near the fumarate hydratase gene (FH), which is involved in the Krebs cycle.
title: Stratifying depression by neuroticism: revisiting a diagnostic tradition using GWAS data

finding: It was reported that a Mono-2 stimulation-specific peak overlapping rs6677309, a fine-mapped variant, was associated with multiple sclerosis (PP = 0.49) near the CD58 locus. The study discussed that CD58 presentation by activated monocytes could enhance CD56+ NK cell expansion, possibly promoting an autoimmune response in multiple sclerosis.
title: Droplet-based combinatorial indexing for massive scale single-cell epigenomics

finding: The rs541032500 locus in the GBP3 gene was identified as having a significant eQTL in five of the six fibroblast cell types and demonstrated significant interaction with cell type. This finding suggested that the interferon induction of GBP3 was likely mediated by genotypes at this locus, with effects varying based on the context of the cell type.
title: Single cell eQTL analysis identifies cell type-specific genetic control of gene expression in fibroblasts and reprogrammed induced pluripotent stem cells

finding: The SNP rs12041002 was identified as a potential biomarker in pancreatic adenocarcinoma through untargeted metabolomics in the research conducted by Martin-Blazquez et al. (2020). This research highlighted the discovery of biomarkers that could be crucial in understanding and treating PDAC, indicating its significance in the metabolic profiling of this cancer type.
title: Exploring the metabolic landscape of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma cells using genome-scale metabolic modeling

finding: The rs1572931 polymorphism of the RAB7L1 gene promoter was found to be associated with a reduced risk of Parkinson's disease. This finding was supported by data that demonstrated an association in several studies, indicating that this particular SNP may play a protective role against the disease.
title: Distinct roles for RAB10 and RAB29 in pathogenic LRRK2-mediated endolysosomal trafficking alterations

finding: The SNP rs213641 was known to affect behavioral responses to fear and anxiety stimuli. Its analysis indicated that it likely functioned in the brain by disrupting the transcriptional start site (TSS) of the STMN1 gene.
title: Annotating and prioritizing human non-coding variants with RegulomeDB

finding: The SNP rs3753326 was predicted as a regulatory variant impacting the expression level of the CELA2A gene in the adrenal gland, indicating its potential role as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL).
title: Annotating and prioritizing human non-coding variants with RegulomeDB

finding: The SNP rs12030742 was involved in studies analyzing the role of PTEN loss in immune escape, melanoma prognosis, and therapy response. This finding was original, providing insights into how genetic alterations influence the effectiveness of immunotherapies in melanoma.
title: Global Pannexin 1-deletion increases tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes in the BRAF/Pten mouse melanoma model

finding: This SNP showed associations with bone density, indicating a potential link to skeletal traits influenced by Neandertal genetic contributions.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: The SNP rs12075 was identified as a significant <italic>trans</italic> pQTL associated with levels of the chemokine MCP4. This SNP was previously linked to alterations in MCP1 levels and was shown to explain approximately 18.66% of variation in MCP4 levels.
title: Integrative omics approach to identify the molecular architecture of inflammatory protein levels in healthy older adults

finding: The SNP rs2228145 in the IL6R gene was found to segregate individuals based on their Prakriti types and was associated with various health conditions such as rheumatoid arthritis and atopic dermatitis, emphasizing its potential in stratifying health risks.
title: Genetic differences between extreme and composite constitution types from whole exome sequences reveal actionable variations

finding: The SNP rs1801133 (C667T; A222V) was found to be associated with breast cancer, offering a causal effect estimate per 1 SD increase in log serum folate of OR 0.94 (95% CI 0.78-1.12), suggesting a protective association overall in serum folate influence, although prior studies reported contrasting estimates.
title: Mendelian randomisation study exploring the associations of serum folate with pan and site-specific cancers

finding: There was a positive original finding relating rs12071801 to the effects of epigallocatechin gallate (EGCG) in cancer treatment, indicating its role in enhancing therapeutic outcomes when combined with other agents in glioma management.
title: A combination of Metformin and Epigallocatechin Gallate Potentiates Glioma Chemotherapy in vivo

finding: The SNP rs2282440 was associated with metabolic syndrome in the Taiwanese population. This finding suggests that variations in syndecan-3 (SDC3), specifically through this SNP, may play a role in the regulation of metabolic pathways relevant to conditions such as obesity and type 2 diabetes, potentially linking SDC3's role in insulin signaling and muscle stem cell differentiation.
title: SDC3 acts as a timekeeper of myogenic differentiation by regulating the insulin/AKT/mTOR axis in muscle stem cell progeny

finding: rs9651053 (G/A) was characterized as a regulatory variant located in the IL6R region and was highly linked with rs72698115 (A/C), a GWAS lead variant of juvenile idiopathic arthritis. The variant decreased binding of NFKB1, thereby increasing IL6R expression in lymphoblastoid cells and contributing to the risk of juvenile idiopathic arthritis.
title: Functional variants in hematopoietic transcription factor footprints and their roles in the risk of immune system diseases

finding: rs4017458 was identified as a novel candidate regulatory variant located in the ITLN1 gene region, linked with rs1333062 (G/T) and rs2274910 (G/T), both GWAS leads for chronic inflammatory diseases including Crohn's disease. The minor allele (rs4017458-G) was predicted to increase ETS2 binding and significantly enhance CD244 expression in whole blood, indicating a risk for chronic inflammatory diseases.
title: Functional variants in hematopoietic transcription factor footprints and their roles in the risk of immune system diseases

finding: The SNP rs12040952 was associated with immune function variations in the context of social adversity and age-related health effects as observed in the study of free-ranging rhesus macaques. The analysis indicated a potential link between this SNP and the levels of CD16+/CD3 Natural Killer cells, which are crucial for immune responses, particularly in the context of tumor surveillance, a topic highlighted in the referenced publication by Meza Guzman et al. in 2020. With respect to sex-dependent immune responses, the SNP's role suggested that variations in its presence could influence the proportions of CD20+/CD3+ ratios, affecting overall immune health and inflammatory responses in different social statuses.
title: Age, sex, and social environmental effects on immune cell composition in a free-ranging non-human primate

finding: This SNP, located in the MR1 gene, was associated with immune response to pathogens like Salmonella and Mycobacterium tuberculosis, underscoring the significance of immune adaptations during historical periods of increased pathogen exposure.
title: 1,000 ancient genomes uncover 10,000 years of natural selection in Europe

finding: The SNP rs642961 was associated with cleft lip (CL) based on previous studies and supported by its positioning in the upper-left quadrant of the cleft map, indicating a stronger risk effect for CL compared to cleft lip and palate (CLP). This relationship highlighted the complex interactions of SNPs within the IRF6 locus related to OFC subtypes.
title: A systematic genetic analysis and visualization of phenotypic heterogeneity among orofacial cleft GWAS signals

finding: The rs1126407 variant, also known as F19Y, caused a phenylalanine to tyrosine substitution in Galectin-8. It was associated with rheumatoid arthritis and showed a notable population frequency disparity, being more common in European populations compared to African and East Asian populations. This variant had been the subject of previous functional studies that explored its impact on Galectin-8, although those studies had not considered the co-occurring variants found on the major haplotype.
title: The impact of natural selection on the evolution and function of placentally expressed galectins

finding: The SNP rs139544379 was associated with an amino acid substitution in the Guanylate Binding Protein 7 (GBP7), specifically a change from Leucine to Proline at position 559. This archaic allele contributed to variation in protein structure, which could be linked to adaptive traits observed in modern human populations, particularly among Papua New Guineans who carry Denisovan DNA.
title: Denisovan admixture facilitated environmental adaptation in Papua New Guinean populations

finding: The SNP rs114165349, located in the promoter region of ARID1A, showed a very high posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.99. This variant was predicted to regulate ARID1A expression, which is an epigenetic regulator tied to altered lipid metabolism. Loss of ARID1A function in murine models resulted in increased cholesterol levels, supporting a role in cholesterol homeostasis.
title: Systematic elucidation of genetic mechanisms underlying cholesterol uptake

finding: The SNP rs3010126 was associated with melanoma metastasis as highlighted in the study by Damsky et al. (2010). This finding was considered original as it contributed to the understanding of genetic factors influencing tumor progression in melanoma.
title: Integrated in vivo functional screens and multi-omics analyses identify α-2,3-sialylation as essential for melanoma maintenance

finding: The SNP rs3828112 on chromosome 1 was identified as a neuroblastoma-risk locus through optimal false discovery rate control in the genome-wide association study (GWAS) findings. Its significance was linked to local genes, particularly NR5A2, which has implications in oncogenic processes and chemoresistance. Additionally, the adjacent gene KIF14 was found to be up-regulated in high-risk neuroblastoma (fold change = 2.03, FDR < 2e-16), indicating its potential role in disease progression.
title: Adopting tipping-point theory to transcriptome profiles unravels disease regulatory trajectory

finding: The SNP rs596985 was linked to multiple brain measurements including cortical surface area and cortical thickness, being located in the intron of the ROR1 gene. This demonstrated a connection between the SNP and structural brain variations.
title: A novel classification framework for genome-wide association study of whole brain MRI images using deep learning

finding: The effect of rs9661059 on blood lipid traits was validated to be significant with a genome-wide p-value of 6.29 × 10^-9, indicating that this SNP had a strong association with blood lipid levels. The analysis demonstrated that, among 51,104 SNPs on chromosome 1, rs9661059 was reliably identified without false positives across more than half of the simulated replicates, confirming its role as a likely true positive predictor for the phenotype.
title: Simultaneous SNP selection and adjustment for population structure in high dimensional prediction models

finding: The Duffy null variant (rs2814778) was identified as an important SNP that should be considered in clinical decision-making processes. Specifically, it was related to avoiding unnecessary bone marrow biopsy procedures, underscoring its clinical significance.
title: Improving polygenic risk prediction in admixed populations by explicitly modeling ancestral-specific effects via GAUDI

finding: SNP rs477992 at locus 1p12 was nominally associated with increased risk of perivascular pigment clustering and decreased risk of blunted vessels.
title: Genetic Disruption of Serine Biosynthesis is a Key Driver of Macular Telangiectasia Type 2 Etiology and Progression

finding: The rs12402521 polymorphism in the Phosducin gene was identified as a predictive marker for the development of hypertension specifically in young subjects who were overweight or obese. This indicated its relevance in understanding genetic factors contributing to hypertension in at-risk populations.
title: Gene Embeddings of Complex network (GECo) and hypertension disease gene classification

finding: The rs11573191 polymorphism of the PLA2G5 gene was found to be associated with premature coronary artery disease in the Mexican Mestizo population. This association highlighted the genetic factors involved in atherosclerotic disease, further elucidating the genetic architecture of cardiovascular disorders.
title: Gene Embeddings of Complex network (GECo) and hypertension disease gene classification

finding: The SNP rs553959593 was identified as changing a guanidine immediately upstream of the start-stop in the 5' UTR of the UHMK1 gene, disrupting its Kozak sequence. This alteration was linked to higher ribosome occupancy at the start-stop and upstream uORF, suggesting repression of UHMK1 translation, which is associated with colorectal cancer cell growth and drug resistance.
title: Regulatory start-stop elements in 5’ untranslated regions pervasively modulate translation

finding: The SNP rs12071910 was associated with integrin signaling pathways, which contributed to the understanding of integrin crosstalk in the context of hepatitis E virus (HEV) entry mechanisms. This finding highlighted the role of ITGB1 in the interaction with naked HEV particles and suggested its involvement in the transport of the virus through cellular structures such as the recycling endosome.
title: A high-content RNA-based imaging assay reveals integrin beta 1 as a cofactor for cell entry of non-enveloped hepatitis E virus

finding: SNP rs2295079 in the promoter region of the MTOR gene was associated with variations in MTOR expression levels. Analysis revealed that it affected multiple age-sensitive phenotypes including body fat and body weight. For certain phenotypes, the effects of the MTOR eQTL showed no genotype x age interaction, suggesting that its influence was consistent across age groups. Two parameters did exhibit a genotype x age interaction, driven primarily by effects in younger individuals, indicating some age-dependent context as well.
title: Deep Phenotyping and Lifetime Trajectories Reveal Limited Effects of Longevity Regulators on the Aging Process in C57BL/6J Mice

finding: The SNP rs937491 was identified as an Ancestry Informative Marker (AIM) with a differential frequency by ancestry. It was involved in the regulation of the methylation value at the probe cg05393297, where its presence affected the methylation levels in breast cancer patients. This SNP contributed to the understanding of genetic ancestry's influence on DNA methylation and could have implications for gene regulation.
title: Genetic ancestry-specific meQTLs control immune function regulation in a breast cancer cohort of African and European patients

finding: A SNP in the GATA-1 transcription factor binding region upstream of the ACKR1 gene was associated with protection against P. vivax in humans. This SNP was found to be relevant as it was suggested that a similar SNP in the 5'UTR of the ACKR1 gene in Papio cynocephalus might reduce susceptibility to Hepatocystis infection.
title: Phylogenetics and genomic variation of two genetically distinct Hepatocystis clades isolated from shotgun sequencing of wild primate hosts

finding: The SNP rs11122017 was associated with the biochemical composition changes in cancerous colon cells treated with mevastatin, which was explored through Raman spectroscopy. The study indicated that mevastatin influenced the cellular characteristics of cancerous cells (CaCo-2), suggesting a potential genetic implication in the sensitivity to statins' cytotoxic effects in colon cancer.
title: Mevastatin in colon cancer by spectroscopic and microscopic methods - Raman imaging and AFM studies

finding: The SNP rs4987369 was associated with the mean fluorescence intensity (MFI) of L-selectin (CD62L) in neutrophils. This association was consistent with the expression of the SELL gene in neutrophils, monocytes, and T cells at the same genetic locus. Moreover, strong correlations were observed between the association Z statistics of MFI of L-selectin and SELL expression across the three cell types, indicating a direct connection between these traits due to the same genetic variant.
title: Shared associations identify causal relationships between gene expression and immune cell phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12082177 had been associated with cancer cell motility as highlighted in the study by De la Fuente and López in 2020. Their research emphasized the importance of cellular movement in the context of cancer, indicating that variations at this SNP could influence the dynamics of cell locomotion, thereby affecting cancer progression.
title: Systemic migrations in enucleated cells

finding: The SNP rs6027 was identified as part of the HR2 haplotype in the F5 gene, which was linked to the regulation of FV plasma levels since the late 1990s. This haplotype contributed to inter-individual variability of FV but was not individually tested in this specific analysis.
title: A genome wide search for non-additive allele effects identifies PSKH2 as involved in the variability of Factor V activity

finding: The SNP rs4524 was shown to influence plasma FV levels independently of rs6027, marking it as an important genetic contributor to FV variability. Like rs6027, it relates back to the genetic regulation of FV plasma levels identified in prior studies.
title: A genome wide search for non-additive allele effects identifies PSKH2 as involved in the variability of Factor V activity

finding: This SNP in the ADAR gene was found to be unique to the SARS-CoV-2-resistant donor 122, indicating a potential role in the high endogenous IFN lambda secretion and resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: An Endogenously activated antiviral state restricts SARS-CoV-2 infection in differentiated primary airway epithelial cells

finding: The SNP rs78230510 was identified as part of a novel region near the DISP1 gene during a GWAS that focused on the S-HDL-ApoA1 metabolite. It passed the genome-wide significance threshold in a dominant model, indicating its association with T2DM-related metabolites.
title: Effect of inbreeding on type 2 diabetes-related metabolites in a Dutch genetic isolate

finding: The SNP rs118043948, located intronically within the DISP1 gene, was also found to be significant in the same GWAS for S-HDL-ApoA1. It contributed to the understanding of the genetic determinants involved in T2DM-related metabolic traits.
title: Effect of inbreeding on type 2 diabetes-related metabolites in a Dutch genetic isolate

finding: The SNP rs1538560 was detected in the vicinity of the DISP1 gene and, alongside rs78230510 and rs118043948, it passed the genome-wide significance criteria for the dominant genetic model during the investigation into S-HDL-ApoA1, shedding light on metabolic disturbances linked to T2DM.
title: Effect of inbreeding on type 2 diabetes-related metabolites in a Dutch genetic isolate

finding: The variant rs519989 localized in an intergenic enhancer approximately 25 kb upstream of the LRRC8C gene was associated with binding changes of transcription factor PU.1. It led to reduced enhancer-promoter connectivity, which subsequently resulted in lower expression of the LRRC8C gene specifically in Neutrophils.
title: Non-coding variants impact cis-regulatory coordination in a cell type-specific manner

finding: The TNFSF4 rs3861950 SNP was linked to increased susceptibility to coronary artery disease, demonstrating its role in cardiovascular proliferation.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: Another TNFSF4 polymorphism, rs1234313, was found to be associated with susceptibility to coronary artery disease, reinforcing its impact on cardiovascular risk.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs3767140 SNP in the perlecan (HSPG2) gene was shown to influence diabetes mellitus through effects on dyslipidemia, indicating its role in metabolic disease.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: For the SNP rs9330298, the findings revealed a consistent pattern where unmethylated fragments were predominantly associated with the G genotype, while methylated fragments were linked to the T genotype across multiple samples. This observation indicated a clear case of sequence-dependent allele-specific methylation (SD-ASM) related to this SNP.
title: Atlas of imprinted and allele-specific DNA methylation in the human body

finding: The SNP rs12061406 was associated with the host-microbiota interactions in colorectal cancer (CRC) as described in the research by Sanchez-Alcoholado et al. The findings highlighted its role in immune microenvironments across distinct consensus molecular subtypes (CMSs) of CRC, showcasing how variations in host genetics could influence microbial associations and the tumor microenvironment.
title: Host-microbiota interactions contributing to the heterogeneous tumor microenvironment in colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs10494021, located 11,897 bp away from the RH gene desert growth locus at 104,730,000 bp on chromosome 1, had suggestive significance in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) related to childhood ear infection. The odds ratio was 1.14 with a P-value of 6.61 × 10^-6, indicating a potential association of this SNP with susceptibility to the clinical trait. The findings suggested that the associated gene could be a novel RH gene related to the trait rather than a distant known gene regulated by this SNP.
title: Pooled analysis of radiation hybrids identifies loci for growth and drug action in mammalian cells

finding: The analysis revealed that rs11121131 is located within a putative enhancer that modulates ERRFI1 expression specifically in keratinocytes. Further experimental validation through CRISPR deletion demonstrated that removing this enhancer led to a significant reduction in ERRFI1 transcript levels, solidifying its role as a potential causal variant for the psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis associations at the 1p36.23 locus.
title: Dissection of a non-coding risk locus at 1p36.23 identifies ERRFI1 as a novel gene in the pathogenesis of psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis

finding: rs11121129 was identified as the lead GWAS SNP for the 1p36.23 region, which was significantly associated with both psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis susceptibility. Despite its identification, the study placed more emphasis on the closely linked rs11121131 as the functional variant influencing disease risk.
title: Dissection of a non-coding risk locus at 1p36.23 identifies ERRFI1 as a novel gene in the pathogenesis of psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis

finding: The SNP rs12123579 was associated with the detection capabilities of Cooperative Primers in real-time PCR assays used for analyzing somatic mutations in circulating tumor DNA. The findings indicated that this SNP could be utilized for reliable detection of rare mutant alleles, enhancing both qualitative and quantitative assessments of cell-free DNA, particularly in the context of cancer therapy response and monitoring resistance mutations.
title: Highly selective Cooperative Primers for multiplex detection of rare mutations

finding: The SNP rs12092601 was positively associated with the phosphorylation of OCT4, specifically at Serine 236. This modification was observed to inhibit germ cell tumor growth by inducing differentiation, indicating a potential therapeutic target in cancer treatment.
title: Structural characterization of stem cell factors Oct4, Sox2, Nanog and Esrrb disordered domains, and a method to identify their phospho-dependent binding partners

finding: The SNP rs12082142 was identified in the context of EBV-related malignancies, particularly associated with lytic induction therapy. This SNP's positive finding indicated a link to the efficacy of therapies targeting EBV-positive cancer cells such as gastric cancer. The research suggested that bleomycin, through its derivatives, effectively induced apoptotic death in these EBV-infected cells, highlighting the therapeutic potential linked to variations in genetic markers like rs12082142.
title: Bleomycin induced EBV-specific gastric epithelial cell death is enhanced by LMP2A

finding: The functional promoter variant rs2295080 T>G in the MTOR gene was associated with an increased risk of colorectal cancer in a Chinese population, indicating its potential role as a biomarker for this cancer type.
title: SNPector: SNP inspecting tool to detect disease existence and drug response in direct naked sequencing depends on mutation index

finding: The SNP rs12030731 was associated with the response to tyrosine kinase inhibitors, elaborated in the work by Pottier et al. (2020). The study described challenges and breakthroughs related to targeted therapy in cancer, contextualizing how genetic variations could affect the efficacy and side effects of treatments, including cachexia-related outcomes linked to Sorafenib.
title: Sorafenib induces muscle wasting by disrupting the activity of distinct chromatin regulators

finding: The SNP rs2383626 was identified as heterozygous in both genomic DNA and cDNA samples derived from the HTD114 cell line. Its presence was linked to the TL:1-187 locus, which played a significant role in chromosome-wide replication timing. Deletion of this locus led to delayed replication timing on chromosome 1, demonstrating that rs2383626 was associated with altered chromosome stability and replication integrity.
title: Epigenetic Control of Hundreds of Chromosome-Associated lncRNA Genes Essential for Replication and Stability

finding: The SNP rs12048590 was similarly found to be heterozygous in genomic and cDNA samples from the HTD114 cell line, also located within the TL:1-187 region. Its association with the TL:1-187 locus pointed to its involvement in replication timing processes. The deletion of the TL:1-187 locus, where rs12048590 resides, resulted in delayed replication of chromosome 1, indicating that this SNP was crucial for maintaining chromosome integrity and replication efficiency.
title: Epigenetic Control of Hundreds of Chromosome-Associated lncRNA Genes Essential for Replication and Stability

finding: The SNP rs34655914 was found to have cross-categorical localization between aortic length and diameter, indicating its relevance to both aortic measurements and potential structural health.
title: Thoracic Aortic 3-Dimensional Geometry: Effects of Aging and Genetic Determinants

finding: The SNP rs35267671 was also noted for its role in the overlap between aortic length and diameter, suggesting its importance in understanding aortic structural variations.
title: Thoracic Aortic 3-Dimensional Geometry: Effects of Aging and Genetic Determinants

finding: The SNP rs11205303 exhibited a significant dominance effect at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold (p=2.6e-16). This finding was observed within the context of investigating pairwise SNP interactions related to adult height, identifying evidence of dominance effects relevant to the genetic architecture of this polygenic trait.
title: Analysis of 3.6 million individuals yields minimal evidence of pairwise genetic interactions for height

finding: The SNP rs1801274, related to the FCGR2A gene, was identified as being associated with the risk of death among COVID-19 patients. This association was reported by López-Martínez et al. (2022) and highlights the role of this genetic variant in COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 control complement-induced inflammatory responses to SARS-CoV-2

finding: The SNP rs11121993 was associated with an increased stem cell phenotype and resistance to chemotherapy, specifically in cholangiocarcinoma organoids. This finding was part of a study exploring how glucose depletion enhanced stem cell traits through AKT phosphorylation and reactive oxygen species generation, suggesting a similar pathway in the context of CRC due to the involvement of related signaling pathways.
title: BMP antagonist CHRDL2 enhances the cancer stem cell phenotype and increases chemotherapy resistance in Colorectal Cancer

finding: The SNP rs12132115 was identified in the context of genetic diversity studies of Thuja plicata in UK woodlands. The findings indicated that this SNP was part of a larger set of 504 SNPs analyzed in a study aimed at monitoring Continuous Cover Forestry practices. The study reported low effective population sizes across various sites, signifying risks associated with low genetic diversity, while also noting high heterozygosity overall. This SNP contributed to understanding the genetic landscape of T. plicata, particularly concerning its ability to withstand environmental shifts and disease threats.
title: Low effective population size but high heterozygosity revealed by SNP analyses in adult and juvenile Thuja plicata in UK Woodlands

finding: This SNP variant was associated with changes in mean platelet volume, which highlights its potential contribution to platelet activation dynamics.
title: LRRC8 complexes are adenosine nucleotide release channels regulating platelet activation and arterial thrombosis

finding: This SNP variant showed an association with mean platelet volume, suggesting its involvement in the mechanisms affecting platelet size and function in thrombosis.
title: LRRC8 complexes are adenosine nucleotide release channels regulating platelet activation and arterial thrombosis

finding: The SNP rs12040916 was associated with the landscape of targeted therapies in triple negative breast cancer (TNBC). This finding highlighted its relevance in understanding the chemotherapeutic landscape and potential implications for treatment response and resistance.
title: Three-dimensional analysis of mitochondria in a patient-derived xenograft model of triple negative breast cancer reveals mitochondrial network remodeling following chemotherapy treatments

finding: The SNP rs324420, associated with the FAAH gene, was reported to modulate extinction recall in healthy humans based on an fMRI study. This finding suggested a potential link between this polymorphism and psychological responses, particularly relating to stress and emotional resilience.
title: Genetic deletion of NAPE-PLD induces context-dependent dysregulation of anxiety-like behaviors, stress responsiveness, and HPA-axis functionality in mice

finding: The rs2228145 SNP was linked to circulating levels of the soluble IL-6 receptor (sIL-6r). Patients with the C,A allele exhibited significantly higher sIL-6r levels both pre-operatively and post-operatively compared to those with the A,A allele.
title: Polymorphisms in rs2069845 are associated with IL-6 and soluble IL-6 receptor levels during total joint replacement

finding: The SNP rs72721996 was found to be located in a SCZ GWAS risk locus associated with the gene PTPB2. It exhibited a significant expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) effect in induced neurons (iNs) and prefrontal cortex (PFC), indicating that cis-acting genetic variation could lead to de-regulation of PTPB2 in schizophrenia (SCZ). However, it was noted that this cis-acting genetic effect could only explain a small portion (R2=0.065) of the de-regulation. Moreover, PTPB2 expression levels were predicted to be impacted by the SCZ-associated microRNA let-7-5p, with a significant anti-correlation observed between PTBP2 expression and let-7-5p. This indicated that both cis-acting variation and trans-acting factors contribute to the multifactorial de-regulation of PTBP2, which likely mediates differential alternative polyadenylation (dAPA) in neuronal cells from individuals with SCZ.
title: Polygenic risk for schizophrenia converges on alternative polyadenylation as molecular mechanism underlying synaptic impairment

finding: The SNPrs4661188 demonstrated a significant inverse interaction with family history of Alzheimer's disease (AD), indicating that this eQTL for the APOA1BP gene may play a role in susceptibility to AD. Additionally, APOA1BP was identified as a susceptibility locus for migraine, highlighting its relevance in neuroinflammatory processes and its potential impact on neurodegeneration in Alzheimer's disease.
title: AIBP controls amyloid beta induced TLR4 inflammarafts and mitochondrial dysfunction in microglia

finding: The SNP rs2305814 associated with cancer risk and immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) response, reinforcing its role in influencing patient outcomes in immunotherapy contexts.
