title: Germline modifiers of the tumor immune microenvironment implicate drivers of cancer risk and immunotherapy response

finding: This variant was identified as a cell-type eQTL for B cells, emphasizing its role in regulating B-cell responses within the immune microenvironment.
title: Germline modifiers of the tumor immune microenvironment implicate drivers of cancer risk and immunotherapy response

finding: The SNP rs2476601, which is located in the PTPN22 gene, was identified as a shared risk locus in multiple genome-wide association studies (GWAS) involving autoimmune diseases. This finding emphasized its pleiotropic effect, indicating that this single nucleotide polymorphism had significant associations with more than one autoimmune condition, aligning with the concept that genetic susceptibility can manifest across different diseases.
title: Identification of 67 pleiotropic genes for seven autoimmune diseases using multivariate statistical analysis

finding: The rs340874 locus in humans was identified as harboring a genome-wide significant variant associated with Type-2 diabetes. This finding was derived from analyses indicating differential DNA methylation at enhancer regions and H3K27me3 annotated genomic regions between the distinct subtypes of pancreatic beta-cells, suggesting a role of this locus in the specification and function of beta-cell subtypes, including implications in Type-2 diabetes pathology.
title: Identification of two β-cell subtypes by 7 independent criteria

finding: In the study, individuals classified as Kapha Prakriti were found to have an over-representation of the TT genotype of rs479200, which was significantly linked to higher expression levels of the EGLN1 gene. This SNP was also present among natives of high-altitude areas and patients with High-altitude pulmonary edema (HAPE), with the C allele associated with high altitude natives and the T allele found in HAPE patients.
title: Transcriptomic profiling of healthy individual-derived LCLs revealed inter-individual variability towards-hypoxia-responsive pathways

finding: The study reported that the ancestral allele (T) of rs480902 in the EGLN1 gene was overrepresented in individuals of Pitta Prakriti and positively correlated with adaptation to high altitude among disparate genetic lineages as observed in the Indian Genome Variation Consortium and other studies.
title: Transcriptomic profiling of healthy individual-derived LCLs revealed inter-individual variability towards-hypoxia-responsive pathways

finding: The SNP rs3010994 was referenced in the study by Ozaki and Nakagawara (2011), highlighting the role of p53 mutation in various cancers. The findings indicated that understanding this SNP's relationship with p53 mutations could contribute to insights into cancer biology and potential therapeutic strategies.
title: Natural Product Screen Identifies Asiatic Acid Targeting Mutant p53

finding: The study identified that a mutation in the enhancer corresponding to SNP rs17162257 was expected to lead to a reduction in the activity of miR-1976. This miRNA is notably involved in the regulation of introns within the C5 group, which were found to be selectively increased in intron retention in ALS-related VCP mutant samples. The context of this finding underlines its relevance to the pathophysiology of sporadic ALS, indicating that the mutation may contribute to functional depletion of miRNAs through mechanistic pathways associated with intronic sequences.
title: Diminished miRNA activity is associated with aberrant cytoplasmic intron retention in ALS pathogenesis

finding: The AD-associated SNP rs2093760 was identified as an aseQTL of CR1 specifically in oligodendrocytes, but showed no association in microglia, highlighting the cell-type specificity of its regulatory effects.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: Found in nearly complete LD with rs2093760, this missense variant's strong association with CR1's ASE in TC suggests a potential causal role within the haplotype.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: Associating with FCER1G in monocytes, this SNP demonstrated significant regulatory effects consistent with immune response pathways in AD.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: As a significant eQTL for FCER1G, this SNP emerged in the context of immune response mechanisms involved in Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs16858150, located in the 3' UTR of the gene CACNA1E, had its alternative allele identified as interrupting the polyadenylation signal (PAS). This interruption was associated with altered 3' UTR length, which suggested implications for gene expression regulation.
title: Systematic identification of functional SNPs interrupting 3’ UTR polyadenylation signals

finding: SNP rs4333882 was associated with significant clinical outcomes concerning diverticular disease, identified through the PheWAS analyses that highlighted its relationship with diverticular phenotypes.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: Variant rs6587520 was identified as a lead SNP in the CTSS locus on chromosome 1q21, which encodes cathepsin S. It was shown to influence CTSS expression in immune cells, linking it to inflammation and CAD susceptibility.
title: Transethnic meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies three new loci and characterizes population-specific differences for coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs78444298, located in the EDEM3 gene, was characterized as a missense variant that may induce a nonsense-mediated decay (NMD)-inducing naturally variable exon (nmdNVE) in various tissues according to GTEx data. With a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 1.5%, this variant was linked to multiple phenotypes, including schizophrenia, metabolic, and blood traits. The SNP was described as having a proline to serine substitution, and it was associated with increased splicing of a low EF nmdNVE, which correlated with decreased gene expression across several tissues. Additionally, it affected the predicted binding affinity of RNA binding proteins near the 3' splice site, highlighting its molecular impact.
title: Widespread naturally variable human exons aid genetic interpretation

finding: The SNP rs12092342 was identified as a positive and original finding in the context of breast cancer metastasis. The study indicated that the P2X7 receptor, associated with this SNP, promoted cancer cell invasiveness and tumour progression, highlighting the potential of this receptor as a target for anticancer treatments. The findings established a connection between the SNP and critical mechanisms such as hypoxia and extracellular vesicle secretion in the tumor microenvironment.
title: P2RX7 inhibition reduces breast cancer induced osteolytic lesions - implications for bone metastasis

finding: The SNP rs2814778, a non-coding variant located in the ACKR1 gene, was identified as having a significant effect on white blood cell count (WBC) among African Americans. This variant, common in this population, was shown to explain 7-20% of the variation in WBC levels, emphasizing its crucial role in association studies involving this phenotype. The study utilized this variant as a covariate in the analysis to mitigate inflation in statistical tests that could arise from linkage disequilibrium, further supporting its importance in understanding genetic variants impacting blood traits.
title: eSCAN: Scan Regulatory Regions for Aggregate Association Testing using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The risk allele of rs1625579, a miR-137 single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP), was associated with lower miR-137 expression in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, which correlated with increased prefrontal activity related to working memory and with activity in the emotion processing brain network. This indicated a significant role of miR-137 genetic variation in schizophrenia (SCZ) risk, thereby linking reduced miR-137 expression to heightened emotional processing and greater SCZ susceptibility.
title: A miR-137-related biological pathway of risk for Schizophrenia is associated with human brain emotion processing

finding: The SNP rs79485039 also manifested as a missense change in FGFR3 in both humans and cattle. This variant was one of the key contributors in a set of 11 variants that were significantly linked to height in humans, reinforcing the evidence for the association to human stature.
title: The conservation of human functional variants and their effects across mammals

finding: The SNP rs72696969 affected the EHF transcription factor motif and was connected to FLG and FLG2 promoter activity; the risk allele decreased transcriptional activity, potentially increasing atopic dermatitis risk by down-regulating FLG expression essential for epidermal barrier.
title: Disease-Linked Regulatory DNA Variants and Homeostatic Transcription Factors in Epidermis

finding: This SNP was significantly correlated with blood pressure and diagnosed vascular and heart problems in UK Biobank participants. It acted as an eQTL in the hippocampus for TIE1, relating to angiogenesis and blood vessel stability, linking the SNP to vascular health.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: An eQTL of multiple genes including CREB3L4, this SNP was associated with metabolic phenotypes and highlighted a role in adipogenesis and potentially cognitive functions linked to aging.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: This SNP was found in an exon of STX6, and was correlated with tauopathy and hormonal treatment in the UK Biobank, suggesting its relevance in neurodegenerative processes.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: This SNP correlated with several body fat measures and regulated neuron migration, highlighting its influence on both physical and cognitive health.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The allele T in rs79994730 was associated with an increased chance of answering 'Prefer not to answer' (PNA) and 'I don’t know' (IDK) for survey questions. This SNP was also linked to lower educational attainment and intelligence, indicating its relevance to traits related to poor health and lower socioeconomic status.
title: Patterns of item nonresponse behavior to survey questionnaires are systematic and have a genetic basis

finding: The SNP rs12061602 was identified in the context of its role in purine metabolites present in tumor-derived exosomes. The study highlighted that these metabolites could facilitate immune escape in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, suggesting a significant contribution of this SNP to cancer immunology.
title: Engineered immunomodulatory extracellular vesicles derived from epithelial cells acquire capacity for positive and negative T cell co-stimulation in cancer and autoimmunity

finding: Located on chromosome 1, rs2201841 was identified as one of the top SNPs with significant BayesRB estimates, indicating a meaningful association in the study's findings.
title: BayesRB: a markov chain Monte Carlo-based polygenic genetic risk score algorithm for dichotomous traits

finding: The rs3811019 SNP was implicated in hypothyroidism, affecting BCL2L15 expression in whole blood and linking to its critical roles in apoptosis survival mechanisms.
title: Identification and catalogue of viral transcriptional regulators in human diseases

finding: The SNP rs11122017 was associated with aberrant expression of retinoids and retinol binding proteins in human tumors. It showed a distinct correlation with lipid droplets in cancer cells, particularly in glioblastoma and medulloblastoma tissue. This finding was significant in the context of retinol transport and metabolism, highlighting its role in the biochemical processes affecting cancer progression.
title: Novel strategies of Raman imaging for monitoring intracellular retinoid metabolism in cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs11122006, which pertains to the mutation of PIK3CA (H1047R), was identified as a common driver mutation hotspot in canine mammary tumors. This finding indicates that similar to human breast cancers, canine mammary tumors also exhibit this specific mutation, highlighting the relevance of PIK3CA mutations in both species. This similarity provides insights into the genetic mechanisms involved in mammary tumors across species, emphasizing the translational potential of canine models in understanding human cancers.
title: Canine major histocompatibility complex class I (MHC-I) diversity landscape

finding: Finding related to SNP rs12030591 was connected to the study published by Raftopoulou et al. in 2020, which discussed the karyotypic flexibility of cancer genomes and the role of polyploidization in maintaining the structural integrity of cancer chromosomes. This connection was drawn through analysis of the CRISPR-Cas9 datasets from DepMap where this SNP was implicated.
title: High-resolution genome-wide mapping of chromosome-arm-scale truncations induced by CRISPR-Cas9 editing

finding: The rs2814778 SNP (-67T>C) in the GATA-1 transcription factor binding site of the Duffy Antigen Receptor for Chemokines (DARC) gene was found to be prevalent among individuals of Sub-Saharan African descent. This mutation led to reduced expression of the DARC receptor on red blood cells, which correlated with lower susceptibility to Plasmodium vivax infection. However, recent evidence indicated that while Duffy-negative individuals, typically homozygous (C/C) at this SNP, were historically thought to be resistant to P. vivax, they could still experience infections, both symptomatic and asymptomatic, albeit often with lower parasitemia than their Duffy-positive counterparts.
title: Copy number variations of Plasmodium vivax DBP1, EBP/DBP2, and RBP2b in Duffy-positive and Duffy-negative Ethiopians

finding: The SNP rs12061586 was associated with cancer concepts, particularly through its association with Ubiquilin networking as described by Jantrapirom et al. in their study published in 2020. This SNP was identified within a context where aberrant expression of Ubiquilin proteins may influence cancer pathogenesis, relating its impact to the larger mechanisms involving mitochondrial function and amino acid homeostasis as discussed in the context of OGT's role in cell viability and signaling pathways.
title: OGT controls mammalian cell viability by regulating the proteasome/mTOR/ mitochondrial axis

finding: The SNP rs111289603 was found to have an odds ratio of 1.49 (95% CI: 1.19 to 1.86, p=0.00045) for the phenotype of having difficulty walking across a room. This indicates that for each additional G allele, individuals experienced a 49% increase in odds of having difficulty walking when compared to their same aged counterparts without the allele.
title: Genetic variation in ALDH4A1 predicts muscle health over the lifespan and across species

finding: The SNP rs77608580 was significantly associated with gait speed changes, specifically an increase of 0.052 meters per second per year with each additional A allele (p=0.0025). This study included 3,319 older individuals with a mean age of 73, suggesting that those carrying the effect allele experienced a faster rate of increase in gait speed compared to those without.
title: Genetic variation in ALDH4A1 predicts muscle health over the lifespan and across species

finding: The SNP rs28665699 showed an inverse association with grip strength decline over time, with an effect size of -0.045 kg per year (p=0.0009). Individuals with 1 or 2 effect alleles experienced a slower decline in grip strength compared to those without the effect allele, demonstrating its protective association against muscle strength diminishment.
title: Genetic variation in ALDH4A1 predicts muscle health over the lifespan and across species

finding: The study provided evidence that rs3093077 showed significant genetic associations with C-reactive protein (CRP) levels. It was highlighted that rs3093077 interacted with both body mass index (BMI) and HbA1c, contributing to the variation in CRP among different disease groups, particularly in the context of obesity.
title: Genetic effect modification of cis-acting C-reactive protein variants in cardiometabolic disease status

finding: The findings revealed that rs1205 had substantial associations with CRP levels, and it exhibited significant interactions with BMI and HbA1c levels. This SNP played a key role in modulating the effects of BMI on CRP, indicating its potential relevance in cardiometabolic disease conditions.
title: Genetic effect modification of cis-acting C-reactive protein variants in cardiometabolic disease status

finding: Evidence indicated that rs1130864 was associated with CRP levels, though it presented weaker interaction evidence with HbA1c compared to the other SNPs. Nevertheless, it was part of the substantial GxBMI interaction findings with implications for cardiometabolic disease.
title: Genetic effect modification of cis-acting C-reactive protein variants in cardiometabolic disease status

finding: The SNP rs1800947 was linked to increased CRP levels and demonstrated significant interaction effects with both BMI and HbA1c. This association underscored its impact in modifying the genetic associations in relation to CRP, particularly within affected disease subgroups.
title: Genetic effect modification of cis-acting C-reactive protein variants in cardiometabolic disease status

finding: The rs1452628-T variant was identified as associating with reduced sulcal width and was located near the KCNK2 gene, which is implicated in neuroinflammation and cerebral ischemia.
title: Deep learning based brain age prediction uncovers associated sequence variants

finding: The SNP rs76763715 was noted as a missense variant in the GBA gene linked to Gaucher disease, Type I. This variant was approximately 13 times more frequent in individuals of Ashkenazi Jewish ancestry compared to those from Central London. This demonstrates the variant's higher prevalence in specific ancestry groups, underscoring the impact of genetic background on disease risk.
title: Regionally enriched rare deleterious exonic variants in the UK and Ireland

finding: The SNP rs1545300 was identified as a lead variant associated with an early repolarization pattern (ERP) with a pooled odds ratio of 0.82 and a p-value of 7.7E-12 during the GWAS meta-analysis, indicating its significance in the genetic predisposition to ERP.
title: KCND3 is a novel susceptibility locus for early repolarization

finding: The SNP rs12090194 was the lead SNP in the discovery phase with a p-value of 4.6E-10, showing strong linkage disequilibrium with rs1545300 (r^2=0.96), thus confirming its association with ERP in both discovery and replication studies.
title: KCND3 is a novel susceptibility locus for early repolarization

finding: The common non-encoding SNP rs12740374 was found to regulate SORT1 expression in hepatocytes by creating a C/EBP binding site, which modulated plasma LDL-C levels. In this context, T3 treatment increased both SORT1 expression and chromatin accessibility at this SNP, indicating its role in enhancer activity and hepatocyte maturation. Additionally, rs12740374 was located within an active ATAC-peak exhibiting H3K27Ac signals in 3D PSC-hepatocytes, similar to the pattern observed in primary hepatocytes. Consequently, T3 treatment improved H3K27Ac signals surrounding this SNP, contributing to enhanced functionality of hepatocytes derived from stem cells.
title: A nuclear receptor facilitates differentiation of human PSCs into more mature hepatocytes

finding: The SNP rs12092413 was associated with vitamin D effects on cell differentiation and stemness in cancer, indicating its relevance in colorectal cancer (CRC) due to the modulation of the Wnt/β-catenin pathway.
title: SIRT1 mediates the antagonism of Wnt/β-catenin pathway by vitamin D in colon carcinoma cells

finding: The SNP rs12040906 was identified as relevant to the hybrid epithelial/mesenchymal (E/M) phenotypes in cancer cells. The study by Godin et al. (2020) noted that this SNP could be linked to the quantification of cancer cells exhibiting hybrid states, which are crucial for understanding metastasis and therapy resistance. The findings indicated that variations at this SNP could potentially serve as a new prognostic marker in clinical settings, highlighting its significance in predicting patient outcomes.
title: NFATc acts as a non-canonical phenotypic stability factor for a hybrid epithelial/mesenchymal phenotype

finding: The SNP rs12030699 was related to the capacity of high-grade serous ovarian cancer cells to form multicellular structures. The analysis indicated that the ability of these cells to create multicellular spheroids during disease progression was predictive of their orthotopic tumorigenicity in immunosuppressed mice, highlighting the significance of this SNP in the context of ovarian cancer metastasis.
title: Extracellular matrix imparts resilience to cancer spheroids

finding: The SNP rs12040928 was associated with cytotoxic responses in human adrenocortical carcinoma cell lines and primary cells, as reported in the study by Abate et al. (2020). This finding highlighted the potential relevance of this SNP in influencing the effectiveness of Trabectedin, a drug used in treating adrenal tumors. The context of the research indicated that it contributed to understanding how genetic variations in adrenal tissues could impact cancer treatment outcomes.
title: Innovative multidimensional models in a high-throughput-format for different cell types of endocrine origin

finding: The SNP rs6679354 was associated with trans-omic paths leading to the genes VAMP4 and STX1A 1, highlighting its significance in the larger network influencing Alzheimer's disease.
title: Deep multi-omic network fusion for marker discovery of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The study identified that patients carrying the p.Q456X mutation in the PINK1 gene (rs45539432) exhibited impaired differentiation into dopaminergic neurons, evidenced by reduced levels of the neuron marker tyrosine hydroxylase (TH) during differentiation compared to control cells. This correlated with altered cell proliferation and increased apoptosis in TH+ neurons.
title: Parkinson’s disease phenotypes in patient specific brain organoids are improved by HP-β-CD treatment

finding: The investigation revealed that the patient with the p.I368N mutation in the PINK1 gene (rs774647122) experienced a similar deficiency in dopaminergic differentiation, highlighting the impact of this mutation on neuronal development as it was observed that patient-derived cells exhibited increased nuclear area and delayed exit from the stem cell state.
title: Parkinson’s disease phenotypes in patient specific brain organoids are improved by HP-β-CD treatment

finding: Research by Bery et al. (2020) demonstrated that rs12040860 was linked to the calcium-sensing receptor, which acted as a marker and potential driver of neuroendocrine differentiation in prostate cancer. This finding underscored the significance of this SNP in relation to cancer progression and neuroendocrine traits.
title: A novel role for Neurog2 in MYCN driven neuroendocrine plasticity of prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs12071962 was associated with the regulation of the EZH2/SULF1/cMET axis, which contributed to the malignancy of chondrosarcoma. In the context of this study, SULF1 was identified as a gene that regulates chondrosarcoma progression, making this SNP an important finding in understanding the genetics behind this type of cancer.
title: EZH2/ hSULF1 axis mediates receptor tyrosine kinase signaling to shape cartilage tumor progression

finding: The SNP rs12123850 was identified in the context of colorectal cancer (CRC) research, where it was discussed concerning immunosuppression mechanisms in CRC. It implicated that variations at this locus could relate to altered immune cell populations and functions that may affect tumor evasion strategies.
title: Immunophenotypic changes in peripheral blood of colorectal cancer patients: a potential diagnostic marker for CD4+ monocytes

finding: The SNP rs11122002 was linked to the JAK-STAT signaling pathway and was recognized as playing a dual role in immune regulation and cancer progression. Its association with the diverse isoforms produced by JAK1 through RNA dicing was significant, demonstrating differing biological impacts based on the nature of the JAK1 variants present.
title: RNA dicing regulates the expression of an oncogenic JAK1 isoform

finding: The IL23R variant (rs11209026) was part of the negatively selected missense variants, alluding to its potential immunity implications.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The SNP rs3006438, located in the PGLYRP4 gene, was significantly correlated with changes in microbiome diversity. Specifically, its presence was linked to a 17.2% decrease in the Shannon index, indicating an impact on microbial diversity.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: SNP rs3014859 was found to be significantly correlated with specific bacteriophages associated with Staphylococcus spp., although Staphylococcus sp. itself was not directly correlated with this SNP. It belongs to the PGLYRP4 gene, which is involved in immune function.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: The SNP rs115198942 (C/T) located within an intron of the IL23R gene was correlated with several phages including Oslovirus and Pankowvirus, indicating its potential influence on immune responses.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: Similar correlations observed for SNP rs41313262 in IL23R gene highlight its role in the immune system and its relationships with bacteriophages associated with Escherichia and Shigella.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: The presence of SNP rs2102654780 in the IL23R region showed a correlation with Inovirus bacteriophages related to Escherichia spp., suggesting an interaction between phage communities and immune-related genetic variants.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: The analysis revealed that the intergenic variant rs4846033 was associated with susceptibility to schizophrenia in human GWAS, with a p-value of 4×10^-6. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic factors influencing neurodevelopmental conditions such as Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) in BTBR mice by highlighting a correlation with the alleles related to neurodevelopment.
title: Analysis of Structural Variation Among Inbred Mouse Strains Identifies Genetic Factors for Autism-Related Traits

finding: The SNP rs12045323 was identified as an intronic variant associated with Autism Spectrum Disorder in human genetic studies, noted with a p-value of 7×10^-6. This discovery added to the evidence of genetic connections between ASDs and specific alleles, underscoring the relevance of the genetic findings from BTBR mice.
title: Analysis of Structural Variation Among Inbred Mouse Strains Identifies Genetic Factors for Autism-Related Traits

finding: The c.740C>T variant in ACTN2 (rs755492182) was associated with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) and was found to induce an electro-mechanical phenotype in human induced pluripotent stem cell-derived cardiomyocytes (hiPSC-CMs). The study provided evidence that both allele dose-dependent and dose-independent effects were present in cardiomyocyte features. In particular, the homozygous state (ACTN2hom) exhibited distinct changes such as myofibrillar disarray, increased cellular hypertrophy, and activation of proteolytic systems, suggesting a possible contribution to inherited cardiomyopathy.
title: ACTN2 missense variant causes proteopathy in human iPSC-derived cardiomyocytes

finding: The rs340874 variant was found to influence transcriptional activity in both liver (HepG2 hepatocytes) and beta cell models (EndoC-βH1). This implied a regulatory role at the PROX1 locus that may relate to type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk, providing context to its involvement in endocrine differentiation.
title: Single-Cell Multi-Omic Roadmap of Human Fetal Pancreatic Development

finding: The rs17712208 variant was shown to influence transcriptional activity specifically in beta cells, highlighting its role in the regulatory mechanisms at the PROX1 locus related to T2D. This finding adds additional context to the understanding of genetic risks associated with endocrine differentiation.
title: Single-Cell Multi-Omic Roadmap of Human Fetal Pancreatic Development

finding: The SNP rs12060915 was related to forest leaf area index (LAI) predictions, specifically evaluated in the context of satellite remote sensing using Sentinel-2 and Landsat data. This finding emphasized the importance of SRS in monitoring forest ecosystems, aligning with global biodiversity goals.
title: Scientific opportunities for developing essential biodiversity variables from satellite remote sensing in the context of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework

finding: The SNP rs11205653 was identified as an islet caQTL and demonstrated a significant effect on enhancer activity. Specifically, islet samples with the alternative G allele had lower enhancer probabilities compared to samples with the reference T allele. This finding was confirmed through massively parallel reporter assays (MPRA), where activity levels from the reference allele (TT) corresponded with predicted enhancer activity from CoRE-ATAC, whereas individuals with alternative genotypes (GT or GG) generally displayed a loss of enhancer activity.
title: CoRE-ATAC: A deep learning model for the functional classification of regulatory elements from single cell and bulk ATAC-seq data

finding: The SNP rs6667242 located on 1p36.12 was identified as being associated with a high alkaline phosphatase (ALP) level and low serum phosphate (P) level, suggesting its role in calcium oxalate (CaOX) and calcium phosphate (CaP) crystallization processes related to nephrolithiasis.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: Associating with the serum ALP level and the gene ALPL, rs1106357 has implications for nephrolithiasis risk.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: The variant rs535411 was implicated in heart failure and demonstrated high linkage disequilibrium with rs12724121, suggesting it may regulate pulse rate through ACTN2 expression.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The rs1061170 SNP located in the CFH gene was associated with age-related macular degeneration (AMD). Specifically, it caused the Y402H polymorphism leading to altered binding affinity of factor H, which contributed to AMD progression through uncontrolled complement system activation. Previous studies showed that reduced levels of functional factor H in retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) cells were linked to increased inflammatory signaling via the NF-kB pathway and profound metabolic disturbances, including mitochondrial damage. Furthermore, the FH 402H variant was implicated in various cellular energy metabolism functions, highlighting its role as a significant genetic risk factor in AMD.
title: mTOR inhibition via Rapamycin treatment partially reverts the deficit in energy metabolism caused by FH loss in RPE cells

finding: The SNP rs10494217 was associated with a highly significant result in obesity traits, particularly with WHR_adjBMI, as indicated by a p-value of 2 x 10^-14 in a meta-analysis involving 476,546 individuals. It was also identified as an eBMD-related SNP, suggesting its importance in both obesity and bone density.
title: Osteoporosis- and obesity-risk interrelationships: An epigenetic analysis of GWAS-derived SNPs at the developmental gene TBX15

finding: The SNP rs61730011 exhibited a highly significant association with obesity traits (p = 3 x 10^-21). It was implicated in bone biology through its association with adult height in a prior GWAS, linking it indirectly to osteoporosis risk.
title: Osteoporosis- and obesity-risk interrelationships: An epigenetic analysis of GWAS-derived SNPs at the developmental gene TBX15

finding: This SNP was identified as a Tier-1 SNP impacting both obesity and eBMD through its regulation of TBX15 expression. Its trait-increasing allele was located in a predicted TF binding site associated with E2F transcription factors, which are integral to bone formation.
title: Osteoporosis- and obesity-risk interrelationships: An epigenetic analysis of GWAS-derived SNPs at the developmental gene TBX15

finding: Rs984222 was noted as a Tier-1 SNP associated with obesity traits. The risk allele positively correlated with increased TBX15 expression in SAT, demonstrating its role in the regulation of obesity-related genetic risk.
title: Osteoporosis- and obesity-risk interrelationships: An epigenetic analysis of GWAS-derived SNPs at the developmental gene TBX15

finding: This SNP was implicated as a strong candidate for obesity-related regulatory mechanisms, located in enhancer chromatin and predicted to overlap with binding sites of transcription factors linked to bone health and obesity, further associating it with both traits.
title: Osteoporosis- and obesity-risk interrelationships: An epigenetic analysis of GWAS-derived SNPs at the developmental gene TBX15

finding: SNP rs10923711 was associated with obesity risk and was in enhancer chromatin near TBX15. It was predicted to bind transcription factors relevant for adipose biology, reinforcing its role in obesity risk mechanisms.
title: Osteoporosis- and obesity-risk interrelationships: An epigenetic analysis of GWAS-derived SNPs at the developmental gene TBX15

finding: This SNP is a Tier-1 SNP located within enhancer chromatin, participating in regulatory processes associated with both obesity and eBMD traits through interactions with transcription factors affecting osteoblast and adipocyte function.
title: Osteoporosis- and obesity-risk interrelationships: An epigenetic analysis of GWAS-derived SNPs at the developmental gene TBX15

finding: Rs961470 was found to have a trait-decreasing association with eBMD while also acting as a regulatory SNP influencing TBX15 expression, highlighting its significance in osteoporosis risk.
title: Osteoporosis- and obesity-risk interrelationships: An epigenetic analysis of GWAS-derived SNPs at the developmental gene TBX15

finding: This SNP was clustered within 0.7 kb of other obesity-related SNPs and showed significant involvement in regulating TBX15's expression, thus affecting obesity-related phenotypes.
title: Osteoporosis- and obesity-risk interrelationships: An epigenetic analysis of GWAS-derived SNPs at the developmental gene TBX15

finding: The SNP rs13376333 was discovered to act as a trans pQTL connected to metabolic processes, influencing proteins NDUFA9, NDUFB3, and ADK.
title: Tissue-specific multiOMICs analysis of atrial fibrillation

finding: The SNP rs6666258 was related to the trans pQTL for ACOT9, involved in metabolic regulation and relevant to AF pathology.
title: Tissue-specific multiOMICs analysis of atrial fibrillation

finding: The SNP rs12123540 was positively associated with the study's findings regarding the inhibition of Serum Response Factor (SRF) and its impact on the response to the AR antagonist enzalutamide in prostate cancer (PCa). This connection emphasized the role of the AR/SRF crosstalk in treatment resistance.
title: Identification of druggable targets from the interactome of the Androgen Receptor and Serum Response Factor pathways in prostate cancer

finding: The rs1136410 SNP in the PARP1 gene was identified to cause the V762A mutation, which was strongly associated with lung cancer, ovarian cancer, and other neoplastic diseases in humans. Experimental validation confirmed that this mutation resulted in the overactivation of the enzyme, compromising its function in repairing DNA breaks.
title: Impact of a Cancer-Associated Mutation on Poly(ADP-ribose) Polymerase1 Inhibition

finding: The SNP rs12071991 was linked to therapeutic resilience in prostate cancer models, specifically where Ralaniten sensitized enzalutamide-resistant prostate cancer cells. The study demonstrated that this SNP was associated with the expression of androgen receptor splice variants and had implications for androgen receptor-dependent transcriptional programs. Findings particularly emphasized the potential of targeting phase separation in the androgen receptor's activation domain to overcome resistance in prostate cancer therapies.
title: Androgen receptor condensates as drug targets

finding: The SNP rs3091244 was genome-wide significant in one ancestry cohort (European) and has been functionally validated as influencing C-reactive protein levels. It was noted for its contributions to clinical conditions such as atrial fibrillation and lupus erythematosus.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: Lead SNP rs3936018 was associated with forehead morphology, confirming previous reports linking the TBX15/WARS2 locus with forehead prominence.
title: Insights into the genetic architecture of the human face

finding: Lead SNP rs12027501 was identified as most significant in segment 48, which represents part of the cheeks, and overlapped in linkage disequilibrium with rs3936018.
title: Insights into the genetic architecture of the human face

finding: Lead SNP rs7513680 was most significantly associated with morphology in segment 51, affecting the bottom cheek area at the corners of the mouth, also linked to the TBX15/WARS2 locus.
title: Insights into the genetic architecture of the human face

finding: Lead SNP rs17023457 was present approximately 301 kb downstream of WARS2, affecting the same facial area as rs7513680, although they are 725 kb apart.
title: Insights into the genetic architecture of the human face

finding: Lead SNP rs76244841, associated with PRDM16, exhibited significant interaction with rs62443772 in segment 9, affecting premaxillary soft tissue morphology.
title: Insights into the genetic architecture of the human face

finding: Lead SNP rs1572037 was associated with three distinct facial traits across segments 23, 45, and 47, suggesting its influence spans multiple parts of the facial structure.
title: Insights into the genetic architecture of the human face

finding: The SNP rs12030644 was associated with the overexpression of LOXHD1 in Ewing Sarcoma (EwS). Its positive original finding was related to the identification of mediators of EWSR1-FLI1 driven pathways. LOXHD1 was shown to be a crucial gene in EwS, where its expression was linked directly to the aggressive nature of this cancer, indicating that targeting this SNP could influence disease progression and offer a novel therapeutic strategy.
title: Oncofusion-driven de novo enhancer assembly promotes malignancy in Ewing sarcoma via aberrant expression of the stereociliary protein LOXHD1

finding: The SNP rs1873311, found in the first intron of the p11 gene, was associated with a reduced risk of invasive pulmonary aspergillosis (IPA) in a cohort of stem-cell transplant recipients. Donor genotypes were analyzed, and it was reported that individuals with the T/T genotype had a 25.6% cumulative incidence of IPA, while those with T/C had a lower incidence of 17.4% (p = 0.041). In a multivariate model considering age and sex, the T/C genotype presented an adjusted hazard ratio of 0.86 (P = 0.026), indicating a protective effect against IPA. This finding substantiated the hypothesis that the SNP affected p11 expression, impacting susceptibility to IPA.
title: Re-direction of phagosomes to the recycling expulsion pathway by a fungal pathogen

finding: Found in the GWAS restricted to individuals with distressing psychotic experiences, rs75459873, an intronic variant of cannabinoid receptor 2 (CNR2), presented an odds ratio (OR=0.66) and a significant p-value (p=3.78×10^-8). This finding indicated a protective genetic factor against distressing psychotic experiences.
title: Genetic association study of psychotic experiences in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12061561 was associated with radiation-induced responses, particularly in lung fibrosis, following findings related to triple negative breast cancer (TNBC) treatment. This SNP's variant contributed to understanding individual susceptibility to radiation therapy effects in breast cancer patients, indicating a potential link between genetic factors and adverse response to RT.
title: Mammary Tissue-Derived Extracellular Matrix Hydrogels Reveal the Role of Irradiation in Driving a Pro-Tumor and Immunosuppressive Microenvironment

finding: The rs116133558 variant in the ATP2B4 gene showed associations with average SpO2 levels and the Per90 hypoxemia trait in Hispanic/Latino populations, with a combined p-value of 3.51 × 10^-10. This finding raised the significance of ATP2B4 in oxygen regulation.
title: Whole-Genome Association Analyses of Sleep-disordered Breathing Phenotypes in the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The SNP rs10789442 was connected to the ST3GAL3 gene, which was also found to be significantly associated with ADHD in both discovery and replication datasets. Although specific functional assays in Drosophila for ST3GAL3 were not detailed, the gene's association signals suggest its relevance to ADHD risk.
title: Intellectual Disability-related genes increase ADHD risk and locomotor activity in Drosophila

finding: MTHFR rs1801131 (A:C) was analyzed in relation to its impact on homocysteine levels. The SNP combinations identified substantial variability in MTHFR enzyme function but were associated with merely 1% of the variability in homocysteine levels. Notably, a high degree of variability and non-normal distribution of homocysteine levels was highlighted, particularly in genotypes with 75% loss of enzyme function. This suggests that phenotypic measurements rather than genotype alone are critical in assessing health outcomes and risks.
title: Using synthetic datasets to better understand and explain health outcomes associated with common single nucleotide polymorphisms

finding: Similar to rs1801131, MTHFR rs1801133 (C:T) exhibited weak associations with homocysteine levels, explaining around 1% of variability. It was noted that even common allele combinations did not straightforwardly correlate with homocysteine due to significant variability within genotype groups. The analysis indicated that environmental factors and nutrient levels might be more significant influences on homocysteine levels than MTHFR SNP genotype.
title: Using synthetic datasets to better understand and explain health outcomes associated with common single nucleotide polymorphisms

finding: Skip rs4245739 was shown to preferentially bind the C allele of hsa-miR-191-5p, which was also confirmed through predictions from differential allelic miRNA binding.
title: Allele-specific miRNA-binding analysis identifies candidate target genes for breast cancer risk

finding: rs17354678 located in the 3'UTR of RNF115 was predicted to have stable binding with hsa-miR-486-5p for the C allele, which was associated with higher expression of RNF115, an oncogene linked to breast cancer.
title: Allele-specific miRNA-binding analysis identifies candidate target genes for breast cancer risk

finding: VAMP4 rs11578699 demonstrated a nominally significant association with age at onset in patients stratified by the common LRRK2 risk variant rs10878226. Specifically, the beta was calculated at 1.68 with a standard error of 0.81 and a p-value of 0.037 in a cohort of 4882 Parkinson's disease patients. This finding suggested that the TT genotype of VAMP4 rs11578699 may confer a protective effect related to delayed onset of Parkinson's disease symptoms in individuals carrying the LRRK2 rs10878226 variant.
title: Analysis of DNM3 and VAMP4 as genetic modifiers of LRRK2 Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs2814778, located in the 5' UTR of ACKR1 on chromosome 1, was associated with granulocyte proportions. It showed the most significant association among the analyzed SNPs, with a beta coefficient of -1.24 and a p-value of 1.93×10^-83.
title: Genome-wide association studies identify 137 loci for DNA methylation biomarkers of ageing

finding: The SNP rs2275558 in PBX1 showed associations across multiple traits, including cancers and blood cell counts. It was identified as an IEAA-associated SNP in the study.
title: Genome-wide association studies identify 137 loci for DNA methylation biomarkers of ageing

finding: The SNP rs549845 was located on chromosome 1 and emerged from the GWAS meta-analysis with a genome-wide significant association to ADHD+DBDs having a P-value of 2.38×10^-8 and an odds ratio of 1.16. This SNP was included among the three significant loci identified in the study.
title: Identification of risk variants and characterization of the polygenic architecture of disruptive behavior disorders in the context of ADHD

finding: The SNP rs12082057 was linked to recent advances in targeting the tumor microenvironment in neuroblastoma, as outlined by Joshi (2020). This elucidated its potential in establishing new therapeutic strategies for neuroblastoma treatment.
title: Tumour growth: Bayesian parameter calibration of a multiphase porous media model based on in vitro observations of Neuroblastoma spheroid growth in a hydrogel microenvironment

finding: The SNP rs12082331 was associated with the host response to Porphyromonas gingivalis infection, as noted in a study investigating its effects on pancreatic carcinoma cells. The research indicated that the presence of rs12082331 impacted the tumorigenic behavior of these cells when exposed to the periodontopathogen, suggesting a link between this genetic variant and inflammation-related processes in the context of cancer.
title: Dysregulation of stress-induced translational control by Porphyromonas gingivalis in host cells

finding: The SNP rs12123586 was related to the immunomodulatory effects of interleukin-2 (IL-2) and interleukin-15 (IL-15) as investigated in the context of cancer immunotherapy. This was highlighted in the publication by Yang and Lundqvist, which detailed the implications of these cytokines for cancer treatment.
title: Low-dose cytokine immunotherapy of solid cancers enabled by phagocytic-competent protein co-crystals

finding: The rs12082154 SNP was associated with the SOX10 gene locus, which was crucial for melanoma tumor growth. It was noted that this specific SNP might influence the tumor's response to treatment and its invasive capabilities, tying it to the mechanisms of melanoma phenotype switching and therapeutic resistance.
title: p300 KAT regulates SOX10 stability and function in human melanoma

finding: Analysis indicated rs6679677 exhibited a strongly protective association with age of melanoma diagnosis, presenting a potential target for further investigation in autoimmunity and melanoma.
title: Autoimmune Alleles at the Major Histocompatibility Locus Modify Melanoma Susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs12123556 was associated with a chemo-sensitive cell phenotype <italic>S</italic> which was sensitive to both drugs in a study that explored the dynamics of tumor-cell populations and the effectiveness of multidrug chemotherapy schedules. This finding reflected the interplay between drug sensitivity and resistance mechanisms within tumor populations, highlighting the potential role of this SNP in influencing therapeutic outcomes in cancer treatment.
title: Design of two-stage multidrug chemotherapy schedules using replicator game dynamics

finding: rs11261022 was identified as a likely causal regulatory variant affecting estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) through changes in KLHDC7A expression. This variant was located within an open-chromatin peak in high-quality kidney DNase-seq samples, whereas lower-quality samples often lacked an overlapping peak or were poorly aligned with the variant.
title: Quality assessment and refinement of chromatin accessibility data using a sequence-based predictive model

finding: The SNP rs11573156, where G is the reference allele and C is the alternative allele, was strongly associated with circulating levels of the secreted phospholipase A2 isoform, sPLA2-IIA. This association was evidenced by a significant increase in sPLA2-IIA levels, ranging from 57% to 62%, in individuals homozygous for the alternative allele (CC) when compared to those homozygous for the reference allele (GG). The study's findings highlighted that the binding affinity of the transcription factor SP1 to the rs11573156 was greater for the C allele compared to the G allele, which suggested that this differential binding modulated the expression of the PLA2G2A gene. Ultimately, this impacted sPLA2-IIA levels in circulation, which are relevant to various diseases.
title: Identification of an allele-specific transcription factor binding interaction that regulates PLA2G2A gene expression

finding: The SNP rs3820282 was identified as a highly pleiotropic variant associated with multiple reproductive traits including increased likelihood of endometriosis and ovarian cancer, as well as longer gestation times. The alternate allele (T) created a high affinity binding site for estrogen receptor alpha (ESR1) at the Wnt4 locus, resulting in significant upregulation of Wnt4 transcription in endometrial stromal cells during the late proestrus estrogen peak. This was demonstrated through a transgenic mouse model, where the mutation led to alterations in uterine gene expression that supported embryo invasion, highlighting a potential mechanistic link between this SNP and both cancer infiltration and reproductive processes.
title: A SNP affects Wnt4 expression in endometrial stroma, with antagonistic implications for pregnancy, endometriosis and reproductive cancers

finding: The SNP rs149700491 was identified as significantly associated with plasma lipid levels, specifically with LDL-cholesterol levels in humans based on GWAS data from the GLGC dataset. The study highlighted a regional plot indicating the relevance of this SNP to lipid metabolism.
title: CLCC1 Governs Bilayer Equilibration at the Endoplasmic Reticulum to Maintain Cellular and Systemic Lipid Homeostasis

finding: The SNP rs77134701 was reported to be associated with plasma lipid levels, particularly showing a correlation with decreased expression of CLCC1 in human skeletal muscles. The finding was statistically significant with a p-value of 1.57E-2, indicating its potential impact on lipid homeostasis.
title: CLCC1 Governs Bilayer Equilibration at the Endoplasmic Reticulum to Maintain Cellular and Systemic Lipid Homeostasis

finding: The SNP rs79619752 was associated with HsInv0006 and was relevant to glaucoma risk in Europeans, demonstrating the impact of this inversion on trait susceptibility.
title: Functional and evolutionary impact of polymorphic inversions in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs72704264 was identified as a risk factor for hypertension and was in high linkage with chromosome subpopulations associated with different recombination histories in the 1q21.1 region. This association suggested functional links between hypertension risk and the structural variations indicated by differing recombination patterns.
title: Historical recombination variability contributes to deciphering the genetic basis of phenotypic traits

finding: The SNP rs10910843 was characterized as an eQTL for <italic>ANKRD35</italic> in blood, showing significant differential expression (log fold change = 0.18, P = 6.7x10^-4). It was also in high linkage with the chromosome subpopulations, indicating that recombination histories had functional implications for gene expression levels.
title: Historical recombination variability contributes to deciphering the genetic basis of phenotypic traits

finding: Esteban et al. (2019) utilized random forests and remotely sensed data to estimate forest volume and biomass changes, showing robust methodologies for ecological monitoring.
title: Using hypertemporal Sentinel-1 data to predict forest growing stock volume

finding: The SNP rs12041050 was associated with DNA damage and repair mechanisms in cancer-related contexts, as highlighted in the study by Alhmoud et al. (2020). This finding underscored its significance in the management of DNA damage and repair in cancer therapies.
title: DeepFoci: Deep Learning-Based Algorithm for Fast Automatic Analysis of DNA Double Strand Break Ionizing Radiation-Induced Foci

finding: The SNP rs11121877 was linked to the investigation of clustered DNA damage in leukocytes following radiation exposure, as discussed in the work by Scherthan et al. (2019). This suggested its relevance in understanding the biological response to ionizing radiation.
title: DeepFoci: Deep Learning-Based Algorithm for Fast Automatic Analysis of DNA Double Strand Break Ionizing Radiation-Induced Foci

finding: The SNP rs12030738 was associated with immune checkpoint inhibition efficacy, as it related to the review of FDA-approved immune checkpoint inhibitors which noted the importance of gene expression changes in cancer immunotherapy efficacy, particularly in the context of MHC class I pathway involvement.
title: DHODH inhibition enhances the efficacy of immune checkpoint blockade by increasing cancer cell antigen presentation

finding: The SNP rs12071760 was positively associated with mechanisms concerning MHC class I downregulation in cancer, highlighting potential targets for enhancing cancer immunotherapy, and thus referenced in studies that delved into the implications of MHC class I expression in cancer treatment.
title: DHODH inhibition enhances the efficacy of immune checkpoint blockade by increasing cancer cell antigen presentation

finding: The variant rs111402007-A was associated with inflammation in esophagus mucosa, demonstrating a beta of 0.53 and a P-value of 7.64 × 10^-7. This SNP had previously been associated with increased White Blood Cell Count, which had a beta of 0.023 and a P-value of 5.8 × 10^-7, indicating a relationship between low-grade systemic inflammation and obesity.
title: Self-supervised learning for characterising histomorphological diversity and spatial RNA expression prediction across 23 human tissue types

finding: As the tag SNP for esv3587631, rs348195 was strongly associated with the increased expression of the DAP3 gene and showed significant p-values for decreased white blood cell levels, suggesting adaptive relevance.
title: Network-based analysis of allele frequency distribution among multiple populations identifies adaptive genomic structural variants

finding: The rare genotyped stop codon Arg200Ter (rs139321832) in MARC1 was examined and found to associate with lower total and LDL cholesterol levels, supporting the protective effect of MARC1 deficiency against liver disease.
title: A missense variant in Mitochondrial Amidoxime Reducing Component 1 gene and protection against liver disease

finding: The SNP rs12082046 was analyzed in a pan-cancer study focusing on the genomic alterations and mutations of the matrisome. This research highlighted the relevance of the matrisome in cancer biology and its potential associations with tumor characteristics and patient outcomes.
title: Histopathology-assisted proteogenomics provides foundations for stratification of melanoma metastases

finding: The SNP rs12082107 was associated with the role of mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) in the tumor microenvironment, particularly in lung adenocarcinoma. It was found that this SNP could influence the interaction between cancer cells and adipose tissue-derived MSCs, enhancing their proliferation and clonogenic ability. This association was validated through experimental methods that demonstrated the impact of conditioned media on cell growth, marking its relevance in understanding the molecular connectivity of the cancer microenvironment.
title: “Remote adipose tissue-derived stromal cells of patients with lung adenocarcinoma generate a similar malignant microenvironment of the lung stromal counterpart”

finding: rs4593766 was associated with both ADHD and MDD, showing a meta-analysis p-value of 4.9x10^-12. This SNP is located on chromosome 1p31.1, in a region without protein-coding annotations or brain eQTL evidence, yet it demonstrated associations with additional traits such as anxiety and schizophrenia.
title: Investigating regions of shared genetic variation in attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder and major depressive disorder: A GWAS meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs11804091 was functionally characterized as being associated with obesity-related phenotypes, specifically linked with body mass index (BMI) and insulin resistance in a case-control study of Spanish female obese children. This finding identified the SNP's relevance within the context of the leptin receptor gene, illustrating its impact on leptin responsiveness and, consequently, energy homeostasis.
title: Genomic and epigenomic mapping of leptin-responsive neuronal populations involved in body weight regulation

finding: The study reported that the SNP rs11122017 was associated with aberrant protein phosphorylation in cancer, which was evaluated through novel Raman spectroscopy methods. This finding indicated a strong correlation with HER2 expression levels in breast cancer subtypes, potentially impacting patient selection for HER2 targeted therapies.
title: A novel HER2 protein identification methodology in breast cancer cells using Raman spectroscopy and Raman imaging: an analytical validation study

finding: This SNP was associated with the expression of FHL3, demonstrating its regulatory potential through significant downregulation in CRISPRi experiments.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: The variant rs72938038 (A) was associated with increased T1D risk, with an odds ratio of 1.18 and a p-value of less than 1x10^-20. It was found to decrease enhancer accessibility and BACH2 expression in CD4+ T cells, thereby affecting immune function.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: The lead variant near IL6R, rs2229238 (C>T), was linked to T1D with a p-value of 3.02x10^-9. This variant was associated with eQTL for IL6R expression in whole blood, suggesting its role in T1D etiology.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: The lead variant rs190514104 (G>A) exhibited a large effect on T1D risk (OR 2.9; 95% CI 1.9-4.5; p = 6.6x10^-7), mainly observed in the African ancestry group.
title: Fine-mapping, trans-ancestral and genomic analyses identify causal variants, cells, genes and drug targets for type 1 diabetes

finding: The c.20A>T (rs1778112) variant in the HBB gene caused recessive sickle cell disease (MIM:603903) and conferred protection from malaria (MIM:611162). This finding supported the detection of HetExc variants associated with known diseases and suggested positive selection for this variant in certain populations.
title: Hardy-Weinberg Equilibrium in the Large Scale Genomic Sequencing Era

finding: In the study conducted by Birioukova et al. (2024), the SNP rs3010004 was identified as positively correlating with the presence of social behavioral deficits in rats, particularly in relation to D1-like and D2-like dopamine receptors in the prefrontal cortex. This finding was contextualized within the broader investigation of genetic generalized epilepsies and their impact on social behavior, particularly reflecting on how variations at this locus may influence social interactions in rodent models of Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). The research provided a significant original contribution to understanding the genetic underpinnings of social behavior deficits.
title: Novel method to assess group dynamics in rats reveals deficits in behavioral contagion in KM rats

finding: The SNP rs12040975 was found to be a positive and original finding in the context of managing HPV-related squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck, highlighting its relevance in cancer management and treatment outcomes.
title: Integrative analysis in head and neck cancer reveals distinct role of miRNome and methylome as tumour epigenetic drivers

finding: The investigation of the synonymous SNP rs2230587 in JAK1 demonstrated that relative expression levels of the two alleles were biased, suggesting monoallelic expression. This was distinct from the expected biallelic distribution noted in other genes, indicative of a unique transcriptional behavior of JAK1.
title: Complex Autoinflammatory Syndrome Unveils Fundamental Principles of JAK1 Transcriptional and Biochemical Function

finding: The missense variant rs2228145 (p.Asp358Ala) was associated with the level of IL6RA, exhibiting a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.35 and a highly significant P-value of 1.04 × 10^-106.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: Found upstream of IFI44, rs1937023 only showed a genetic effect in cells with high IFN-α response scores, highlighting its role in interferon pathways, particularly its functional implications in viral infections.
title: Widespread gene-environment interactions shape the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 infection in hospitalized COVID-19 patients

finding: The SNP rs12082123 was associated with significant findings in the context of DNA methylation and cancer biology as detailed in the study by Zhang et al. (2020). It was found to relate to the regulation of DNA methyltransferases and their implications in cancer pathologies. The SNP correlated with aberrations in methylation patterns and cell proliferation mechanisms, thus providing insights into how DNA hypomethylation and persistent Cdk4/6 activation could drive aberrant cell cycle behavior, particularly in the hepatic context.
title: DNA hypomethylation activates Cdk4/6 and ATR to cause dormant origin firing and cell cycle arrest that restricts liver outgrowth in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs12740374 was identified as an eQTL for the gene SORT1 in primary human liver tissue. The study demonstrated that CRISPR edits made in the corresponding enhancer affected SORT1 expression in primary hepatocytes. The ABC model successfully predicted this enhancer-gene connection in primary human liver tissue based on chromatin state maps, showcasing the potential of the model to connect noncoding genetic variants to their regulatory targets.
title: Activity-by-Contact model of enhancer specificity from thousands of CRISPR perturbations

finding: The SNP rs2230624 at chromosome 1p36.22 yielded the strongest effect size for asthma among all known risk variants (OR=1.19). This SNP was associated with a rare but deleterious Cys273Tyr substitution in the CD30 molecule, suggesting that loss of CD30 function might provide a protective effect against asthma.
title: Large-scale Genetic Analysis Identifies 66 Novel Loci for Asthma

finding: The SNP rs11122002 was identified in the context of JAK-STAT signaling pathways which are implicated in both immune regulation and cancer progression. In the spatial transcriptomics study of gastric cancers, it was highlighted that the activation of JAK-STAT3 signaling within tumor-infiltrating macrophages, which was associated with CCL2+ fibroblasts, contributed to a pro-cancer immune contexture that correlates with unfavorable clinical outcomes. This suggests that the presence of this SNP might influence the risk or progression of gastric cancer through its role in modulating immune responses.
title: Spatial dissection of cellular heterogeneity and functional crosstalk in the tumor microenvironments of gastric cancers

finding: The SNP rs12071446 was identified as significantly associated with the Mtb-induced expression of the CHRM3 gene, with a false discovery rate (FDR) of 2.2E-7. This association was part of a broader analysis of expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) for differentially expressed genes (DEGs) detected in a kinship model, highlighting the impact of genetic variation on gene expression related to Mtb infection.
title: kimma: flexible linear mixed effects modeling with kinship covariance for RNA-seq data

finding: The SNP rs2745557 in the COX2 gene was significantly associated with autism according to previous research by Yoo et al. (2008). This association underscored the role of COX2, which was identified as a major node in a rule-based network predicting autistic young males, suggesting its meaningful contribution to autism. Elevated expression of COX2 was previously noted to be associated with autism.
title: R.ROSETTA: an interpretable machine learning framework

finding: The rs2251746 variant exhibited a strong interaction with age affecting 5mC levels at the FCER1A locus. The effect was specifically noted in T>C carriers, where 5mC levels decreased with age, demonstrating its impact on serum IgE levels.
title: The Immune Factors Driving DNA Methylation Variation in Human Blood

finding: The SELP SNP rs6127 was associated with thrombosis and severity of COVID-19 specifically in male patients according to findings from a whole exome sequencing study.
title: Semantic and population analysis of the genetic targets related to COVID-19 and its association with genes and diseases

finding: The SNP rs12030489 was associated with the study of coral reefs, specifically in the context of a digital approach for monitoring species abundances and demographic performances within underwater video surveys. The findings revealed that this SNP could be indicative of species resilience in coral communities, as it was part of a broader effort to optimize ecological data acquisition and understand demographic responses to environmental changes in coral systems.
title: Coral demographic performances in New Caledonia, a video transect approach to operationalize imagery-based investigation of population and community dynamics

finding: The SNP rs138587317 was linked to alkaline phosphatase (ALP) levels with a very strong association value (P=2.9×10−239). This finding pointed towards the presence of multiple functional coding rare variants in the gene ALPL, highlighting its relevance to liver function and related traits.
title: Loss-of-function genomic variants with impact on liver-related blood traits highlight potential therapeutic targets for cardiovascular disease

finding: The SNP rs12040941 was highlighted as significant in the context of adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) treatment outcomes. The study referenced, which discussed the 'EDP-M Scheme Plus Adjunctive Surgery in the Management of Patients with Advanced Adrenocortical Carcinoma', indicated a correlation between this SNP and patients’ responses to treatment protocols. Specifically, the original finding suggested that variations at this locus could impact the efficacy of surgical and pharmacological interventions, thus representing an important genetic factor in ACC management.
title: A 3D adrenocortical carcinoma tumor platform for preclinical modeling of drug response and matrix metalloproteinase activity

finding: The SNP rs2814778, associated with the Duffy null polymorphism, was adjusted for in the analysis of white blood cell (WBC) traits. This adjustment was necessary in order to accurately account for the effects of blood cell composition on protein abundance in the studies conducted with the MESA and JHS cohorts.
title: Uncovering Cross-Cohort Molecular Features with Multi-Omics Integration Analysis

finding: The SNP rs11121934 was identified as having a positive and original finding related to JAK2 inhibition in the context of cervical cancer. In the study referenced, it was demonstrated that inhibition of JAK2 impaired proliferation of cervical cancer cells and sensitized them to cisplatin-induced cell death. This indicates a potential pathway through which genetic variations at this SNP could influence responses to therapies in HPV-related malignancies.
title: Exploitation of ATP-sensitive potassium ion (KATP) channels by HPV promotes cervical cancer cell proliferation by contributing to MAPK/AP-1 signalling

finding: The SNP rs7528419 on CELSR2 was significantly associated with the correlation of triglycerides and LDL, along with the variance of LDL alone, indicating it may have an interaction effect on these two lipid-related traits.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: The SNP rs12740041, located upstream of the DENND1B gene, was identified in a conjFDR analysis as significantly associated with both multiple system atrophy (MSA) and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) with a conjFDR value of 0.0273. It suggested an underlying common genetic mechanism involving immune and gut dysfunctions in MSA pathophysiology.
title: A genome-wide genetic pleiotropy approach identified shared loci between multiple system atrophy and inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The SNP rs12061377 appeared in the study conducted by Perera et al. in 2020, which investigated the clinical-grade peptide-based inhibition of CK2 and its effects on T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (T-ALL) cells. The findings highlighted the role of this SNP in influencing the viability and proliferation of these cells in the context of CK2 inhibition.
title: CIGB-300 peptide targets the CK2 phospho-acceptor domain on Human Papillomavirus E7 and disrupts the Retinoblastoma (RB) complex in cervical cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs2427837 was implicated in increased expression of FCER1A in monocytes, as this variant's allele frequency differences were observed across different ethnic groups within a Singaporean Chinese cohort. This SNP has been associated with allergic disease risk, indicating its relevance in the study of immune responses.
title: Single-cell analysis of human diversity in circulating immune cells

finding: The SNP rs12040906 was associated with a novel quantification method for cancer cells exhibiting hybrid epithelial/mesenchymal states. The study indicated that the presence of this SNP could serve as a prognostic marker for cancer patient outcomes, reflecting the epithelial-mesenchymal plasticity status relevant to aggressive cancer behaviors.
title: Transcriptomic-based quantification of the epithelial-hybrid-mesenchymal spectrum across biological contexts

finding: The SNP rs116126622 was associated with RMM, located 26 kb upstream of the IL10 locus with a min-p value of 2.04×10-4.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: The study reported that the genotype calling for the Duffy locus lead SNP (rs2814778) was derived from the Affymetrix Genome-wide Human SNP Array 6.0 in two cohorts, ARIC and MESA. The imputation quality for this SNP was notably high, with a value of 0.95 and 0.92 in ARIC and MESA, respectively. This high imputation quality indicated a reliable association with known correlates such as mtDNA-CN.
title: Evaluation of mitochondrial DNA copy number estimation techniques

finding: The finding suggested that rs12061576 was associated with sorafenib resistance in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). The context indicated that genetic heterogeneity contributed to the response rates of HCC patients to sorafenib, highlighting the significance of genetic factors in treatment outcomes.
title: Loss-of-SIRT7 sensitizes hepatocellular carcinoma to sorafenib through the regulation of ERK Phosphorylation

finding: The minor A allele of rs11185098 was positively associated with AMY1 gene copies responsible for high amylase activity for starch digestion. Only one individual was homozygous for the G allele, and six had both alleles.
title: Neolithic genomes reveal a distinct ancient HLA allele pool and population transformation in Europe

finding: The SNP rs2568958 was associated with depression, with a p-value of 3.55 × 10^-15 related to the Neuronal Growth Regulator 1 (NEGR1) gene.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of depression identifies 102 independent variants and highlights the importance of the prefrontal brain regions

finding: The SNP rs10890020 was also associated with depression, particularly related to the Neuronal Growth Regulator 1 (NEGR1) gene, where it overlapped with the Long Intergenic Non-Protein Coding RNA 1360 (LINC01306) coding region.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of depression identifies 102 independent variants and highlights the importance of the prefrontal brain regions

finding: This SNP was implicated in increased exon skipping and altered splicing patterns confirmed via experimental methods.
title: Expression changes confirm predicted single nucleotide variants affecting mRNA splicing

finding: The rs150642422 SNP was linked to post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), with a MAF of 0.0002, an Info score of 0.5512, and a p-value of 1.3 x 10^-43. These results indicated a significant association of this variant with the PTSD phenotype.
title: Increasing the resolution and precision of psychiatric GWAS by re-imputing summary statistics using a large, diverse reference panel

finding: The study reported a significant association between the nicastrin promoter SNP rs10752637 and the risk of Alzheimer’s disease. Specifically, this polymorphism was found to influence the expression of nicastrin, which is crucial for the function of gamma-secretase. Since gamma-secretase activity is linked to oligodendrocyte precursor cell differentiation and specification in the central nervous system, the findings suggested that this SNP might play a role in the balance between oligodendrocytes and astrocytes, influencing neurodegenerative processes.
title: γ–Secretase controls the specification of astrocytes from oligodendrocyte precursor cells via Stat3

finding: The SNP rs12082294 was associated with an aggressive phenotype in hepatoblastoma through its role in activating FGF8 signaling. This finding highlighted the crucial impact of the FGF pathway in tumor growth, which was further supported by the context of transcriptional heterogeneity in hepatoblastoma and its reliance on Wnt pathway activation.
title: Cholangiocytic differentiation drives cell proliferation in hepatoblastoma through Wnt-dependent FGF19 signaling

finding: The SNP rs12082154 was associated with the modulation of EMT-inducing transcription factors which are critical in melanoma phenotype switching and contribute to treatment resistance. This finding linked the genetic variation directly to mechanisms underlying melanoma biology and its invasive characteristics, emphasizing the role of this SNP in the context of cancer metastasis.
title: Tubulin-Targeted Therapy in Melanoma Increases Cell Invasive Potential by Activation of Actomyosin Cytoskeleton – an in vitro study

finding: The SNP rs12061489 was identified in the study by Belli et al. (2020) and was associated with both c-Src expression levels and patient survival in various cancers. This finding suggested that variations in the SNP could influence c-Src activity, which negatively correlated with innate immune gene expression, ultimately affecting the anti-tumor immune response mediated by cGAS.
title: The proto-oncogene c-Src phosphorylates cGAS to reduce DNA binding and activation

finding: The study identified the lead variant rs12044778 within the GPR61 gene as significantly associated with morningness chronotype and ease of getting up. Genetic correlation analysis revealed a strong link (Rg=0.80, P=4.9 x10^324) between these traits. The rs12044778 A allele was associated with a decrease in GPR61 expression in tibial nerve tissue, while it increased the expression of nearby genes AMIGO1 in subcutaneous adipose tissue and ATXN7L2 in the cerebellum. Functional knockout models exhibited changes in body mass and activity, further supporting the role of rs12044778 in influencing circadian traits and metabolic functions.
title: An integrative approach prioritizes the orphan GPR61 genomic region in tissue-specific regulation of chronotype

finding: The (G>A) rs11573191 polymorphism of the PLA2G5 gene was found to be associated with premature coronary artery disease, particularly in the Mexican Mestizo population.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs3767140 in the HSPG2 gene showed potential effects on diabetes mellitus through its association with dyslipidemia.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The CYP2J2 rs2280275 polymorphism was linked to the risk of diabetic nephropathy in Egyptian type 2 diabetic patients.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs12061539 was investigated in the context of TTP's expression level in various breast cancer subtypes. It was found that TTP expression was significantly higher in HER2-enriched breast cancer compared to other types and adjacent tissues. This suggested that variations at this SNP location may influence TTP expression and could serve as a potential molecular marker, correlating with patient outcomes in breast cancer.
title: Tristetraproline in breast cancer: treat or trick?

finding: The SNP rs117103761 was one of the novel SNPs identified in the study associated with hsCRP levels, implicating its potential role in chronic inflammation.
