finding: This SNP showcased paternal associations with various obesity-related traits, supporting the hypothesis of imprinted paternal expression in the context of genetic predispositions to obesity.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: Demonstrated paternal associations with significant traits related to metabolism and obesity, reinforcing its potential role within the imprinted region at locus 1q25.2.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs1047303, a stabilized N367T variant of the SDR HSD3B1, was associated with resistance to androgen deprivation therapies in castration-resistant prostate cancers. Approximately 30% of the population carried this variant, which allowed prostate cancer cells to self-sufficiently produce pro-proliferative androgens, suggesting that it may impact the effectiveness of treatments.
title: SDR enzymes oxidize specific lipidic alkynylcarbinols into cytotoxic protein-reactive species

finding: Identified in the FDA5 PRS, this SNP is located within the gene RHOU, which is associated with type 2 diabetes. It was significantly associated with obesity risk in the studied children.
title: Polygenic risk score based on weight gain trajectories is predictive of childhood obesity

finding: The SNP rs2814778, known as the Duffy-null allele (FY*O), was identified as protective against the malaria parasite Plasmodium vivax infection. This finding came from an analysis of the admixed population of Cabo Verde, where it was hypothesized that admixture facilitated rapid adaptation to the malaria parasite. The allele was almost fixed in West African populations and was associated with reduced expression of Duffy antigens on blood cells, which led to decreased susceptibility to infection by P. vivax. The study highlighted the strong selection pressures acting on this locus, marking it as one of the strongest examples of natural selection in human history.
title: Rapid adaptation to malaria facilitated by admixture in the human population of Cabo Verde

finding: The analysis of SNP rs12123723 was linked to the CCR2/MCP-1 chemokine pathway and its role in lung adenocarcinoma. The context provided by the study revealed that this SNP was associated with the modulation of inflammatory responses pertinent to tumor microenvironments, thereby demonstrating its potential importance as a genetic factor influencing cancer progression.
title: Molecular determinants of antagonist interactions with chemokine receptors CCR2 and CCR5

finding: The synonymous variant rs201404149 in MTFR1L was identified as influencing mean reaction time and was relevant to cognitive processes, particularly in Alzheimer's contexts.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The missense variant rs146766120 in AMIGO1 was associated with episodic memory, which directs its relevance to cognitive resilience and function.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The intronic variant rs11589562 in MAST2 was associated with visual attention, emphasizing its connection to cognitive processing frameworks.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The SNP rs12123556 was associated with the response to chemotherapy in tumor populations. It was identified as having a significant impact on the dynamics of both sensitive and resistant cell populations within the context of adaptive chemotherapy models. The findings suggested that variations at this locus contributed to how effectively the sensitive sub-population could be maintained under chemotherapy control, influencing the likelihood of resistant populations taking over as responsive tumor growth tactics were altered.
title: Stochastic competitive release and adaptive chemotherapy

finding: The SNP rs45461499 was identified in the CDC20 gene, which is related to acute lymphoblastic leukemia. It was reported as a clinically relevant genetic risk locus and was shown to harbor protein-RNA interaction sites, thus indicating its potential involvement in the disease.
title: Transcriptome-wide high-throughput mapping of protein-RNA occupancy profiles using POP-seq

finding: The rs10127939 SNP, associated with the FcγR3A receptor, was linked to variations in the proportion of NK cells degranulating in response to targets opsonized with anti-CD235a antibodies in individuals. This highlighted distinct cellular responses in MIS-C, contributing to the understanding of immune dysregulation in the syndrome.
title: Antibody-mediated cellular responses are dysregulated in Multisystem Inflammatory Syndrome in Children (MIS-C)

finding: The rs396991 SNP, also associated with the FcγR3A receptor, showed similar results to rs10127939 in terms of NK cell functionality. The findings indicated a relationship between this SNP and the altered immune response observed in MIS-C, reinforcing the notion of antibody-mediated cellular response dysregulation in this condition.
title: Antibody-mediated cellular responses are dysregulated in Multisystem Inflammatory Syndrome in Children (MIS-C)

finding: Associated with the CDK11A gene, rs2843128 demonstrated colocalization with sQTL data, revealing a relationship between its genotype and splicing of exon 6. Findings indicated that this variant's presence was associated with greater risk of COPD and correlated with splicing behavior that could influence gene function.
title: Analysis of genetically driven alternative splicing identifies FBXO38 as a novel COPD susceptibility gene

finding: This SNP was linked to splicing in the CDK11A gene and showed colocalization with sQTL data. Genotype analysis pointed to increased skipping of exon 6 in transmissions related to COPD risk, suggesting a protective mechanism through alternate splicing.
title: Analysis of genetically driven alternative splicing identifies FBXO38 as a novel COPD susceptibility gene

finding: The SNP rs10798002 was associated with telomere length (TL) through a locus in the SWT1 gene, and it was identified as a lead SNP in one of the trans-ancestral genome-wide association studies (GWASs) involving 644,553 individuals. This association reinforced the understanding that genetic determinants can influence TL.
title: Unraveling the causal genes and transcriptomic determinants of human telomere length

finding: SNP rs12061584 showed a significant relationship with optimized light delivery during personalized PDT. The study indicated that this SNP may play a role in determining individual responses to light doses in cancer therapies, highlighting its relevance in tailoring treatment strategies based on genetic profiles.
title: In vivo, online label-free monitoring of heterogenous oxygen utilization during phototherapy with real-time ultrasound-guided photoacoustic imaging

finding: The SNP rs12092579 was associated with metabolic changes and polarization processes in tumor-associated macrophages. Specifically, it was linked to the modulation of these macrophages in the context of lung adenocarcinoma, impacting the tumor microenvironment and immune response.
title: Spatiotemporal Profiling Unveiling the Cellular Organization Patterns and Local Protumoral Immune Microenvironment Remodeling in Early Lung Adenocarcinoma Progression

finding: Lioudyno et al. in 2021 reported that the common genetic variant rs2821557 in KCNA3 was linked to the severity of multiple sclerosis.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: A meta-analysis by Liu et al. in 2020 showed an association between TNFSF4 polymorphism rs3861950 and susceptibility to coronary artery disease.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: This SNP, rs1234313, was part of Liu et al.’s meta-analysis from 2020, reinforcing its involvement in coronary artery disease susceptibility.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: The SNP rs3736907 was identified as a synonymous variant affecting CD101 expression and displayed a notable AdaptMix P-value of 1.05×10^-9. It was associated with T-cell proliferation, indicating its role in immune function in the Chilean cohort.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: The SNP rs1171148, an intronic variant of BRINP3, was reported with an AdaptMix P-value of 2.31×10^-8. This SNP was linked to body mass index (BMI) variations in the Mexican cohort, indicating possible adaptations to energy storage.
title: Disentangling signatures of selection before and after European colonization in Latin Americans

finding: The SNP rs2230288 in the GBA gene (p.E365K) was associated with a higher odds of having cognitive impairment at baseline (OR 2.05 [1.33, 3.18], P-value = 1.3E-3), faster development of cognitive impairment (HR 2.58 [1.71, 3.89] P-value = 5.5E-6), and lower MoCA score (Beta -1.23 [-1.97, -0.50], P-value = 1.0E-3). These findings were previously reported and confirmed in the updated analysis.
title: Genome-wide association study of Parkinson’s disease progression biomarkers in 12 longitudinal patients’ cohorts

finding: The SNP rs75548401 in the GBA gene (p.T408M) was associated with faster development of Hoehn and Yahr stage 3 (HY3) with a hazard ratio (HR) of 2.35 [1.58, 3.49], P-value = 2.5E-5. This establishes its role in disease progression.
title: Genome-wide association study of Parkinson’s disease progression biomarkers in 12 longitudinal patients’ cohorts

finding: The SNP rs12082154 was identified as a significant factor in the context of melanoma phenotype switching and resistance to treatment. Specifically, it was shown that variations in SNP rs12082154 were linked to alterations in the expression of EMT-inducing transcription factors, which are critical for melanoma phenotype plasticity and therapeutic resistance. This finding supported the notion that the genetic landscape, including specific SNPs, plays a role in the mechanisms underlying resistance to therapies in BRAF-mutant melanoma.
title: The CoREST Repressor Complex Mediates Phenotype Switching and Therapy Resistance in Melanoma

finding: The SNP rs12033824 was identified as a risk variant for schizophrenia (SCZ) and was found to disrupt the binding motif of zinc finger transcription factor ZBTB6. This effect was observed within a functional cis-regulatory element (fCRE1) at the TRAPPC3 locus, influencing neuronal differentiation.
title: Functional characterization of gene regulatory elements and neuropsychiatric disease-associated risk loci in iPSCs and iPSC-derived neurons

finding: The SNP rs12123752 was positively correlated with the regulation of pro-inflammatory cytokines, particularly CCL2, which was highlighted in the study by Li, Wen, and Lin in 2020. This correlation was significant in the context of Triple Negative Breast Cancer (TNBC) metastasis, specifically relating to the effect of EYA3 on NF-kB signaling and the reduced activation of cytotoxic NK cells at the pre-metastatic niche.
title: An EYA3/NF-κB/CCL2 signaling axis suppresses cytotoxic NK cells in the pre-metastatic niche to promote triple negative breast cancer metastasis

finding: The variant rs199703974 was significantly associated with the corrected QT measurement (QTc) trajectory probability, with a p-value less than 3E-08. This association indicated a relationship with WLS, a gene previously linked to QT interval in larger cohorts.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: The rs4536035 variant was identified as significantly associated with QTc interval trajectory probability. An eQTL analysis showed it to be linked with WLS expression in the coronary artery, further supporting its relevance in cardiovascular outcomes.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with QTc interval trajectory probability. It formed part of a linkage disequilibrium block with other significant variants associated with QT length.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: The variant rs4244620 showed suggestive significance (p-value < 7E-07) in relation to QTc interval trajectory. It was also found to map to a potential regulatory region near the WLS gene.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: Identified as upstream of WLS, rs1304851468 had H3K27Ac enrichment, indicating its potential role as an active enhancer in cardiovascular tissues, supporting its association with QTc interval.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: Identified in previous work, rs112611436 was associated with a 12ms increase in QT interval, reaffirming its connection to cardiovascular traits.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs12030738 was associated with immune response in melanoma patients, particularly reflected by an expression pattern that aligned with the IFNγ signature, which correlated with positive responses to immunotherapy and improved outcomes for patients. This finding was significant, with implications suggesting that genetic variations at this locus might influence the effectiveness of treatments targeting immune checkpoints.
title: Melanoma-intrinsic NR2F6 activity regulates anti-tumor immunity

finding: A significant dominance deviation was detected for rs12124078, a SNP associated with kidney function. This finding contributed to the evidence of dominance variance in complex traits, although the total dominance variance explained by this SNP was reported to be very small.
title: Estimation of non-additive genetic variance in human complex traits from a large sample of unrelated individuals

finding: The SNP rs12040964 was associated with SOX2 expression and transcriptional activity in a subpopulation of cancer stem cells in sarcoma. This correlation highlighted its prognostic implications for cancer stem cell populations.
title: WDR5 represents a therapeutically exploitable target for cancer stem cells in glioblastoma

finding: The WNT3A gene polymorphism rs752107 was associated with an increased risk of essential hypertension and related cardiovascular diseases, linking blood pressure regulation to genetic factors.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The CYP2J2 gene variant rs2280275 was studied for its association with diabetic nephropathy, indicating a possible role in kidney disease among diabetic patients.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: rs147600757 was associated with Rikenellaceae and replicated at nominal significance.
title: Inter-determination of blood metabolite levels and gut microbiome supported by Mendelian randomization

finding: The study found that the alternative allele of rs1338681 disrupted a CTCF binding motif, leading to reduced binding affinity. This was demonstrated through association mapping which showed significant evidence for correlation between the footprint and the nearby regulatory variants, thus establishing it as a footprint-variant pair.
title: Quantitative assessment of association between noncoding variants and transcription factor binding

finding: The PTGS2 polymorphism rs5275 showed a significant association with invasive ovarian carcinoma risk in the context of pooled analyses involving NSAID use, indicating its relevance in ovarian cancer susceptibility.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs798000 was found to overlap a peak in T cells that showed high chromatin accessibility, indicating that it primarily affected the T_A-2 transcriptional cell state, particularly in the context of a regulatory pathway associated with RA pathology. This SNP was linked to the gene CD2, which plays a significant role in T cell activation.
title: The Chromatin Landscape of Pathogenic Transcriptional Cell States in Rheumatoid Arthritis

finding: SNP rs11209051 was identified as overlapping with a chromatin peak in T cells. This finding suggested its involvement in the regulation of the IL12RB2 gene, implicating it as a putatively causal variant in RA pathology, with statistical significance demonstrated through a Wilcoxon test.
title: The Chromatin Landscape of Pathogenic Transcriptional Cell States in Rheumatoid Arthritis

finding: The SNP rs12061419 showed a significant correlation with lipid metabolism alterations in hepatocellular carcinoma. This SNP was previously identified as a contributor to the modulation of lipid profiles, which affected the sensitivity of liver cancer cell lines to therapies like doxorubicin and idarubicin.
title: Anthracyclins increase free PUFAs and etherPEs with PUFAs as potential hallmarks of lipid peroxidation and ferroptosis

finding: The SNP rs12137855 was associated with ultrasound-defined non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in a Chinese Han population, suggesting its relevance in metabolic diseases. This finding related to LYPLAL1 and indicated potential implications for understanding fat distribution and metabolic traits, especially in light of sex-specific effects observed in mouse models.
title: Knockout of murine Lyplal1 confers sex-specific protection against diet-induced obesity

finding: The SNP rs1065828, located in the CE region, displayed a significant difference in the alternative allele fraction between control subjects and those with alcohol use disorders (AUDs). In the study, the fraction of alternative alleles in RNA was approximately 37% in SH-SY5Y cells and 30% in SK-N-BE(2) cells, indicating that this SNP led to lower expression of the alternative allele in individuals with AUD.
title: Allele-Specific Expression and High-Throughput Reporter Assay Reveal Functional Variants in Human Brains with Alcohol Use Disorders

finding: rs11580593 was found to be significantly associated with neurodegenerative disorders during the GWAS, highlighting its potential link to Alzheimer’s disease and related conditions.
title: Deep Learning-based Feature Extraction with MRI Data in Neuroimaging Genetics for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs12092667 was positively associated with the expression of the EVI1 gene, which plays a significant role in leukemia and solid tumors, as reported by Liang and Wang in their 2020 study. This finding indicated that variations at this SNP may influence the proliferative and invasive behaviors of cells related to these cancers.
title: Transcriptional regulation and repressive condensates modulate a proliferative-invasive cellular switch in vivo

finding: The SNP rs12037905, located within the long noncoding RNA gene LYPLAL1-AS1, was identified as being associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) and lipid traits, such as high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol and triglycerides (TG) levels. It was shown to have protective effects against high BMI, suggesting its potential role in preventing and combating obesity-related diseases.
title: Quantile Regression for biomarkers in the UK Biobank

finding: The study cited in the context identified that rs12082209 was associated with the therapeutic potential of chemically modified miR-489 in triple-negative breast cancers. This finding related specifically to the effectiveness of miRNA mimetics that had been modified to enhance their potency against cancer cell proliferation, demonstrating an integration of genetic variation and therapeutic strategy.
title: Development of 5-FU-modified tumor suppressor microRNAs as a platform for novel microRNA-based cancer therapeutics

finding: The SNP rs12954 located on chromosome 5D was identified to be associated with resistance to the leaf rust race PKTTS. Although the PKTTS race is virulent to the Lr1 gene, the data indicated that the SNP rs12954 itself did not represent Lr1, and was thought to be linked to a different QTL potentially conferring seedling stage resistance.
title: Identification of novel leaf rust seedling resistance loci in Iranian bread wheat germplasm using genome-wide association mapping

finding: The SNP rs72697237 was highlighted in the study as having substantial allelic activity impacting transcription in beta cells.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: The study identified that the rs5051 C>T promoter variant in AGT is significantly associated with increased AGT transcription, showing up to a 68.6% increase in AGT levels through alterations in transcription factor binding. This effect was crucial in analyzing blood pressure phenotypes, as rs5051 C>T was associated with a 0.10 mmHg increase in systolic blood pressure per allele in the UK Biobank cohort, with a stronger association in Black participants (1.17 mmHg increase). This highlighted the variant's role in contributing to hypertensive phenotypes.
title: Analysis of the Combined Effect of rs699 and rs5051 on Angiotensinogen Expression and Hypertension

finding: The SNP rs545608 in the CRYZL2P-SEC16B gene showed established associations with BMI, Type 2 diabetes, and body fat. This SNP was confirmed during both the discovery and replication phases of the study.
title: A genome-wide association study of neonatal metabolites

finding: The rs114101502 SNP in ZCCHC11 was linked to an increased risk of breast cancer.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: The SNP rs74865018, associated with a non-coding duplication, was found to have a significant association with skin color, as evidenced by the p-value of 1.373x10^-9. However, it did not show a significant effect on any neighboring gene expression, indicating its specificity in influencing skin pigmentation traits.
title: Resolving the insertion sites of polymorphic duplications reveals a HERC2 haplotype under selection

finding: The SNP rs17375290 was significant for height and associated with promoter markers in relevant tissues.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The intronic SNP rs3820190 in PLOD1 showed evidence of association with mitochondrial RNA methylation levels at mt-tRNA-R (position 10413) through altered expression. Although PLOD1 is not known for mitochondrial function, the association suggests a potential indirect role through eQTL mechanisms impacting genes like MFN2.
title: Nuclear genetic regulation of human mitochondrial RNA modification

finding: The SNP rs6655954 was identified as a significant selection signal in all studied populations including Dongxiang, Tibetan, and Yugur. This signal related to genetic adaptations associated with cardiovascular system diseases and lipid metabolism.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of ethnolinguistic diverse northwestern Chinese Hexi Corridor people from the 10K_CPGDP project suggested the differentiated East-West genetic admixture along the Silk Road and their biological adaptations

finding: The SNP rs78658433 was also significant in the candidate genes involved with natural selection signals impacting cardiovascular disease in the studied ethnic groups.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of ethnolinguistic diverse northwestern Chinese Hexi Corridor people from the 10K_CPGDP project suggested the differentiated East-West genetic admixture along the Silk Road and their biological adaptations

finding: The SNP rs12030683 was related to the adoptive cell therapy strategies aimed at targeting solid tumors. It highlighted the significance of antigen-specific T cells in the context of CAR T-cell therapy, emphasizing the potential for these cells to be harnessed effectively against solid tumors.
title: Advancing CAR T-Cell Therapy: Simultaneously Attack Tumor and Immunosuppressive Cells in the Tumor Microenvironment

finding: The SNP rs3010913 was identified as a positive and original finding related to the role of protein kinase A (PKA) in cancer. Caretta and Mucignat-Caretta (2011) discussed how alterations in PKA signaling pathways can contribute to tumorigenesis, suggesting that this SNP may be implicated in the modulation of PKA activity associated with cancer development. This highlights the significance of PKA in cancer biology and provides a potential genetic marker for further investigation into cancer susceptibility.
title: Molecular Determinants and Signaling Effects of PKA RIα Phase Separation

finding: The SNP rs77149735 was associated with a fetal brain-specific enhancer located at chr1:243555100-243556100, which was identified as having a strong p-value of 7.68E-11. This SNP was linked to differential enhancer activation based on findings from massively parallel reporter assays (MPRA).
title: Regulome-wide association study identifies enhancer properties associated with risk for schizophrenia

finding: The variant rs11209026-A in the IL23R gene was found to provide significant protection against immune-related diseases such as inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) in European populations. The derived A-allele was present in high frequencies among ancient Anatolian Farmers (AF) and was likely under weak positive selection, leading to its introduction into the ancient European gene pool. This event contributed to the observed frequency gradient of rs11209026-A across Europe, influencing the rates of IBD incidence, which were highest in northern and eastern Europe. The analysis of ancient genomes showed the A-allele was absent in Western Hunter-Gatherers (WHG) but present in subsequent farming populations (Early Farmers and Late Farmers). Overall, findings indicated that ecological factors and dietary changes during the Neolithic may have exerted selective pressure favoring the protective A-allele, enhancing survival by reducing intestinal inflammation and microbiome dysbiosis.
title: Neolithic introgression of IL23R-related protection against chronic inflammatory bowel diseases in modern Europeans

finding: The SNP rs12082297 was associated with the study of lymphatic valves and lymph flow in cancer-related lymphedema. The research highlighted that variants in this SNP may impact the regulation of eNOS and hence influence lymphatic valve development, which is critical for unidirectional lymph transport and preventing diseases like lymphedema.
title: Endothelial Nitric Oxide Synthase Regulates Lymphatic Valve Specification By Controlling β - catenin Signaling During Embryogenesis

finding: The analysis of SNP rs12040949 provided insights into its association with telomerase mechanisms and their implications in aging and brain health. In the context of the study, it was linked to the telomerase deficiency model in zebrafish, highlighting the role of telomere maintenance in mitigating senescence and neuro-inflammation within the aged brain. This finding underscored the connection between the SNP and telomerase-related dysregulation observed in age-associated cognitive decline and blood-brain barrier integrity.
title: Telomerase-Dependent Ageing In The Zebrafish Brain

finding: The SNP rs11122002 was associated with the regulation of JAK-STAT signaling pathways. Given its relevance, the study indicated that modifications in this genetic locus could potentially influence immune responses mediated by T-cell activation. This correlation was significant in the context of T-cell activation and the behavior of specific phosphorylated STAT proteins as observed in previous research.
title: Simultaneous assessment of eight phosphorylated STAT residues in T-cells by flow cytometry

finding: The SNP rs12123711 was associated with NDRG1 expression, which was identified as an independent prognostic factor in inflammatory breast cancer. The study indicated that altered expression levels of NDRG1 could correlate with malignancy and poor prognosis, particularly showcasing its significance in pathways related to cancer progression.
title: Mechanism of N-Myc Downstream Regulated Gene-1 regulating Integrin expression to inhibit gastric cancer metastasis

finding: The study highlighted rs505151 as a missense variant that demonstrated a significant correlation with altered PCSK9 levels among the elderly cohort in Brazil. This SNP was associated with increased risk factors for myocardial infarction (MI), showcasing its potential role in cardiovascular diseases (CVD).
title: Active and Allosteric Site Binding MOLECULAR MECHANICS-QUANTUM MECHANICS studies of STEVIOSIDE Derivative in PCSK9 Protein Intended to provide a safe Antilipidemic agent

finding: The analysis of rs562556 revealed that it is a missense variant influencing PCSK9 functionality. This SNP was found to modify the atherogenic lipid profiles, thus contributing to the predisposition to stroke and other cardiovascular complications in the studied population.
title: Active and Allosteric Site Binding MOLECULAR MECHANICS-QUANTUM MECHANICS studies of STEVIOSIDE Derivative in PCSK9 Protein Intended to provide a safe Antilipidemic agent

finding: This SNP was determined to be the best candidate for deleteriousness among breast cancer-associated variants at the 1p36 locus. Further studies demonstrated that the risk T-allele negatively impacted KLHDC7A promoter activity.
title: DSNetwork: An integrative approach to visualize predictions of variants’ deleteriousness

finding: This SNP was prioritized as a top candidate alongside rs42334486 for its regulatory role indicated by a significant ranking in the deleteriousness assessment.
title: DSNetwork: An integrative approach to visualize predictions of variants’ deleteriousness

finding: This variant was confirmed as a strong candidate following its significant ranking in assessment for regulatory variants at the analyzed locus.
title: DSNetwork: An integrative approach to visualize predictions of variants’ deleteriousness

finding: The SNP rs146434626 was found to significantly associate with the activity of HMGN3 in frontal cortex tissue, achieving a p-value of 6.5×10^-16, which surpassed standard genome-wide significance thresholds.
title: Identifying Genetic Regulatory Variants that Affect Transcription Factor Activity

finding: The rs2476601_A>G variant was associated with prednisolone, a steroid used for rheumatoid arthritis (RA), reinforcing its connection within therapeutic applications for RA.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The rs11591147_G>T variant of PCSK9 was identified as disease-causal for statin medication, associated with multiple cardiovascular traits, underlining its casual implications in lipid regulation.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The SNP rs12092579 was associated with changes in the expression of genes involved in inflammation, lipid metabolism, and tissue repair. This finding was significant in the context of lupus nephritis, where alterations in macrophage and monocyte subsets in both mouse models and human patients were observed, indicating the relevance of these pathways in the disease.
title: Intrarenal myeloid subsets associated with kidney injury are comparable in mice and patients with lupus nephritis

finding: This SNP was highlighted as a Tier-1 SNP affecting <italic>RP11-392O17.1</italic> with supporting evidence from eQTLs related to obesity, leading to its classification as a credible regulatory SNP.
title: Epigenomic and transcriptomic prioritization of candidate obesity-risk regulatory GWAS SNPs

finding: Found to overlap significantly with chromatin states associated with <italic>RP11-392O17.1</italic>, implicating it in the regulatory processes influencing obesity.
title: Epigenomic and transcriptomic prioritization of candidate obesity-risk regulatory GWAS SNPs

finding: The SNP rs12061445 was implicated in the context of non-coding RNA roles in cancer, specifically relating to the transcriptional activity of RNA polymerase III (Pol III) and its associated isoforms. It was discussed in a study that identified the regulatory mechanisms of Pol III, particularly the effect of the POLR3G subunit on the expression of small noncoding RNA, which can significantly influence cancer outcomes. This finding was highlighted in the context of the detrimental effects in patient survival when POLR3G, driven by MYC, was upregulated.
title: A cancer-associated RNA polymerase III identity drives robust transcription and expression of SNAR-A noncoding RNA

finding: The SNP rs12071985 was associated with the study conducted by Tomko et al. in 2020, which investigated the anti-cancer potential of cannabinoids, terpenes, and flavonoids found in cannabis. The findings demonstrated that combinations of nerolidol and delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) or cannabidiol (CBD) could produce variable responses, which included antagonism, additivity, or synergy, depending on the concentrations used. This indicated that the SNP may relate to the response variability seen in patients with chemotherapy-resistant breast cancer.
title: Anti-cancer potential of cannabis terpenes in a taxol-resistant model of breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs12071811 was found to be associated with the proliferative classification of HER2-positive breast cancer cell lines. This suggests a connection between this specific SNP and cancer behavior, particularly in the context of breast cancer subtypes, including triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC). The findings were based on transcriptomic analysis which identified various cancer cell-type clusters in tumors, indicating that genetic variations, such as that at rs12071811, could influence cancer stem cell populations and impact treatment resistance.
title: Identification of two cancer stem cell-like populations in triple-negative breast cancer xenografts

finding: The SNP rs1801160 in DPYD was linked to drug response to 5-fluorouracil, showing its potential impact on treatment efficacy for patients receiving this chemotherapy.
title: Epigenetic inhibitors sensitize DLBCL cells to rituximab and doxorubicin

finding: SNP rs2297595 in DPYD was associated with toxicity in patients treated with 5-fluorouracil, emphasizing the need to consider this variant for risk assessment in chemotherapy.
title: Epigenetic inhibitors sensitize DLBCL cells to rituximab and doxorubicin

finding: The SNP rs12061617 was associated with the regulation of ubiquitin-proteasome system-related degradation of S2P RNAPII, crucial for the resolution of transcription blocks following DNA damage. The study highlighted the role of key proteins like P53, ATM, and DNAPK in this process, suggesting that variations at this SNP could influence the efficacy of DNA double-strand break repair through alteration in these regulatory mechanisms.
title: Old players in new posts: the role of P53, ATM and DNAPK in DNA damage-related ubiquitylation-dependent removal of S2P RNAPII

finding: The rs946528 locus on chromosome 1 was significantly associated with platelet count (PLT) in Bangladeshi individuals but not in the Pakistani cohort. It was part of a larger haplotype encompassing a credible set of 343 variants, with functional annotation suggesting that the locus's most likely mediator was PIK3R3, a gene involved in cardiovascular phenotypes.
title: PIK3R3 is a candidate regulator of platelet count in people of Bangladeshi ancestry

finding: The rs1707303 variant, located in intron 1 of PIK3R3, was highlighted as overlapping with a regulatory region indicative of significant epigenetic activity, contributing to the association with PLT.
title: PIK3R3 is a candidate regulator of platelet count in people of Bangladeshi ancestry

finding: The SNP rs2228145, associated with the IL6R genetic variant (Asp358Ala), displayed significant associations in the PheWAS analysis conducted within the MVP cohort. The minor allele frequency was identified as 0.35, with the risk allele being A. MAP method yielded 13 significant associations after Bonferroni correction, while ICD-9 codes identified 12. Specifically, the odds ratio for the association between il6R SNP and ischemic heart disease was estimated at 0.945 (p-value = 3.89 × 10^-19) via the MAP method, indicating a strong association compared to the ICD method, which reported an odds ratio of 0.955 (p-value = 3.59 × 10^-12). The MAP approach demonstrated greater power to detect associations, with higher log odds ratios and more robust p-values compared to the traditional method.
title: High-throughput Multimodal Automated Phenotyping (MAP) with Application to PheWAS

finding: The SNP rs1106529 was strongly associated with bone mineral density and obesity-risk traits. It was located in the extended promoter chromatin in osteoblasts, overlapping the Myob-hyperm DMR immediately upstream of the TBX15 promoter region. This region exhibited low or no methylation coupled with strong enhancer/promoter chromatin, suggesting that in osteoblasts, rs1106529 contributed to the DNA methylation-sensitive upregulation of TBX15.
title: Promoter-adjacent DNA hypermethylation can downmodulate gene expression: TBX15 in the muscle lineage

finding: The NOS1AP rs12742393 (A/C) polymorphism was shown to influence the therapeutic efficacy of nateglinide among Chinese patients with type 2 diabetes, underlining its importance in pharmacogenomics.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The urotensin II rs228648 polymorphism was linked to the risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus, suggesting its relevance in metabolic diseases.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The genetic variant rs2890565 was associated with the susceptibility to type 2 diabetes mellitus, adding to the understanding of genetic factors influencing diabetes development.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs12030699 was mentioned in the context of study by Goyeneche et al. (2020), which correlated with the capacity of HGSOC cells to form multicellular structures. This indicates that genetic factors at this SNP may relate to the tumorigenicity and treatment response in HGSOC, particularly in light of the propensity for cells carrying different SNP profiles to exhibit varied reactions to therapies like nelfinavir.
title: Nelfinavir induces cytotoxicity towards high-grade serous ovarian cancer cells regardless of platinum sensitivity, involving induction of the unfolded protein response, modulation of protein synthesis, DNA damage, lysosomal impairment, and potentiation of toxicity caused by proteasome inhibition

finding: The variant rs736756 was associated with the gene NRDC, having a PPA of 96.5% in relation to a GWAS on depression, indicating its strong causal role linked to the disease.
title: A Unifying Statistical Framework to Discover Disease Genes from GWAS

finding: The SNP rs629301 from the <SORT1>/<CELSR2> locus displayed a positive colocalization signal with liver <cis-eQTL>, indicating it was associated with changes in expression levels. However, the presence of overlapping expression signals made separate SNP-based genetic interaction analyses unfeasible.
title: Pairwise genetic interactions modulate lipid plasma levels and cellular uptake

finding: It increased the expression of MRPL9 in the heart and was associated with myocardial infarction, further supported by a low p-value pointing to a significant relationship.
title: Unveiling the role of Tdark genes in genetic diseases and phenotypes through bioinformatics-based functional enrichment and network analyses

finding: This SNP was linked to decreased PEAR1 platelet protein levels, suggesting that it influenced platelet reactivity. It served as a causal variant explaining a platelet reactivity signal and had previously been documented in GWAS related to platelet phenotypes.
title: Genome Sequencing Unveils a New Regulatory Landscape of Platelet Reactivity

finding: The SNP rs1044595 at 1p25.3 near STX6 was identified as leading SNP in the associated locus, with its risk allele linked to increased STX6 expression in bulk brain samples and oligodendrocytes.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: The SNP rs3789362, in high linkage disequilibrium with rs1044595, was found to overlap with an oligodendrocyte-specific enhancer, suggesting it increases STX6 expression.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: The cis-pQTL rs11589479 was reported to colocalise with Crohn's disease, indicating a shared genetic signal that contributes to phenotypic traits.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: The missense variant rs34687326 (p.Gly99Ser) was identified as a risk factor for inflammatory bowel disease and colocalised with Crohn's disease as a cis-pQTL.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: The pQTL rs2071579 was associated with substantial differences in measurement correlations across platforms, implicating it in potential functional impacts on the protein target YKL-40.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: The pQTL rs4950928 was found as the Olink counterpart to rs2071579, significantly affecting the correlation coefficients and was involved in gene expression dynamics.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: The SNP rs2391769 was identified as a novel shared risk SNP associated with both ASD and ADHD, mapped to the novel gene DPYD, which relates to disorders such as intellectual disability.
title: Combining multivariate genomic approaches to elucidate the comorbidity between ASD and ADHD

finding: The SNP rs1195871 was associated with hypertension, meeting a significant threshold (p<5 × 10^-8), and was found to be relatively conserved among vertebrates. It was one of the two SNPs identified in proximity to the 5' end of the ADGRL2 gene that correlated with cardiovascular disease.
title: Latrophilin-2 mediates fluid shear stress mechanotransduction at endothelial junctions

finding: The intronic SNP rs186892211 in the ADGRL2 locus was strongly associated with large-artery atherosclerosis and subsequent ischemic stroke, as classified by the TOAST system, showing a very high odds ratio of 720 (p<3.134e-10). This indicated a significant impact on cardiovascular disease outcomes.
title: Latrophilin-2 mediates fluid shear stress mechanotransduction at endothelial junctions

finding: The SNP rs11207510 was also identified as a T2D-associated variant and was found to be located at an LSD1-bound site that interacts with the JUN promoter in human islets. This finding indicates a possible regulatory role in gene expression associated with insulin secretion and metabolic responses.
title: Nutrient regulation of the islet epigenome controls adaptive insulin secretion

finding: The SNP rs12061393 was associated with responses to anti-EGFR therapy in colorectal cancer (CRC). Specifically, it related to the secretion of epidermal growth factor (EGF) by cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs), which contributed to chemoresistance in CRC. This finding highlighted the role of CAFs in influencing tumor behavior and therapy outcomes, emphasizing the importance of metabolic interactions in the CRC microenvironment.
title: Elucidating Tumor-stromal Metabolic Crosstalk in Colorectal Cancer through Integration of Constraint-Based Models and LC-MS Metabolomics

finding: The SNP rs7528684 was associated with the risk of autoimmune diseases, particularly in the context of Hashimoto’s thyroiditis in Iranian patients. The study indicated that this SNP had a regulatory effect on the expression of hFcrl3, contributing to the modulation of immune responses.
title: Upregulated Fcrl5 disrupts B cell anergy and causes autoimmunity

finding: The SNP rs11264750 was evaluated in relation to its eQTL effect on the promoter region of hFcrl5, suggesting its involvement in regulatory pathways that may influence autoimmune disease susceptibility through mechanisms related to B cell anergy.
title: Upregulated Fcrl5 disrupts B cell anergy and causes autoimmunity

finding: The variant was associated with participation in the food frequency questionnaire (FFQ), where the allele linked to higher intelligence was tied to completing more FFQs.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: This variant was associated with MHQ participation; the allele linked to higher cognitive function was related to higher odds of completing the MHQ.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: Associated with higher odds of completing the MHQ, similar to other variants that indicated enhanced cognitive function.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: Identified as a significant signal associated with various participation measures.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: The CASQ1 genotype variant rs2275703 was correlated with type 2 diabetes and related metabolic traits among a large cohort of Danish whites, suggesting its influence on diabetes susceptibility.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs34372695 variant was not found to associate with sporadic Parkinson's disease among Central Chinese patients, adding to the complexities of genetic influences in disease.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs12092334 was identified in the context of immunotherapy for glioblastoma (GBM). The study highlighted the importance of understanding the tumor microenvironment, particularly the role of distinct tumor-associated macrophage (TAM) subtypes and immune cell interactions. This SNP was linked to the functional heterogeneity of glioma and immune cells, providing insights that could inform future therapeutic strategies in this immunologically cold cancer.
title: Single-cell transcriptomics reveals immunosuppressive microenvironment and highlights stumor-promoting macrophage cells in Glioblastoma

finding: The SNP rs1047980 within LAMC2 was associated with maximum habitual alcohol consumption in approximately 140,000 U.S. European and African American veterans, indicating its relevance to alcohol intake patterns.
title: Genome-wide association mapping of ethanol sensitivity in the Diversity Outbred mouse population

finding: The rs1044299 SNP located at the PAPPA2 locus was significantly associated with serum PAPP-A2 levels (P = 6.85×10^-5), although it was not genome-wide associated. It was observed that this association was attenuated when conditioned on nearby height signals.
title: Protein QTL analysis of IGF-I and its binding proteins provides insights into growth biology

finding: The SNP rs3820282, a C>T transition in WNT4 intron 1, was identified as a likely pathogenic variant associated with increased risk for gynecologic disorders including endometriosis and ovarian cancer. The variant created a binding site for nuclear receptor transcription factors and led to increased WNT4 expression in gynecologic tissues. In a study cohort of 103 human gynecologic tumors, the rs3820282 genotype was linked to significant metabolic remodeling characterized by heightened AMPK activation, particularly in tumors from non-White patients. This SNP demonstrated a strong association with metabolic reprogramming and was shown to increase the dependent activity of WNT4 signaling in ovarian cancer cells.
title: WNT4 regulates cellular metabolism via intracellular activity at the mitochondria in breast and gynecologic cancers

finding: SNP rs7549250 was documented within intronic regions of IL6R and was associated with myocardial infarction (MI) and CAD in several GWAS, indicating significant connections to heart disease. It acted as an eQTL for IL6R in the left ventricle and atrial appendage.
title: Dissecting Regulatory Non-Coding Heart Disease GWAS Loci with High-Resolution 3D Chromatin Interactions Reveals Causal Genes with Pathophysiological Relevance to Heart Failure

finding: The SNP rs4129267 was also located within IL6R's intronic regions and showed associations with heart disease traits, particularly in proxy SNP associations with decreased C-reactive protein levels. It was significant as an eQTL in multiple tissues.
title: Dissecting Regulatory Non-Coding Heart Disease GWAS Loci with High-Resolution 3D Chromatin Interactions Reveals Causal Genes with Pathophysiological Relevance to Heart Failure

finding: The SNP rs7528419 was identified as influencing the expression of SORT1, a gene linked to LDL-cholesterol levels. While the original significance of the association decreased after methylation-adjustment, the finding emphasized the effect of DNA methylation on lipid/lipoprotein measurements, relevant for assessing risks related to cholesterol-related diseases like myocardial infarction.
title: Incorporation of DNA methylation into eQTL mapping in African Americans

finding: Similar to rs7528419, rs12740374 was also associated with SORT1's expression and its role in lipid levels. The decreased significance post methylation-adjustment underscored the potential influence of methylation in cholesterol metabolism and the risk assessment for cardiovascular diseases driven by lipid profiles.
title: Incorporation of DNA methylation into eQTL mapping in African Americans

finding: The finding for rs1332018 indicated a significant correlation with GSTM3 expression as well as its relationship with DNA methylation. The T allele correlated with higher expression and lower methylation, influencing susceptibility to diseases such as HBV and HCC that exhibit higher incidence in African Americans.
title: Incorporation of DNA methylation into eQTL mapping in African Americans

finding: For rs57711775, the findings highlighted its association with HSPA6 expression, observing an increase in both expression and methylation levels. This suggests a potential genetic risk factor for HCC specific to African Americans, as the significant allele variant identified in this SNP was not present in European ancestries.
title: Incorporation of DNA methylation into eQTL mapping in African Americans

finding: This variant was found downstream of the XPR1 gene and was significantly enriched in regions known to house L1 expression regulators, reinforcing its potential regulatory role.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS reveals loci linked to human variation in LINE-1- and Alu-copy numbers

finding: The SNP rs12030742 was associated with the role of PTEN loss in immune escape and melanoma prognosis. The study provided evidence that PTEN inactivation has significant implications for melanoma treatment response, further supporting the functional relevance of PTEN-related pathways in melanoma.
title: The lipid phosphatase activity of PTEN dampens FRA1 expression via AKT/mTOR signaling to suppress melanoma

finding: The study identified rs1414273 located in miR-548ac as significantly associated with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) with a P-value of 8.26×10-4 and demonstrated that this SNP conferred a dominant inheritance pattern, suggesting strong links to the disease pathogenesis.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: The SNP rs76763715, corresponding to the N370S variant in the GBA gene, was identified as a significant risk variant for PD, further reaffirming its crucial role in the genetic predisposition to the disease.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: The SNP rs4454537 in the GREM2 region was associated with low bone mineral density (BMD) in hips in a southern Chinese population. This finding pointed to the influence of genetic variants in GREM2 expression within osteoblasts, thereby affecting fracture risk in humans.
title: Genetic dissection of femoral and tibial microarchitecture

finding: The SNP rs9287237, also found on chromosome 1, was associated with trabecular bone fraction. This finding further demonstrated the distinct genetic architecture affecting trabecular bone compared to cortical characteristics.
title: Genetic dissection of femoral and tibial microarchitecture

finding: The SNP rs12071799 was associated with the epigenetic characterization of Lynch-like individuals. This study found that the methylation changes tracked by pseudotime analysis were linked to genetic variations, with rs12071799 being pivotal within the context of age-related changes and cancer risk assessment among individuals with Lynch syndrome.
title: Pseudotime analysis reveals exponential trends in DNA methylation aging with mortality associated timescales

finding: The SNP rs12041009 was associated with the effectiveness of statins in cancer therapy, particularly in personalized medicine approaches. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic factors that influence the anticancer effects of drugs like statins.
title: The molecular basis of the anticancer effect of statins

finding: The SNP rs12061448 was linked to the function of Src Family Kinases in advanced solid tumors, particularly in the context of overcoming therapy resistance. Its association with melanoma indicated that variations at this locus could contribute to the development of resistance through mechanisms involving Src family signaling. This research underscored the therapeutic potential of targeting these kinases to manage resistance and improve treatment outcomes.
title: A neural crest stem cell-like state drives nongenetic resistance to targeted therapy in melanoma

finding: The SNP rs11121844 was identified in a study related to splicing factor mutations in myeloid malignancies. It was associated with significant clinical features that impacted tumor progression. This finding is relevant to understanding the broader implications of regulatory sequences in cancer, particularly in their role in modulating genes like SF3A1, which is a splicing factor linked to tumor growth.
title: Integrative identification of non-coding regulatory regions driving metastatic prostate cancer

finding: The study found that TMOD4 (rs115287176) was significantly associated with myocardial infarction and hypertension. This association suggested a relevant link between the SNP and cardiovascular conditions, indicating its potential role in atherosclerosis development due to its influence on cholesterol homeostasis.
title: The LEPIS-HuR-TMOD4 axis regulates hepatic cholesterol homeostasis and accelerates atherosclerosis

finding: The SNP rs6690215 was found to help recover the association signal at the gene level for IL10 despite the absence of rs2093761 in GWAX. This led to a genome-wide significant association at IL10 with a P-value of 1.4 x 10^-7 in the context of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD).
title: A statistical framework for cross-tissue transcriptome-wide association analysis

finding: The SNP rs59043219 displayed association with more than 5 CpGs within the gene body of IRF6, highlighting its significance in IBD-associated regulatory mechanisms.
title: Methylation Quantitative Trait Loci are Largely Consistent across Disease States in Crohn’s disease

finding: This SNP was part of the molecular basis of the Duffy blood group system and relevant for malaria resistance, showing a nearly fixed difference between Europeans and Africans.
title: How to choose sets of ancestry informative markers: A supervised feature selection approach

finding: The SNP rs141140594 was identified at a locus of suggestive significance (POIROT p = 2.43 × 10^-7) on chromosome 1, where it lies 3kb from the gene ATP8B2. Nearby variants in this region have been previously associated with type 2 diabetes, although the mechanisms of the gene's implication in the disease remain unclear.
title: POIROT: A powerful test for parent-of-origin effects in unrelated samples leveraging multiple phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs10751449 was part of a haplotype identified in the erythroid-specific promoter of the ATP2B4 gene, which was associated with lower expression of the PMCA4 protein in mature red blood cells. This reduced expression was linked to lower mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration in the blood and a protective effect against malaria.
title: Identification and quantitative characterization of protein-DNA interactions with the native holdup assay: GATA1 regulation of the plasma membrane calcium pump

finding: The SNP rs10736845 was found to be a key component of the haplotype within the erythroid promoter of the ATP2B4 gene, exhibiting an effect on the expression level of PMCA4 and resulting in lower hemoglobin concentration and reduced malaria susceptibility.
title: Identification and quantitative characterization of protein-DNA interactions with the native holdup assay: GATA1 regulation of the plasma membrane calcium pump

finding: SNP rs10751451 was identified within the haplotype that altered expression in the ATP2B4 gene. It contributed to lower PMCA4 protein levels in red blood cells, decreased mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration, and offered protection against malaria.
title: Identification and quantitative characterization of protein-DNA interactions with the native holdup assay: GATA1 regulation of the plasma membrane calcium pump

finding: The SNP rs61816761 at the 1q21.3 locus in the FLG gene was associated with the largest effect on age of asthma onset. Each copy of the asthma risk allele was associated with an average of 4.57 years earlier onset compared to individuals without the risk allele, with a p-value of 8.15×10^-27. This finding indicates a significant genetic influence on the timing of asthma onset.
title: Shared and Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for Childhood Onset and Adult Onset Asthma: Genome- and Transcriptome-wide Studies

finding: The SLC6A17*P61P variant was reported to reduce gene expression in the brain, and this reduction was also associated with LOAD, suggesting its significance in the disease.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The MTHFR*677C>T variant was associated with an increased risk for LOAD and other age-related disorders, indicating its importance in the genetics of Alzheimer's disease.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The study reported that the rare non-synonymous point variant rs371481157 (c.C2015T, p.A672V) was identified in one individual in a cohort of ALS patients. It was predicted as pathogenic by a majority of prediction tools, indicating a potential link to ALS pathogenesis.
title: SFPQ intron retention, reduced expression and aggregate formation in central nervous system tissue are pathological features of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: The variant rs763571943 (c.C229T, p.P77S) was observed in two individuals from the GnomAD nNFE dataset and also in an ALS patient from the Project MinE dataset. This rare variant was noted for its presence in ALS patients, contributing to the genetic understanding of the disease.
title: SFPQ intron retention, reduced expression and aggregate formation in central nervous system tissue are pathological features of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: This SNP was specifically identified as a rare variant associated with African ancestry, and it was notable for being significant in the pooled analysis.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis

finding: This SNP was noted as a rare variant exclusive to American ancestry found in the pooled analysis.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis

finding: The study indicated that rs646776, located near the gene sortilin, was identified as a regulator of progranulin levels in human plasma. This finding was significant as it connected genetic variability to the modulation of progranulin, which is crucial for lysosomal function and associated with frontotemporal dementia and neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis.
title: Surf4 Promotes Endoplasmic Reticulum Exit of the Lysosomal Prosaposin-Progranulin Complex

finding: The SNP rs13303010 was identified in the meta-analysis and showed nominal significance for pancreatic cancer risk.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs3790844 was confirmed as nominally statistically significant in relation to pancreatic cancer risk based on the GWAS data.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs1967017 at the PDZK1 locus was confirmed as a causal variant influencing serum urate levels. This association played a significant role in understanding the genetic components linked to hyperuricemia and gout.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control
